name: QUARTETnary
description:
Ready to explore the history of Earth?

Welcome to QUARTETnary: the card game about the geological time scale!

Discover the formation of mountain ranges, the evolution of animals and plants, the changing face of the Earth through the ages and more, all captured within 60 beautifully illustrated cards.

Playable by anyone over the age of 8, QUARTETnary is suitable for groups of 2 to 5 players and can also be enjoyed solo (thanks to its domino-mode). Gameplay follows that of the classic card game Quartets (similar to Go Fish and Happy Families), where players aim to collect sets of four cards belonging to a specific group; in this case, a geological time unit.

Make the most complete timeline of the history of the Earth and win!

—description from the designer

name: Pavlova coco
description:
Pavlova Coco is Blanc-mange Coco with drawings: each player tries to create the funniest comic book possible with 3 cards.

In Pavlova Coco, each player receives 11 cards with drawings depicting the men from the Coco Blanc-Manger game on a beach. The objective is to make other players laugh by forming a comic book with 3 cards. A game is played on 4 points.
Each player receives 11 cards. A player (the BD master) puts 1 of his cards on the table. All other players choose 2 cards from their game to form a fun 3-card comic book. The BD master chooses the funniest combinations.

name: Cows
description:
Use speed and strategy to make the most money as a cattle rancher in this whimsical card game.

Gain a resource card from the market by being the first each round to spot the most numerous card type revealed. Use standard actions to gain or exchange cards from the market even if you aren’t the fastest. The more cows you have, the more points you can get from them; press your luck for a massive reward, but be careful because you might lose any that you can’t support!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Market, Push Your Luck, Speed Matching, Take That

name: EGREGO
description:
In EGREGO you will Represent the forces of good, evil or chaos and make your play to possess the villagers and conquer the village. Choose from 21 entities and dive into this dark experience of asymmetrical mechanics, strategy and luck.
Discover the village one card at a time and find all the villagers before your opponents. It can also be played in cooperative mode, in which players must unite to make their faction prevail by bending the will of the villagers. You can also play EGREGO in a more narrative variant: Play as your 3 entities and, with the behavioral tendencies they represent, Invent stories about the villagers you possess. EGREGO is the perfect game for lovers of mental challenges, strategic confrontations and storytelling.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Zone of Control

name: Storm Raiders: Resource Specialist Crew Card Promo
description:
Introducing the resource specialists of Atlantis! These five unique Crew will make it easier for you to fulfil Contracts.

Shuffle these into your Crew Card deck for every play count.

Abilities:

Pay 1 fewer Electrical Parts when fulfilling a Contract
Pay 1 fewer Mechanical Machinery when fulfilling a Contract
Pay 1 fewer Orichalcum when fulfilling a Contract
Pay 1 fewer Fuel when fulfilling a Contract
Pay 1 fewer General Goods when fulfilling a Contract


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: The Battle of Kawanakajima 1561
description:
The Battle of Kawanakajima is about the fourth Kawanakajima battle that took place in 1561, in which Takeda Shingen and Uesugi Kenshin clashed in Shinano Province (present day Nagano Prefecture) over territorial expansion.

This game is a revival of Shingen vs. Kenshin: Blood bath at Kawanakajima released by Sho Kikaku in 1988 with a modern design.

At the beginning of the game, the Takeda army has a small army compared to the Uesugi army, but as the game progresses, the main forces heading towards Mt. Tsumame come to the main battlefield, so the offense and defense are reversed in the first and second half of the game.

This new edition also includes new units, rules and variants. Both the old and new versions are included.

Game scale

Distance on the map (1 hex) = approximately 330m
1 unit = approximately 500 to 1000 men


Number of players = 2 people
Play time = about 90 minutes

Game information:

Solitaire quality: high
Rule difficulty: low


—description from the publisher (translated and adapted)


永禄 Eiroku (era) - 1558-1570
辛酉 Metal Rooster (58th term of the sexagenary cycle)
川中島合戦 The Battle of Kawanakajima

name: Fabulous Vegas
description:
In Las Vegas of the 1950's, improve your casino's and be the one that attracts the most visitors!
In this worker placement game, you try and have the most attractive casino's by building VIP facilities, upgrade rooms and hire better staff. Staff members enhance your actions or give you permanent bonuses depicting on slot machines. Some even give you alternative ways of scoring points! Every visitor gives you income and garners points for the end score. Visitors step off the plane on one side of the board and it is your job to attract them to your casino's on the strip on the other side of the board. Beware of mobsters that make your life a bit more difficult!

name: Chakana
description:
Have you heard about Inca "chess"?
It's dynamic intellectual duel where you can fight not only with your own pieces but with common ones. Here they are, ladybugs, Sun God's messengers. And these ladybugs you share with your opponent can fly all over chakana (Inca or Andean cross) and sit on your "ordinary" pieces making you stronger. Take the opponent's ladybug-king in your Cantua, Inca sacred flower, and you win!

—description from the designer

name: Trick Circle: Yo-yo Edition
description:
Trick circle is a game for 1-4 yoyoers that helps develop and innovate your trick set in a fun and interactive way. There are 3 ways to play but I’ll just explain the main way to play here. :)


Deal the cards to all players.
Next each player chooses one card from their hand to play in the center.
All players then use the cards played to create tricks.
Finally all players vote in the best trick and the player with the most votes wins the highest power card.
Repeat this until there are no cards left in anyone’s hands.
The player with most points wins!


—description from the designer

name: Ubongo: Die Schule der magischen Tiere – Der Film
description:
In Ubongo, players compete to solve individual puzzles as quickly as they can.

To begin, each player takes twelve polyominoes — that is, pieces consisting of 2-5 squares in some configuration; players use these pieces each round to try to recreate patterns shown to them on puzzle cards. The quicker you complete the puzzle, the larger the reward you receive.

Ubongo: Die Schule der magischen Tiere – Der Film features the same gameplay as the Ubongo base game, but with players now trying to collect the magic animals instead of gems. The game also includes a co-operative variant in which players try to help one another complete the challenges.
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Pattern Building, Real-Time, Set Collection

name: Dark Hearts
description:
Dark Hearts is a solo wargame with RPG elements. As the chosen Dark Heart, the player will lead the dark elf armies to conquer and dominate the world below the surface in the name of the Spider Mistress.

The gameplay revolves around a solitaire wargame with RPG elements contained within a book available in PDF and physical formats. Players will navigate through distinct phases, including conquest, relations, treachery, and events. The modular play feature allows customization, offering a variety of campaigns, enemies, and supplements for replayability.

Players utilize military force, intrigue, and dark magic to conquer territories, manage resources, and overcome rivals, resolving battles and tests through uncomplicated mechanics.

The goal is to lead the dark kin to victory within the allocated number of turns, all while managing relationships with advisors, disposing of rivals, and making decisions to survive the deadly game of power. Failure results in swift death, and only the strongest and most twisted Dark Heart can triumph.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Events, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rome's Defiance: Hannibal
description:
Rome's Defiance: Hannibal is a solo board game where players step into the shoes of Hannibal's Carthaginian army on its path to conquer Rome. The game chronicles Hannibal's life through his battles, spanning from Hispania to Rome and Carthage.
The player faces off against intuitive yet challenging enemy armies controlled by an AI.
Immerse yourself in the strategic depth of Hannibal's military campaigns and experience the relentless pursuit of victory in this epic solo gaming experience!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Astralia Chronicles
description:
Astralia Chronicles in an trading card game with classic game design and anime aesthetic. Its easy to learn, hard to master gameplay and stratified lore will provide an immersive game experience for both new and expert card gamers.

Astralia Chronicles is a game that is played between 2 and the objective of the game is to win by defeating the opponent Lead card.

Each player choose a Lead (his companion during the battle: it determine the cards that player can put in the decks and who will start the game), a Persona Deck (a 5-card deck that represents the idendity of the Lead and are the heart of the strategy, usable via Lead unique skill) and the Main Deck (a 45-card deck with all other Characters and action that player can play during the game). Each Lead has a peculiar gameplay, strength and weak points.
Each player has a field of 6 slot, where they can call cards from their hand. There are 3 types of cards: Characters (that can fight with other Characters, Scenography or Leads), Scenography (cards that remain on the field but they cannot attack) and Actions (cards that can be played in both turn with immediate effects).
Each card has a fragment cost, a resource that is granted simultaneously to both player at the start of each first-player-turn.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Interrupts

name: Liberty Ignited
description:
In the tumultuous landscape of 1923, Liberty Ignited unfolds amidst relentless continental wars. The heartland, staunchly advocating US neutrality, finds itself at odds with the East and West Coast states. These coastal powers, seeking to shift the nation's power dynamics, make a bold decision to invade the central US states. The struggle for valuable resources becomes the epicenter of a dynamic conflict that will shape the fate of the entire nation.

Liberty Ignited introduces a revolutionary deck-building mechanic. Craft your initial deck and shuffle, the sequence of units determines their availability. This innovative approach adds a layer of depth, allowing players to adapt their tactics based on the evolving composition of their decks.

Embark on tactical endeavors as you execute strategic Actions, including launching attacks, orchestrating movements, conquering territories, and acquiring new units to bolster your forces. Navigate the ongoing continental conflicts of 1923, where dice rolls dictate the outcomes of your decisions. Employ careful unit shifts, aiming to convert your opponent's territories into crucial assets under your faction's control. Refine your deck's makeup through strategic thinning, ensuring a precisely tuned draw deck to confront the diverse challenges.

Diverging from the frozen landscapes of Arctic Ignited, Liberty Ignited invites players to immerse themselves in the ongoing conflicts of 1923. Balancing chance, strategy, and deck-building finesse, the game promises an immersive dieselpunk saga. Liberty Ignited unfolds against the backdrop of a nation in turmoil, offering an unparalleled gaming experience in the rich historical setting of 1923.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Civil War, Dice, Wargame
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Zone of Control

name: Crimetime: Fall 004 – Das letzte, was du siehst, bin ich
description: "Someone who deserved it died tonight. And she won't be the last!" This anonymous threat appears on local TV in Schaffhausen, an idyllic Swiss town. Shortly afterwards, the first body is found. Will the phantom strike again? Relentlessly experience every twist and turn of the story - goosebumps guaranteed.

name: ABC Warriors: The Miniatures Game
description:
Supreme military robots, created for a conflict that ended centuries ago, the ABC Warriors are built to endure warfare in all its deadly forms – atomic, bacterial and chemical.

ABC Warriors – The Miniatures Game is a skirmish tabletop miniatures battle game for two or more players based on the 2000 AD series The Volgan War written by Pat Mills and illustrated by Clint Langley.

Team up with Hammerstein, Joe Pineapples, Mongrol, Deadlock, Steelhorn, Zippo and Ro-jaws to take on Volkhan. The Ikon of Ikons and fearsome leader of the Volgan robotic forces is intent on conquering Marineris City with his crazed robot hordes, aided by the treacherous Blackblood and insane Mek-quake.

Will Volkhan obliterate all in his path, or will the ABC Warriors succeed in standing firm against the Volgan war machines?

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Random

name: Soda Jerk
description:
Soda Jerk is set amidst the bustling vibrant American soda fountain era of the 1950s. Each player embodies the spirit of a soda-slinging hero, poised to mix, shake, and serve their way to glory. Armed with personalized decks of cards, Soda Jerks scramble to match symbols and gather the precise ingredients needed to craft the perfect drink, all while racing against their opponents to serve waiting customers promptly.

As the clock ticks down and closing time looms after two rounds, victory awaits the player who has amassed the most coin—a taste sweeter than the finest pop in town!

—description from the publisher

name: Walking with Jesus
description: Walking with Jesus is a table top board game for children 6 & up, it teaches about the life of Jesus from his annunciation to his resurrection.

name: Galactic Space Junkers
description:
The interstellar mining corporation Deep Core, has embarked on an ambitious project to extract energy from space junk. They have discovered that the ore found on various planets in a newly discovered galaxy contains the key to unlocking an innovative, clean energy source. To achieve this, Deep Core has constructed advanced space stations equipped with a new covert recycling technology. As a space junker, your task is to mine for various ore types scattered throughout the planets and repurpose them into specialized circuits that will power your space station to powerful new levels.

In Galactic Space Junkers, you will build a bag of mined junk ore to recycle, store, and build into distinct types of circuits which vary in value. You will have your own space station to upgrade with your built circuits. Once your station reaches max circuit level, the game will end. The player with the most powerful space station will be the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Goko Games
description:
Goko is a card game that's fun and helps you learn Korean. It's friendly for everyone, whether you know Korean or not. Take turns collecting letter cards to match your word cards. Watch out for bombs, trade wisely, and form alliances to win with strategy.

Whether you're aiming to learn Korean as a New Year's resolution or looking for the perfect gift for a K-Pop enthusiast, join us in making this game a reality. We're excited to share our game with you and we hope you'll love it as much as we do.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Matching, Trading

name: SD Gundam Grand Battle LSI Game
description: This is a game based on the Gundam franchise. Players maneuver on a board with their units and when they go into battle both pieces are placed into an electronic reader and the computer displays the results of the battle.

name: 無限まちがいさがし (Infinity Find the Difference)
description: Every time the card changes, the difference become new! Find the difference card game

name: 탐정이 너무 많다 (Too many detective)
description:
The owner of the mansion was found dead. The participants who were stranded in the mansion due to heavy snow each claimed their innocence by providing alibis...
However, criminals always leave traces at the location of their crime.
Whose hands are in possession of the unproven alibi?

name: Dracula's House
description:
Dracula's House is a game about exploring the home of Vlad.

Four players attempt to find and destroy Dracula before they succumb to him and his minions. The game involves searching rooms, fighting off minions, and obtaining items that will aid the players in their quest.

This is game number 15 in Bandai's Party Joy line of games.
mechanics: Events, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Roll and Rails: Portugal – Spain Map Pack
description:
Portugal - Spain Expansion for Roll and Rails game.

Contains: Spain map for solitaire game, Portugal map for multiplayer game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Trains
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Roll and Rails: France Map Pack
description:
France Map Expansion for Roll and Rails game.

Contains: Corsica map for solitaire game, France map for multiplayer game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Roll and Rails: South Africa – Madagascar Map Pack
description:
South Africa - Madagascar Maps Expansion for Roll and Rails game.

Contains: Madagascar map for solitaire game, South Africa map for multiplayer game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Roll and Rails: Brazil – Peru Map Pack
description:
Brazil - Peru Map Expansion for Roll and Rails game.

Contains: Peru map for solitaire game,Brazil map for multiplayer game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Roll and Rails: India Map Pack
description:
India Map Expansion for Roll and Rails game.

Contains: East India map for solitaire game, West India map for multiplayer game,
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Roll and Rails: Australia – New Zealand Map Pack
description:
Australia - New Zealand Map Expansion for Roll and Rails game.

Contains: New Zealand map for solitaire game, Australia map for multiplayer game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Roll and Rails: Egypt – Tunisia Map Pack
description:
Egypt - Tunisia Map Expansion for Roll and Rails game.

Contains: Tunisia for solitaire game,Egypt map for multiplayer game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Roll and Rails: China – South Korea Map Pack
description:
China - South Korea Map Expansion for Roll and Rails game.

Contains: South Korea map for solitaire game, China map for multiplayer game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Roll and Rails: Santa's Base Map Pack
description:
Winter Holiday Map Expansion for Roll and Rails game. Free version.

Contains: North Pole with Santa's Base map.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Roll and Rock: Bands Expansion
description: This expansion gives players possibility of playing as 1 of 12 real bands each with its unique ability that changes the way you play the game.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Roll and Control: Vicious Fight
description: In Vicious Fight you will fight against your opponent's units, maneuver your troops and give bribes to take control of the castle. This expansion gives more interaction between players.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Roll and Control: Merchant's Cove
description: Expansion for Roll and Control. In Merchant's Cove you will produce resources in cities and send them for trade after each Era. Resources that you can send are based on people that can load ships and on a contract that is decided at the beginning of the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Roll and Control: Kingdom Builder
description: Expansion for Roll and Control. In Kingdom Builder players decide borders of Provinces before the game begins. Size and borders of Provinces make different things more or less important during each game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Roll and Control: Legacy
description: In Legacy Expansion you will play whole campaign on four maps that change from game to game. The winner is the player that gets the most consistent scores throughout all four games.

name: Roll and Control: Quests
description:
In Quests Expansions you will need to perform certain tasks that will grant you points. They make each game more diverse by including more objectives to fulfil during the game.

Contains: quests sheet.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Industrollization: Specialists&Investors
description:
If you want to add more strategy and challenges to your Industrollization game this is perfect expansion. It includes two modules you can add to your game. you can add both or only one it's up to you.

Specialists. Thanks to this module you will get 7 specialists that will help you during the game with their special actions. Each specialist can be used only once during the game, so choose the perfect time to use their help wisely.

Investors. This module brings investors to your game. Fullfill their needs to score more points. Each player will be able to pick 6 investors during the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Print & Play

name: Royal Builders: Archipelago
description:
Travel through the ocean and develop whole archipelago.
If you want to increase replayability and variety of the game of Royal Builders you should definitely try Archipelago expansion. This expansion lets you travel from port to port to discover new lands and expand your kingdom.

This expansion contains new maps to play and new mechanics offering you new way of play.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: Royal Builders: Industrial Construction
description:
Expansion for Royal Builders.

Create buildings that produce resources, connect them and get luxurious goods.
If you want to increase replayability and variety of the game of Royal Builders you should definitely try Industrial Constructions expansion. This expansion lets you create production chains which will give you additional points.

This expansion contains new maps to play and new mechanics offering you new way of play.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: Royal Builders: Unique Structures
description:
Construct different buildings in a city to score even more points.
If you want to increase replayability and variety of the game of Royal Builders you should definitely try Unique Structures expansion. This expansion lets you build unique structures. The more you will build the more points you will get.

This expansion contains new maps to play and new mechanics offering you new way of play.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: Dice Castles
description:
Dice Castles is a quick to play, easy to learn, puzzle game that plays solo or with up to 6 players! It's a game all about moving a D6 die through a castle card. But along that way you may run into ice, warps, time shifts, gravity switches, bombs and more...

Solo: dice castles can be played solo as either a quick single puzzle (of 17 different puzzles) to try to navigate to all 5 goals OR it can be a solo adventure to try and explore to all 10 castles in one run, starting from a single random castle card. There are also 16 challenging scenarios in addition to all this.

Multiplayer: Multiplayer is a hectic and fun real-time race to get to all 5 goals on a single castle card before the other players do. But if you get stuck, your points at that moment is what you score for the round. The first player to all 5 goals wins OR the player who made it to the most by the end of a run. Beware however, gravity and time aren't what they seem to be - especially in multiplayer.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Different Dice Movement, Hexagon Grid, Real-Time

name: Recruits Card Game
description:
Recruits is a popular card game played by the critters in the forests of Wrenwood. It combines elements of strategy, luck, hand management, and blind bidding, making it an exciting and competitive game. It is played in taverns as gamblers wager bets and by travelers wanting to pass the time at night during camp. The game has been around so long that many variations have surfaced.

Players try to outbid each other to draft the best team of Recruits, earning the most points to win. Several Recruits are available to bid on at a time, each with different point values. Players take turns laying down cards in bids for the highest total pair of cards in hopes of claiming the Recruit. With restrictions on what cards can be placed for bidding, players will block other players, stall recruitment, and force others to waste cards, all while carefully managing their hands and planning the next move. When all the bids are placed for a given Recruit, the pile is resolved, and the Recruit goes to the highest bidding player. At the end of the game, the player with the highest point total in Recruits wins.

—description from the designer

name: Manóváros
description:
The game surrounds us, lying right before us, we just have to notice it. When we go outdoors, children immediately start to collect things, stacking pebbles... But how can you play a board game with berries, pebbles, and little sticks? How does the sunlight play with us? This book and the 7 game boards found in it help with this – take them with you to the park, on trips, on vacation: go outside and play a little with the world!

—description from the designer (translated)

A játék körülvesz minket, előttünk hever, nekünk csak észre kell vennünk. Ha kimegyünk a szabadba, a gyerekek rögtön el is kezdenek gyűjtögetni, kavicsokat rakosgatni... De vajon hogyan lehet bogyókkal, kavicsokkal, botocskákkal társasjátékot játszani? Hogyan játszik velünk a napfény? Ebben segít ez a könyv és a benne található 7 játéktábla – vigyétek magatokkal a parkba, kirándulásra, nyaralásra: menjetek ki a szabadba, és játsszatok kicsit a világgal!

—description from the designer

name: Historical Conquest: American Revolution Expansion
description:
Historical Conquest Expansion Packs each include 20 additional cards based on a specific era in history.

This one includes new events, people and more about the American Revolution, including Major John Pitcairn.
categories: Adventure, American Revolutionary War, Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Trading

name: Historical Conquest: Roman Expansion
description:
Historical Conquest Expansion Packs each include 20 additional cards based on a specific era in history.

This one includes new events, people and more about the Romans, including Quintus Fabius Maximus.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Trading

name: The Australian Football Game
description:
The Australian Football Game is an early example to simulate the game of Australian rules football. The board has the positions of footballers marked with a circle. Players would use a counter (the football) that is slid across the board by pressing down using another flat disc. The object would be to move the counter onto your players circle. If successful a player could get close enough to shoot for a goal. If a goal is scored a player receives 6 points and the ball is returned to the center to recommence play.
The game could be played for a designated time or first player to reach an agreed final score.

—user summary

name: Lily Leapers
description:
It is a fantastic day for a race at the pond!

Be the first to get all your frogs across to win!
Jump along lily pads towards the log while kicking your opponent into the water or snatching a delicious fly on the way!

So hop to it!
--

Lilly Leapers is a simple, strategic, and endlessly re-playable 2 player racing game; For fans of The Royal Game of Ur & frogs in general.

—description from the publisher

name: Tenkafubu
description:
This is a new game in the Sengoku Jidai series from Hexasim. The battles of Okehazama (1560), Anegawa (1570) and Nagashino (1575) are depicted.

The game emphasizes orders assigned to each army's Clans as much as the inertia of the battle. A game turn is divided in activation phases drawn from a recipient containing Clan chits and obligatory chits (for combat, movement, etc.). The game system is also remarkable for the battle plans that each players may choose before starting the engagement.

Sieges played a key role in the battles of Nagashino and Okehazama, and as such have their own specific set of rules. The fortress of Yokoyama is also present at the battle of Anegawa.

Okehazama is a two player game in which decoy troops play an important part.
Nagashino can be played with two or three players. The setup is an opportunity for the players to try 8 different situations. One of which is the very frontal historical battle.
Anegawa can be played by 4 players (2 teams of 2).
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Zone of Control

name: Ντοπιολαλιά: Ηπειρώτικα (Νtopiolalia: Ipeirotika)
description:
The goal of the game is for a player or a team to win the most points answering correctly to the questions and summing up at the end the points of each card in its possession.
The game can be played from two or more players or teams.

The game incorporates Folklore, linguistic, and cultural data from a specific region of Greece (Epirus). Other version of the game refer to other regions (Crete, Thrace, Piraeus, Pontus)

name: Hoofd Bewaking
description:
Your house is a museum. Various valuable art treasure maps are distributed in your house or garden.

Try to steal as many objects as possible.
Beware, some treasures are too heavy to lift alone.
Work with your teammates (team of thieves) to carry the items to the correct getaway car.

Be careful, because one of the players is Head of Security.
As a living security camera it is his job to catch the thieves red-handed.

The thieves have 3 minutes to steal as many art treasures as possible without being caught.
The camera lens opens every four seconds so that the Head of Security can track down the thieves.
When a thief is caught twice he is out.

name: PEEP
description:
What percentage of Danes have had sex on the lawn?
What percentage of Danes have intentionally cheated on taxes?

PEEP is the game that gives you the answers to how we Danes really are!

As the first board game ever – supposedly – PEEP gives you a sneak peek into the secret everyday lives of Danes.

The game has asked a lot of normal Danes a lot of abnormal questions, which they have answered anonymously. Now it's up to you and your opponents to try to guess what the Danes have answered to the many questions.

In PEEP, it's not just about guessing right, but also about daring to take risks and gamble when it matters. A right bet can turn the tide...

PEEP is a cheerful game for everyone.

If you dare to play along and reveal how you yourself respond to the questions in the game, PEEP will definitely be an exciting and revealing experience.

name: Hark! Vengeance
description:
HARK! VENGEANCE cries your name, demanding you redress the iniquities of crime. Crime’s roots run deep. Crime is a festering corruption that spews a stench of despair and chaos. Crime is a dread phantom that makes the innocent quake in fear. But crime is also a crucible, forging its own demise in you, the hardened force of bone-crushing justice, the lone fighter, ready to trade blows with the wicked and trace every vile villain to his secret lair.

Hark! Vengeance is a card game for 1 player. You control a lone fighter, punching and kicking through hordes of enemies to find the bosses at the head of a possibly endless criminal conspiracy. The game emulates “beat-em-up” video games, as your hero progresses through various stages filled with low-level foes, obstacles, hazards, power-ups, and secrets that will help you progress deeper. It’s no sweat to find rascals who need to be taken down, but you’re out for revenge against the deepest villains in the criminal conspiracy. Each game will see you revisit stages, discover five new challenges, and face off against a boss who is part of the criminal conspiracy. The deeper your journey into the criminal underworld takes you, the greater the glory, the colder the vengeance, and the higher the score you achieve.

This is a “Make-as-You-Play” game, which means that you will create and modify many of the components during play, principally index cards. Each copy of Hark! Vengeance will evolve differently, with stages and bosses posing different challenges and opportunities. Moreover, should you complete the deck and jump into a sequel, there is no limit to the number of stages you can explore or despicable bosses you can beat down.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Fighting, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Asuntos Internos
description:
"Attention to all units, a murder has occurred". Witnesses immediately alerted the Homicide Division of the city's Police Station. The crime scene is being investigated without knowing that among the officers is the Killer. Furthermore, there might be an Accomplice diverting the investigation so that the culprit is never revealed. Will they manage to uncover the murderer in time?

"Asuntos Internos" is an exciting hidden roles game for 4 to 8 players that puts them in the shoes of forensic detectives investigating a mysterious murder. One player secretly takes on the role of the killer, while the rest of the players act as investigators working together to solve the case.

The main objective of "Asuntos Internos" is to solve a murder by accusing the killer before time runs out. Players must collaborate to identify the killer and gather enough evidence to bring them to justice.

The Killer wins the game if, by the end, they haven't been discovered (if there are Accomplices in the game, they also share the victory as the Killer wasn't uncovered).

The Innocent Police win the game if they manage to discover the Killer, revealing their role through Evidence and Investigations.


“¡Atención a todas las unidades, ha ocurrido un asesinato!” Testigos inmediatamente dieron aviso a la división de homicidios de la Policía de la ciudad. La escena del crimen está siendo investigada sin saber que entre los uniformados está el Asesino. Además, podría haber un Cómplice que esté desviando la investigación para que nunca se sepa el culpable. ¿Lograrán descubrir al asesino a tiempo?

Asuntos Internos es un emocionante juego de roles ocultos de 3 a 8 jugadores que los sitúa en el papel de detectives forenses que investigan un misterioso asesinato. Uno de los jugadores asume en secreto el papel del asesino, mientras que el resto de los jugadores representan a los investigadores que trabajarán juntos para resolver el caso.

El objetivo principal de Asuntos Internos es resolver un asesinato acusando al asesino antes de que el tiempo se agote. Los jugadores deben trabajar juntos para identificar al asesino y recopilar pruebas suficientes para llevarlo ante la justicia.

• El Asesino gana la partida si al final del juego no logró ser descubierto (si hubiera Cómplices en la partida, estos también comparten la victoria debido a que el Asesino no logró ser descubierto).

• Los Policías Inocentes ganan la partida si logran descubrir al Asesino, revelando su Rol por medio de Evidencias e Investigaciones.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action/Event, Deduction, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: mob7
description:
mob7 (もぶセブン) is a shedding card game from Japan, similar to Old Maid. In mob7, players are shedding cards from their hand so that the value totals to 7 exactly. Any combination of cards is allowed, even seven 1s, as long as it is exactly 7 in total.

The deck is formed of one 7, two 6s, three 5s and so on, and also only four 0s. The deck is shuffled and the cards dealt out. A player starts by drawing a random card from their right hand neighbour's hand, and then lays down a 7 combo if they can. Going clockwise, the next player then draws a random card from their hand and play continues.

If a player is able to empty their hand, either by shedding or having their last hand card drawn from them, they are out for the round. The remaining players continue until one is left, who is the loser of the game.

「ババ抜きのようでババ抜きじゃない そんなゲームです」　基本的な進行と勝利条件はババ抜きのようですが、捨てるカードは同じ数同士ではありません。０〜７の数字のカードを足し合わせて７になるセットを１組捨てていきます。足して７にさえなれば、足し合わせて捨てるカードは３枚以上でも構いません（１が７枚でも可能）。最も早く手札を全てなくした人の勝利です。
使用するカードは数字は７が１枚、６が２枚・・・（０のみ４枚）言ったように階段状に異なる枚数の３２枚です。
--description by user

name: Who's the Boomer
description:
In Who's the Boomer, a party game blending humor and strategy in the realm of contemporary culture, players compete to determine who is most in step with the times. Influence the game by selecting challenging questions for your opponents.

Each player manages a character deck that reflects their in-game persona. Answering questions incorrectly will age your character.

name: 80s and 90s Hum It
description:
Work as a team to perform and guess the 80s and 90s tunes. Whether you hum like a harmonious hummingbird or drone like a bee, hummers are happy people, so keep on humming. —description from the publisher

Guess the classic 80s and 90s songs from the hummed clues. The better you hum and the faster you guess, the more points your team will score.

name: Corny Jak Śwynto Ziymia
description: Coal mining game. Players are trying to bring up as much coal as possible. Game has dice rolling for movements and deck building for action cards. Cards provide events and negative interaction.
mechanics: Command Cards, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Redemption: The Prophets
description:
The Prophets Redemption CCG Expansion Set introduces 105 new characters and enhancements from the Bible to bring more strategy and excitement to the game of Redemption. This set was introduced in 1996. Each pack contains 8 cards, 4 common, 3 uncommon, and 1 rare card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Operation Bøllebank
description:
Operation Bøllebank is a solitaire game that depicts the events of the night between 29th and 30th April 1994, when a UN armored task force of tanks and APCs from DANSQN2 engaged Bosnian-Serb forces around the town of Kalesija, near the border between Bosnia and Serbia.

The Player will control the UN forces, while the game system drives the opposition. In order to win, the player must reach the base TANGO 2 with at least one of their Leopard tanks, while trying to comply with the restrictive Rules of Engagement. Any player's casualty will be considered a failure of the mission.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Redemption: The Women
description:
The Women Redemption CCG Expansion Set introduces 81 new characters, enhancements, and artifacts from the Bible to bring more strategy and excitement to the game of Redemption. Cards are common.

Each booster contained 8 cards.

The set introduced a new type of card called a Site, which can hold a Lost Soul and prevent characters of a different color than the Site from rescuing that Lost Soul. Sites can also be used along with Heroes to grant them access to Lost Souls held in specific colored sites.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: The Warriors
description:
The Warriors Redemption CCG Expansion Set introduces 171 new characters, enhancements, and artifacts from the Bible to bring more strategy and excitement to your Redemption games. Cards are common, uncommon, rare and ultra-rare.

This was the first set to contain ultra-rare cards.
This set introduced two new types of cards, Artifacts and Fortress Sites, along with a new Silver color Hero brigade that is all Angels.
This was also the first set to include a set icon in the bottom corner of the card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: The Apostles
description:
The Apostles Expansion Set of Redemption CCG introduces 207 new characters, enhancements, and artifacts from the Bible to bring more strategy and excitement to your Redemption games. Cards are common, uncommon, rare and ultra-rare.

Each booster pack contains 10 cards.

This was the first set to include gold borders on ultra-rare cards. The Fortress Site card icon was changed as well.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: The Patriarchs
description:
The Patriarchs Redemption CCG Expansion Set introduces 159 new characters, enhancements, and artifacts from the Bible to bring more strategy and excitement to your Redemption games. Cards are common, uncommon, rare and ultra-rare.

This set introduced a new card type: Covenant Cards. Covenant cards were the first dual type, both Good Enhancement and Artifact.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: The Kings
description:
The Kings Redemption CCG Expansion Set introduces 250 new and re-printed characters, enhancements, and artifacts from the Bible to bring more strategy and excitement to your Redemption games. Recommended for advanced players. Cards are common, uncommon, rare and ultra-rare.

Booster packs contain 10 cards.

This set introduced Warrior-class characters and enhancements. Warrior-class enhancements can be played on warrior-class characters and retained on that character after battle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: Angel Wars
description:
The Angel Wars Redemption CCG expansion set uses the excellent art and intriguing characters from the amazing new animated series, Angel Wars. The animated series is being produced by TeleStoryTOONS LLC and distributed by EMI-CMG. This newest card set adds 150 new cards to the Redemption trading card game.

Booster packs contain 10 cards and are common, rare and ultra-rare.

This set introduced dual color enhancement cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Religious

name: Redemption: The Priests
description:
The Priests Redemption CCG Expansion Set introduces 251 new and re-printed characters, enhancements, and artifacts from the Bible to bring more strategy and excitement to your Redemption games.

Booster packs contain 10 cards of common, uncommon, rare and ultra-rare rarity.

This was the first set to include rarity identifiers on cards as well as identifying tags on cards.
This set introduced two new color brigades, Teal (Good) and Orange (Evil), and Curse cards, which are dual Evil Enhancement and Artifact.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: Thesaurus Ex Preteritus
description:
Thesaurus Ex Preteritus Redemption CCG Expansion Set introduces 60 new cards into the game. It is also called Treasures from the Past

Each card booster pack contains two (2) Thesaurus cards and thirteen (13) cards from the Warriors, Prophets, Limited Edition, Apostles and Patriarchs sets. The approximate card mix is as follows:
2 Thesaurus foiled cards
4 Apostles (all rare/ultra rare)
5 Patriarchs (rare/ultra rare or uncommon)
1 Warriors (random)
3 Prophets and/or Limited Ed. (common, uncommon or rare)

All cards were considered common and were foil. This was the first set release to include numbered cards for reference in the bottom corner. This set introduced Territory Class Enhancements, which can be played outside of battle as long as a character of the matching brigade is in play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: The Disciples
description:
The Disciples Redemption CCG Expansion Set introduces 115 new cards. All cards are considered common.

Each card box contains four (4) Disciples cards and eleven (11) cards from the Apostles, Patriarchs and Angel Wars card sets. The approximate card mix is as follows:
4 Disciples cards
4 Apostles (all rare/ultra rare)
4 Patriarchs (rare/ultra rare)
3 Angel Wars. (common, rare or ultra-rare)

—description from the publisher

name: Redemption: The Early Church
description:
The Early Church (TEC) Redemption CCG Expansion Set introduces 146 new and re-printed characters, enhancements, and artifacts from the Bible to bring more strategy and excitement to your Redemption games.

This set introduced territory class characters as well as many great new cards.

This set contains 4 ultra-rare, 34 rare, and 108 common cards.

Each card box contains five (5) Early Church cards and ten (10) cards from the Rock of Ages, Faith of Our Fathers and Kings. The approximate card mix is as follows:​
5 The Early Church cards (1 Ultra-Rare or Rare and 3 Commons cards) (random)
4 Kings cards (random)
3 Faith of Our Fathers cards (random)
3 Rock of Ages cards (random)​

This is the first set with altered graphic design, without the scroll by the scripture verse and the card special ability in that box instead of in the picture. It introduced Territory Class Characters that activate and stay active when put in play.

—description from the publisher

name: String Theory
description:
Throughout history, some subsets of the population have believed wildly improbable things. These are often referred to as conspiracy theories and the threads holding those theories together are often tenuous at best. In this game you play as a radio show host trying to convince the public of ridiculous conspiracy theories. Weave your way between people, places, events, and things to spin a tall tale that surly must be true. Game play involves moving a string and bobbin around a peg board to connect locations on the game board. The first player to make a credible theory wins.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Connections, Grid Coverage, Hexagon Grid, Line Drawing, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Redemption: The Persecuted Church
description:
The Persecuted Church (TPC) Redemption CCG Expansion Set introduces 93 new and re-printed characters, enhancements, and artifacts from the Bible to bring more strategy and excitement to your Redemption games.

This set contains 3 ultra-rare, 26 rare, and 64 common cards.

Each card box contains four (4) Persecuted Church cards and ten (10) cards from the Rock of Ages, Faith of Our Fathers and Kings. The approximate card mix is as follows:
4 The Persecuted Church cards (1 Ultra-Rare or Rare and 3 Commons cards) (random)
10 random cards from Kings, Apostles, Patriarchs, and Angel Wars.
1 Warriors card (random)

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: Cloud of Witnesses
description:
The Cloud of Witnesses (CoW) Redemption CCG Expansion Set introduces 129 new and re-printed characters, enhancements, and artifacts from the Bible to bring more strategy and excitement to your Redemption games.

This set contains 3 ultra-rare, 36 rare, and 90 common cards.

Each card box contains four (4) Cloud of Witnesses cards and eleven (11) cards from the Warriors, Angel Wars, Kings, Apostles, and Patriarchs. The approximate card mix is as follows:
4 Cloud of Witnesses cards (1 Ultra-Rare or Rare and 3 Commons cards) (random)
3 Angel War cards (random)
3 Kings cards (random)
2 Apostles cards (rare or ultra-rare)
2 Patriarchs cards (rare or ultra-rare)
1 Warriors card (random)

This set introduces the Cloud cards, which is simply any card that has a cloud visual “tag”.

—description from the publisher

name: Redemption: Revelation of John
description:
The Revelation of John (RoJ) Redemption CCG Expansion Set introduces 129 new and re-printed characters, enhancements, and artifacts from the Bible to bring more strategy and excitement to your Redemption® games.

This set contains 3 ultra-rare, 36 rare, and 90 common cards.

Each card box contains four (4) Revelation of John cards and eleven (11) cards from the Rock of Ages, Faith of Our Fathers and Priests. The approximate card mix is as follows:
4 Revelation of John cards (1 Ultra-Rare or Rare and 3 Commons cards) (random)
5 Priests cards (random)​
3 Faith of Our Fathers cards (random)
3 Rock of Ages cards (random)

This set introduced The Reserve, which is another element of deck building. In certain formats, a deck can have a certain number of cards that are part of the deck, but not yet in the deck. They can be accessed through certain cards and brought into play from The Reserve.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: Fall of Man
description:
The Fall of Man (FoM) Redemption CCG Expansion Set introduces 147 new and re-printed characters, enhancements, and artifacts from the Bible to bring more strategy and excitement to your Redemption games.

This set contains 3 ultra-rare, 36 rare, and 108 common cards. It also contains 18 Legacy Rare cards, which are older cards that have been brought back with a new twist.

Each card box contains five (5) Fall of Man and ten (10) cards from the Thesaursus ex Preteritus, Disciples, Patriarchs, and Kings. The approximate card mix is as follows:​​
5 Fall of Man cards (1 Ultra-Rare, Rare, or Legacy Rare and 4 Commons cards) (random)
3 or 4 Kings cards (random)
3 or 4 Patriarchs cards (random)
2 Disciples cards (random)
1 Thesaurus ex Preteritus card (random)

This set introduced Cities, which are dual Fortress Sites and regular Sites, and Unity. Unity is an identifier on some cards that appears in the format "Unity: X (Y)" and means "If all of your X are Y". If the unity is met, the ability activates.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Good Cop Bad Cop (Fourth Edition)
description:
Take a look around the table to figure out if your fellow cops are Honest or Crooked so you know if they are on your team or against you. Grab a Gun or Equipment and work with your team to take down the opposing leader!

This version has the following primary changes from English 3rd Edition:

A gun for everyone instead of a limited number depending on player count to ensure you always have something useful to do on your turn.
Instead of a Lead Investigator token, each player has a reference card that shows their winning condition and the actions they can take on their turn.
Gender and racially neutral integrity card art.
Improved some of the least useful equipment cards like Surveillance Camera and Truth Serum.
The box has the pin on the side rather than the top.
Various other small improvements to the verbiage on equipment cards and rules.
mechanics: Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Memory, Take That

name: Bunny 100
description:
Do a squat, flex your bicep, make a fart sound...? Get silly and laugh out loud in this part game of counting to 100! Challenges are added every 10 numbers. Can you keep up? Avoid the poop and become the ultimate Bunny Master.

Players lay all the decks on the table and open one action and one unit card. From the youngest player, count from 1 to 100. However, you have to perform the action on the action card instead when you reach the number indicated. More challenges will be added along the way. Players who fail perform the correct action will receive a rainbow poop. The game ends at 100 and the player with the least rainbow poop... wins!

name: Backdoors & Breaches: Expansion Deck
description:
Backdoors & Breaches: Expansion Deck v1.2 was created to add additional attacks, injects, and a procedure card to the Core Deck. We introduced Consultant Cards that can help you solve the incident.

Backdoors & Breaches is an Incident Response Card Game created by Black Hills Information Security and Antisyphon Training to help information security professionals learn cybersecurity and conduct fun and engaging table top exercises.

—description from the designer

name: Royal Builders: Market
description:
Trade resources for missing goods and victory points.
If you want to increase replayability and variety of the game of Royal Builders you should definitely try Market expansion. This expansion lets you exchange goods and score additional victory points.

This expansion contains market sheet and new mechanics offering you new way of play.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: Bier Pioniere: Johann Schlegel Promo card
description:
Promo card for Bier Pioniere that was at first exclusively given to backers of the game on Spieleschmiede.

Ability: You may fulfill one order and will receive 1 VP for it, while all other players will lose 1 VP.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Hand Management, Simulation, Trading, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Bier Pioniere: Flaschenoffner Promo card
description:
Promo card for Bier Pioniere that was at first exclusively given to backers of the game on Spieleschmiede.

Ability: You may fulfill one order, but it must contain 'Pils'.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Hand Management, Simulation, Trading, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: R.A.V.E.L.
description:
Can you pierce the secrets of the R.A.V.E.L. (Rare Artefact Vertiginously Enigmatic and Logical)?

R.A.V.E.L. is an endlessly resettable puzzle, where you’ll have to manipulate 8 dice placed in the centre of a grid in order to solve the Cog cards placed around it. Each solved Cog card will grant you a unique opportunity to further unlock the remaining cards, but only the clever use of your limited resources will allow you to pierce the secrets of this strange contraption.

name: Freigard
description:
The horrible Walking Castles are about to invade the peaceful land of Freigard. Gather the most valiant defenders of this enchanted abode and defeat the relentless mechanical monsters!

Freigard is a deceptively simple game of risk taking and hand management: each turn you have the choice between scoring (if possible) your hand of 3 cards, or draw one extra card (then discard one) in order to improve your hand. If you’re too greedy, you risk burning through your deck too fast, but settling down too often might not get you the powerful army you need to defeat the strongest Walking Castles…

—description from the publisher

name: Last Minute
description:
You’re an elite (?) bomb squad and have just one minute to defuse a series of dangerous devices before everything goes… you know.
Will this be your Last Minute?

Last Minute is a solo/coop game that plays in real time: you’ll have to play the right Defuse cards on the appropriate Bomb cards, respecting a double timer condition. A cool head, fine planning and (if you face the challenge with friends) good coordination will be necessary to avoid an explosive defeat!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mayor of Chicago
description:
It’s election year in Chicago, and as an aspiring politician this might be your golden opportunity to rise to the coveted position of Mayor. Will you gather enough money, popularity, and power to prevail?

Mayor of Chicago is a solitaire game of tight management and tough choices. Each turn, you draw a city card and decide whether you want to use it to expand your knowledge of the Windy City (by laying this card as part of the map), or hire the assistant depicted on the back of the card to benefit from their special power or scoring abilities. Only by managing shrewdly your resources and the powers of the assistants will you be able to gather enough votes to be elected.

—description from the publisher

name: Banana Loco
description:
A banana treasure-hunting card game where players strategize, dominate, and compete to collect precious bananas. Each treasure can be found using its corresponding colored treasure map or monkeys. You can use them to find your desired bananas.

Be careful! Other players will try to steal your treasures and your belongings!

A set collection and hand management game, Banana Loco is a party game for competitive players.

Bury treasures in the center pile. Find ways to own them. Use monkeys to dig and protect your treasures. Dominate other players by raiding their treasures!

Strategize and fool other players by using traps or empty treasures. Use each turn to protect, raid, and steal banana treasures from other players.

Become the greatest banana treasure-hunter!

Strategize, Dominate, and Win!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Karnivorous
description:
Seeking to end world hunger with giant apples, scientists used their discovery on the wrong plants, and now the apples will be feasting on them! Soon the rest of mankind will be snacks, too, unless you brave gardener-robots — the only non-vegetable sentient beings in the lab not yet eaten — take care of this infestation.

In the 1-4 co-operative game Karnivorous, players must allocate their dice to trigger actions: run through the lab, fight plants, and resolve crisis cards that increase their knowledge of these aggressive plants. Only the best use of your dice results will allow you to stop this rampant deadly growth!

—description from the publisher

name: Redemption: Prophecies of Christ
description:
The Prophecies of Christ (PoC) Combined Redemption CCG Expansion Set contains 222 new cards plus 18 Legacy rare cards.

This set contains 6 ultra-rare, 72 rare, and 144 common cards. It also contains 18 Legacy Rare cards. Legacy rare cars are re-releases of older cards that have re-worked abilities.

Prophecies of Christ released in 2 phases from 2018–2019.

Each combined phase 1 and phase 2 card box contains five (5) Prophecy of Christ and ten (10) cards from the Women, Rock of Ages, Faith of our Fathers, Unlimited, and Thesaurus ex Preteritus. This is set to change as they run low on Rock of Ages cards. The approximate card mix is as follows:
5 Prophecies of Christ cards (1 Ultra-Rare or Rare and 4 Commons or Legacy Rare cards) (random)
5 Faith of our Fathers cards (random)
2 Rock of Ages cards (random)​
2 Unlimited cards (random)
1 Thesaurus ex Preteritus (random)​

This set introduced Star cards, which are cards you can reveal when they are drawn to one-time activate the Star ability.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: Faith of our Fathers
description:
The 2007 Faith of our Fathers Redemption CCG Expansion Set consists of 100 cards. The cards are sold in ten sets. Each card set comes in a tin along with five expansion packs, one each from the Original, Prophets, Apostles, Kings and Priests sets.

This is the 1st Faith of our Fathers set release.

This was a newer release format, in that each Tin, numbered 1-10, included the same cards. One could simply purchase the 10 cards they wanted in the specific tin in which they were sold.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: Rock of Ages
description:
The 2008 Rock of Ages Redemption CCG Expansion Set consists of 90 cards. The cards are sold in nine sets. Each card set comes in a tin along with five expansion packs, one each from the Unlimited, Prophets, Apostles, Patriarchs and Priests sets.

This set was released in Tins of 10 cards, numbered 11-19, with each tin containing the same Rock of Ages cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: Faith of our Fathers 2
description:
The 2011 Faith of our Fathers Redemption CCG Expansion Set consists of 30 cards. The cards are sold in three sets. Each card set comes in a tin along with five expansion packs, one each from the Original, Prophets, Apostles, Kings and Priests sets.

This set was released in Tins numbered 20-22, and contains 10 cards where each numbered tin has the same identical cards.

They are all considered common.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: Rock of Ages 2
description:
The 2011 Rock of Ages Redemption CCG Expansion Set added 30 cards. The cards are sold in three sets. Each card set comes in a tin along with five expansion packs, one each from the Unlimited, Prophets, Apostles, Patriarchs and Priests sets.

This set contained tin numbered 23-25, where each numbered tin had the same identical 10 Rock of Ages cards.

All cards considered common.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: Rock of Ages 3
description:
The 2013 Rock of Ages Redemption CCG Expansion Set added 10 cards. The cards are sold in one set. The card set comes in a tin along with five expansion packs, one each from the Unlimited, Prophets, Apostles, Patriarchs and Priests sets.

This set was 1 tin, numbered 26, which released 10 new cards.

This was the first Rock of Ages set that was in the new non-scroll graphic design format.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: The Lineage of Christ
description:
The Lineage of Christ (LoC) Redemption CCG Expansion Set contains 240 new cards plus 18 Legacy rare cards.

This set contains 6 ultra-rare, 72 rare, and 162 common cards. It also contains 18 new Legacy Rare cards.

This set introduces the term Meek, which is a character with no abilities, and UR+ cards, which are alternate art, full color equivalents (no border) of UR cards. 1/3 of all UR cards are UR+.

Normal Pack:
Each normal card box contains five (5) The Lineage of Christ and ten (10) cards from the Apostles, Angel Wars, Kings, Patriarchs, I/J Starter, and RoA. The approximate card mix is as follows:
5 The Lineage of Christ cards (1 Ultra-Rare or Rare and 4 Commons or Legacy Rare cards) (random)
3 I/J or Rock of Ages cards (random)
3 Patriarchs cards (random)​
2 Apostles or Angel Wars cards (random)
2 Kings cards (random)​​

Super Pack:
Each card box contains five (10) The Lineage of Christ cards. The approximate card mix is as follows:
8 Common or Legacy Rare cards (random)
2 Rare or Ultra Rare cards (random)

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: Gospel of Christ
description:
The Gospel of Christ card set is available as both regular packs and Super Packs. There are 252 cards and 18 new Legacy Rare cards.

This set introduced Tokens, which can be created by certain cards.

Each card box contains:
5 cards from I & J Starter and RoA set #26
5 cards from GoC (4 common or legacy rare and 1 rare or UR or UR+)
Each Display will include 2 UR or UR+ cards.

Each Super Pack contains:
8 common (or Legacy rare) cards and 2 rare or Ultra-rare (UR) cards
Each Display will include 4 UR or UR+ cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: Israel's Rebellion
description:
There are 129 cards in the Israel’s Rebellion set.

Each card box contains nine (9) cards:

Four (4) Israel’s Rebellion cards (3 common and 1 rare or ultra-rare).
Five (5) “Redemption Roots” cards.
Each Display will include 1 ultra-rare.

“Redemption Roots” are new versions of classic Redemption cards that have been given new life through updates and modifications. There are 224 unique Roots cards in total.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Redemption: Roots
description:
Redemption Roots are new versions of classic Redemption cards that have been given new life through updates and modifications. There are 224 unique Roots cards in total. These cards could be considered a new card set. But, rather than sell them as an expansion set, we are using these to fill out card packs for expansion sets such as Israel’s Rebellion.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Babble Battle
description: Babble Battle is a hilarious word game. Wear the included mouth separators and try to say the funny phrases. Your teammates have to guess what you're saying which can be hard and hilarious to do with the mouth separators in. The team with the most correct phrases guessed throughout the rounds wins the game. Over 600 phrases! Ridiculously fun party game and perfect for family game night!

name: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them: Niffler Challenge
description:
The adorable, mischievous Niffler has its own game for the first time! The objective of the game is for each player (2 players) to load up the Niffler with jewelry and coins until they spill into the briefcases. The first player to spill the jewelry and coins wins. The game includes one Niffler on a rocking base, two wands, 64 coins, and necklace pieces.

Load up the Niffler with jewellery and coins. - description from the publisher

Fantastic Beasts 39895-11L Wizarding World Challenge Harry Potter Niffler Game, Multi-Colour, One Size. The adorable, mischievous niffler has its own game for the first time.

name: Invaluable
description:
In the game of Invaluable, players are directors of competing museums. They buy and sell artifact cards, to amass high scoring collections, or to just get rich. Either approach can win you the game!

The order in which players offer artifact cards determines the value of those cards, so players must carefully time their actions. Running out of money at the wrong time can ruin your plans! Of course, you should try to make sure that exact thing happens to your opponents!

On their turn, a player puts a card from their hand up for auction. If another player wins the auction, the original player is paid the winning bid. But if the original player wins the auction, the money is removed from the game. Cards that are won at auction are placed in the winning player’s museum tableau following very simple rules.

Once every card has been sold, the game is over. Artifacts in museums are worth points depending on how they are positioned relative to other artifacts. Subsequently, the same artifact can be worth different amounts to different players. Coins are also worth points, opening up another possible route to victory for shrewd artifact sellers.

—description from the designer

name: DCeased: Life Equation Set
description:
This set contains four of the most requested characters from the Kickstarter comments that weren't released during the campaign. It was created for purchase in the pledge manager.

The pack contains:

Super Heroes

Supergirl
Beast Boy
Brainiac


Bystanders

Eagly
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Relative Insanity:  Old Farts
description:
Expand the fun of Relative Insanity with Relative Insanity Old Farts! In Relative Insanity, you read a setup card aloud, like “When my brother brought out his new baby to show the family, Granny blurted out…” Then everyone else chooses one of their punchline cards to finish the phrase, like maybe “You are not the father!” or “I just vomited a little bit in my mouth.” The reader picks the one they think is the funniest, and that player gets a point! Old Farts is a “grand” expansion to the original focusing on older relatives! Use the Old Farts expansion as its own game or to expand on the original game for more laughter than ever before! Featuring the humor of Jeff Foxworthy, it’s a different hilarious game each time you play!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Legends Awaken: The Iberian Quest
description:
Legends Awaken: The Iberian Quest is an adventure and strategy board game that immerses players in the rich tapestry of Spanish history and mythology. Through a journey through the Iberian Peninsula, participants discover ancient legends, face mythical creatures and forge their own destiny in a world where history and fantasy intertwine.

Game Mechanics:

1. Character Selection:
- Each player chooses a character based on Spanish historical or mythological figures, each with unique abilities that influence the strategy of the game, there are a total of 17 cards to choose from.

2. Exploration and Movement:
- Players explore the path, which depicts a medieval Spain, using a card-based movement system, revealing new areas and challenges.

3. Encounters and Challenges:
- By visiting new locations, players face challenges that may include solving puzzles based on history and mythology, battles with mythical creatures using a card combat system, or moral decisions that can change the course of their journey.

4. Collection and Use of Objects:
- During their adventure, players can acquire magical items that offer special advantages, such as increasing their strength in battle, protecting themselves from certain dangers, or unlocking secret paths.

5. Missions and Achievements:
- Each player has a main quest based on their character's story, as well as side quests they can complete for additional victory points.

6. Interaction between Players:
- Although the game can have a cooperative or competitive approach, depending on the game mode chosen, there will always be elements of interaction between players, such as trading, temporary alliances or duels.

7. Victory Points:
- Players accumulate victory points by completing missions, overcoming challenges, and collecting valuable items. The player with the most points at the end of the game, or the first to complete their main mission, is declared the winner.

Legends Awaken: The Iberian Quest is designed to be accessible to both novice and experienced players, offering strategic depth and narrative immersion that invites participants to immerse themselves in the rich history and mythology of Spain.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Educational, Fantasy, Medieval, Mythology, Travel
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Events

name: Say This Playlist
description:
A party game of song titles.

Do you know people who can hear a random word in the middle of a conversation and immediately start singing a song that contains that word? This is the premise of Say This Playlist.

To start the game a player picks a card from the deck and reads the word on the card to the group and also flips the sand timer. Using the supplied playlist cards and dry erase markers, all players races to write down as many song titles that they can think of (no Googling) before the time expires.

The players then take turns reading the songs on their playlists and if anyone else has the same song, they each have to erase that song from their list. You get a point for every remaining song and you count your points for that round.

The play ends after 4 rounds have been completed and the winner is decided by whoever has the most points.

—description from the publisher

name: Hurt Party: A Game of Bad Apologies
description:
Hurt Party: A Game of Bad Apologies pokes fun at all of the terrible ways we say we’re sorry.

Inside the cake-inspired box, you’ll find 250 terrible apology cards and 250 hurt cards.

Everyone starts with seven Apology Cards. In each round, one person is the “Hurt Party,” the person whose feelings were hurt, and they read out a random Hurt Card explaining what has hurt them.

Hurt Card examples include:
“You ignored my cat.”
“You broke my favorite mug.”
“You left without saying goodbye!”

The Hurt Party then decides which apology is their favorite, and gives their Hurt card to the player with the best (or worst!) apology.

Apology card examples include:
“You’ll be fine.”
“Sorry, I’m the worst.”
“Sorry, but you should lower your expectations.”

The first player to collect 5 Hurt Cards wins the game!

—description from the designer

name: Once a la Carta
description:
Let's take "Chilean Once"! Together with your family and friends, enjoy a good conversation, doing challenges and gathering the ingredients that make this rich Chilean tradition possible.

Start by taking turns answering questions, telling experiences and carrying out challenges to win cards, with which you can exchange and collect the necessary characters to prepare your favorite "Chilean Once".

Collect as many characters as possible to assemble and prepare your favorite "Chilean Once". If you collect more than the rest you win and you must choose the person who clears and organizes the table. On the contrary, if you collect fewer characters than the rest, you lose and you have to wash the dishes.

name: Spottington
description:
One player at a time draws a card, then every player seeks the matching picture on the village-scape board. Each player has a token to stake their claim if they see the image first. The 7 double-sided, interchangable hexagonal boards keep the game fesh every time as well as the extensive pile of 250 image cards to choose from.

This game is great for young and old alike as a warm-up for game night or some quick rounds of fun.

name: Chef's Table
description:
Chef’s Table is a medium-weight, cooperative worker placement game. Players take actions in different areas of the kitchen as they prepare, plate, and improve ingredients (dice), building the perfect 4-course meal for the restaurant’s VIP guests. Kitchen space and ingredients are limited, and players need to be strategic as they manage personal and shared resources.

Players will control a unique kitchen station where they manage a custom pool of ingredients (dice), workers, and special actions. Players select a chef who will lead their station; Chef’s have own unique talents that boost performance as they visit different areas of the kitchen.

Players allocate workers throughout the kitchen, where they use personal or shared ingredients in different ways. The team earns Favor Points for each completed menu item, but will lose points for incomplete items, or ingredients that don’t meet Chef E’Lahn’s standards. Each course is more challenging than the last, requiring more ingredients, higher ingredient quality (dice value), or both.

Service and Course Challenge cards modify how the kitchen operates or elevate the standards for one or more menu items. The difficulty imposed by challenge cards will also escalate, so be prepared! Players can also play against a course timer (Clocked-In mode), which requires even more cooperation and communication.

Think you’ve earned your promotion? Compare the team’s final score to Chef E’Lahn’s service standards: a set of scoring criteria by which your performance is evaluated. Each game, record your team’s name on Achievement Cards. Try new combinations of chefs and stations, ramp of the difficulty of the game by using challenge cards, and test your team to achieve your culinary dreams!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Kleingarten
description:
In this tiny corner of your world you’ll work and play with Neighbors while becoming a Master Grower. With each turn of the game you will build new features that will eventually yield a multiplying harvest of Resources. Share with Neighbors, support community events, and learn from Master Growers as you earn Victory Points along the way. Each player creates a unique horticultural space (their own Kleingarten!) where they harvest energy and water, grow a variety of plants, and raise small animals.

Kleingarten is a competitive roll-and-write about sustainable horticulture. Over 12 rounds, each player will recruit volunteers, work in their garden, install renewable energy, harvest resources, and share with neighbors.
