ボスサリーノ (Bossarino) is a 2 player deduction game from Japan. The game is packaged in a small plastic can, with a cloth gameboard (5x5) and ten chips, five for each player. The chips show a mafia boss, a pair of goons and a pair of innocent bystander. Players lay out their pieces face-down, hiding which piece is which from their opponent. The goal is to either eliminate the opponent's boss, or get their boss off the other side of the board.

Players take turns either moving pieces one space in any direction, including swapping positions with the opponent's chip, or challenging the opposing chip when they are adjacent.

If the challenge is between a goon or boss and the opponent's goon or boss, the opponent's piece is eliminated (winning the game if it was the boss).

If the challenge is between a bystander and a goon or boss, the bystander wins, eliminating the goon/boss whoever's turn it was (winning the game if it was the boss).

Alternately, getting the boss off the board through the middle three spaces wins the game too.
--description by user

The boss is leaving, so "Bossarino!"
Want to experience the thrill of a dramatic battle of wits? Bossarino will make it happen!
・Light and the size of an empty can! It's easy so anyone can play!
・Your personality comes out and makes you laugh! That person who is usually quiet is actually...

Move each other's five hidden pieces to find and eliminate the opponent's boss, or sneak your own boss away. Enjoy the thrill of the moment when you turn the pages.

ボスが去るから"ボスサリーノ！"
・ドラマのような、ドキドキ、ざわつく心理戦を手軽に味わいたい？ 「ボスサリーノ」なら叶えてくれる！
・空き缶サイズで軽い！簡単なので誰でも遊べる！
・性格がでたりして笑える！普段大人しいあの人は実は・・・
「正体の隠されたお互いの５つのコマを互いに動かし、相手のボスを見つけて排除するか、
自分のボスをこっそり逃がしてください。」
めくる瞬間のドキドキ感をお楽しみください。
--description by publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Grid Movement, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Square Grid

name: Resequence: A Card Game
description:
Resequence is a captivating, fast-paced, 1 to 8 player game where you take the helm of a Faction, vying for dominance over a fractured Novus City. Your objective is clear: increase the value of your faction characters while diminishing your opponents’. Resequence offers a dynamic and ever-evolving battlefield, where alliances can shift and power dynamics are in constant flux. Choose your moves wisely, and let the grid become your canvas in this immersive game of strategy and skill.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Math, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Connections, Deck Construction, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Skate Summer: Special Trick Promos
description:
Pack of 3 trick promo cards (Jackhammer, Reiman Flip and Nell Raiser) that were unlocked during the Skate Summer Kickstarter campaign and given for free at all backers.

Jackhammer - Get 2 flames per player with higher score

Reiman Flip - When moving, you may discard to move to big air

Nell Raiser - When played, score 1 pt per regular trick card in combo
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Different Dice Movement, Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Resource to Move, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Smelly Left-Overs
description:
The Smelly Left-Overs deck has 98 letter cards, 2 Burp and 2 Oh Poo cards.

Each player starts with a hand of 3 cards. During your turn you draw a card, then play as many cards from your hand as you can and want, either playing letters to start a word, or adding letters to extend a word already on the table. When a word is finished it is set aside and play continues, starting a new word.

Play continues until the deck is exhausted and no one can play any more letters. The cards remaining in each player's hand is their "smelly left-overs", and the player with the fewest wins. The Burp and Oh Poo cards cannot be played, so they will become part of your leftovers at the end.

A variation is to select a theme, and all words formed must relate to that theme.

name: 1-2-3 Shout
description: 1-2-3 Shout has a deck of 26 letter cards (AABBCCDDEEFGHILMNOPRRRSSTT) and a deck of 26 theme cards. Both are shuffled, and the top card of each deck is revealed at the same time. The first player to shout out that matches the theme and starts with that letter wins both cards. The whole deck is gone through, and the player with the most won cards wins.

name: Warfront
description:
A classic fantasy wargame… in your pocket!
Warfront is a 2D wargame designed to be fast and played on the go!
Your typical 3D models associated with well known fantasy wargames are reimagined as 2D unit cards within a standard sized deck of cards.
Deploy, move and activate these unit cards across a war torn fantasy battlefield.
The perfect introduction to wargaming and the perfect light distraction for veteran players. All the essential elements of wargaming distilled into a punchy and engaging package.

In Warfront, take command of the righteous Zenith Guard to protect the kingdom or lay waste to the land as the Corrupted Legions led by Belzen the Corruptor.
These two factions, and all future expansions, are designed as a reimagining and homage to classic, beloved fantasy tropes.

Warfront is going to particularly appeal to:

Gamers new to wargames wanting to play and enjoy the genre without the usual enormous barriers to entry.
Gamers looking to be able to play fantasy wargames on the go, on holiday, during their lunchbreak etc without carting around their delicate models.
Gamers looking to introduce fantasy wargaming to their friends and relatives without scaring them away!
Any gamer looking to enjoy a fun, fast-paced and thematic board game!


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Movement Points

name: Alpha Bet
description:
Alpha Bet plays similar to 7-card draw poker where players make words with the letter cards -- 102 in the deck -- using provided plastic chips in two colors.

For each hand, players each place one chip in the center and get dealt a 7 card hand. Then everyone has 2 opportunities to discard 1 or more cards and get dealt replacement cards, to improve their hand. After that there is betting, players in turn start a bet with chips, meet the previous bet and possibly raise it, or fold, dropping out of the hand. The maximum bid is 5 chips. After the bidding is over, those still in the hand reveal their cards and announce the word(s) they are spelling. The best hand wins the pot of chips. Play until a certain time expires, or one player has all the chips.

Hands are primarily ranked by the length of the words made:

7 letter word
6 letter word
5 and 2 letter words
5 letter word
4 and 3 letter words
4 and 2 letter word
4 letter word
3 and 3 letter words
3, 2, and 2 letter words
3 and 2 letter words
3 letter word
2, 2, and 2 letter words
2 and 2 letter words
2 letter word


If players tie for the length of their words, then the points on the letter cards is added, and the higher total wins. If still tied, they split the pot.

name: Lucky Egg's Cereal Snap
description: Race other players to match your cereal cards, the first player with no cards left slams the buzzer to start the Udder Chaos battle. The player who slammed the buzzer picks up the squishy Udder Chaos milk carton and throws it at other players. The last player to be tagged by the milk carton when the buzzer goes moo, loses that round.

name: Psycho²
description:
Psycho² (Psycho Squared) is a realism crime scene investigation game. It takes real forensic and deduction techniques used by real detectives and delivers them straight to your door. Take down murderers hidden in the community, elusive serial killers and twisted cults.

With our unique 3 stage investigations you and your friends, partners (or just you) can set out every month to find a new killer.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Deduction, Finale Ending, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Word Grab
description: To play Word Grab, the 90 letter tiles are spread out face up on the table. At the word "Go", all players simultaneously grab letters from the pile that make words; once they have a word they each add its letters to their personal letter pile. After everyone is finished grabbing letters, each player goes through their pile and says the words they formed, and their score is the total number of letters used. If there are any leftover letters that they forgot how they used, or if they misspell a word, the letters involved are subtracted from their total. Highest total wins.

name: The Never Ending Game
description:
The Never Ending Game has over 100 letter tiles. On their turn each player takes a letter and either starts a word or adds a letter to those already in play. The object is not to finish a word of 4+ letters. Before playing a letter a player may challenge the previous player in one of two ways:


For completing a word of 4+ letters, decided by consensus of the players or by checking an agreed-on dictionary.
For making a string of letters that is not part of a valid word. The challenged player says what word uses those letters if they can.


However the challenge resolves, that ends the round, the letters are discarded, and the winner of the challenge starts the next word. The game can be played in one of two modes:

Winning: The winner of each challenge gets a token, and the first player to an agreed-on total (like 8) wins.
Elimination: The loser of each challenge gets a token, and when a player gets an agreed-on total, they are out for the rest of the game.


There are also 4 difficulty levels:

Easy. New letters may only be added at the end of the current sequence of letters.
Medium. New letters may be placed at either end of the current sequence.
Expert. New letters may be placed anywhere in the current sequence, but the letters' order must be preserved.
Genius (Anagram level). After adding a new letter the entire set of letters may be rearranged in order.


Since a player must place a new letter on their turn, bluffing is frequent, and a player must catch a previous error and challenge the previous player in order to end the current round.

name: Dice Among Thieves
description:
Dice Among Thieves is a 3-4 player game of thievery and luck.
Players take turns as the lead thief on a job.
Players press their luck, stealing dice from other players and trying to amass the most points by the end of the game. Sometimes you have to work together for your own benefit.

The game comes in a mint tin, and contains 16 dice (4 each of 4 different colours), 6x character cards with special abilities, instructions, score sheets and a pencil.

Keep score with our free online score calculator or by printing more free score sheet.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Publish or Perish: A Satirical Party Game about Academic Life
description:
Welcome to academic publishing! In this humorous game that may involve collaboration, backstabbing, and science trivia, you navigate the whimsical and often chaotic academic life. The fun doubles when playing with a loud friend who enjoys nerdy academic trash-talking!

Gameplay Setup
Separate all Action Cards, Manuscript Cards, and Trivia Cards into 3 piles.
Place 7 Manuscript Cards face-up and replenish back to 7 when any are taken.

Winning the Game
Whoever has the highest number of citations at the end of the game wins.
The main way to gain citations is to claim a Manuscript Card (i.e., publish a manuscript) by playing the required Research Cards (shown on the Manuscript cards) into the discard pile in one’s turn.
IMPORTANT: When a player publishes a paper, they must announce what they publish. Then, all other players must say “Congratulations on your publication!” while clapping. Anyone who fails to send Congratulations while clapping must give an Action Card of their choice to the person who catches them. Place the published Manuscript Card next to yourself face up to indicate it is your publication.

Gameplay
Deal each player 3 Action cards to hold in secret.
The youngest player goes first.
In a player’s turn, they can play as many Action Cards as they wish in any order. Draw 2 cards from the Action Card draw pile at once to end their turn.
Whenever the draw pile depletes, randomly take 10 cards from the discard pile as the draw pile.
In your turn, you can discard up to 1 Research Card to have someone ask you a trivia question. If you answer correctly, you can retrieve any Research Card from the discard pile to keep.
Game End
When any player publishes their 5th Manuscript, all remaining players will have one more turn, and then the game ends.
For groups with less than 4 players, the game ends when someone publishes their 6th Manuscript.
The first person who publishes their 5th manuscript (or 6th if there are fewer than 4 players) will receive the “First to publish” Token and gain 2 extra citations.
Unconstructive criticism, backhanded compliments, and academic trash-talking about newly published papers and players’ actions are encouraged throughout the game. The person who is voted as the best trash talker at the end of the game will receive the “Best trash talker” token and gain a 3-citation bonus.
There is no hand limit, and the number of cards one holds is public knowledge.

name: Tipperary: Objective Cards
description:
New Challenges: Objective Cards for Tipperary

This promo is part of the Lookout magazine "News from the Lookout" Issue #20.

name: Invocaster
description:
In Invocaster, play as a powerful wizard capable of summoning legendary creatures!
Face your opponents by strategically moving your creatures, using their powers and enhancing their strength with elemental tiles.
Your goal: eliminate each of your opponents to become the greatest sorcerer of them all.
Are you ready to take on the challenge?

Invocaster is a turn-based strategy game where each player plays as a powerful wizard.
The goal of the game is to eliminate everyone else's wizard and be the last survivor.
To achieve this goal, each wizard can summon legendary creatures who will reveal themselves throughout the game in a shared common pool.
Once summoned, a creature remains under the control of its wizard.
Players will take turns performing actions such as moving their creatures, using their powers, attacking enemies or to strengthen their team using energy tiles.

For even more complex strategies, advanced game modes exist such as constructing your own team of creatures or equipping artifacts to enhance your wizard.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: スパークリングハピネス (Sparkling Happiness)
description:
Sparkling Happiness is a may-follow trick-taking game, but only until you win your first trick with a card offsuit. You can follow suit as a normal must-follow game, but you win more points for winning tricks offsuit. When you win your first trick offsuit, you must follow suit after that, and then you cannot win a trick with the color that you won the offsuit trick or tricks. If you do, you lose both tricks. Also, you need to finish the round with an exact number of tricks. How you organize your things and get rid of what doesn't sparks happiness is up to you.

—description from the publisher

name: Una questione di voto: Leader in prima linea
description:
The first expansion for the board game Una Questione di Voto which introduces important innovations for the enrichment of the gameplay. The Leaders of the political parties come into play, the electoral campaign increases in intensity and scenography thanks to the new scoreboard of the boot of Italy on which the Leaders will move with the chosen means of transport, attendance bonuses and regional media will affect the national votes together with new "thematic matching" cards. For the second part of the game, government life, amendments, parliamentary questions, recovery fund decrees and new wildcard event cards will add further strategies available to players.

—description from the publisher (translated)

La prima espansione per il gioco da tavolo Una Questione di Voto che introduce delle importanti novità per l'arricchimento del gameplay. Entrano in gioco i Leader degli schieramenti politici, la campagna elettorale aumenta di intensità e scenografia grazie al nuovo tabellone dello stivale d'Italia su cui si muoveranno i Leader con i mezzi di trasporto scelti, bonus presenza e Media regionali incideranno sulle votazioni nazionali insieme a nuove carte "tematiche abbinate". Per la seconda parte della partita, la vita di governo, emendamenti, interrogazioni parlamentari, decreti recovery fund e nuove carte evento jolly aggiungeranno ulteriori strategie a disposizione dei giocatori.

—description from the publisher

name: Una questione di voto: Squadra di Governo
description:
The second expansion for the game Una Questione di Voto.

The concept of Governance enters the gameplay of the base game with the Cabinet team of Ministers, with the new additional final victory mode calculated in "Governance Points", with the new deck of "Chronicles from Italy" cards, with the new boards to be added to the basic board and the board for the Governance points track complete with summary legend. The electoral campaign will be even more captivating with the new "Exit poll" dashboard and the colored wooden cubes of the political parties for monitoring the regions won at the polls. Two new types of Leader profiles (charismatic and diplomatic)

—description from the publisher (translated)

La seconda espansione per il gioco Una Questione di Voto.

Il concetto di Governance entra nel gameplay del gioco base con la squadra di Governo dei Ministri, con la nuova aggiuntiva modalità di vittoria finale calcolata in "Punti Governance", con il nuovo mazzo di carte "Cronache dall'Italia", con le nuove plance da aggiungere al tabellone base e la plancia per il tracciato dei punti Governance con tanto di legenda riassuntiva. La campagna elettorale sarà ancora più accattivante con la nuova plancia "Exit poll" e i cubetti di legno colorati degli schieramenti politici per il monitoraggio delle regioni conquistate alle urne. Due nuovi tipi di profili Leader (carismatico e diplomatico)

—description from the publisher

name: Una questione di voto: Bicameralismo perfetto
description:
The third expansion for the game Una Questione di Voto

The mixed electoral system, majoritarian and proportional, becomes part of the gameplay making the simulation even more realistic with the use of the new regional constituency boards including single-member and proportional constituencies. The two chambers of Parliament, the Senate and the Chamber of Deputies, take physical shape thanks to the two new boards and the colored wooden cubes that will represent the senators and deputies, a new deck of "Chronicles from Parliament" cards will increase the interaction of the players, this and more inside the box.

—description from the publisher (translated)

La terza espansione per il gioco Una Questione di Voto

Il sistema elettorale misto, maggioritario e proporzionale, entra a far parte del gameplay rendendo la simulazione ancora più realistica con l'uso delle nuove plance circoscrizioni regionali comprese dei collegi uninominali e proporzionali. Le due camere del Parlamento, Senato e Camera dei deputati, prendono forma fisicamente grazie alle due nuove plance e ai cubetti di legno colorati che rappresenteranno i senatori e i deputati, un nuovo mazzo di carte "Cronache dal Parlamento" andrà ad aumentare l'interazione dei giocatori, questo e altro ancora all'interno della scatola.

—description from the publisher

name: Political Fallout
description:
Welcome to Political Fallout, where objectives aren't just set—they're fueled by unbridled AMBITION! Your mission: seize the most Influence currency before the final curtain falls. Navigate a treacherous landscape of cunning bluffs, strategic alliances, and political finesse to secure your dominance. In the chaos of Mutual Nuclear Destruction, emerge not just a survivor, but the mastermind behind civilization's triumphant resurgence!

Political Fallout takes place in the shadowy world of Alealamia, a dark mirror to our own world, where six superpowers vie for unyielding supremacy. The delicate equilibrium hangs by a thread, balanced on a knife's edge of alliances and trade deals on the brink of collapse. Behind each nation's facade lurk Elites, the puppet masters pulling the strings of power.

Take command as one of these nations, orchestrating your Elite cadre to outmaneuver adversaries and claim victory. Your ultimate quest: amass the most influence currency to ensure your nation's resilience in the face of impending nuclear apocalypse. As the world hurtles towards oblivion, only the nation with the highest influence currency can carve out a future amidst the radioactive ruins, ready to lead the charge in rebuilding from the ashes.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Negotiation, Political, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Negotiation, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Scallywager
description:
Set sail and seize the legend!

In this Liar's Dice type game, challenge yer fellow pirates to be the last mate standing and holding all ye plundered treasure. Bet, parlay, or call your enemy captain a liar, but be careful, your crew mates are always at risk on the high seas of Scallywager! Succeed and you shall acquire treasure and adventure cards to assist you on your journey. Fail and you lose your precious six-sided treasures until you are totally out of the game. A captain wins the game when no other crew mates are left aboard their ship. May ye dice be ever in ye favor!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Olygo
description:
Olygo is an engaging board game that puts your strategic thinking to the test. Players compete to create intricate polygon shapes on the game board to accumulate points and outwit their opponents. The goal is to strategically place pieces to form unique polygons, earning more points for complex and larger shapes. Be prepared to strategize, block your opponents, and plan your moves carefully in this dynamic and challenging game of geometric wit. Olygo is a thrilling blend of creativity and tactics, providing a fun and competitive experience for players of all ages.

—description from the designer

name: Biblus: Chronicle I
description:
Step right up, adventurers, and prepare to embark on an epic journey through the sacred scriptures in Biblus: Chronicle I! Gather your flock of 2 to 10 eager participants, for a test of biblical knowledge and wits like no other.

Within the confines of this ancient tome lie 64 enigmatic rebus cards, each a cryptic window into the cherished tales of the Good Book. With the shuffle of cards, the game ignites, promising moments of both enlightenment and hilarity.

As players take turns drawing from the deck, the tension mounts. With bated breath, they reveal the intricate symbols, challenging their peers to decipher the hidden truths within. Amidst a chorus of guesses and laughter, one lucky soul holds the key to the solution, their lips sealed as others scramble for revelation.

With each triumphant deciphering, a card is claimed, a badge of honor for the victor. Yet, even in moments of defeat, the journey continues, with unsolved rebuses returning to the deck for another chance at glory.

Passing the torch of inquiry from one seeker to the next, the cycle of discovery unfolds until every card finds its rightful keeper.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Party Game, Real-time, Religious, Trivia
mechanics: Deduction, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Interrupts, Ladder Climbing, Memory, Multi-Use Cards, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Spatûla
description:
Immerse yourself in a captivating story from the moment you step into an idyllic village. Experience an adventure that will transport you into a world of culinary greatness, exploration, and foodfights. Find your way in the village on a modular tabletop game.

Explore the village, meet its people and remember their desires. Collect various objects and ingredients, and strive to keep them. Stay on the move, engage in food battles with your opponents. Venture down unexplored paths and navigate with impeccable timing and the use of fast passes.

Embark on the journey to become the next successor and proud proprietor of the renowned restaurant, ‘Spatûla’! But not before you prove your mettle, overcome obstacles and challenges, and ultimately unveil the secret recipe.
mechanics: Action/Event, Catch the Leader, Hidden Victory Points, Market, Matching, Memory, Pieces as Map, Player Judge, Point to Point Movement, Race, Targeted Clues

name: Fit the Fishes
description:
In Fit the Fishes the players will be populating their aquariums with fish by tracing cardboard stencils and completing various objectives, like feeding the fish and providing them shelter.

In the end, each player is left with a drawing
that can be brought to life with colored pencils!

The game develops visual perception, fine motor skills, as well as attentiveness, and presents a fun and stimulating activity for the children. How many fishes can YOU fit?

—description from the publisher
publishers: ADC Blackfire Entertainment GmbH, Red Cat Games

name: Bear Mountain Camping Adventure: Rough Terrain
description: This expansion adds a 5th player option to the game as well as off-road tires, water bottles, campsite tiles, camping activities, and more!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Race

name: Path of Alexander (2nd Edition)
description:
Back in 2020, I designed and released a limited edition special roll and write solitaire game called Path of Alexander which followed Alexander the Great and his journey through Asia. Admittedly, the game was incredibly difficult when released and suffered from a few balance issues. Those have since been fixed as the player now earns Movement Factors every turn along with a number of other mechanical improvements. Path of Alexander is now available again in a new and improved edition, currently the only version available is digital but I'm working on getting a physical package together.

—description from the designer

name: Pirate Poker
description:
In Pirate Poker, you are a pirate in search of treasures and the goal of your quest is to be the first to find five diamonds or to eliminate your opponents.

Players will discover treasures and everybody will bet to have the priority of choice to get their favorite treasure. This is already cool but there is more, players can be sneaky and pay to hide the treasure they have discovered. What’s in this hidden treasure, a Diamond? a Parrot? a Malediction? nobody else knows… except maybe if you have a Monocular to have a peek!

You’ll find plenty of items in treasures that will affect the game, attacking opponents, stealing cards, modifying bet, trading, spying on cards and much more. New players appreciate the ease of play while advanced players enjoy the high level of strategy and the deep mind play.

Strategy, bluff and knowing your opponents will be the key to victory.

name: Biota: Strange World
description:
Biota: Strange World is a competitive tableau builder in which 2-5 players traverse the planet of Biota, gathering resources and collecting creatures with unique abilities. Players will use these abilities to move around the map, gather extra foods, and avoid the apex predators that hunt them and their creatures.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Dost Thou Deceive Me?!
description:
Lie, Boast, and Persuade Your Way to Fame in Dost Thou Deceive Me?!

Collect cards and tell tales to other heroes in an attempt to tell the best, most outrageous, most heroic, most costly adventure you can.

But if you get caught in a lie, you might be eliminated from the game. The best hero (read: the best liar) wins! Boast your way to glory, persuade your friends of your honesty, and cheat your way to a win. Find the power of deception with Dost Thou Deceive Me?!

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination, Single Loser Game, Storytelling

name: Hunivity: magyar szólások és közmondások
description:
In this game, you surely won't fall asleep. It revs up, activates, and simultaneously enhances observation skills, hand-eye coordination, vocabulary, and, last but not least, thinking skills.

This game prepares you to tackle obstacles more easily in exams.

Recommended for kids preparing for written exams and those who don't want to forget the wisdom and truth hidden in Hungarian proverbs.

Players move across the game board, trying to guess idioms and proverbs based on cards. Those who guess correctly can advance on the board, and the first to overcome all obstacles wins the game.

name: Várurak
description:
As a castle lord or lady, the king rewards or punishes your deeds. You can build a medieval castle and your associated estate.

In the marketplace, you can buy horses, carriages, tools, bows, and animals.

During various missions, you need attention, vocabulary, good mobility, and clever thinking because you receive rewards for good performance.

If you are skilled, tactful, and help others, you can be the one who quickly builds their own castle with the associated estate and thus win the game.

2 developer games in one. For the little ones, the goal is to collect objects by taking steps on the game board. For older children, players need to collect objects on the game board, but here, after successfully completing tasks, they can earn money to purchase those.

name: Észpörgető
description:
A childhood favorite game enriched with novelties and ideas.

Perfect for expanding vocabulary, enhancing concentration, acquiring knowledge, and excelling under exam pressure.

The well-loved game 'Country, City, Boy, Girl...' with its simple yet tactical rules and 'Mind-Twister' thinking provides excellent entertainment for both novice and experienced players

name: Rejtélyes betűk
description:
On multiple game boards, enjoy 12 types of letter games.

From Letter World to Expressive Signs, Brain Twister, Language Lover, Secret of Secrets, Word Builder, and Word Battle, these letter and word games offer enjoyable experiences for all ages.

Includes Latin letters and runic symbols.

The game makes learning Székely-Hungarian runic writing enjoyable and effortless.

name: Bringára fel
description:
The bike race winds through the historical counties of Great Hungary, where various obstacles await. Stay vigilant as your water and sandwich may run out, leading to trouble.

Smart tactics are crucial; others may outpace you. Courage and daring are needed to be the first to finish the race.

name: Puny Gods
description:
Let’s face it, your Gods are awful. They are arrogant, ego-maniacal, greedy, petty, and well, just crap. In fact, they spend most of their time making the lives of their Villagers arduous and miserable.

At this point, the Villagers have had enough. So, they devise a plan to rid themselves of their awful Puny Gods...

How to Play...
Each player uses their Villager cards to win tricks against other players over multiple rounds.

Players drafts a hand of Villagers and bet how many tricks they will win. Each player plays one of their card in clockwise order. After cards have been played, the winner of the trick is the player with the highest ranking card. If two cards share the highest rank, the Players must Duel.

The winning Player chooses one of their Puny Gods to Denounce and gives that card to the player of their choice.

At the end of each Round of Battles, the player with the least Puny Gods gets a Token. At the end of the game, the player with the most Tokens wins!

However, there are few twists along the way, making play a bit crafty and a lot more fun!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Communication Limits, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Trick-taking

name: Ritter Rost und die Suche nach den Zahlen
description:
This game is perfect for learning the 4 basic arithmetic operations.

All cards are laid out face down, the number cards separated from the arithmetic operation cards. First, an arithmetic operation card is turned over and then 2 random number cards - then these two cards must be calculated correctly according to the arithmetic operation card. If the result is correct, you can keep the number cards.

name: What do you meme?: Schitt's Creek Expansion Pack
description: Schitt's Creek themed expansion for "what do you meme". Features 50 caption cards and 30 photo cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: AQUA PIPE
description:
Players mission is to make aqua pipe line. The game goal is to make A or B below.

Game mechanics:
Players decide on colors and first player by casting dice or coin toss.
There are no pieces on the board at the start.
Players may place one of their own pipes at any available space on the board or move one of their own pipes to another available space.
Player can only move a pipe on the board after he/she placed at least one each of the three size pipes.
Three different size pipes can be placed on the same space because of their structure.

A: To make four pipes in-a-row with same size of your color.
B: To make four sets of three pipes in-a-row with same size of tour color.

a One-time, limited edition made in aluminum was available through the Kickstarter campaign.

—description from the designer

name: Field Commander: Robert E. Lee – Seven Days Battles Battle Pack
description:
An optional battle pack which includes five battles:

Oak Grove
Beaver Dam Creek
Gaines’ Mill
Glendale
Malvern Hill
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Volles Fass voraus: The Tavern
description:
This harbor tile replaces the upper left most tile during setup. When you ships reach the TAVERN harbor, your sailors demand liquid refreshment - or they will turn their backs on you. To pay for your crew's inevitable drinking spree, you should be liquid as well - that means, have enough doubloons...

SETUP:
Set up the game of Volles Fass voraus as usual. Then replace the harbor tile at the corner of the gameboard next to doubloon space 30 with the TAVERN HARBOR TILE. (On that island, you can even see a picture of the tavern with its straw parasols.)

-- These are the 4 berths at the TAVERN --

The berth all the way left (bollard #1):
If your ship lands here, it will become expensive! Every sailor you have wants to take drinks worth 2 doubloons. For each of your sailors, you need to decide whether you pay his bill – or whether you let him go, i.e., put him back into the box.

The berth second from the left (bollard #2):
If your ship lands here, it won‘t be cheap either! Every sailor you have wants to take drinks worth 1 doubloon. For each of your sailors, you need to decide whether you pay his bill – or whether you let him go, i.e., put him back into the box.

The berth second from the right (bollard #3):
If your ship lands here, it won‘t be quite that expensive! Every 2 of your sailors share drinks worth 1 doubloon. Decide for all your sailors whether you pay their bill – or whether you let them go, i.e., put them back into the box. For each doubloon (of the bill) that you don‘t pay, you lose 2 sailors. If you have only 1 sailor overall, he won‘t cost you anything. If you have 3 sailors, you‘ll have to pay only for 2 of them (= 1 doubloon). Even if you have exactly 5, 7, 9, 11 or even 13 sailors, one of them drinks at the TAVERN for free.

The berth all the way right (bollard #4):
Your sailors don‘t drink… or they pay on their own… or the tavern keeper takes care of the bill himself – for whatever reason… So, if your ship lands here, you lose neither any doubloons nor any sailors! Sit back and relax, and wait for the next game turn … that you – with berths in the east – will carry out as usual only when all the other ships have left the tavern and have arrived at the next harbor by now!

name: Bibi Blocksberg: Der verhexte Hexenhut
description:
Bibi and her friends have to practise a duplication spell on Aunt Mania's hat. "Hocus pocus, fidibus! The witch's hat is there four times. Hex-hex!" And indeed: 4 identical hats are lying in front of the young witches! But when Bibi tries to pick one of them up, it suddenly makes a sound: "Meow!" Something must have gone wrong. But the four of them realize that you can have a lot of fun with the bewitched witches' hats ...

On the outside, the 4 witches' hats look the same, but when you press them, each one makes a different animal sound. Crow, cat, owl and frog - remember which hat makes which animal sound and where each hat is located. This will enable you to correctly complete the various task cards that are revealed one after the other. But it's not that easy, as the hats are constantly changing positions.

For advanced players, there is a second game variant, in which you mix additional reaction cards into the game.

name: Ticket to Ride Map Collection 8: Iberia & South Korea
description:
Ticket to Ride Map Collection 8: Iberia & South Korea gives you the chance to set up rail networks on two peninsulas with wildly different settings.

On the Iberian peninsula, players start the game by drafting six destination cards, then keeping four of them — a process they repeat before the train deck runs out the first time. While you're trying to fulfill those eight destination cards with only 35 trains, you can possibly pick up festival cards along the way. The deck is seeded with 54 festival cards, and when one is drawn, you place it next to the city on the game board. If you build a route that connects to one or two cities with festival cards, you choose one of those cities and collect all of the festival cards near it. The more you collect from a city, the more they're worth at game's end!

In South Korea, you start the game as in Iberia by drafting six destination cards, then keeping four of them. All of the routes are grouped by color: blue in the northeast, yellow in the northwest, and so on. When you claim a route, you can also place one of your trains on the province mat on an empty space of the matching color showing the number of cards you played of that color; you can play more cards than required to claim a route should you want to place on a higher number. Additionally, each player has a set of "express train" cards (+1, +2, +3), and you can spend a card on your turn to either draw more train cards, draw more destination tickets, or claim a higher number on the province mat. At game's end, evaluate each color on the province mat, with the player (or players) with the highest sum of values claimed earning bonus points.
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Where Eagles Fly
description:
Welcome to the roaring 1920s, where the world has gone wild about aviation. Air races and daring record-setting flights dominate the news. The Golden Age of Flight has just one record that is still up for grabs:

Be the first aviator to fly around the world.

It will require careful selection and training of crews, tact and diplomacy, water landings, extreme weather, and logistical planning of thousands of gallons of fuel and oil, replacement engines, and remote supplies.

A trip lasting 175 days, covering 27,000 miles, and including landings in 22 different countries awaits you…

Do you have what it takes to achieve one of aviation’s most incredible feats?

Where Eagles Fly is an around-the-world racing adventure reliving the 1924 historical race where everyone flies a plane around the globe competing to be the fastest pilot and win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: VAULT: Reset
description:
...You have proven yourself to be a valuable asset to PALADIN INTERNATIONAL, and have been hired as an AGENT of THE CORPORATION. New equipment and tools have been made available to you in your ongoing role as a DATA EXTRACTION SPECIALIST...

...PALADIN INTERNATIONAL does NOT accept failure...
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Number
mechanics: Action Points, Matching, Network and Route Building

name: VAULT: Anarchy
description:
You have been betrayed by another agent of PALADIN INTERNATIONAL & are now on the run! Your digital identity has been used against you. Multiple CYBER-CRIMES have been attributed to you, and your efforts to clear your name have been thwarted. The only way to escape incarceration is to steal back your digital identity, stored in the corporate vault, and clear your name. You have also decided to ‘take the fight’ to your previous employer, with a goal to cause chaos, and disrupt business, damaging their manufactured reputation.

Anarchy is the plan. Escape is the goal. Is this still just about clearing your name?
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Number
mechanics: Action Points, Matching, Network and Route Building

name: Fainting Goats
description:
Scare the goats on the top of the hill to make them faint and win the game. Press the goat button to randomly set a target sound level, pick a card that will instruct you on what noise to make and try to match the decibel meter. Each player will take turns yelling noises like bird chirps, zombie growls, dog barks and more until a player successfully matches the set volume.

Watch as the goats hilariously faint and fall off their hill giving that player one G.O.A.T point, the first player to reach 10 points first wins.

name: The Game of Lansdowne PA.
description:
This is a Monopoly spinoff where the properties are various businesses in the community Lansdowne, Pennsylvania. Many of the components are generic, and can be used by similar games about other communities. Only the board and the box are unique to this game about Lansdowne.

It appears this game was produced in 1989 as a fundraiser for the Lansdowne United Methodist Church, which subsequently became The Garden Church. In 2018 the church building was torn down and replaced by an apartment building for senior citizens.

The game has the usual forty spaces in a rectangle around the board edge. But, instead of having ten spaces on each side, there are eight spaces on two opposing sides and twelve on the others. In addition to the name of a local business, the spaces for which a player can obtain "Property Title Cards" have addresses between 102 and 415. (Many numbers are not used.) The center of the board has a map of the community as well as sketches of a local school and some of the churches in the community, and additionally a list of nearly 250 patrons for the production of the game. None of the artwork or text in the center of the board is relevant to the play of the game.

There are twenty-eight Property Title Cards. So that they are identical from one community's game to another, they do not have the name of the property on the card. Instead they just have the address of the corresponding space from the board.

Instead of Chance and Community Chest cards, this game has eight spaces that give "Star" cards. There are forty-seven of these Star Cards. Presumably these are identical to the Star cards in other community games published by Unique Promotions Incorporated.

There is one more card, the "Lots'o Rule Card", from one of the three sheets of Star cards. This is an information card which explains what happens when a player lands on the "Lots'o" space on the opposite corner from the "Start" space. When a player lands on this space they can gamble any amount of money on one roll of the dice. On a 3, 5, 9, or doubles the player loses the bet. On a 4, 6, 8, or 10 they double their bet, and on a 7 or 11 they triple it. Note that in the game sometimes this is referred to as "Lots'o" and other times as "Lotso".

There are also two red dice, six pawns in different colors, and play money in denominations from $50 to $5000.

There are no houses or hotels in this game, but, for each property in a color group a player owns, they receive progressively more rent when an opponent lands on it. This is roughly double rent for properties where the player has two of a color group, approximately triple for three of a color group, and approximately quadruple for four of a color group. Players do not have to own an entire color group to receive a bonus.

Players who go bankrupt are eliminated.

For the most part prices are inflated from Monopoly. Players start with $27,500. Properties cost from $650 to $5000. Basic rent runs from $50 to $1000. Yet passing "Start" only gets the original $200.

The artwork for this game is similar to that in Unique Promotions's other games:

The Game of Denver, Pennsylvania
The Game of Hoboken, New Jersey
The Game of Midlothian, VA
The Game of Riverton, N.J.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Income, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading

name: Legenden toppen!
description: As with other titles in the toppen! game line, in the card game Legenden toppen! players compete in multiple tricks at once by using cards that have multiple statistics on them.
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trick-taking

name: Taco Takedown Tuesday
description:
Taco Takedown Tuesday invites players into the spicy and competitive world of taco truck ownership, where the ultimate goal is to prove that you are the best in the business. Assemble your ingredients, complete customer orders, and strategize to outshine your opponents in this fast-paced card game.

Gameplay revolves around playing Ingredient cards from your hand to complete customer orders. Timing is crucial, as the player who places the final ingredient on a customer's order must collect that customer along with all assigned ingredients. This creates a balance of completing orders efficiently while considering the potential consequences for opponents.

Unique Review cards add an extra layer of strategy. Players can manipulate their reviews from negative to positive and vice versa, influencing the pace of the game. The Achievement Cards further elevate the competition by offering additional points for fulfilling specific conditions. These elements make every decision impactful, ensuring that players remain engaged throughout the entire game.

name: New to the Game
description:
New to the Game is a quick-paced card game where each player is a parent of four children. Each parent is trying to get their children to bed, while simultaneously waking up the children of their opponents. Players draw a card each turn. Then, they can play a single card, either a snooze card on their own children, an alarm card on an opponent's child or a special card that mixes things up. Once two snooze cards are on a child, that child is in bed. When a player gets all four of their children in bed, that player wins.

'—description from the designer
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Zoic Zoo
description:
In the cooperative deck building game Zoic Zoo, time travel is possible. The players choose roles and then set about building a zoo of prehistoric animals and money-making facilities. Players buy cards from the market to better fulfill their roles. The collectors add time machines and collecting gear to their deck so that they can go back in time to collect the animals of their choice. The builders buy habitats, acreage and facility cards that can then be built in the zoo. Each animal and facility brings in visitors and research. At the end of each round, the revealed animals back in time shift, and some are hidden and new ones are revealed. Once all the animals have been revealed, game play ends. Goals that change according to the number of players and the number of animals collected, are then compared to the number of visitors and research that was brought in by the players’ zoo. If the players reached or exceeded these goals then they win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Taking Tiger Mountain by Oblique Strategy
description:
Taking Tiger Mountain by Oblique Strategy is a cooperative game where players will navigate a modular maze of puzzles inspired by The Codex Seraphinianus by Luigi Serafini. There are no printed rules. "Conduct" is informed by a curated set of prompts taken from Brian Eno and Peter Schmidt’s Oblique Strategy cards. For instance, a card may read “What are the sections sections of? Imagine a caterpillar moving.”

A sheet labeled “companion” is included, which outlines setup and potential game ending conditions. A book about a nonexistent language inspires a game without rules. What could be more Eno than a metaphor about collaboration and what we overcome to create art?

—description from the designer

name: Pozitivity
description:
Pozitivity guides you step by step, playfully, and entertainingly introduces practical techniques to transform a pessimistic mindset into optimism. Players, regardless of age, can sow the seeds of optimism within themselves based on these methods.

Because cultivating an optimistic mindset not only brings better mood, problem-solving, and performance but also contributes to overall physical well-being.

Our goal is to collect as many hearts as possible to reach the Castle of Happiness. Each color on the path corresponds to a deck of cards or a so-called self-experience field. In the former, you have to answer questions, while in the latter, you need to complete tasks related to happiness-boosting techniques.

name: Bargain Quest: Brick & Mortar Promo Pack
description:
This Bargain Quest: Brick & Mortar Promo Pack includes:


1 Convention Season event card
4 alternate art heroes


Convention Season:

During the Shopping Step, each time a hero enters a shop, draw a new hero to replace them with tokens equal to their purse value. Once all shops are occupied, shuffle the remaining heroes back into the hero deck.

name: You Laugh You're Out
description:
The official family party game for people who can't keep a straight face
The funniest person goes first. They are the Joker. Jokers pick a card and have 30 seconds to make others in the group laugh by doing what the card says. If anyone laughs, they lose and must give up a laugh token to the Joker.
When a player runs out of Laugh Tokens, the game ends. And the player with the most Laugh Tokens wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Sky Empire
description:
In the skies over planet Dopheus, players will take on the role of a Doppler, a salamander-like creature with one mind and two bodies, in a quest to find the crystals and reactivate the monolith defense to thwart the invasion from the evil sentinels!

To win the game, you must collect the four crystals, activate a monolith, and ascend to the position of the Emperor of Dopheus!

The game takes place over several game rounds, where players place their Dopplers either in the Council to take Council actions, or on the board for character unique abilites. Or both! You have two bodies! To take actions on the map you activate the tiles with an initiative token, and that allows you to move to this tile, explore, produce, construct and/or battle opponents!

There are 4 different crystals in the game:

The blue crystal is obtained by having 12 buildings on the board, you can be lucky to use a Leviathan airship and find it by drilling on Tropic Islands, or you can build the epic Ancient Sky Tower!

The yellow crystal is more elusive. There is one in the middle of the map from the start, so the first to occupy the central area gets the yellow crystal - otherwise, you have to obtain it from salvage development when you explore; there are also missions for it in the action cards. You may also be lucky to get it from drilling with a Leviathan airship on Volcano Islands.

The red crystal is the crystal of battles! You get it by winning a combat against a player or NPC flying in a Behemoth or higher-class airship. Alternatively, you need to destroy an opponent's home base or Sky Tower, or find it by drilling with a Leviathan airship on Rock Islands.

The green crystal is unique to each character in the game. You can only obtain it by fulfilling your character's goals - for example, having 5 airships on the board or purging 10 exploration tokens to get it.

Take part in this epic adventure, in more than 40 different airships, to find the crystals and stop the invasion - and become Emperor over all of Dopheus!
categories: Aviation / Flight, City Building, Civilization, Dice, Economic, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Industry / Manufacturing, Miniatures, Pirates, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Action/Event, Advantage Token, Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Different Dice Movement, Events, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Income, King of the Hill, Market, Modular Board, Movement Template, Moving Multiple Units, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Race, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement, Trading, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types, Zone of Control

name: Pozitivity Family
description:
The objective of the game is for your family to enter the Castle of Happiness, collecting reward hearts along the way and getting to know each other's stories better. As you progress toward the Castle of Happiness, monsters appear, presenting new challenges. Defeat them and continue your journey with even greater unity!

The game of family togetherness that builds self-esteem and confidence through play!

Pozitivity Family is specifically designed for families, offering a chance to play, grow, and laugh together with those you love most. It strengthens self-esteem, positive focus, and unity, enhancing psychological and emotional well-being. Promoting optimistic thinking, it provides playful bonding, quality time, and rejuvenation, contributing to the experience of positive moments.

name: Arthropods
description:
Four interactive tiles placement games in a box

Arthropods is about our six legged back yard friends: play either as an ant or a bee colony. Both variations have two difficulty modes. Families with children (8+) should definitely play the basic game for a maximum of fun, while experienced players are better challenged playing the full game. In all cases should you aim to score the highest amount of points. Game mechanics used to achieve this are:

Tile placement
Area control
Resource gathering
Blocking and/or attacking


Other mechanics used for a ballenced play are:

Drafting
Open market
Hand building


The Ants


Antropolis - basic game playing as ants
Supersize Colony - strategically challenging game playing as bees


Ants are hard workers who build nests and tunnels (hexagon tiles). They also gather food (resource) in the forest, which allows them to perform more actions. Each type of ant (queen, worker, soldier and larva) can perform specific actions and is needed to (f.e.) score points, gather resources, get more ants or defend against other players. Points are scored for completed nests, tunnels and achieving bonuses.

The Bees


Happy Honey Beez - basic game playing as bees
Knights in Buzzing Armor - highly interactive game playing as bees



Bees are buzzy to build hives (hexagon tiles) and collect pollen or honey (resources). They too have different tasks per type (queen, worker, drone and egg) and interact a lot with other colonies. Points are scored by building hives, producing honey and the size of the colony.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Closed Drafting, Market

name: Florist Tourist
description:
Load your truck bed with the latest floral requests. can you complete more deliveries then the competition? Find out in this dice drafting, pattern matching game of Florist Tourist!

Compete against a fellow florist runner to complete the most daily deliveries. Players draft trucks to determine flower color and dice for locations. By arranging petals on one of a players' three mats and completing the pattern of a delivery goal, they can score 1-3 points. Two of the three levels of goals reward temporary or permanent placement petals. When two of the three goal draw decks are depleted, points are tallied and onenplayer will be the master Florist Tourist.

—description from the designer

name: Jealy Jellies
description:
Two jealous Jellies, green with envy, compete for the most consumed objects. Objects in the dungeon labyrinths are located using Gem Positioning Spells. This is because the Jellies are too slow to hunt and Magenta Minotaur energy elixirs are located in another kingdom.

Players are competing Jellies who take turns combining four secretly selected gems with four of their opponents' gems.

When gem colors are mixed with each other, different objects are gained. This is known as the Finding Phase. In the second Phase, the Feeding Phase, players spend their objects for valuable rewards worth Victory Cubes. The players with the most Victory Cubes at the end of the sixth round is the victor with the fullest Jelly belly!

—description from the designer

name: Σκορ 5 (Score 5)
description:
One player plays with the yellow pawns, the other one with the black pawns. The players place at turns one pawn on the table game. The player who puts first five pawns of his colour on line is the winner. This line may be horizontal vertical or diagonal. If the player manages to surround two pawns of the adversary (only two) when he may move them off the game. These pawns may be used again at the game. The player with the black pawns starts the game

—user summary

name: TV & Film Quiz
description:
Who knows their television and films?

This is a trivia game themed around TV and movies, featuring 100 cards, each with a question and 4 possible answers to pick from.

Play against friends and family, alone or in teams.

name: Vil et un conte
description:
Vil et un conte is a narrative game cards.

Each player plays a villain and must tell their version of the facts of the chosen tale while avoiding the trap cards placed by their companions within a time limit. The hourglass is turned over at each stage and the storyteller must say or mime the trap imposed. The storyteller obtains tokens if he passes the tests.

No winner no loser just fun time

—description from the publisher (translated)

Vil et un conte est un jeu narratif d'ambiance et de cartes.

Chaque joueur incarne un vilain et doit raconter sa version des faits du conte choisi tout en évitant les cartes pièges posées par ses comparses dans un temps imparti. Le sablier est retourné à chaque étape et le conteur doit impérativement dire ou mimer le piège imposé. Le conteur obtient des jetons s'il réussit les épreuves.

Pas de gagnant pas de perdant juste passer un bon moment.

—description from the publisher

name: Fairytale Kingdom
description:
Long-long ago in the kingdom of Fairytales for princesses were Born. Lots of guests came for the celebration and the magic firebird flew along. It made a special present for the princesses: awarded them with the Talent of ruling the seasons. Since then on they were called - Spring, Summer, Autumn and Winter.

Time passed, princesses grew up and turned into young beauties. Princesses started ruling the kingdom in turns, each in her season. But once a prince from the far away kingdom caught the firebird and put it into cage. Day by day magnificent plumage of the firebird started disappearing and golden feathers stopped shining with radiance...

In a short while a great misfortune came to the kingdom of the four princesses: All the four seasons got mixed up. It started snowing in summer, and flowers bloomed in winter. So one day princesses went to the firebird to seek for help in restoring the order, but could not find the firebird anywhere. Then princesses Set off for a dangerous journey in search for the magical bird.

—description from the back of the box

Gameplay: spin the arrow. When the rotating arrow stops move the princess on which the arrow points one step forward. The first princess that reaches the firebird can make a wish to all other princesses and all together win as everything is back to normal.

name: Castles of Mad King Ludwig: Colossal
description:
Castles of Mad King Ludwig: Colossal contains enlarged room tiles, tile trays with lids doubling as within-game tile holders, and a score track adjusted to the setup with the larger pieces (as they are not stored on the track in contrast to the standard game). The tiles are twice as big (i.e. four times bigger in area) compared to the standard tiles.

The expansion allows the Castles of Mad King Ludwig: Collector's edition to be played with larger pieces, especially convenient for solo play and conventions. For playing the game, the expansion requires the cards, card trays, and game pieces (player markers, coins, towers, tokens, etc.) of the base game.

The expansion contains a gameplay differences compared to the base game: The Foyer tiles (i.e. the starting tile for each player) of the base game have three entrances at both sides of the tiles. The Foyer tiles of the "Colossal" expansion have three entrances on one side and four entrances on the other side, thus allowing more variation in the starting position.

This expansion was available as a bundle with Castles of Mad King Ludwig: Royal Collector's Edition in the Kickstarter campaign.

name: JöKö
description:
Playing Jökö requires a sharp eye, quick reflexes and an ability to play faster than your opponent. The aim of the game is to be the first to get rid of all your cards by placing them onto the matching symbols.

PREPARATION

Shuffle the cards and deal out the entire deck to all players. Each player must hold their cards face-down in one hand. The other hand is used to play.

PLAYING THE GAME

For 2 players

Each player, one at a time, flips over the top card of their pile and places it face-up in a row in front of them. Each player has their own row, and they take turns to play up to 5 cards in each row.

When there are two matching cards on the table-identical symbols-, players must place one of their cards onto the matching cards before their opponent, irrespective of whether the cards are in the row in front of them or in the opposite row. This can happen before these rows are completed with 5 cards each. If so, after covering the matching cards on the table, players continue taking tums to complete their rows.

If each player has already placed 5 cards in their row and there are no identical symbols on display, each player collects the cards of their own row and places them face-down at the bottom of their pile of cards. The game proceeds the same way until one of the players gets rid of all their cards.

—description from the rulebook

name: Efectiviwonder
description:
At a glance

Two books, two players, 50 enigmas: you will only reach the keys if you always work as a team
There is only one rule: never show your book to another! You will have to communicate very well
Linguistic, logical, mathematical, visual enigmas... keep your five senses alert
When you find the key you will always be able to say... Efectiviwonder!
The perfect original gift for those who have a Sherlock Holmes soul


What does it consist of?

Are you and your best friend the queens of puzzles? Do you know a couple of geeks who are professionals at solving puzzles? If you are passionate about challenges, you can't miss ¡Efectiviwonder! * In the pair of books it contains, a couple of researchers will be able to find fifty enigmas organized into three levels of difficulty: elementary, advanced and expert. This book is not like the others: in each one you will find only half of the enigma that you will have to solve and there is only one rule: Do not show your book to your partner. They will be able to talk as much as they need, draw, mime, whatever they want except see both books at the same time. All the puzzles are totally exclusive, they are designed by Regalador's creative team. The biggest challenges to squeeze your brain, train your communication, develop your lateral thinking and exercise your imagination are here. When they solve them all they will only be able to shout... EFFECTIVIWONDER!


—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Typical Spanish
description:
A game with almost 200 very own tests to organize a very Typical Spanish party
Let the fun begin... roll the dice and read the card from one of its six different categories!
For those fun people who are nicer than pesetas, this game will be, in two words: impressive
This original gift will bring out the best in a dinner, a few drinks or any celebration and will disconnect you from your cell phone for a while.
If you are looking for a different type of board game, check out all our games here


What does it consist of?

If you have heard someone on the beach shouting "There are beers, potatoes...!", you remember who said "How are you?", you take a nap, you have ever sent someone to fry asparagus and your hair stands on end when The jackpot comes out in the Christmas lottery... You are Typical Spanish and this is your game. Do you want to know what challenges you will have to face? These are the six categories:
How is the people: if you imitate Made in Spain characters like a flamenco dancer, do you think anyone will guess it?
Become a Picasso: like Picasso, paint Spanish concepts like Naranjito, the rest will say what it is about
Here there is tomato: there are mythical Spanish phrases that we all know. Who said them for the first time?
Spanish Trivial: a question about Spanish popular culture and three possible answers
White and in a bottle: say Spanish expressions moving your lips and gesturing trying to get the team to guess it
Ask Reverte: the card proposes a word, the team will have to guess whether or not it is accepted by the RAE


The first team to get a card from each category will be the winner of Typical Spanish, a game that makes you laugh!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: ¿Qué me estás container?
description:
You will speak with your tongue hanging out, adding stupid or "otolozondo solo lo o" to the final words.

Roll the dice and find out how you will have to read the cards during the next round, there are 6 different categories!

Each round will last 30 seconds, match as many cards as you can in that time! You will keep each correct card. Whoever accumulates the most cards in each of the ten rounds will win a "Güiner" card.

—user summary

name: Cómo conocí a vuestra serie
description:
At a glance

A game of almost 200 series tests to dance, guess and of course... Act! The ideal game to have a great time.
You don't have to be a “serial buff”, just wanting to have a good time is enough!
Today the protagonists are you: roll the dice and find out which category you get!
Enjoy humming your favorite intros, remembering the iconic phrases of your favorite characters or acting out the scenes that have stuck in our minds.
An original gift that will bring out the best in a dinner, drinks or any celebration.
If you are looking for a different type of board game, check out all our games here


What does it consist of?

The laughter marathon is guaranteed! From the frenetic fight for the Iron Throne in Westeros, through the mysterious investigations of Sherlock Holmes to Carrie's heels wandering the streets of New York, all the series in our life are here to make you have an unforgettable time. And if you don't have much of a habit with Netflix or HBO, don't worry, this game is not going to be an encyclopedia about series. How I Met Your Series is a party in the form of a board game. Its mechanics are very simple: one dice, six categories, two teams eager to enjoy and a single winner. These are the six categories, which team will win this season?:
Trivial: One question and four possible answers. Choose the right one and show that you know more about series than Sheldon does about comics.
Script: “Hello hello, neighbor!” What series does the phrase on the card belong to?
Spoiler: Describe a series with only 5 words without using those that are prohibited. The series rippers have arrived!


Intros: Humming the intro to your favorite series seemed easy... until your team has to guess it.

Outtakes: Action! It's time to bring out your acting skills: play the proposed scene and the rest will have to guess.


Series marathon: You will have to say all the series that come to mind following the proposed category, for example, Disney series!
Ready to play? Every time you manage to win a test, your prize will be the game card itself. The first team to get a card from each category will be the winner.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Got Ya!
description:
At a glance

Do you know yours? Be the fastest to prove it!
Read a question, choose your answer and place it face down without anyone seeing it. The others will have to quickly go for the option they think you have chosen to win the point, are you ready?
280 cards and more than 500 questions to have a great time.


The game that will succeed at your next family gatherings and at any drink, picnic or get-together you have with friends.
If you are looking for a different type of board game, check out all our games here

The ideal original gift for others to show how much they know you and vice versa. And remember! Keep your friends close and your enemies even closer ;)


What does it consist of?

Have you ever had a soul mate, an inseparable cousin or that special person about whom you know every detail of their life: their fifth surname, their craziest hobbies, their ID number, their strangest tastes...? The definitive game has arrived to prove that this is the case. Playing is very simple, but be careful, because you will have to put all your senses alert and be the fastest. There are three types of cards: Game cards, Response cards and Voting cards. The player on his turn reads the question on the Playing Card and secretly chooses the number among the Answer Cards that corresponds to his decision and places it face down on the table. This is the starting signal for the rest of the players to quickly rush for the Voting Card with the number they think will be the correct answer. The player on his turn reveals his answer by turning over his card and whoever got it right gets the point. There are three different rounds where the number of answer options increases, therefore, the level of difficulty in getting it right also increases.


Round 1: Pink Playing Cards and Voting Cards 1 and 2.
Round 2: Blue Playing Cards and Voting Cards from 1 to 3.
Round 3: Orange Playing Cards and Voting Cards from 1 to 5.
Get all the points, fight for the correct answer and become the winner. Ready, set… GOTYA!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Bear Mountain Camping Adventure: Extreme Weather
description:
Don't forget your umbrella and rain boots to combat the extreme weather introduced in this expansion. Earn a lantern to protect your hand and experience even more fun activities.

With this expansion, weather will affect how the game is played through Weather Events. All of the possible Weather Events are shown across the Weather Board.

The game is played in rounds. The first round starts before the first player takes their turn, and ends when the gameplay gets back around to the first player (just before they take their second turn). The purpose of the Weather Event Tracker matching the color of the first player's Player Mover (camper) is so that all players know exactly when each round begins and ends.

At the beginning of each round, players decide who will roll the Weather Die for the round (it doesn't matter who rules the dice each round), to see which Weather Event will take effect.

To know which die to roll each round, you will look at the forecast. If the Forecast Token is sitting on a sunny space then you'll rule the white Weather Die. If it's sitting on a stormy space, you'll roll the black Weather Die. Since the Forecast Token starts on his sunny space, you'll roll the white Weather Die for the first round.

After rolling the die, move the Weather Event Tracker to the Weather Event for that round. This way, all players will know what the Event is throughout the round. You can then put the Weather Die back in its space on the Weather Board.

name: Paperi scatenati
description: Paperi scatenati ("Ducks Wild") is a game inspired by the cartoon container called Go cart. This program was broadcast in the 90s in the evening on Italian TV. All the squares on the board, except the starting ones, have face down tiles. At each turn you move one space and turn over the cards face down. These can have positive and negative points that must be added or subtracted from your score. At the end of the turn you have to redistribute the tiles on other spaces on the board. The game ends when a marker reaches another spot space. Whoever has the most points will be the winner.

name: Undergrove: Whispering Woods
description:
This Whispering Woods micro expansion adds new goal cards and mushroom tiles to Undergrove.


2 Goal Cards
4 Mushroom Tiles

name: Team Quiz Challenge: Cats vs Dogs
description:
Dog or cat - which side are you on? 222 quiz cards with exciting, informative questions and quirky tasks about the furry four-legged friends will challenge your team's knowledge. And in the end, it may not be so much a question of dog OR cat, but simply a lot of fun! Party on: Which team will win the challenge?

—description from the publisher

name: Team Quiz Challenge: Natur vs Technik
description:
Nature or technology - which side are you on? 222 quiz cards with exciting, informative questions and quirky tasks relating to both topics will challenge your team's knowledge. And in the end, it may not be so much a question of nature OR technology, but simply a lot of fun! Party on: Which team will win the challenge?

—description from he publisher

name: Siggi Safe
description:
As raccoons, you try to crack the code of the large safe by skillfully rolling the dice. The first person to enter all their numbers into the safe wins.

On your turn, you try to roll the numerical value of any tile in front of you. he dice eyes of the white dice are added (plus calculation). the dice eyes of the red dice are subtracted (minus calculation). Is the result a number that is displayed in front of you as a tile? Take the tile and throw it in the safe. No. What the heck: You can roll more dice one after the other.

—description from the publisher

name: Pieks & Peng
description:
"Piks, bams and bangs! The porcupines love nothing more than popping balloons. But the competition is fierce because everyone jumps into the fray at once. Whoever gets rid of all their spade cards first wins the round. And whoever wins two or three rounds first wins the game.
A spiky card game"

You have no cards of your own and do not have to get rid of them. The cards are valid for both teams - and the team that has the corresponding colored chip in its half of the field always reads out.

—description from the publisher

name: Melrose Place
description: Melrose Place is a game inspired by the 90s TV series of the same name. By moving around the board you have to try to get all the photos of the characters from the show by passing some tests, answering questions not related to the series, using appointment cards, etc.

name: Beverly Hills 90210
description: Beverly hills 90210 game inspired by the TV series of the same name. By going around the board you need to overcome different tests to be able to reach a certain number of points, based on the number of players, in the 6 school subjects. With audio cassette in which the voices of the protagonists of the show describe different tests to be faced.

name: HyggeSNAK
description:
HyggeSNAK is a conversation game. For those who want to have a pleasant evening, with a little extra activity in the conversation.

In HyggeSNAK you have to guess, laugh and talk! You must try to guess which questions other players would prefer to answer, based on a few clues. Should we talk about favorite movies or food? Are secret hobbies revealed or maybe you will be entertained with the crazy experiences?

HOW TO PLAY
You take turns to draw two cards and choose a question that you would like to answer. The rest of the table must now try to guess which of the questions the player has chosen. You choose whether you want to play with points.

This game can be used alone, or expanded with the conversation cards from e.g. FriendSNAK and other Either/Or games from SNAK.

The game consists of 110 cards with 200 questions and rules.

name: Despelotados
description:
At a glance

The game for couples with which you will surely end up upset


Concentration and speed will be the keys to getting your partner to take everything away

Its travel size makes it your perfect companion
The perfect original gift to give a touch of fun to the hottest nights


What does it consist of?

Within this game are the most fun and different moments of passion as a couple. Despelotados is a game of concentration, observation and speed in which, of course, like any good couples game worth its salt, whoever loses takes off their clothes. Let your partner surprise you with this game in which the balls will make the temperature rise as the clothes disappear. Do you want to know how to play?
Shuffle the cards and divide them into two piles that will be placed face down in front of each one.


In turns you must reveal the top card of your deck in a shared central pile.

When the last two balls match, the first to hit the central pile will get his partner to take off a piece of clothing
There are some special cards that do not need a partner... the hot balls: the last one to hit them will perform a special task ;)
When you take off a piece of clothing you will take the cards from the central pile, whoever runs out of cards wins... and will be able to completely undress their partner!


—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Hot Room
description:
At a glance

The first intimate Escape Room on the market, a very original board game for spicy couples
Solve the puzzles and indulge yourself in the racy scenes, thinking has never been so exciting!
Its five different scenarios will take you to live five of the hottest stories. 5 games in one... and always with a happy ending
Do not panic! If at any time you don't know how to continue, there are clues that will help you continue.


You can only complete the mission... by raising the temperature of the room!

What does it consist of?
The mechanics are simple: choose one of the five Hot Room stories and solve the riddles, puzzles, games and enigmas that each adventure proposes to know which card to continue with.
