Furthermore, to get to the end you will also have to recreate the spiciest scenes with your partner. Will you dare? Here is a small preview of each of the stories:

The wedding of your life: The big day has arrived, your brother has decided to say I do! Between drinks, laughter and dancing you meet someone very very interesting. How and where will the party end?
Conference room: A boring work conference becomes a very interesting place thanks to someone's mischievous gaze. Can you overcome your bosses and make the fantasy come true?


Romantic getaway: It has been many days without seeing each other and, finally, you will be able to spend a few days together in a rural house on the outskirts. Will you be able to find the right room and prepare the right environment to unleash your passion?

Forbidden massage: Work, home, everyday worries... the time has come to pamper yourself and put yourself in the hands of someone professional, but you didn't even remotely expect them to be so attractive. Who was going to tell you that a simple massage could raise your temperature so much?
Reunion of neighbors: You have just returned to your city to visit family after a time working abroad and you meet your next-door neighbor by chance. You realize that the years have treated him very, very well. Will you take advantage of the lost time?


Set the mood, overcome the most insightful mental puzzles and enjoy the most physical challenges. If you do everything right, every story will have its... happy ending ;) The original gift of the moment for the spiciest couples

—description from the publisher (translted)

name: Retro Racer
description:
Retro Racer is an exciting dice-driven, card-based racing game for 1 player.

It is inspired by the old video game racers of the past: Pole Position, RC Pro Am, Rad Racer, F-Zero, and more.

Race your car on 11 different courses, encountering random obstacles and trying to beat the Pace Car. But be careful, don’t blow up! Speed is dangerous and the faster you go, the more perilous the drive! Dice determine the obstacles you face, and how well you control the race car! Roll different dice as you go faster.

Retro Racer does not use a board; it is totally card-based and dice-powered. It is a small-footprint game that gives the full racing experience. Your player dashboard, course layout, and track segments are all cards. Your car and obstacles are small chits.

Each course is composed of modular track cards. You will reveal new segments of track as you speed off your current track card.

It's Retro Racer!

For use with the Home Tabletop Entertainment System.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement

name: Primacy: A Coyote & Crow Card Game
description:
In Primacy: A Coyote & Crow Card Game, players take on the role of one of the five factions of Makasing, the nations first laid out in the award-winning roleplaying game, Coyote & Crow. Players will construct a deck of 45 cards from a pool of 300 that allow them to gain status and prestige against their opponents by completing daunting mutual challenges.

The world of Coyote & Crow is an alternate future where the Americas were never colonized. Instead, powerful Native nations rose in their stead. The world is a mix of science and fantasy. Players will have advanced technology, powerful ceremonies, and epic heroes at their disposal. Each of the five nations available to play have unique asymmetric advantages and disadvantages to create distinct play styles for every kind of gamer.

While this game is primarily for 2 players, there are rules that allow for a 3-4 player experience as well.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Political, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management

name: Bare Foot - N- Wild
description:
First released to the public in 1986, BARE FOOT-N-WILD is the newest, wildest, most exciting, card game ever! Combining strategy with the luck of the draw, this fun and easy card game is great for bringing together family and friends. Carefully designed cards make playing the game easy to learn. Using strategy, math skills, communication with partners, and learning new card terms, this game appeals to the fun side of kids of all ages!

BARE FOOT-N-WILD is a canasta/rummy style card game for two to six players. When playing with two, three or four players, you will use the cards with blue backs. With five or six players, you will use the blue-backed cards plus the cards with red backs. Playing with partners is recommended when four or six people are playing the game.

Playing BARE FOOT-N-WILD can be exciting for both singles and doubles. A family friendly card game, BARE FOOT-N-WILD is good for ages from 13-113. Take your family back to the days when families shared time at the table and games were happy, good, clean fun. Get BARE FOOT-N-WILD today!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Communication Limits, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Barnyard Zombies
description:
Barnyard Zombies is a rummy style board game about herding zombie livestock.
When mad cow mutated into mad sheep, mad pig and eventually the dreaded mad chicken, humanity was completely unprepared. City slickers, unaccustomed to dealing with livestock, were gonners. But country folk survived by learning to herd the monstrous beasts. In the post apocalyptic war for limited resources, barnyard zombies have become the new weapon of choice.
Each player commands a rival survivor faction and shares two objectives, herd zombie livestock to enemy barnyards and recruit survivors. Each zombie has two traits, animal and color. Players manipulate these traits to Attach, Spawn, Link and Split zombie hordes. The Spawn and Link actions recruit survivors. When a survivor pool is depleted, all barn bunkers are breached. The more zombies in a player's barnyard, the more casualties they're likely to suffer.
To help them in their quest for dominance, players employ scavenged supplies like ammo, grenades, brains, barbed wire, radioactive waste and more.
At games end the player with the most survivors wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Interrupts, Matching, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Take That

name: Last Outpost
description:
When the explorers discovered Sigma-24, the settlers celebrated the discovery of a seemingly perfect haven. The colony swiftly took shape, with the colony ship repurposed to construct the inaugural city on this promising new world. For decades, the colonies thrived in harmony.

However, the idyllic scene shattered during the 30th year, precisely at the arrival solstice. An unseen, unknown gravitational force emerged, tearing the planet asunder beneath their once-stable homes. In the ensuing month, violent earthquakes and tremors ravaged their once-thriving cities and vital infrastructure. Faced with impending doom, the clans rallied for a final, desperate effort to escape.

In a race against time, they erected a last outpost within the dwindling stable region of the planet. The colonists feverishly worked to construct a generational colony ship, their lifeline to a new world and a chance at survival.

Last Outpost is a simultaneous-play roll-and-write game that combines polyomino colony building, engine building, and tech tree mechanics.
Players will permanently mark their player boards as they construct buildings, load evacuation shuttles, progress through tech trees, and manage their in-game economy.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Income, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Truck-Kun
description:
Truck-kun is a game in which players try claiming the best Isekai they can! Isekai are randomly generated by two cards: Subject card + World card and are assigned a random value determined by a six-sided die rolled by the player currently with the Truck-kun meeple.

Play continues until a player reaches 20 or more points or when a player can no longer play a character from their hand.

Let's see how you play the hero or villain, and which Isekai you can claim!

—description from the designer

name: Wandering Galaxy: A Crossroads Game
description:
Explore space like never before in Wandering Galaxy, the newest addition to Plaid Hat's "Crossroads Game" universe.

In the game, players are members of a ragtag starship crew traversing the edge of charted space in search of fame and riches. Together the players command and control a ship as they set off on a world-jumping campaign, taking on jobs too dangerous (or too insane) for the average space traveler. Come aboard and fly across the galaxy to see whether your crew can make enough profit to pay off their ship and become masters of their own cosmic destiny!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Worker Placement

name: Grid-Football American Football Board Game
description:
There's not much to say:

It's Football.

Everyone wants to play football, but this board game is the first true simulation of American Football.

You can run or pass the ball or make any play that you see on a standard American football game on television.

Every play develops naturally. You can run the ball or pass the ball on any play. It is like playing at the speed of a slow motion replay where you control where the players move next.

One play is divided into small time segments separated by a dice roll. Each roll of the dice represents a few seconds of play time. Each team rolls 2 dice to determine how much energy (energy units) it has for that roll.

The game is played on a light and dark green checkered field, and the scoreboard and down markers are built in. The offensive and defensive player pieces are setup on the field. There are two main types of player pieces, Backs and Linemen.

To start a play the offense rolls 2 dice using the dice shaker. The game can be played between two players like checkers or chess, or it can be played in groups of 2 to 4 people.

There are two teams, Home and Visitors. Each team takes turns rolling the dice and moving their pieces a little further until the play is over which can be a pass completion, incompletion, interception or tackle. The field represents 10 yards so each touchdown on the field scores 10 points (or yards) on the scoreboard. The team that reaches 100 yards first wins the game!

Note: Basic knowledge of Football is a prerequisite for the rules.

Recommended for ages 8 and up depending on brain size. The game is not as difficult as Chess or Go, but more challenging than Checkers, Reversi or Backgammon.

There are 3 levels of play: Beginner (Amateur), College, or Pro-level. At the pro-level the game can be as challenging as Chess or even Go. At the Beginner-level anyone can learn to play most of the basic moves in less than 10 minutes.

There are no cards or guessing. This is real football, where you control the OFFENSE and the DEFENSE.

ARE YOU READY TO PLAY SOME FOOTBALL ???

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Movement Points

name: Escape from the Tinker's Trap
description:
Escape from the Tinker's Trap is a cooperative puzzle game. It can be played alone or with up to 4 people. Players journey into the mysterious tinker's workshop working together to repair his various gadgets while searching for hidden puzzles and finally uncovering the truth behind the Tinker's trap.
Typical duration is 60-90 minutes. This is a paper puzzle solving game and is really designed to be a one-time experience. It is published by the Mysterious Package Company

name: Planetary Peril
description:
Welcome to the uncharted depths of space! Your mission is to settle and thrive in this newly discovered solar system. But beware, for the journey ahead is filled with peril and competition. To emerge victorious, you must master the art of trading, resource management, and strategic development.
There are many things to keep in mind as you embark on your quest.
Use the unique skills and perks of your captain and ship to gain an edge over your adversaries. Water, metal, and gas are the lifeblood of your victory, efficiently gather and utilize these resources to advance put yourself ahead of other players. Trade with fellow players; be crafty in your negotiations, seeking to acquire scarce resources while offloading surplus goods. Build settlements and cities to establish a strong foothold in the solar system -- upgrade your infrastructure to enhance resource production. Invest in Progress cards to gain strategic advantages and stay ahead of your rivals. Enhance your ship’s and buildings’ capabilities for greater attack, defense, and range.

Compete against others to score the winning amount of points to become the most dominant force in the solar system.

Designed for 2-5 players, this game features (not including add-ons) 8 captain cards, 8 ship cards, 85 Progress cards, 30 Hazard cards, 60 resource cards (20 of each), 6 dice, 5 sets of player tokens and markers (1 player token, 5 settlements and cities, and 4 player card markers), 16 Habitable planet markers, 6 Hazard planet markers, 2 special planet markers, 4 wormhole markers, 5 player cards, and an instructions / rules pamphlet.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Second Season Express
description:
A new way to play your favorite pro football board game: play a complete pro football game in less than 30 minutes, with SECOND SEASON Express! The realism, excitement and drama of the full-fledged Second Season board game, distilled into a half-hour card-and-dice experience!

SECOND SEASON Express presents a game of football in "minute-sized" chunks of action, similar to our hockey and soccer games. The field is broken down into zones rather than specific yard lines. You choose a basic scheme for both the offense and defense, which represents a sequence of two to four downs. The offense chooses PASS/RUN, defense chooses from among the four base SS defenses, PASS-SAFE-RUN-BLITZ. Roll the dice, check the team cards, register the result. That's it!

It's important to note that SECOND SEASON Express is NOT a score generator or drive simulator. It's based on the original game, and uses the SECOND SEASON framework for play results. Play sequences succeed or fail largely on the abilities of the players, aided by smart coaching calls. You'll experience the same highs and lows of real football, with games decided by players making big plays--or NOT making them!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cold Snap Express
description:
A new way to enjoy your favorite Canadian pro football board game: play a complete pro game in less than 30 minutes! The realism, excitement and drama of the full-fledged COLD SNAP board game, distilled into a half-hour card-and-dice experience!

Using COLD SNAP's established ratings, terminology and play mechanics, the express version breaks the game's play down into sequences or "chunks" of plays, rather than individual play calls. The offense chooses pass or run as the primary play-call mode, and the defense calls one of the four classic COLD SNAP defense settings (deep, up, safe or blitz) as its primary defense mode. The dice are rolled and the result is generated, same as with the original game. The difference is, the result will represent what happened over a sequence of plays, not just one play.

Total game-play time is condensed by about two thirds so a full game takes around 30 minutes.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Janosch: Post für den Tiger
description:
Do you know the famous german illustrator and author Janosch? This game is about the characters from his most famous children's books: the tiger, the rabbits and all of their friends.
In this game you play one out of 6 bunnys (the postmen) who has to collect 4 specific letters out of letterboxes to bring them to the tiger. You can also try to "phone" your fellow bunnys to jump to one of the letterboxes and get a letter when its not your turn.
This tabletop game for children is all about collecting and memorizing and the world of Janosch.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Race, Set Collection

name: Grit and Glory
description:
Grit and Glory is an adrenaline-pumping card game set in a post-apocalyptic world in which speed, tactics, and a bit of luck are the keys to success! Take on the role of a fearless leader, then race for dominance, guiding your convoy through the treacherous wasteland to claim the richest territories.

Each round starts by revealing a location card, which gives players a target number they try to reach with their convoy as close as possible. Players can press their luck playing cards from their deck, and whoever gets closest to the target receives the best reward. Topping the target makes you bust, leaving you (almost) empty-handed. At the end of each round, a player chooses a new card with a unique ability to add to their deck.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Race

name: Adult Shits
description:
Who has never invented a lame excuse to get out of an inconvenient situation? In this party game, messages are presented with embarrassing situations that we have to overcome. To make the game even more challenging, each player will have to invent an excuse based on the keywords presented. The best and most hilarious excuse wins!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Traitor's Tide
description:
Traitor’s Tide is a game of looting and deducing! Become a loyal shipmate or a devious traitor in your quest to grab the most gold before your ship is destroyed. Will you uncover the mutineer, or will you walk the plank?

—description from the publisher

name: Trick Builders
description:
Trick Builders is a combination trick-taking / deck-building / drafting game where 2-4 players (5-6 with additional cards) compete to win tricks and score points. Between hands players acquire cards for the next hand. These cards give them a benefit for the round they are acquired, but then go into the common deck for future rounds.

There are two ways to play Trick Builders. The Standard Version is recommended for new players and players wanting faster, more streamlined play. Between trick-taking rounds, cards are drafted to add two cards to each player’s hand as the deck grows.

The Advanced Version adds a layer of complexity and depth. Each card has both a cost and an income. Winning tricks will give players currency to purchase stronger cards that will go into their hands for the next round and then into the common deck for subsequent rounds.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Trick-taking

name: Potioneers
description:
A must-follow trick taking game where trump changes each trick. Players vie for ingredients used to make potions which they will then sell to customers.

The 0 card of each suit is the debtor and can be played at any time, even if the player has a card of the led suit. It allows subsequent players to also not have to follow lead.

Winner of a trick wins the ingredient card that is up for grabs and then can either claim a potion (which shows three required ingredients), brew a potion they've claimed, or sell a potion they've brewed to a customer looking for an ingredient that matches what is in that potion.

After all 12 customers are claimed, players get a point for each customer they've satisfied and each potion they've brewed.

—user summary

name: Micky im Farbenwald
description: Micky im Farbenwald ("Mickey in the Color Wood") is a children's game very similar to Sagaland. You have to move around the board by throwing the dice, this does not have numbers but colors, and manage to find the two trees and the two images that portray your character (Goofy, Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck, Horace)

name: kiss
description: Kiss is an abstract game for two people. You need to place tetrominoes on a board and try to achieve dominance of your color. The tiles are double-sided so every time a tetromino of your color touches (kisses) one of your opponent all the tiles that make up that color block will be rotated.

name: Piccole donne
description: Piccole donne ("Little Women", the game of mysterious bags) is a speed game in which participants have to search their bags (plastic pockets) for the object represented on the card. There are cards that will make the bags exchange, this will spice up the game because, by finding the right object faster, you will help your opponents. At the end, when they have been covered on the board, the tokens will rotate and the most present color will indicate the player who won.

name: Canta tu quiz
description: Canta tu Quiz is a music-based party game. We challenge each other to recognize songs or artists. In the box there is a cassette, many cards and also a fake microphone to grab to book. It was released in the wake of the fame of an Italian TV show in which people did karaoke on a traveling stage around various cities.

name: The Dream
description: The Dream is a quick traitor tile-laying game in which everyone starts as heroes, but anyone could choose to turn traitor over the course of the game.

name: Steamhenge (Fan expansion for Age of Steam)
description:
A Stonehenge inspired semi-modular expansion map for Age of Steam.

The board starts out incomplete with an empty central ring of hexes.

The map tiles have the 'new cities' on them and are themed as sacred hexes.

Each player may deliver one offering (good) to the central alter during the course of the game (when it becomes reachable from a placed map tile). Bonus points are rewarded for that delivery.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Map Addition, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Chamberfield
description:
Chamberfield is a 2-4 player strategy game where players harvest resources and compete to load their four air ships before returning to land.

The current player of a round gets to manipulate the CHAMBERFIELD, gather, and possibly fulfill an order. Other players may choose to either gather, take a new order, or fulfill an order.

On any given turn, someone will come out on top!

—description from the publisher

name: Madcala
description:
This was once the Mad Hatter's favorite tea party tradition, a game of Madcala, that was until the Cheshire Cat took over as host.

In this edition of Madcala, the characters from Wonderland's War will be taking part in his tournament of Champions!

Madcala is a 1v1, asymmetric game that pits players against each other in a battle of wits and luck! Out thinking and out maneuvering your opponent will prove easier said than done!If you can reduce your opponent's health to zero, you win!

On your turn, you will pick a plate of beads pick them all up and leave one behind on each plate you pass, whatever plate you end on will give you an action to perform. You can also call on the aid of your "plus ones" to the event. They have powerful abilities that give each player a different approach and strategy.

—description from the publisher

name: Medicos
description:
Fun, fast thinking, interactive and educational board game for health professionals. Our board game is meticulously crafted to provide a visually stunning and interactive experience. From the beautifully designed game board to the intricately detailed playing pieces, every aspect of Medicos has been carefully thought out to ensure a truly immersive gameplay.

We have collaborated with leading healthcare professionals to ensure that the questions and scenarios presented in the game are not only entertaining but also highly informative. You'll find yourself constantly learning and expanding your medical knowledge as you progress through the game. Whether you're playing with friends, family, or colleagues, Medicos is guaranteed to spark lively discussions and friendly competition.

﻿﻿The goal of the game is to explain as many medical words as possible within 60 seconds and have your teammates guess the word you are trying to explain. Packed with 364 unique cards with over 2000 medical terminologies, ranging from different specialities like pediatrics, obstetrics and gynecology, cardiology & surgery. This game also contains Question cards and diagnostic test cards making it more interesting and competitive.

﻿﻿Travel game- the game comes in a small box that is super convenient for taking in cars. Pack it along with your supplies, essentials and other vacation must haves. It is great for a road trip, social events, schools, parties, beach day, camping games or simply playing at the house.

—description from the publisher

name: Chronicles von Drunagor: Zeitalter der Dunkelheit – Neue Helden & Neue Monster
description:
The armies of darkness grow stronger and a new threat enters the battle for Drunagor: the Demon Lord. You can face this lieutenant and his new attack cards, and the two new monsters can add even more variety to all your adventures.

But it's not just the Army of Darkness that receives support. Two new heroes have found their way to you and are ready to take part in the fight for the world of Drunagor:

The experienced hunter Handruiel offers you his ranged fighting skills. The second new hero even belongs to a new hero class: As a Shadow Knight, Lordwrath brings with him a whole new arsenal of techniques and abilities that allow you to use new strategies.

In addition to these two heroes, this expansion contains all monsters from Monster Pack #1 of the Gamefound campaign. Look forward to Death Herald, Dark Scout and of course the Demon Lord.

This is an expansion for the cooperative dungeon crawler Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness by Daniel Alves and Eurico Cunha. The base game is required to play this expansion.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Die Armeen der Dunkelheit werden stärker und eine neue Bedrohung greift in den Kampf um Drunagor ein: der Dämonenfürst. Ihr könnt euch diesem Leutnant und seinen neuen Angriffskarten stellen und die zwei neuen Monster können alle eure Abenteuer noch abwechslungsreicher machen.

Aber nicht nur die Armee der Dunkelheit erhält Unterstützung. Gleich zwei neue Held:innen haben ihren Weg zu euch gefunden und sind bereit in den Kampf um die Welt von Drunagor einzugreifen:

Der erfahrende Jäger Handruiel bietet euch seine Fernkampfkünste an. Der zweite neue Held gehört sogar einer neuen Heldenklasse an: Als Schattenritter bringt Lordwrath ein ganzes Arsenal neuer Techniken und Fähigkeiten mit sich, die euch neue Strategien erlauben.

Neben diesen zwei Held:innen enthält diese Erweiterung alle Monster aus dem Monster Pack #1 der Gamefound Kampagne. Freut euch auf Todesbote, Dunkler Späher und natürlich auf den Dämonenfürst.

Dies ist eine Erweiterung für den kooperativen Dungeon-Crawler Chroniken von Drunagor: Zeitalter der Dunkelheit von Daniel Alves und Eurico Cunha. Das Grundspiel wird benötigt, um diese Erweiterung zu spielen.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Creative Games Studio LLC, Frosted Games, Pegasus Spiele

name: Familienwichtel haben's satt: Raus aus der Stadt!
description:
The family gnomes want to move from the office building in the city to a little house in the countryside on the outskirts of the city. From the office building in the middle of the game board, the first player moves according to the number rolled. The other players follow in turn.
Red number spaces: There is a funny event in each of these spaces. If a player comes to a number space, the verse with the corresponding number from the game rules is read out.
Yellow tram-stations: If a player reaches such a tram station, he draws the top one from the face-down yellow St-cards. He must follow the instructions given. No more cards are drawn at the terminus; instead the player can roll the die again.
Blue subway stations: The same rules apply to these subway stations.
A player must roll the exact number to reach the goal. Whoever gets to the little house on the outskirts of town first with their family gnome wins the game.

The game is based on the book "Familienwichtel leben gefährlich" from Bruno Horst Bull & Erika Meier Albert.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Laia
description:
Laia has invited you to a sleepover and you’re having so much fun playing with her huge collection of soft toys that you didn’t realize it’s time to go to bed. But first, you have to tidy up the bedroom and put all the soft toys back on their shelves so they can also have sweet dreams.

In this kids' game players compete to be the first to place the soft toys in their correct shelf according to a objective card. Each player has a personal board and soft toy tokens that they must move around the tokens with one finger and without lifting them up or going outside the board. A very fun and educational kids game with two difficulty modes.

—description from the publisher

name: Which Craft?: Trial and Error
description:
Add a layer of intrigue with a thieving robber, throw your friends into the stocks, and interrogate suspects in this exciting expansion!
Trial and Error introduces 4 new villagers and 3 new action cards to the Which Craft? hidden role game.

name: John Deere-opoly: Collector's Edition
description:
Make your opponents green with envy as you purchase equipment, dealerships and land too grow your wealth. Collect $200 when you pass Drive Green, but don't get sent to HAIL! Test your luck- and your skills- as you strive to become the top farmer in this collector's edition of John Deere-opoly.

Farm-themed game pieces include a tractor, combine, dozer, ear of corn, pig and a cow. Game made in the USA.

BUY, RENT, WIN! John Deere helps you get rich quick with this engaging spin on a classic game
FUN FARM TWIST: Buy farmhouses and barns to collect more rent, avoid getting sent to “Hail”, and be sure to collect $200 for passing Drive Green!
FAMILY FUN FOR AGES 8+: A great way to liven up family game nights, can you become a farming tycoon
COLLECTOR'S EDITION: Includes board, 28 Deed cards, 14 Auction cards, 14 Farmers Market cards, 2 dice, play money, farm houses and barns and 6 game tokens and storage box with rules
OFFICIALLY LICENSED JOHN DEERE PRODUCT: Produced by TOMY – Our mission is to make the world smile!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: English, Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading

name: The Aetherial War Card Game: Chaos and Consequences Core Set – Brutal Enemy Expansion
description: Think you're up to the challenge of facing off against the toughest foes in the galaxy? Well, then it's time to prove it! The Brutal Enemy Expansion gives players the opportunity of taking on even stronger enemies for each tier of every faction in the Chaos and Consequences Core Set. Depending on the Mission, you'll encounter one of twelve different enemies added to each battle. Good luck. You will need it.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: The Aetherial War Card Game: Chaos and Consequences Core Set – Ally Expansion
description: Load up with the Ally Expansion. This mini expansion provides you with a new type of card: Allies. These mini-cards can be gained as a reward in place of equipment cards. They attack just like players, and even have special abilities to activate that can give you an advantage in tough situations.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction

name: The Aetherial War Card Game: Chaos and Consequences Core Set – Hidden Agenda Expansion
description: The Hidden Agenda Expansion adds a competitive aspect to every campaign. Now, each player draws a Hidden Agenda card from the stack, but doesn't reveal it. During each Mission, every player will attempt to complete the objective listed on the card. These may be helpful to the team, or put them at risk of failing. Completing it will allow you to place it face-down beside your character card. At the end of the campaign, the player with the most Victory Points (VP) from their completed Hidden Agenda cards is the winner. But beware, you can only win if you complete the final mission.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction

name: The Aetherial War Card Game: Chaos and Consequences Core Set – Omega Expansion
description: This expansion gives players an alternative hero character card and three extremely powerful Action Cards per character. Intended for New Game+ or a connected campaign between core sets, these cards will make sure you are ready for anything.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction

name: Pete the Cat Terrific Taco Game
description: Help Pete the Cat make terrific tacos! Players practice counting and visual identification skills as they collect silly taco toppings to fill their Order Cards. The first player to fill three Order Cards wins in this fantastic food game! - description from the back of the box

name: Greedy Farmers
description: There are many crops planted and poultry raised on the farm, and always a lot of pests come to eat the crops, so the farm owner announced: "Whoever harvesting the crops and catch the pests the fastest will win." Come and collect your rewards!". The player who gets the most rewards wins the game!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Farming

name: Greedy Fishermen
description:
At the magical elf Lake, the players take turns rolling dice and decide what fish to catch based on the combination of the dice. The fish caught is temporarily placed in the bucket. If you decide to stop, you will immediately get all the fish in the bucket. You may continue to catch. If you don't catch any fish, you have to pour all the fish in the bucket back into the lake! Therefore, fishing technique and risk assessment are equally important in this competition!
At the end of the game, the player with the highest value catch wins the game!

name: ЧПОК ЧМОК (Smack Smack)
description:
ЧПОК ЧМОК is a bright alternative to classic forfeits, a daring addition to any party. The box contains 55 new tasks that will help players open up and shed light on the most unexpected questions. Players will find a new game mode with action cards. Players will not only answer strange and indiscreet questions, but also complete tasks - also crazy and frank.

—description from the publisher

ЧПОК ЧМОК – яркая альтернатива классическим фантам, дерзкое дополнение к любой вечеринке. В коробке содержится 55 новых заданий, которые помогут игрокам раскрыться и пролить свет на самые неожиданные вопросы. Игрокам предстоит не только отвечать на странные и нескромные вопросы, но и выполнять задания – тоже безумные и откровенные.

—description from the publisher (Russian)

name: Top Hero
description:
Heroes from all walks of life gather together to show off their special skills, compete with each other, and strive for the throne of hero!
Which one is more powerful, the wizard's sneak attack, or the knight's active attack, which is more practical? Can the ranger's reconnaissance operations uncover the assassin's sinister plan?
There is a saying: The waves behind the Yangtze River push the waves ahead, and the waves in front die on the beach.
The real heroes are usually not the ones who come early, because history is written by "posterity"...

name: The Blog Master: Exploring Europe
description:
Grow your "Travel Blog" while traveling Europe! A game about not only becoming a blogging superstar but learning about and sharing the world around you...

During your journey, you will visit some of the greatest landmarks Europe has to offer while growing your fledgling "Travel Blog" into one of the most popular places on the web to visit. The goal of the game is simple: gain likes, post articles on attractions, lodging, dining locations, and generate affiliate revenue to grow your blog. However, it is your strategy in how you achieve these tasks that will ultimately make you "The Blog Master".

With over 700 unique cards, you will have to change your path to earning blog stars with almost every game. Your ability to constantly reevaluate your choices is what will draw you in and make you want to play again!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Clash Masters
description:
Clash Masters, is an engaging card game that offers a refreshing blend of simplicity and strategic depth. The game kicks off as players construct their defenses, paving the way for an exciting journey of destroying each other's fortifications and engaging in intense duels. The ultimate triumph awaits the last player standing.

Clash Masters is a card game for 2-4 players and the age target is 7 and above. Combine more decks to increase the player limit.
The game features a range of attack cards and a set of five versatile action cards. Utilize attack cards to engage opponents in strategic confrontations, while the action cards offer a spectrum of unique functions.

Game content:
- Game box
- 51 playing cards
- Rule booklet

How to play (in brief):

Shuffle the deck
Deal 8 random cards to each player.
All players set up 3 defense cards, which leaves 5 cards in hand.
In turn, use the attack cards to destroy enemy defenses and use the action cards to turn the tide of the battle to your advantage.
The game is played in a clockwise direction and the person to the left of the dealer starts the game.
All players will in turn try to destroy each other’s defenses.
When a player loses all 3 defense cards, the player may be challenged to a duel. If the duel is lost, the player is eliminated from the game. If the duel is won, the player is rewarded with +1 new defense card and gets to continue the game.
The last player remaining wins the game.


—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Children's Game, Number
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That

name: Beneath The Sewers
description:
Beneath The Sewers is a solo print-and-play tri-fold game. Recruit a team of mice, clear a path, and lead the rest of your colony to safety.

Humans have created a machine. A machine so terrifying that it forces the mice to evacuate their homes. The sewer pipe, your only escape route, has been invaded with the machine’s tentacles. In Beneath The Sewers, you must recruit a team of mice, clear a path, and lead the rest of your colony to safety.

Each sewer pipe is segregated into 6 levels, consisting of 3 parts and 6 segments. You must climb up segment by segment to move on to the next level till you reach the exit and escape. Each level will have a starting number of machine tentacles. Roll a d6 to determine the part and segment where the tentacles will emerge. More tentacles might also emerge after the end of each turn.

You can perform several actions per turn depending on the number of recruits you have. Your move count is also dependent on your endurance. The higher you climb, the lesser endurance you will have. However, this can be mitigated by purchasing upgrades using experience points earned by eliminating the tentacles.

You and your colony will be safe once you have climbed all 6 levels.

name: #Fica a Dica
description:
In a relaxed and challenging way, #Fica a Dica will test your skills in giving tips, miming and guessing the names of people or things during three exciting rounds.

With up to 16 players divided into two teams, everyone will try to get the most words right while racing against time! The team with the highest score wins!

But stay tuned! The same words that fall to the opposing team may, in subsequent rounds, fall to your team as well. Memory and attention can help.

And, to get even more excited, teams will be able to write the names of people who are part of their circle of friends on the blank pieces of paper, personalizing the game in a very fun way.
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Memory, Team-Based Game

name: LEADERS: The Combined Strategy Game – Soul of Africa
description: One of the nation expansions for the main game. This set gives a new possible leader with special characteristics (non attacking region decree).

name: Hydrologic Cycle
description:
Hydrologic Cycle is a fast-paced, 1v1 or 2v2 player, area-control card game where players fight for control of the global water cycle. To win, players must use their knowledge and memorization skills to connect water cycle reservoirs and transport processes and end the game with more of their cards covering the game board.

Hydrologic Cycle uses simultaneous play to keep the game flowing (like water in the global water cycle!), which means players are drawing, playing, and discarding cards in real time as they attempt to match reservoirs and transport processes to claim areas of the board. Cards can be played on top of one another as play progresses, so who controls a particular location on the board will change rapidly during the game. A player can also play a card on the board more than once, so long as it is played with a directly connecting card.

The game ends immediately when every space on the board is covered with a card. The winner is determined by noting the player whose cards cover the top of the most spaces on the board.

For science educators and home schoolers, Hydrologic Cycle meets a number of Next Generation Science Standards (NGSS) and Common Core Math standards for learning the global water cycle for grades 3-12 using the introductory side of the game board, while the advanced side of the game board is appropriate for use at the university level. A curriculum guide containing suggestions, lesson plans, optional rules, and other resources for using Hydrologic Cycle in your high school or college classroom accompanies some KS bundles.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection, Speed Matching
publishers: Center for Learning Through Games and Simulations, Central Michigan University Press

name: Know Thyself
description:
A 60-minute 2-player personality game that uses archetypes of the human personality to foster introspection, self reflection, fascinating conversation and deeper connections between people.

Personality traits are represented on cards. You pick one at random and then cast 2 votes, numbered 1 to 5 to show how closely you think you, and the other player aligns with that trait.

Then you reveal the votes in turn and explain why you made the choices that you did. You give examples and rationalise your decisions. The conversations fly.

Points are scored when a player correctly guesses the score that they other player gave themselves. E.g. If someone pulls the "RAGE" personality card, and gives themselves a 4. If the other player also gives themselves a 4, then they get 1 point.

At the end of 60 minutes the person with the most points is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Questions and Answers, Voting

name: Too Much Info
description:
Take turns to describe and guess words, but make sure you don't give it away.

The describing player must choose a word on a card and describe it, aiming for half the players to guess the word correctly. If everyone or no-one guesses correctly then you are awarded no points and must wear the hat of shame.

Earn points by guessing correctly or by getting as close to half the other players to guess your word. Points awarded changes depending on how many players there are.

—description from the publisher

name: Bop It!: Star Wars – The Mandalorian: The Child
description:
This small Star Wars edition of the classic Bop It! game features the franchise's beloved character The Mandalorian The Child.

The game commands you to Bop it, Twist it, Pull it, in the voice of The Mandalorian and you have to respond as fast as you can. If you get it right, you get another chance, but if you don't, you're out! The commands get faster the longer you go on, and you'll hear the sounds of The Child as you play.

—description from the publisher

name: Firefly Adventures: Brigands and Browncoats – Escape the Dragon's Lair
description:
Steal important information from the home of the planet's most notorious crime boss, who happens to be nicknamed, The Dragon? No problem, In and out. Easy money. Well... things didn't go smooth and now you and your crew have to hightail it out of there, doubletime!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Line of Sight, Role Playing, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Firefly Adventures: Brigands and Browncoats – Joyride
description:
You touched down planetside ahead of schedule. Rather than twiddle yer thumbs waitin' for your contact, you stopped by the bar to celebrate a job well done. Your celebrations turned out to be premature however, when some hoodlums hotwired your M.U.L.E. and drove off with your contraband in the back seat!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Line of Sight, Role Playing, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Firefly Adventures: Brigands and Browncoats – Part Problem, Part Success
description:
The Client wants to deliver some Delicate materials to a contact outside Town. In and out with no fuss. Pity the M.U.L.E. has broken down and needs a part. The locals can help provided you don't snoop where you ain't wanted. There is another issue, a band of cowboys have caught wind of the Job and want the goods for themselves, or destroyed. They will reach Town at any moment.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Line of Sight, Role Playing, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Firefly Adventures: Brigands and Browncoats – Derelict
description:
Your employer had some sensitive data he sent around the normal Alliance routes—that meant traveling through Reaver space. The transport had a full complement of passengers hopeful for a new life on the rim worlds at the fringes of Alliance control. They didn’t get what was expected. The craft is a total loss. It remains structurally intact, but has been dead in the water for weeks until its discovery and it bears the distinct marks of Reaver boarding. The find came across the Cortex and your employer needs you to collect his data before the Alliance arrives to claim it—and he’s willing to pay you well for your efforts.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Line of Sight, Role Playing, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Firefly Adventures: Brigands and Browncoats – Unification War
description:
As sergeant of the 57th Independent Ground Brigade you’re defending the Serenity Valley. An airborne Alliance Skiff threatens your men and to take it out you’ll need to reach a nearby UA 571-D, and anti-aircraft gun. Unfortunately it lies on the other side of a squad of Alliance soldiers hidden in trenches. No one leaves Serenity, you just learn to live there. Let’s go duck hunting!

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Line of Sight, Role Playing, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Alice in Wonderland: Wet Girls and the Caucus Race
description: As Alice characters in the caucus race drenched in Alice's tears, you will play 1-2 cards from a hand of 2, drawing tokens to reduce your wet rating and performing card effects. Afterwards, draw back up to 2. At the end of a round, points are awarded based on how dry players are. Most points wins after a few rounds.

name: Travelist
description: The World Tourism Organization organizes the "Around the World" competition, calling on people who like to travel to compete to visit tourist attractions using limited air tickets and numbers on them. On each journey, the more attractions you visit on different continents, the higher your score. If you visit a continent repeatedly on multiple trips, try becoming a "travel expert" on that continent to get extra points. Can you win among the many travel experts?
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Travel

name: Doom Cat
description:
You're a young witch learning the ropes of magic. Unfortunately, your mischievous cat found your spell book and summoned demons!

In Doom Cat, you must learn how to draw sigils. You start with a magic circle page filled with numbered candles. Roll 3 dice and draw a line between 2 of the candles matching two of the dice. The other number tracks the rounds and unlocks abilities.

Doom Cat comes with campaign cards that increases the scoring opportunities and immerses you deeper into the world of sigil magic. Shuffle and play with a few random ones, or play them in order, progressively increasing the difficulty. Each scoring criteria incentivizes emergent beauty, giving each player a unique sigil each time!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Pineapple Cake Prison Break
description:
What's the best way to break out of prison? You could smuggle some tools, dig a hole, and crawl out. Or you could horde ingredients from the bakery and make a pineapple cake to bribe the guards to look the other way while you grab their keys.

In Pineapple Cake Prison Break, players race to be the first to escape jail.

The core rule set involves bluffing. On your turn, offer another player a card face down and say what one of the objects on it could be. They say if they believe you or not. Reveal. If they were correct, they choose to keep it or not. If they were wrong, you choose. Both of you want to finish a set of 5 tools or 5 ingredients. But you also want to avoid 3 matching items, which will get you caught and reward the other player.

You may also play without bluffing rules, either half-truths or open information. All three rulesets emphasize strategically choosing which player to target and which card to offer.

The game is enriched with optional action cards that can dramatically change the game. They are still offered to another player and may backfire if they catch you bluffing about them.

Includes rules for solo and co-op play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Race, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Das große Tourenspiel
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. Each player starts with 300 DM and has to make deliveries to 10 customers. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. On arriving on space x the players get bonuses or penalties according to the sum of money they own.

The players with the most money, after having completed his deliveries, wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Goldrausch
description:
The players take turns to roll 3 dies and tries to get a triple. After choosing a number, they may roll again with 2 dies and a third time with 1 die. If they get a triple, they get get the tokens from the corresponding space on the game board. If not the have to pay a token for each number different from their chosen one to the space of this number (double if it is a "1")

If 3 following numbers are rolled, the player may change one number and roll the third die two times.

On the third roll a "6" is a joker.

If a player is out of tokens, he is out of the game. The player with the most tokens at the end of the game (after an agreed on time) is the winner.

—user summary

name: Abenteuer im Amazonas
description:
Since the statue was stolen from the temple, the water flowing through your village has turned brown and rotten. Could you help the temple servant and replace the statue of the god?

This demo adventure will introduce you to the basic principles of the game and give you a taste of the Magnificum adventure games.

name: Forsaken: The Shaman and The Stray
description:
Two new characters are included in this expansion - Stray and Ghixu-Ghexu, the Shaman.

This expansion includes:

2 new characters (each with a miniature, character board, 3 story cards, 10 feats and 1 starter gear)
18 encounter cards
1 Offworld Salvager Class Module (4 story cards and 4 feats)
24+ reserve cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Forsaken: The Prisoner and the Peon
description:
Two new characters join forsaken in this expansion: The prisoner O'phyddia Cold and the Peon Killquick.

This expansion contains:
- 2 new playable characters (each with miniature, character board, 10 feats, 3 story cards and 1 starter gear)
- 1 warden pod miniature
- 18 encounter cards
- The Empyriad Exile class module (4 story cards and 4 feats)
- 24+ reserve cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Forsaken: Lab Limited bonus content
description:
All of the Kickstarter stretch goals and bonus content in one box!

Contains:
2 Character miniatures
2 Character boards
28 Feat cards
22 Story cards
4 Ruins cards
9 Persona cards
17 Asset cards (gear, weapons, and data)
2 Bounty cards
1 Wondrous Sundry
18 Encounters
1 Observer reference card
1 Observer dice tower replacement tile
3 Acrylic persona standees
2 Cub Cards (Lil Watta and Femryk)
42 Reserve cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph

name: Scallywags
description:
The Ulti-mutt Board Game!

Jump on board with Scallywags, where ruff around the edges canines compete for land and loot! These tough pups are out to seek adventure, plunder hard fought treats, and seek fame as the top dog of the high seas.

2 to 4 players take turns working through explore, buy, battle, and loot phases to consolidate a cat free empire. Claim unexplored islands, build & battle yer fleet on the high seas, and bury the most plunder to win!

Watch out for event cards that will change the tide of the game and enjoy plenty of well-placed dad jokes along the way.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Income, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Black Spirits: Wayward and Weathered
description:
Black Spirits: Wayward and Weathered is an expansion for the popular Black Spirits: Combat Cards game system, a supplement that replaces dice components in board games based on extremely popular dark fantasy action RPG video games to use cards for their combat systems rather than dice. Expand on the tactics established in that core set to enrich virtually every aspect of the board game. Support and customize your specific build with specialized stat cards, use completely new and intricate playstyles with brand new character class cards, dive into exploration and adventure with discovery cards, or accept a new level of challenge with affliction cards. Or include them all for a rich and tactical experience full of hard decisions and fraught with peril.

As with the Black Spirits: Combat Cards core set, Black Spirits: Wayward and Weathered is drop-in with no modifications, house rules, or tweaks necessary to the board game played. It's built with the latest sets of those board games in mind, but is also compatible with earlier versions of those games, so you can inject new life (or of course, death) into your already-owned games regardless of what your collection looks like.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: King John's Tournament
description:
King John’s Tournament is a 1 to 2 player card/dice game that plays in 20 to 30 minutes. Your goal is to obtain the highest score possible by shooting three arrows at a target. To do this you will be rolling dice, adjusting the dice and placing the dice to match other required dice results. There are six cards representing the travel of the arrow before it hits the target. The game can be played using multiple levels of difficulty.

Goal of the game
The goal of the game is to get the highest score possible. To do this, you need to fire all three of your arrows into the direct center yellow section of the target which will earn you a max total of 30 points. The farther you get from the center, the lower your score will be for that arrow shot. Player with the highest score wins.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Medieval, Print & Play

name: Party Alias: Souboj generací
description:
The popular party game Party Alias in the latest version. As the name suggests, the game is a battle of generations - parents and children. Or children and parents?

Unlike Party Alias and Party Alias Big Bet, this version is all talking, no pantomime or drawing - just like Party Alias Women vs Men.

One of the players explains a word or phrase to their team so that they can guess it and thus come closer to winning.

Does that seem too easy? Well, watch out, there's a catch: kids explain words from their parents' world and parents explain words from today's teenagers' world.

Can you express yourself succinctly and clearly in a limited amount of time? See if you can be equal competitors!

Party Alias: Souboj generací ("The Party Alias Clash of Generations") game includes: game plan, 400 cards containing 2,400 words, hourglass, 2 pieces and rules.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Party Game, Racing, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Heroes of Timeline
description:
Heroes of Timeline is a board game that brings you into a captivating fantasy world and challenges your strategic skills in quick and dynamic battles.
- Zero randomness
Heroes of Timeline is a board game that will never let a victory to be stolen from you by an unlucky dice throw. Only your strategy and choices lead the Heroes to a victory or a defeat.
- Unique heroes
Unique abilities of each Hero and each Team mean that every move you make is crucial, and every match you play is unique.
- Painless rules
The game is designed to start playing quickly. This video will prepare you for your first Heroes of Timeline game in roughly 10 minutes.
- Deep strategy
You lead two Teams of mightiest Heroes, and you direct their maneuvers, attacks, and abilities in a turn-based combat. The stakes in this game are high: any attack on an unprotected Hero means elimination.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Movement Points, Role Playing, Turn Order: Progressive, Zone of Control

name: Spotzee-Dotzee
description:
Playing Pieces: Five Spotzee-Dotzee dice, with different colors on each side. Scoring sheets included.

Your Goal: To have the highest total score after each player has scored all 13 turns.

To Start: Choose a player to go first. Play moves to the left.

On Your Turn: Roll all five dice. Then, you may make up to two re-rolls of any dice you wish, trying to create the best possible score. You do not have to use all three rolls of the dice, and can score at any time.

Scoring: You must record a score on one of the rows of the score sheet each time you take a turn, even if it means scoring zero in an empty row that your dice do not match. You cannot move or change any score after it has been recorded on the score sheet.

A "Super Spotzee" (five of a kind) is the highest score you can get, and is worth 10 points. If you roll additional "Super Spotzees," you can score them in another row (such as "Count the Red Dots") and mark a small box in the Bonus line to add 10 more points to your final score!

name: Don't Get Grinched
description:
24 pairs of cards and 1 Grinch card - avoid the Grinch to win.

Cards are shuffled and all dealt out. Players remove their pairs before play proceeds. Players take it in turns to take a card from the previous player without looking and remove a pair of it makes one.

The player at the end of the game with the Grinch loses.

name: Les adresses jaunes
description:
The streets of Hong Kong are brimming with exceptional restaurants, showcasing the city's rich culinary heritage. But a major political crisis has shaken the archipelago, dividing society into two polarized camps. Among the city's businesses, some are quietly committed to support the pro-democracy camp (the yellow ones). Will you be able to share your precious locations without risking exposing them to the authorities?

Yellow Places is a cooperative game in which players are trying to guess the tiles they have in their hands, by cleverly positioning their pieces on the board. The board represents a district of Hong Kong with 27 businesses. Players win the game together if they manage to guess all their tiles and get everyone to guess them.

—description from the designer

name: Postcards from Canada
description:
Postcards from Canada is a children's/family game about collecting stamps of Canadian animals to complete postcards.

The game comprises six dry erase postcards, 150 stamps and 54 attribute cards. These cards have attributes that are used to collect stamps and manage destinations. The dry erase postcards have spaces to collect five stamps and two boxes to write and manage their destination.

Also available: Postcards from America.

GOAL:

Complete your postcard by collecting five stamps and all the letters in your destination.

SETUP:

Each player gets a postcard on which they write a destination. The destination must have at least five unique letters. For example PARIS or CHICAGO, but not TORONTO. Each player also gets at least five stamps, more with longer destination words.
Using the destination, players randomly draw stamps equal to the number of unique letters in their destination.

GAME PLAY:

Game play is simultaneous with a player drawing the next attribute card. All players act upon the attribute revealed to either mark a letter from their destination or add a stamp to their postcard.

To collect a stamp, the animal must match the attribute. For example, the attribute "fins" matches a salmon, a turtle, a manatee and a dolphin.

To collect a letter, the destination's word must have that letter. All matching letters are recorded in the collection box. For example, with "SEATTLE" (with five unique letters), a match with "E" will collect two E's.

WINNING:

To win, a player must collect five stamps and all the letters in their destination.

STRATEGY:

The destination a player selects may have advantages or disadvantages compared to the destinations of other players.
For example, a longer destination gives a the player more stamps to use, but also may take longer to complete their postcard. Effective selection of the destination is key to winning.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Sprocketforge
description:
In Sprocketforge, players are artificers building a factory with enchanted gears to produce mana and complete orders to earn renown. Players will add, upgrade, and swap gears in their factory to create an efficient system.

However, mana is messy and clogs up your vents, requiring players to balance earning points with keeping their machine clean. The noble houses of Sprocketforge will reward the factories with the cleanest system as players vie for favor to earn more points and additional actions.

Be the player with the most renown at the end of the game to win!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Contracts, Follow, Hidden Victory Points, Income, Market, Modular Board, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Thwarted! A Game of Super-Villainy Power Pack
description: This 22-card expansion to Thwarted! A Game of Super-Villainy contains new Villain Persona cards, Hero buff and debuff cards, and updated reference cards.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Bomber Command
description:
According to the rules Bomber Command is "a simulation loosely based on he RAF's night bomber offensive against the Third Reich."

In the standard game the RAF player launches ten bombing raids. Before each raid the German player receives six random units and deploys them on the map face-down. The British player then receives three units and random and programs the raid they will carry out using a copy of the map and the Raid Details Chart.

Once the raid begins the British units carry out their program and the German units may react. However, each German unit has a limited number of moves it can make during the raid.

The German player knows how much damage the bombers do to the cities, but they do not know how much damage the bombers take from either flak or nighfighter attacks; both players see the die rolls but the British player chooses one of two combat results tables to use for the raid and the German player does not know which one it is.

Victory points are awarded to the British for damaging cities and to the Germans for damaging plans and for British raids in which fewer than two planes are used. Since the German player does not know how much damage they are doing (and may not find out how many planes are used in a raid) their points are hidden from them until the end of the game.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Programmed Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Nuclear Ducks
description:
It’s the future, but don’t think about it too hard. It’s just ducks strapped to engines... or maybe the ducks are piloting them from a cockpit... or maybe visualization is the enemy of suspended disbelief.

This game is meant to contemplate the difficulties that arise within a tight pack of racers who are propelled at breakneck speeds by engines that contain radioactive fuel and that heat up uncomfortably quickly to meltdown temperatures in environments that hate you.

Being in the lead is bad: you must smash through an everlasting air barrier that builds resistance heat. Being in the middle of the pack is bad: you will absorb extra exhaust radiation from ducks ahead of you. Being in the rear is bad: if you don’t floor it to the brink of explosion, you’ll never catch the leaders. Hitting obstacles at these speeds is very bad.

Which equipment should you bring? Will it be stuff that staves off dangerous meltdown and blackout conditions? ..or perhaps performance-pushing engine boosts and aerodynamic modifications? ..or tasty duck snacks that have an assortment of effects?

Each race is abstracted via relative movement on a series of 3-laned boards that cycle in the style of Thunder Road. Turns are simulated by moving forward or backward in the inside or outside lanes, respectively. Hazards, turns, and environmental effects are dictated by a 6-stage course card.

Aggression and thrillseekery are provided by you.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Relative Movement, Turn Order: Auction, Variable Player Powers

name: Casey Jones
description:
Race steam locomotives across the United States, delivering cargo to earn money.

Spend your earnings to buy bigger locomotives and pull longer trains, or buy the railroads themselves, and charge other players for using them.

Only watch out for cows on the tracks ….

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Crond
description: An abstract game similar to chess and checkers, played by 2-4 players. The objective is to capture the crown squares of other players, the last remaining player is declared the winner.

name: Without our King
description:
In Without our King: 2-4 rulers compete in a game of a strategic conquest and political maneuvering to seize control of The Last Kingdom, a once mighty realm on the island of Luminar. The Last Kingdom is thrown into chaos following the slaughter of the God King. The island of Luminar now witnesses the rise of warlords and zealots challenging established treaties and faiths. March your legions of archers, swordsmen, and deadly shock cavalry to dominate enemy lands. Construct walls and castles to defend your territory. Ensure your councilors are elected to the Council and deceive your enemies to win at all costs.

—description from the publisher
categories: Fantasy, Medieval, Political, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Deduction, Grid Movement, Income, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Trading

name: Zoom Prima
description:
The new generation quiz game, which was created in cooperation with the documentary TV Prima Zoom.

You can look forward to 4 different categories - nature, interesting places, science and technology, history - which will check your knowledge. Game cards contain a number of beautiful photos and 3 different types of questions. Players collect points for the correct answers and the one who gets the most wins the game.


Kvízová hra novej generácie, ktorá vznikla v spolupráci s dokumentárnym televíznym kanálom Prima Zoom.

Tešiť sa môžete na 4 rôzne kategórie – príroda, zaujímavé miesta, veda a technika, história – ktoré preveria vaše znalosti. Herné karty obsahujú množstvo krásnych fotografií a 3 rôzne typy otázok. Hráči zbierajú body za správne odpovede a ten, kto ich získa najviac, vyhráva.

name: Rondomi
description: Each player receives 5 slices. The remaining slices form a hidden stack, The youngest player starts by placing one of his slices on the table. The other players proceed clockwise and try to complete one of the two figures by placing a matching slice next to it. If a player does not have a matching slice they draw a new one from the stack. If the new slice does not match either, it's the next player's turn. The first player to place all their slices wins the game.

name: Data Heist
description:
You are a rookie hacker and want to be admitted into the inner circle of the hacking fraternity. Prove your worth by stealing as much personal data from the marketplace and prevent your competitors from stealing too!

The game's objective is to score as many points as possible by successfully performing attacks on victims in the marketplace.

Players can attack by choosing a target from the marketplace, playing Praesidium cards from their hand (to determine the type of attack: DDOS, phishing or social engineering) and rolling the corresponding number of dice to find out the strength of the attack. If the strength matches or overcomes the resistance value of the target, the attack is successful and the player scores the number of points depicted on the target card.

In the more advanced variant of the game, players may obtain special attacks and use protection measures to thwart attacks of other players, so that they themselves can win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: I Know You
description:
A 2-player board game for friends, family, and especially couples (even on dates) to have a fun challenge in getting to know one another better through questions about preferences and little things in life. How much you really know about them?:“Do you prefer eastern or western food ?”, “Can you swim well?”, “Do you prefer a good view or a good food restaurant ?” and many other questions. Who can give a more accurate answer about the other person will be the winner in this game of authentic communication.

—description from the designer

name: Guilty: Monaco 1955
description:
In this second entry in the Guilty series (after Guilty: Houston 2015), you will lead the investigation in a game with chillingly realistic details!
"Damn it, has he forgotten me or what!?" Worried, you take a few steps towards the harbor, leaving the mechanics in the paddock behind. The Prince isn't the kind of man to bail out... Admittedly, your promotion to lieutenant-colonel of the Monaco Carabinieri is nothing more than a golden early retirement, but after twenty years in homicide, your cop instincts are intact: something's going on this morning. Something that's likely to make far more noise than the fury of the Formula 1 Grand Prix.

In Guilty: Monaco 1955, immerse yourself in the dark and fascinating world of the game series that reinvents the interactive detective story!

Which leads will you follow in this labyrinth of lies, false trails and shocking revelations? Each card you play brings you closer to the truth, but also closer to danger. In this game where every detail counts, you'll have to fit the puzzle pieces together while keeping an eye on the clock. Because, yes, your time is running out! At every moment, the hourglass of justice runs out, and the choices you make have irreversible consequences.

Will you be the methodical investigator who follows the evidence to the end, or the instinctive one who takes calculated risks to nail the culprit? And beware: any misstep could lead you down a blind alley, or even worse. You can assume the consequences of your choices... or bitterly regret them.

Whether illuminated by the harsh light of the crime scene or shrouded in the darkness of a notorious alleyway, Guilty offers an immersive gaming experience that will keep you on the edge of your seat until the ultimate revelation. Each entry is a new challenge, a new story and a new opportunity to demonstrate your deduction skills.
If you have the soul of a detective and are looking for a challenging gaming experience, Guilty is for you. So, are you ready to take control of your destiny and solve the most complex investigations? The countdown has begun...
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph

name: Commander Deck
description:
A one vs one deep space starship battles card game that is quick to learn and fast to play. It takes the WAR card game of old and adds a bit of flare by adding a way to track your progress towards victory with a first time ever seen card mechanic that delivers visual elements that is sure to please any science fiction fan.

—description from the publisher

name: What Do You Meme?: Family Edition Expansion Pack #1
description:
More Cards, More Memes, More Fun: This is the expansion to the fan favorite (and family-friendly) meme-matching game you know and love.

Contents
100 caption cards
25 photo cards
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: A Trip to Paris
description:
Published by A. Williams & Co. of Boston and copyrighted by Mudge & Spooner in 1857. Thought to be the predecessor game to the Peter Coddle games (Trip to New York, Trip to Chicago) as it was published a year prior to Gould & Lincoln‘s Peter Coddle’s Trip to New York game in 1858.

One person is selected to read the story which is accompanied by a set of cards in the box. The cards, containing the names of various objects, are distributed equally to all participants. When the reader encounters a blank space in the story, that person looks at one of the participants who then must read one of their cards to complete that missing part of the story.

name: Harbinger: Under the Cursed Fells
description:
Embark on a harrowing journey to Illnue in the first captivating installment of our Harbinger Series. Uncover the dark secrets that lie beneath the mysterious affliction that have befallen the Toreln. Whispers of kidnapped children echo through the Storm Watcher’s Forest. As the main hero, you catch wind of these unsettling rumors and immerse yourself in not only a search for the missing children, but for answers.

Your mission begins with tracking down the sole survivor of these kidnappings, leading you into a quest to unravel the mysteries behind the nocturnal abductions by enigmatic creatures. Face unseen dangers and forge alliances. Your new ally is the key to unlocking the secrets of these mysterious kidnappings as you navigate treacherous paths and encounter dangers that will put your skills to the test. Illnue conceals not only its kidnapped children, but an unforeseen force working against them. Brace yourself for an immersive narrative that portends evil at every turn.

Are you ready to face the shadows, rescue the kidnapped children, and unveil the mysteries of Illnue? In Under the Cursed Fells, the fate of Illnue’s children rests in your hands!www.harbingersystem.com

This first set allows players and content creators to add dimensional dungeon structures to their adventuring! This set comes with a campaign compatible with Vrahode – The Calteeryn Ascension, three exclusive minion miniatures, one Legendary Creature miniature and cards for each as well as five rooms, six hallways, thirty 2” supports, two stair units, fifteen M/M connectors, four stair treads, twenty-four walls clips, one 2-sided 2” wall, one 3” 2-sided wall, two 2-sided 4” walls, two 2-sided 5” walls and two 2-sided 6” walls.

All full color vinyl artwork for the rooms, hallways and walls in this set were all created by Léni Scheider of Darkest Dungeon the board game fame!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy

name: Demopoly
description:
"The Filipino Game of Life"

Demopoly is a game with obvious similarities in appearance to Monopoly. Players roll dice and move along spaces around the board. When they land on a space they take the action listed. They may buy a company share, draw a cash prize card, pay a fine or be arrested. Players who are arrested then draw a sentence card to determine the penalty for their particular crime. Shares pay preset dividends.

Demopoly is almost entirely a luck dependent game. The only player decision is whether or not to buy a share when you land on a share space. All other outcomes in the game are decided by the dice and the cards. There is no player interaction such as trading or negotiation.

The winner of the game is the last player left. Players may be eliminated from the game by going bankrupt or, less likely, being sentenced to death for a capital crime.
mechanics: Income, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Track Movement

name: Don't Let the Pigeon Drive the Bus Game!
description:
A simple roll-and-move game included in 20th Anniversary Edition of the Mo Willems picture book Don't Let the Pigeon Drive the Bus.

Players roll a die to move their buses through town, trying to reach the finish while doing silly tasks along the way. First player to the finish wins.

Note: this game is a similar but simpler game to the 2010 game of the same name.

name: Harbinger: Shadowed Seas
description:
