The tranquility of the seas has been shattered by the emergence of an ancient ocean goddess. With vengeful fury, she vows to annihilate any of the crafted races daring to navigate her domains. As the hero, your mission is nothing short of colossal—gather the concealed fragments of a powerful device to thwart the wrath of the ocean goddess in this deadly second installment in our Harbinger Series.

Scour treacherous waters, haunted islands, and deep sea-caverns across the expanse of the Gulf of Duwora to the Kharmandryn Ocean for the pieces you need to defeat your legendary enemy. Unveil the legends of the deep waters in this nautical quest that will challenge your seafaring and problem-solving skills.

Shadowed Seas beckons you to immerse yourself in this adventure of the tides. Will you emerge victorious, or will the goddess’ wrath prevail before you can gather the device you need to destroy her?

This second set allows players and content creators to increase the depth and complexity of dimensional dungeon structures to their adventuring! www.harbingersystem.com

This set comes with a campaign compatible with Vrahode – The Enlightened & The Enslaved(exp 1), three exclusive minion miniatures, one Legendary Creature miniature and cards for each as well as five rooms, five hallways, thirty 2” supports, thirty 4” supports, two stair units, two stair risers, two spiral stair units, fifteen M/M connectors, twelve stair treads, twenty-four walls clips, one 2-sided 2” wall, one 3” 2-sided wall, two 2-sided 4” walls, two 2-sided 5” walls and two 2-sided 6” walls.

All full color vinyl artwork for the rooms, hallways and walls in this set were all created by Léni Scheider of Darkest Dungeon the board game fame! Time to go vertical!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures

name: Harbinger: Warrens of the Heretic
description:
With the dangers of the shadowed seas behind you and the fate of Vrahode sprawled before you, meet your next enemy in the depths of the Forgotten Mountains.
Dive into the labyrinthian complex of Warren’s of the Heretic, spanning four levels of unparalleled challenge. Encounter the perilous Priul Guardians, meticulously crafted to test the mettle of even the most seasoned of heroes. Your Enemy, the wielder of a mysterious cloak that renders its wearer invisible to the true creator’s of Vrahode, proves to be one of your most treacherous foes yet.
Continue to expand your horizons with new races and rewards, facing the dangers of the unknown, and a fated battle with the Priul Engineer, who wields more than just the power of invisibility, but the ability to construct monstrosities that will put your courage to the test. Are you ready to face the challenges that lie within the labyrinths? www.harbingersystem.com

This third set allows players and content creators to further increase the size, depth and complexity of dimensional dungeon structures to their adventuring! This set comes with a campaign compatible with Vrahode – Facing The Storm (Warrens of the Heretic), three exclusive minion miniatures, one Legendary Creature miniature and cards for each as well as seven rooms, eight hallways, thirty 2” supports, thirty 4” supports, two stair units, two stair risers, one 4-piece dungeon riser, four 2” balustrades, fifteen M/M connectors, four stair treads, twenty-four walls clips, one 2-sided 2” wall, one 3” 2-sided wall, two 2-sided 4” walls, two 2-sided 5” walls and two 2-sided 6” walls.

All full color vinyl artwork for the rooms, hallways and walls in this set were all created by Léni Scheider of Darkest Dungeon the board game fame! Time to go vertical!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures

name: Harbinger: Bastions of Tenebrea
description:
Prepare for the ultimate test as the Harbinger series reaches its zenith with the fourth and final installment – Bastions of Tenebrea. A dark force has unleashed corrupted mountains across the realms of Vrahode, each harboring a diabolical plan orchestrated by the emerging Oberyn race. Spreading like a sinister plague across the once-pristine lands of Vrahode, ominous shadows loom, threatening to plunge the world into darkness.
Confront the Oberyn race and rise above the darkness to save the realms in this epic, unfurling campaign with formidable foes at each corrupted mountain spire and undeniable intensity throughout the adventure. Bastions of Tenebrea promises an unforgettable narrative, weaving together threads of the Vrahode series into a climactic finale. Do you have what it takes to face your greatest and final Enemy in the Harbinger series? www.harbingersystem.com

This forth set allows players and content creators to create further and to the maximum size, depth and complexity of dimensional dungeon structures for their adventuring!
This set comes with a campaign compatible with "Vrahode – The False Gods' Deceit", three exclusive minion miniatures, one Legendary Creature miniature and cards for each as well as four rooms, six hallways, thirty 2” supports, thirty 4” supports, two stair units, two stair risers, two spiral stair units, two 4” balustrades, fifteen M/M connectors, four stair treads, twenty-four walls clips, one 2-sided 2” wall, one 3” 2-sided wall, two 2-sided 4” walls, two 2-sided 5” walls and two 2-sided 6” walls.

All full color vinyl artwork for the rooms, hallways and walls in this set were all created by Léni Scheider of Darkest Dungeon the board game fame! Time to go vertical!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures

name: Inklings
description: Inklings is an easy-to-learn card game that uses memory and math skills to teach children how to quickly identify and respond to numbers, in a format that plays to their strengths. With 54 cards, players try to avoid the ink and jokers, grab duck shields, and get the highest score you can into your hand.

name: Urban Trivia
description: The popular, live trivia game converted to a tabletop form. Test your friends and family with a wild ride through a black cultural celebration. With questions that range from categories in African-American art, movies, sports, TV, music, and more, your knowledge of the culture will truly be put to the test. This game is guaranteed to bring a ton of laughs and nostalgic energy to your next game night, cookout, kickback, holiday party, or family reunion.

name: Raising Rabbits
description:
Raising Rabbits is an engaging, card-driven board game designed by Aaron Rebelo and published by Rebel Raptor. Unlike many games relying heavily on chance, Raising Rabbits offers a medium-weight experience where strategic decisions reign supreme. Featuring a diverse array of over 40 rabbit breeds and a dynamic market of valuable items, players immerse themselves in the competitive world of rabbit ownership.

In Raising Rabbits, you step into the boots of a passionate rabbit enthusiast, eager to excel in the competitive rabbit community. As you navigate through the game's rounds, representing the fleeting summer months, your goal is to accumulate as much money, ribbons, and bunnies as possible before the season draws to a close. To achieve success, you'll need to leverage your rabbits and their unique characteristics.

The game presents various avenues for players to gain an edge:


Fulfill personal goals to swiftly earn valuable points.
Gather rabbit droppings and capitalize on their value as fertilizer for quick cash.
Showcase your finest rabbits in shows to demonstrate your superior rabbits.
Breed rabbits strategically, collecting bunny tokens for lucrative long-term gains.
Explore the market, expanding your rabbit collection or acquiring items to bolster your chances of victory.


Raising Rabbits culminates in a tense race to accumulate the highest point total over the course of six rounds, typically lasting 45 minutes per game session. With up to 5 players, you can ensure your gaming group will enjoy the competitive gameplay, the fantastic art, or collecting handfuls of bunny tokens.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Auction/Bidding, Chaining, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hidden Victory Points, Market, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Traces of Hubris
description:
Traces of Hubris is a two-player game that simulates the German Case Blue (Fall Blau) summer offensive in southern Russia during the second half of 1942. The goal was to “cut off” the Volga at Stalingrad and to capture the Caucasus oil fields.

The Axis player must eliminate the Soviet forces and break their defense lines in order to reach his objectives. The Soviet player must do everything to defend the homeland, and hold until he gets a chance to strike back. The game uses the same core mechanics as Traces of War.

Game Scale:

Game Turn: 2 weeks / 1 month
Hex: 22.5 kilometers
Units: Divisions and Corps


Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium-low
Players: 1 or 2 Players
Playing Time: 3-6 hours

Note: Players will need to provide one opaque cup for game play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Multiple Maps, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Memopolis: Germany
description:
Memopolis is not a usual memo game. All of the 36 cards here are different. How to play it then? Very easily! The aim is to find two different landmarks from the same city. Either from Cologne, Munich, Berlin, Stuttgart, Hamburg or Frankfurt.

—description from the publisher

name: ¿Quieres ser Hernán Casciari?
description:
This game is inspired by the fascinating story of renowned writer Hernán Casciari and his incredible journey towards creativity and connection with words.

After eight years without writing, Hernán Casciari accepted the challenge of writing short stories in two hours on the radio program “Perros de la Calle”, without knowing the story until the listeners gave him an idea live.

This game seeks to capture that unique essence, challenging players to weave fascinating stories with unexpected words and promoting creativity, improvisation, and connection with words. Are you ready to immerse yourself in the magic of storytelling?

Let the game begin!


3 game modes:

Simple Story

Each participant has two minutes to create and tell a story using the three selected words and one word from their hidden card.

At the end of the stories, participants must vote for the best story, based on the creativity, coherence and originality of the narrative.

Competitive mode

Each person secretly chooses three of the 12 words available on their cards and then writes them down on a hidden piece of paper.

Whoever is in turn must tell a story, without mentioning any of the 12 words of his letters, but containing clues and references to the three chosen ones so that those who are listening can deduce them.

Those who are listeners, during each turn, write down on a piece of paper the three words that they believe the narrator in turn chose for their story.

After all the narrations, each player reveals (showing their “hidden” role) the three words chosen for their narration.

Players earn points according to the deductions made. Once all the narratives are met, the points are tallied and whoever gets the most points wins.

Cooperative mode

The participant has to put together a sentence or phrase of at least 20 words, to start the story using the corresponding word according to the order of the chosen number. The turns change approximately every 15 seconds (or with phrases or sentences of at least 20 words).

The goal is to continue the story cooperatively until the card with Mr. Casciari's face appears. When the letter with Mr. Casciari's face appears, whoever is in turn telling the story must give an epic ending to the story.

The team wins the game if a satisfactory ending is achieved. If at any point during the narration, someone says "I don't know", the team is defeated by the game.

name: Piano Piano
description:
In Piano Piano, each player chooses a color and fights to be the first to reach the opposite end of the board. Ready for action?"

Movements:
On your turn, you roll the die and move forward or backward on the sticks of your color. But there's more: you can change the color token, turn the sticks, and even move the opponent's token!

Victory conditions:
The winner is whoever reaches the other end of the board first.

name: Numbsters: Infinity
description: Numbsters: Infinity is a brand new 2-card expansion for Numbsters. It introduces the Infinity card which keeps the game going, and an alternate 8-card that is a Numbster and not a mouth!

name: Lords of Worlds
description:
"Ok what am I missing from my grocery list?
A couple of mountains? Check.
Lake? Check.
Magical tree? Got it.
Mix of deserts and hills? Check.
Lowlands? Oh shoot, I am missing the lowlands! There they are!"
Put on the robes of a deity... and go grocery shopping?

In Lords of Worlds, 2 to 4 players compete to create the most valuable world by purchasing various types of terrain tiles and adding them to their personal planet.
Hire various assistants and utilize them wisely to secure optimal deals, then follow the instructions of your architects to ensure the construction of a gorgeous land!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Movement Points, Set Collection

name: TriCore
description:
TriCore is an abstract strategy game for 2 players of at least 8 years of age, with an average playing time of 25 minutes. A player wins when at the end of the game he/she has more 'Cores' connected to a single group than his/her opponent. The game is played on an elongated hexagonal board consisting of 51 points, and in order to play the game players will need the following:

3 Blue rings (players can replace Rings with Pawns or any other token of blue colour)
3 Red discs – representing the ‘’Cores’’
24 White discs
24 Black discs


—description from the designer

name: Skulls of Sedlec: Archers
description: Archers were once impressive athletes and dangerous warriors. In death, they still seek to hit their chosen Targets. The further the distance, the more prestigious the shot – and the higher the score.

name: Tropicalia
description:
Even this morning, the sky is clear and the sun is high over Tropicalia Island. It is time to collect mangoes, sugar apples and coconuts and to sell them at the various markets: your little island won't build itself!

In this 2 to 4 players game, you and your opponents will send your workers to the different tiles that make up the ever-changing island of Tropicalia to collect and sell fruit. Then, you will use your earnings to purchase various elements, such as buildings and events, to add to your personal board, which will grant you bonuses and points.
At the end of the game, whoever has the most valuable island wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Marvel Fluxx: Card Pack
description:
7 card Marvel fluxx expansion Card pack.
Included are 3 keepers (Miles, Morales, Nick Fury, and Phil Coulson) plus 4 new goals (Avengers assemble!, Agents od S.H.I.E.L.D., Captain America's biggest fan, and Spider-verse)

name: Gospel Grove
description:
The fruits of the Spirit are often sung about and even memorized, but the application is rarely talked about. What does it mean to have the fruit of faithfulness or gentleness, and how can we use those fruits to impact our community

In Gospel Grove, players will take on the role of fruit farmers producing fruit for friends in their community. Turns are quick and simple. Do you need more fruit? Ask the gracious giver. He will happily give you anything you need. Have your seeds not produced any fruit? Go work the ground. Now that you have fully grown fruit, what will you do with it? Place it in your roadside fruit stand so all your friends in the community can freely take from the fruit. Every fruit a player gives away to a member of the community scores points. The player with the most points is the winner.

name: Ordered
description:
In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth, but it's even more amazing than it sounds. God took the chaos of nothingness and organized it into something beautiful. He made outer space full of potential and filled it with planets and stars. He made the ocean and sky full of potential and filled them with birds and fish. He made the land full of potential and filled it with you and me. He made the whole universe full of potential and blessed us with the ability to fill it with beautiful things.

In Ordered, everyone works together to bring order to the chaos. As a team, everyone works as fast as they can to match cards together with another teammate. After a quick hand gesture to ensure the match, the cards must be placed into their proper dwelling place—either the heavens, the waters, or the land. See how fast you and your friends can bring order to the chaos.

—description from the publisher

name: Excavación Dinosaurios Hemisferio Sur
description:
Dinosaurios Hemisferio Sur is a game in which you can carry out your own archaeological excavation.
With patience and care you can discover the dinosaurs of our region, which were the largest in the world.
You will be able to collect the fossils of different dinosaurs and compare their stats and skeletons, learning common characteristics and recognizing their habits.
Dinosaurios Hemisferio Sur stimulates fine motor skills and develops imagination and learning.

—description from the designer

Dinosaurios Hemisferio Sur es un juego en el que podés realizar tu propia excavación arqueológica.
Con paciencia y cuidado podés descubrir los dinosaurios de nuestra región, que fueron los más grandes del mundo.
Podrás coleccionar los fósiles de los diferentes dinosaurios y comparar sus fichas y esqueletos, vas a descubrir características comunes y a aprender a reconocer sus hábitos a partir de su aspecto.
Dinosaurios Hemisferio Sur estimula la motricidad fina, desarrolla la imaginación y el aprendizaje.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Exploration, Prehistoric
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Jumanji Fluxx: Bonus Pack
description:
Looney labs Fluxx Jumanji Bonus pack.
This 7 card expansion pack for Jumanji Fluxx adds two keepers( Zebras and crocodiles), two goals (Stripes and Dangerous Reptiles), plus three new Danger cards (Croc Attack!, Trampled by Zebras!, and Deadly Venom)

name: Tramways: Crisis/Los Angeles
description:
This is the newest Tramways's expansion. 2 new maps for Veteran players with 5 Yellow bus meeples!

Crisis: This map takes place in Axia, the city of the boardgame Crisis. No Leisure, no Commerces... tough map...

Los Angeles: This is the first expansion that includes new wooden component. And only the only expansion that allows you to discard Negative Cards !

name: Hunter's Crest: Darkwood
description:
Hunter's Crest - Darkwood is a 1-4 player cooperative campaign board game set in the mystical and treacherous forests of Darkwood, where players become hunters using cunning, strategy, and strength to capture or slay the enchanted wildlife that roams under the light of the full moon. It’s a choice-driven, narrative-rich experience played over multiple sessions, blending elements of strategy, adventure, and survival into a unique board gaming experience.

In Hunter's Crest - Darkwood, players are thrust into a fantastical world where each full moon brings about the resurrection of the wildlife with the "Kill Memory System," a groundbreaking mechanic where animals not only come back to life but remember previous encounters with hunters, adapting and becoming more cunning with each cycle. This feature ensures a dynamic gameplay experience, challenging players to evolve their strategies and adapt to the ever-changing behaviors of their prey.

Players start their journey at the Eden Lodge, a hub for hunters to prepare for their expeditions into the woods, boast about their conquests, and trade valuable resources and animal parts harvested during the hunt. Here, hunters can upgrade their equipment, purchase new grappling hooks for strategic navigation during hunts, and prepare for the challenges that lie in the shadowy depths of Darkwood.

The game unfolds through a series of hunts, each presenting unique challenges and opportunities. Utilizing the innovative Grappling Hook System, players can traverse difficult terrain, escape impending danger, or engage in thrilling combat with beasts. Success in the hunt requires teamwork, strategic planning, and the ability to think on one's feet.

As the campaign progresses, the decisions made by players at the Eden Lodge and during hunts have lasting effects on the world and the narrative, shaping the future of Darkwood and the hunters' quest within it. Players must manage their resources carefully, develop their lodge, and strengthen alliances to ensure their survival against the dark forces that lurk in the forest.

Hunter's Crest - Darkwood is not just a game of hunt and battle; it's a saga of survival, strategy, and the bonds formed in the face of the unknown. With multiple paths to victory and countless ways to fail, the fate of Darkwood and its hunters hangs in the balance. Will you rise to the challenge and carve your name into the legends of the forest, or will the woods claim you as another forgotten soul? The hunt begins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Prima Zoom: By a flight of the world
description:
Do you like to travel and are interested in the world from all sides? Prima Zoom - by a flight of the world is a separately playable sequel, which you can safely connect with the original game Prima Zoom - get to know the world close up.

The game offers 4 new themes of cards that will take you to a colorful underwater world, mysterious places, show you a varied range of habits and cultural attractions or breathtaking wonders of nature.

In the Prima Zoom quiz game, all players answer questions at the same time, so no one really gets bored.

Prima zoom - flight through the world includes: 160 double -sided cards, 1 hourglass, 1 block of scoring tables, 6 pencils, 6 magnifiers.

name: Bambam Boom
description:
In BamBam Boom, there are 3 kind of Bombs, Blue, Green and Yellow bombs. If a player is blown up by all three different color Bombs, he/she loses the game. The Red 4th bomb is wild, it can be any of the three colors.

The Bomb Cards has a color and a number. The 4 colors, Blue, Green, Yellow and Red corresponds to the four bombs. When played, the color indicates which bomb is activated. That bomb dials increases as many as the card’s number, and it moves clockwise to next player that many steps.

As long as the bomb dials is under 10, everything is fine. Once the dials reaches 10, the bomb is active and the lucky player who has that bomb in front of him/her gets Kaboomed!

The game ends when a player is eliminated. The Winner is the one that deals the last damage to that eliminated player!
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Hot Potato, Kill Steal, Player Elimination, Single Loser Game, Sudden Death Ending, Take That

name: Bambam Cooking Class
description:
BamBam Cooking Class is yet another member of the well-known genre of set collection board games.

What sets it apart from the other competitors is that, when you complete your set and are about to claim the prize, other player(s) may challenge you to a set collection duel!

May the best set collection (through poker tricks) win ...

name: La poética del Té
description:
It brings together a selection of verses about tea written by poets from different latitudes and extracted from the Diario de té blog. It also explores, as a game, theomancy or reading tea leaves and asks questions intended to be answered through writing. Finally, it includes cards with different types of tea in threads and their descriptions to invite those who want to taste them to enter the world of infusions.

The deck is made up of 50 cards and can be divided into 4 series:

Selection of verses about tea (15)
Theomancy: Reading tea leaves (15)
Questions to answer through writing (10)
Types of tea. Preparation and some characteristics (10).


Game modes

Writing and Tea

Immerse yourself in tea times and let the written word flow and manifest. They say that the tea ceremony is a “meditation in motion.” Writing is too. We leave at hand two possible combinations of cards that will serve as inspiration when you pause, have a tea and get ready to write:


Take a verse and a question. From both letters, write a poem.
Extract a tea card and a question. Write from that scenario.


Tea Oracle

Ask a question and answer it with a verse and a letter from the Theomancy series. Take into account the list of symbols and their meanings. Ideally the question should be open, not seeking a univocal, exact or literal answer.

Tea ceremony

Experiencing new flavors in the world of tea. Choose a type of infusion, prepare it and savor it. Then, write a text, record ideas or sensations based on what you experienced. In the deck we share a selection of teas that can be easily found in Argentina. There are many more. Other varieties may be included and new combinations may be made.

Read the tea leaves

Prepare tea in threads and practice theomancy based on the meanings offered by reading its leaves (see selection of cards).

To serve the tea we suggest using a white cup. Once the infusion has been drunk, drain all the remaining liquor, covering the cup with a saucer. Move the grounds three times counterclockwise, turn the cup so that the handle is facing the consultant and prepare to read.

name: Casting de personajes
description:
The work will premiere in six months and will be written by an important Spanish-speaking author. The preselection will be in charge of a prestigious jury taking into account the following acting skills: Creativity, improvisation, artistic path, risk quota and expressiveness. Those who are interested in the proposal must appear at the casting with comfortable clothing and a “letter” of recommendation.

Game modes

Casting (2-4 players)

The objective is to obtain all the cards. In this mode the artistic skills of the characters compete. The deck is distributed among the participants. Each one must stack them face down on the table. The player in turn takes the first of his cards, chooses the ability that he considers with the best chance of winning when compared to that of other characters and sings its value out loud. Then each participant says theirs. Whoever has the highest score on that item takes the cards in play, places them under their pile, and continues the round with a new card. If there are equal scores, the tie must be broken by putting a new card into play each. The casting ends when one player manages to gather all the characters.

Quintet (3 to 6 players)

The objective is to assemble groups of characters, identified by the same letter and color. The deck contains 10 quintets. All cards are distributed among the participants. The first player chooses another player in the round and asks him if he has any of the cards he needs to complete his group of 5 characters, asking for them by letter and number.

For example: Do you have D3? If he has it, he must give it to you. The player on duty can continue asking for cards until someone does not have them, then the right to ask passes to this player. Those who gather all the cards of the same quintet must lower them onto the table. Those who run out of cards during the game, whether or not they have formed groups, must wait until the end of the game. Whoever has collected the most quintets wins.

Let's do it! (2 to 10 players)

This proposal invites us to be the authors of the story. Do you dare?

First you have to do a casting and choose the characters for the play. For this, 5 cards will be distributed to each participant. Taking turns, they will take one of the cards, choose the skill they consider most relevant and say its value out loud. The character with the highest value will win. This dynamic will be repeated until you obtain 5 characters.

Once the casting is completed, it is necessary to decide whether the story will be part of a film, a play or a book. You will have to give it a title and create a script if necessary. Choose the main and secondary characters and decide if the story will be mystery, humor or perhaps adventure. It is necessary to determine the scenario where the events will take place. Then you will have to start writing. It may be helpful to have a notebook or loose sheets of paper, pencils or pens on hand. Maybe listening to music will inspire you. Or maybe they were silent. You just have to open the door to your imagination and… let's get to work!

name: Jeu de Paris
description:
The Paris game is set on a metro map from 1973, when the R.E.R. did not yet run through Paris.
At the start of the game, each player draws six cards with sights that they must be the first to visit. You can move in any direction with the help of a dice. However, if you want to take a connecting train, you have to draw a lucky card, which can disrupt all your plans or those of your opponents.

name: Station to station
description:
Roll-and-move race game from the golden age of steam railroading.
Each player has a locomotive that follows their railroad line.

The game is from 1930 and was produced in England by Harold Wesley Ltd, based at Harlesden Mills, Acton Lane, London, NW 10
The game has become very rare in the decades since it was issued and can only be found occasionally (in museums and with specialized collectors).

The game board measures approx. 46 x 20.5 cm when unfolded.

—user summary

name: 18Gewohnheit Essen Seele Auf: 18Quake
description:
This first feeling of uncertainty is something I want to come back to when playing 18xx. A anxious, stressful and volitile experience. So this is me trying to invoke these feelings through the 18xx-mechanics.

Some of the biggest pointers in the game:
No safe stocks. Presidency can always be swapped when there are two players owning stocks in the company. Special EMR-rules and auctions give players the possibility to timemly sell liabilities.

Dividends from companies are split between player-owned stocks (cube rails-style). So if 1 player owns 1 stock the company pays 100% to the player.

Companies are randomized and floated in a strict order so there is a “fresh” setup every game. Furthermore there is random setup with “super powers” that are attached to the companies through the game. This creates big assymetri in the game. These are the powers:

MIT engineers
Don't pay track penalties (mountains, etc.). + 1 tracklay (can be upgrade/yellow). Passive income: 20

Jimmy White company
Permanent 2 train (take from box). Not counted as a train to train limit. Cannot operate with only this as a train and must EMR if this is the only owned train. Passive income: 10

Brown 30
Can be 100% player-owned of the same player. Doesn't count against share limit. When the company is paid for its shares it only receives 50% of the cash (rest going to the bank). All their trains get to run 1 last time and is removed after the company ends its operating round. faded trains can't be bought inter-companies. Passive income: 0

Top bank
Have curved trains (but is allowed to lay normal track lays). A train can never be run through a tile. Instead of redeeming shares:
Top bank can buy shares from other companies and is counted as a player in all instances except it is not viable as a president. Max 1/or. Top bank can never be president. The shares can be sold as standard issue (but doesn't move the share price). At the end of the game, you add these shares' value to the company.
Passive income: 30
Avant-garde architects
Can upgrade all non-chicago tiles to whatever legal track tile. Ignores usual color rules (can, for example, upgrade to gray from yellow or1). Before starting each operating round the company decides if they want to go first or last in that operating round.
Passive income: 20

Tetsuo the iron machine
Gets +50 for every train that rusts when it's this company's turn. Can buy trains anytime during their OR.
Passive income: 20

K-O & K-company aka Swedish emigrants
Teleport to a non-Chicago spot on the map. Place 1 token free and a yellow city tile (even if no city existed on the map before).
Passive income: 20

Design manifest
The game will be under constant construction but is now in the beta phase. And I want this game to be an open creation. If you have ideas then post them on the forum or discord. If your ideas are big enough we either reshape the rules och create an “official” variant. The dream is to have a collaborate design. See this rule set as beta 1.0.

To avoid pnp-ing or buying more big things, the game has been placed on the 1846 map and setup*. The reason for choosing the 1846 map is that it's one of my favorites. The race for the optimal routes occurs in competition with the others. There's technically a map and tileset, but to get started with the game itself more easily, 1846 + an a4 sheet base is used for the game. Warning/promise. This game is not a 46-clone. But the map is really excellent.

name: Cuppelup: The American Railway Game
description:
Cuppelup is a card game published in 1925.

The game consists of 64 game cards: 8 sets of cards, with 8 cards in each set; each set pertains to a different State. The cards of each set/State are numbered within the set (i.e., ##101-108, 201-208, etc.), and the first card (i.e., #101, #201, etc.) in each set is an engine, followed in order by cars that can be “attached” to the engine in the same order for each set, namely: baggage (##102, 202, etc.), day coach, tourist, diner, parlor, sleeper, and observation. Each of the 64 cards has a photograph of a specific railroad car that was manufactured at the time, and each is given a name applicable only to this card game.

For example, the set of cards numbered 101-108 pertains to the State of Minnesota. Card no. 101 is the engine, and pictured is a steam engine manufactured by Baldwin Locomotive. Within the game, this engine is given the name “Knute Nelson” (a prominent Minnesota political figure). The point is that Baldwin never made an engine that went by that name, and the name is simply one given to the engine for purposes of the game. This is true for all 64 cards. The car shown is identified by manufacturer and is historical; however, the car is then given a name which identifies it to the game only. The names given the cars within the game are necessary, because the cars are repeated from set to set. That is, the card numbered 107 in the Minnesota series (called, “Duluth”) shows the same railroad car that is shown as card 207 in the California series (called, “San Francisco”), card 307 in the Iowa series (called “Dubuque”), and so forth – a car made by Pullman. What this means is that there are actually photographs of 8 distinct railroad cars (including engine) in the game, repeated within each State set.

The cards are wide, measuring 90mm x 63mm. The maker of the cards is not known. The backs of the cards depict the “new” Union Station in Chicago – built in 1925, the same year as the game was published. The cards are accompanied by a paper insert that describes the game and how to play it.

—user summary

name: NEXUS: Unsanctioned Expansion
description:
Introducing the newest addition to the NEXUS: Arena Combat System - the Unsanctioned Expansion! Fill the arena with even more chaos as you command your helots to dismember their opponents for fame, fortune, and the adoration of the crowd in this violent, gladiatorial, sci-fi gorefest!

What's New?

Hostile Entities: Brace yourselves for the unexpected! Encounter the fierce Barge Beast and navigate the treacherous Creature Pit. These dynamic elements introduce an entirely new layer of strategy and danger, keeping every match fresh and unpredictable.
Mutations: Embrace the chaos with the Mutated State. Draw from the Mutation Deck and watch as helots undergo astonishing transformations, altering the course of battle. Adapt or die!
Helot Motivations: Four new helot types bring unique abilities and playstyles to the arena. Will you command a Bloodthirster, a Critiqueur, a People's Champion, or a Sadist? Choose your motivation and let the mayhem begin!
Hazards: Instruct your helot to navigate Toxic Waste Tiles, dodge Dart Columns, and topple Waste Barrels. These hazards increase the bout bedlam, turning the arena into a volatile battleground where danger is omnipresent!


—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Random

name: Grand Tactical Game X
description:
Inspired by Alan Arvold's website ( http://www.imaginative-strategist.layfigures.com/PDFs/Inform... ) on PanzerBlitz and Mike Nagel’s ‘Tactical Game X’, I began work on ‘Grand Tactical Game X’ (GTGx) in January, 2024. This variant & expansion game for Jim Dunnigan’s 1970 classic wargame, PanzerBlitz (Avalon Hill). Instead of 6 minute / 360 second game turns, you will now be able to play each 1 second of time as a game turn, and make each turn valuable and logical, as you use USAF Col. John Boyd’s OODA Loop combat engagement theory.

This rules & play aid set will be available for download and playing with your existing copy of PanzerBlitz. Why not give this Fast Paced (tm) variant a try?!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement, Interrupts, Multiple Maps, Track Movement, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Beginning Expedition
description:
In the year 2053, you're standing on the edge of a big adventure, looking out at a wild island. The world is a mess, but here, it's like a hidden gem waiting to be found.

Explore — that is the goal of the game. In this Print-and-Play, Roll-and-Write game, you will search the island for its habitat and wildlife. You will start from one of the camps, complete the requirements for each area then move to the next, learn new skills, and take a rest. After 2 days, whoever has the most points wins.

This game is for 1-5 players and only requires 1 page for each player. For a solo play — you will need 3 dice (1 die in a different color). For multiplayer — you will need 2 dice for each player and 1 more in a different color.
categories: Adventure, Environmental, Exploration, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Seminal Catastrophe: The Imperial World at War 1850-1920
description:
Seminal Catastrophe is a card driven game that blends diplomacy, warfare, and statecraft. Players take control of one of six unique major powers in the game: Germany/Prussia, the United Kingdom, France, Austria / Austria-Hungary, Russia and the Ottoman Empire.

SC takes place over 7 turns, with each turn representing a decade. If a GW occurs, the game can be extended by, at most, 6 additional shorter GW turns.
A turn consists of numerous player impulses, during which players play action cards for their CP or events. Players will use CP and events to colonize, conduct diplomacy, fight wars, as well as hinder their opponents.
A turn is over once all players have consecutively passed or when all players are out of cards.

Players take on the role of either Germany/ Prussia, the United Kingdom, France, Austria/Austria- Hungary, Russia, or the Ottoman Empire. Italy, should it unify, is not controlled directly by a player and instead interacts with the game using special rules.

SC was designed primarily as a 6 player game, but it can accommodate smaller player counts, including solitaire.

Players can win by fulfilling their individual National Goals and scoring Victory Points. But if the Great War occurs, the victory conditions change. In addition to this, a game can end in an Auto-Victory if a player takes control of a certain number of territorial keys.

name: Sporelings
description:
Sporelings! fairies of the forest, they have thrived on this land for a long time. Sporelings are found amongst trees and grasslands.
Day after day, they build mushroom-shaped houses, grow families, and gather mysterious mana energy from the forest for food. One day, a small group of sporelings landed on a new land that none of its kind set foot on. They are determined to turn this new land into a paradise.
This is an area control, light strategy game that allows you to lead your sporelings to expand their homeland into a new forest step by step.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Dixit Cards with Original Pocket Vinyl Paintings
description: 10 handmade cards for Dixit made by Elizabeth J Jancewicz.

name: Corre Pirata
description:
In Corre Pirata you are a little pirate, exploring the islands in search of treasure while trying to avoid the enemies.

In this children's game, each turn the child draws 2 numbered tiles, which provide 2 coordinates on the game map, where a new treasure will be placed.
These same tiles also contain information on how many steps the player will have available for their movement after placing the new treasure.
However, if one of the tiles is the "X" or if the sum of steps totals 7, instead of moving their pirate, the player will move one of the 4 enemies scattered around the map.
When a treasure is reached, it is collected by the player, granting victory points, boats or swords. Boats are used so that the player can sail between islands and swords are used to defend against enemies or steal treasures from opponents.
The game ends when one player has collected enough treasure points (depending on the number of players).
mechanics: Grid Movement, Movement Points, Square Grid

name: Zombicide: Mission C12 – Axes & Alleys
description:
Designed by players for the Kyoko mission contest, and later published by the original studio, C missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

C12 is a medium difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

Designed by LUCAS MCDANIEL

name: Zombicide: Mission C13 – Sanctuary
description:
Designed by players for the Kyoko mission contest, and later published by the original studio, C missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

C13 is a hard difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

Designed by MATT HIBBARD

name: Zombicide: Mission C14 – Do you want fries with that?
description:
Designed by players for the Kyoko mission contest, and later published by the original studio, C missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

C14 is a medium difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

Designed by JULIEN LE JEUNE

name: Zombicide: Mission C15 – Road Closed
description:
Designed by players for the Kyoko mission contest, and later published by the original studio, C missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

C15 is a medium difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

Designed by TOMA LALIADA

name: Zombicide: Mission C16 – The Zomvasion
description:
Designed by players for the Kyoko mission contest, and later published by the original studio, C missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

C16 is a hard difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

Designed by IAN SUMMERFIELD

name: Panzer Grenadier  1940: Polish Exiles
description:
Bo wolność krzyżami się mierzy

On 21 September 1939, as Polish troops continued to resist German and Soviet invaders, the Polish Army in France began to form. Polish soldiers who had escaped over the country’s neutral borders joined Poles from around the world, chiefly Polish workers resident in France.

By May 1940 the Polish Army in France numbered four divisions and two brigades, with plans for more as recruits either escaped Poland or journeyed to France from elsewhere. When the German launched their long-awaited offensive, the Poles fought them, maintaining stout resistance even as the French Army crumbled around them.

1940: Polish Exiles is a Panzer Grenadier Campaign study by Philippe Léonard that’s based on the heroic battles waged by these Polish exiles, with 15 new scenarios. You’ll need The Deluge (or White Eagles), 1940: The Fall of France and 1940: Swallows of Death to play all of the scenarios.

—description from the publisher
Updated description 2024May11
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Backpack Panda
description:
'Backpack Panda' is a strategic deduction board game designed for 4-8 players where deception is key in the battle between the Light Panda and Dark Panda factions.

Roles are secretly assigned to each player at the beginning of the game setting the stage for intense bluffing and alliances as players aim to trade resources. The player who successfully collects the target resources for their faction secures victory.

As a Dark Panda, earn the trust of your opponents while subtly collecting dark resources, secretly infect another player and survive until the end of the 6 rounds.

As a Light Panda, collect light resources while forging trusted alliances to withstand potential betrayals from the Dark Panda faction and unleash the power of bamboo elements to eliminate your enemies.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Bluffing, Deduction, Party Game
mechanics: Advantage Token, Alliances, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination

name: Famous: Stage I
description:
You are a dreamer - with a fire in your heart and a melody in your head. Posters obscure your bedroom walls, and vinyl records cover the floor. But you have a plan to complement that dream. With the local studio booked a mere 12 weeks from now, you’ll have to hustle...

'Famous: Stage I' is a guitar-pedal-board of both tried-and-true and novel modern board game mechanics that sing behind a theme-first quest into home-town garage-band adventure! Spend your precious few hours each week to:

- Recruit the perfect musicians for your band
- Improve your talents on multiple tracks
- Convert curious crowds into die-hard fans
- Qualify for and book renowned venues
- Grab the right gear for your personal goals
- Buy and sell quirky merchandise for a profit
- Write and record your best songs
- Rehearse for the studio finale
- Hire services for permanent perks
- Assemble a Street Team of volunteers
- Prepare for prestigious contests
- Uncover unexpected opportunities
- Manage through random events
- Build up an eager audience before each gig
- Score the most Fame to become Famous !
mechanics: Action Timer, Action/Event, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Finale Ending, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Set Collection, Simulation, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Eat Putin!
description: Players choose a team of time-traveling dinosaur assassins, getting a deck of cards that determines movement on a 13x13 board illustrated to look like a city being destroyed by a time paradox. Putin is an n.p.c. with its own deck of movement cards. Each turn a player draws a card to move their three dinosaurs, trying to capture Putin and save the time continuum. First person to do so wins.

name: Pick Your Pic!
description:
Dive into a world of laughter as you search your phone's pics for the perfect match to the chosen adjective and noun cards.
Be the Judge, choose your favorite card combo, and set the 60-second timer! Can your friends find the most epic, bizarre, or downright comical image before the clock runs out?
It’s the only card game where you’re supposed to be on your phone. With a huge variety of prompts to choose from, every round is a new adventure in a convenient take-anywhere size.
Suitable for all ages or anybody with a cellphone.

name: Song Survivor
description:
Compete against friends in a song-themed contest! Sing, quote, or mimic your way to victory by connecting songs to the round's chosen word.
TWO EXCITING GAME MODES: Whether you're belting out tunes or surviving the musical face-off, Song Survivor offers versatile gameplay for all ages. Decide the group's skill level then the Judge draws a card. Players battle to either outperform or outlast each other each round.
Suitable for all ages or anybody who listens to music. It’s perfect for road trips, your next game night, or karaoke challenge.

name: Thuis Quizspel
description:
Ontdek het bordspel over de wereld van Thuis. Antwoord op vragen en kom meer te weten over de personages en gebeurtenissen uit de TV-serie. Het perfecte bordspel om tijd door te brengen en plezier te hebben met vrienden en familie.

Discover the board game about the world of the Flemmish tv show Thuis. Answer questions and learn more about the characters and events from the TV series. The perfect board game to spend time and have fun with friends and family.

name: Feral State Chapter 3
description:
Feral State Chapter 3 is the final chapter in the Feral State Saga. In this new chapter our heroes meet a companion and together they are looting the streets of a post-apocalyptic city! Will they make a good team or perish under the pressure of zombie hordes? Would you trust a newcomer, or is it better to be cautious?

If you own the first two games already, you can play with the third one with a "Campaign mode" add-on! You'll be able to experience the whole story all over, parts 1 to 3, with progression, skills and other new features!

Again your mission is to reach the final boss and eliminate him and the Zombies all over the postapocalyptic town. On your way you will fight zombies using unique battle system, which involves both luck and skill.

Feral State Ch. 3 is a PnP dice game. You roll a D6 to attack and the choose which body part you want to hit on a "pizza wheel", where you can choose the rolled number or the opposite side of the "pizza wheel" and do damage to.

name: Små Trädgårdsmästare
description:
When spring breaks out, the cutest little gardeners you have even seen wakes up – Bianca the bee, Fitz the fly, Sophia the butterfly, Nikki the ladybird and Sami the dragonfly.

The game contains two ways of playing.

In variant 1 (from 7 years), you and your friends gather on the meadow to bet on and watch the little insects having a race. On your turn you will play cards to move one insect forward and watch the chain effects being triggered if it lands on a rocket token, which triggers the movement of another insect, that might trigger the movement of a third insect etc. In the end, you will receive points based on how well the insects you placed your bet on performed in the race.

In variant 2 (from 5 years), you will play as one of the insects and take on the task of pollinating some of the flowers in the meadow. Try to remember where the species you have chosen are placed to avoid flying in vain. The first insect to have pollinated all flowers of its chosen species win the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Race

name: Citizens of the Spark
description:
The fate of creatures touched by the spark of intelligence hangs in the balance. You must recruit strong animal allies to your city and unlock the potential of your citizens if your settlement is to survive the days to come...

Citizens of the Spark is a variable set-up card game in which players take turns attracting citizens, taking actions, and claiming sparks. The more citizen cards a player has of a specific type, the more powerful that citizen's action becomes. The player with the most sparks in their city when the deck runs out wins!

Play with 7-10 animal citizen types per game, chosen from 30 available creatures and combined into one shared deck. Every citizen type has distinct powers, making each game's action combos uniquely variable.

On your turn, recruit multiple citizens by selecting an available group of cards, placing them in your city tableau, and grouping like citizens together to grow their action strength. Next, select one type of citizen in your tableau to activate, taking the effect of the card and discarding it from your city. But keep watch on rival cities, because when you activate a citizen, all players can follow your move and activate a matching citizen of their own!

Citizens of the Spark is great for fans of games like Dominion, SmashUp, Everdell, and Wingspan. You'll find endless clever card combos, gorgeous anthropomorphic animal art, and no down-time between turns.
mechanics: Layering, Melding and Splaying, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: Black Spirits: Remnants
description:
Black Spirits: Remnants is a is an expansion for the popular Black Spirits: Combat Cards game system, a supplement that replaces dice components in board games based on extremely popular dark fantasy action RPG video games that test the mettle of players' souls to use cards for their combat systems rather than dice. It expands on the philosophy of that set by introducing enhancements that add depth to your board game, with a goal focused on maximum value per dollar. It provides the same type of gameplay depth and similar design goals as Black Spirits: Wayward and Weathered, the sprawling expansion to Combat Cards, but in a package half the size. The two sets can be played separately, but they also intertwine, so having both expansions becomes greater than the sum of each.

As with the Black Spirits: Combat Cards core set, Black Spirits: Wayward and Weathered is drop-in with no modifications, house rules, or tweaks necessary to the board game played. It's built with the latest sets of those board games in mind, but is also compatible with earlier versions of those games, so you can inject new life (or of course, death) into your already-owned games regardless of what your collection looks like.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Build & Destroy: Expansion 1 – Innovations of War
description:
Introduces new strategies involving electricity, remote bases, storage options and additional defenses, adding layers of complexity and intrigue to the battlefield.

—description from the designer

name: Revamp: the haunted mansion
description:
Revamp is a competitive dice allocating game for 2 to 4 players. The players are owners of a mansion. They want to make it into a haunted mansion and therefore must revamp the place. The cards that are placed on the player board, form the haunted mansion.

Goal of the Game
The players need to create the most successful haunted mansion. This is a haunted mansion that creates as much fear as possible amongst the visitors. To achieve this, the owners are hunting for the most scary props, creatures and interior to satisfy (read: scare) their visitors.

End of the game
The game ends when a player has all the 9 attraction spots covered in their haunted mansion. The player who collected the most fear points at the end of the end scoring, wins the game.
This dice allocating game is interactive and fun!

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Collectible Components, Dice, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Action Points, Automatic Resource Growth, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Different Dice Movement, Drawing, Hand Management, Income, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Market, Matching, Moving Multiple Units, Multi-Use Cards, Pattern Building, Pattern Movement, Programmed Movement, Re-rolling and Locking, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Take That, Turn Order: Pass Order, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Build & Destroy: Expansion 2 – Uncharted Waters
description:
Takes the adventure beyond known realms, introducing boats for added strategic depth. Players can now explore uncharted territories both on land and sea, unlocking new possibilities for expansion and domination.

—description from the designer

name: Build & Destroy: Expansion 3 – B75 Intellectus Unleashed
description:
Introduces a non-human player, enabling solo play against one or more non-human opponents. Face challenges that test your strategic prowess in the face of artificial intelligence.

—description from the designer

name: Build & Destroy: Expansion 4 – Fresh Blood
description:
Unleash the next level of strategic warfare with the Build & Destroy – Expansion 4: Fresh Blood – the pinnacle expansion for seasoned tacticians and ardent enthusiasts alike.


Elevate Your Gameplay:


Command with authority as you explore the intricate strategies introduced by the Fresh Blood expansion. Elevate your gaming experience, whether you’re facing off against friends or competing in high-stakes tournaments.


Expand Player Count to 6:


Elevate your gaming nights by expanding the player count from 4 to 6, introducing more friends into the strategic battlefield. Fresh Blood unlocks new possibilities for larger and more dynamic clashes.

—description from the designer

name: Bandekrigen Spillet
description:
A game about dominating the Copenhagen crime scene.
Monopoly-style, you move around on the board, buying areas. If you land on someone else's area, you pay rent to them.

In the game, you play as either Rockerne, Nørrebro, Politiet, or Christiania. If you go bankrupt by not being able to pay another player, you lose the game, but you are not out. Instead you will be working for the other player.
The game ends when two players have lost. If they have been taken over by the same player, that player wins. Otherwise, the two remaining players compare money and the richest wins.
mechanics: Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 18 Parceks
description: 18 Parceks is a trick-taking space race, where the tricks give you resources instead of points. After trick phase you use those resources to move your space ship on a modular space track bulit with cards. Players may also attack other players and make pit stops on space stations, where they can buy upgrade cards to their ships. These upgrades include better weapons, engines, shields etc.

name: SAS: Rogue Regiment – Hot Dogs
description: This expansion for SAS Rogue Regiment introduces new rules, a new mission and an all-new event deck to your game of Stealth And Shooting. Take out all new enemies including attack dogs, flamethrowers and a fuel truck. You’ll even get the chance to blow up a ‘Seehund’ submarine…BOOM!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Wargame, World War II

name: K9 Quest
description:
Dropped into the frozen wilderness, you are given a mere month to acquire both the supplies and the skills to propel a rag-tag group of dogs into a dependable team capable of enduring the most challenging terrain and weather conditions imaginable.

With the dogs and your own iron will as your sole companions, you must use everything at your disposal to navigate the trail to victory. The reward of advancing however, must always be balanced with the weather, the terrain and the health of the dogs.

When darkness approaches, do you set up camp to regain your strength or do you press the advantage and risk injury? When the winds roar and the snow blinds your path, do you hunker down or blindly inch your way forward to where the next checkpoint ought to be?

In K9 Quest, calculated foresight is critical to avoiding defeat. Blind ambition however, is needed for ultimate victory.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Dilema
description:
How well do they know you? How well do you know others?

Get to know your friends or family deeply by seeing what they would do in unpredictable, strange, interesting or funny situations.

Dilema is a game of deduction. The winner is the one who correctly predicts what the other players' answers to dilemmas, opinions and confessions are.

A board game of fun while you deepen the connection of your relationships and train your emotional intelligence.

name: Personal Preference: Expansion Pack Set
description: Card set for three additional categories for Personal Preference: Concepts + Ideas, Art + Photography, and Quotes + Sayings.

name: Plan Ferpecto: Promo Cards
description:
This pack of promo cards was published for Ludifest in Santiago on the 15th and 16th of April, 2023.

It contains 16 item cards, contributed by 16 people from the Chilean games industry (designers, publishers and influencers):

Jimena Aros
Maureen Berho
Gloria Cárdenas
Naty Casten
La Profe Lu Estrella
Ketty Galleguillos
Estefi Leiva
Mapa
Laura Mena
Joselyne Millán
Miila Parra
Margarita Pino
Adriana Rubio
Mafe Santander
Daniela Valentini
Ximena Vilches

Due to an error, the cards were printed in the the wrong format (too large). They cannot easily be shuffled into the deck, but can be placed within the card matrix.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Tridecco
description:
This is a 3-4 player competitive strategy tile game. The object of the game is to get rid of your pieces first. The board consists of 13-sided Einstein shapes. On a turn, a player can play one piece. If playing the piece forms a hexagon, the player can move again.

The game board is a continuous Einstein shape map of 13-sided shapes (Tridecagons). The pieces have two different colors and each player has a unique combination of two colors. It's easier to connect with other players' pieces to form hexagons, so one cannot simply build off of their own piece.

The game rules are very simple. The challenge of this game is grasping shape geometries, and getting a spatial recognition of how the shape work and connect. This can take some getting use to. The game really challenges ones' ability to visualize geometry.

—description from the designer

name: Football: The Board Game – Five-a-Side
description:
Welcome to Football: Five-a-side!

Get ready to experience the thrill of football in this fast-paced board game that captures the essence of the beautiful game in just 20 to 50 minutes. With six iconic teams—Barcelona, Madrid, Paris, Manchester, London, and Munich—compete head-to-head in intense, strategic matches.

Inside the box, you'll find everything you need to dive into the action-packed world of football. Unleash your team's potential with 12 player cards for each side, carefully crafted to feature 1 goalkeepers, 4 defenders, 3 midfielders, and 4 attackers. Customize your team's strengths with 10 training tokens—5 for attacking prowess and 5 for defensive mastery—to give your players the edge they need to dominate the pitch.

The game includes three dynamic football pitches that set the stage for thrilling showdowns. Roll the dice to determine the outcomes and make strategic decisions that will lead your team to victory.

With 72 player cards, 6 team boards, 72 player tokens, 6 penalty arrows, 30 training tokens, Football: Five-a-side offers endless possibilities for tactical gameplay, ensuring every match is unique and exciting. Take charge of your favorite team, devise winning strategies, and outmaneuver your opponents to claim footballing glory!

But wait, there's more to this box than meets the eye! Unfold it to reveal the grand stage for the ultimate showdown—the football stadium for the final match between the best players. The box transforms into a vibrant and immersive stadium setting, complete with detailed graphics and design elements that bring the excitement of the final moments to life.

Gather your elite players, set the stage, and experience the pulse-pounding thrill of the final match right at your fingertips. This innovative feature elevates your gaming experience, turning the box into the heart of the action, where champions are made and unforgettable moments unfold. Immerse yourself in the atmosphere of a thrilling football final, creating memories that will last well beyond the last whistle.

Whether you're a seasoned strategist or a rookie, Football: Five-a-side promises excitement, competition, and the joy of the game. Get ready to lace up your boots and experience football in a whole new way!

—description from the publisher

name: Шалені шкарпетки (Crazy Socks)
description:
Шалені шкарпетки ("Crazy Socks") - a crazy evening is guaranteed!

Brief rules:

Divide into 2 teams (1+ players each) and place your chips on the "Start" field. Each team takes its own sock.

Each team chooses a player for the first turn. This player spins the arrow to select the item to be pulled from the sock.
Both players start the search at the same time. You can't put your hand in a sock beforehand.
The player who first draws the desired item gets one point.
After each round, return the objects back to the sock.
At the end of the round, pass the sock to another team member - now it's his turn to spin the arrow.
The first team to score 9 points wins!


—description from the publisher

name: Superclub Rivals
description:
Superclub Rivals is a highly competitive card-based take on a fierce football rivalry. Two manager play a total of 9 matches against each other with an off-season (transfer window ++) between each one. Whoever wins the final match is the champion.

The matches are quick, tactically challenging and super fun. Given that there are only 9, each one feels as crucial as a real-life local derby. The off-seasons prepare you for the next match. They are strategic, transformative and well … also super fun.

—description from the publisher

name: Slaget om Herning
description:
A Monopoly style game focused around the Danish city Herning. Buy and own local places, complete goals as your persona describes and rule Herning. Either make the other players go bankrupt or complete 3 of your goals to win the game.

Midtjyllands hovedstad har fået sit eget brætspil! Land på felter som MCH Arena, Boxen og Hingstekåring.
Brætspillet er familievenligt, og kan spilles af 2-6 personer i alle aldre. Spillet hylder og tager kærligt pis på hverdagen i Herning og tager i gennemsnit 1-2 timer at spille.

name: Monopoly Junior: Bluey
description: The classic junior version of Monopoly but featuring Bluey and her family. Play all over town with Bluey and her family! Collect dollarbucks and win! Includes Mum, Dad, Bingo, and Bluey tokens!

name: Video Club: Teen Pack
description:
This expansion pack is made up of 6 very popular genres for the childhood and adolescence of the generation of the 80's and 90's. Friendship Movies, with groups of friends going on adventures, superheroes were already popular in the 80s thanks to Tim Burton's Batman and Christopher Reeves' Superman. Time travel had as a reference one of the best movies in pop culture: Back to the Future, fantasy made our imagination fly and animated movies were our favorites when we were little.

Genres included:

Friendship (Hey you guys!)
Anime (My codename is Project 2501)
Cartoons (Hakuna Matata!)
Fantasy (You must live your story)
Superheroes (Where will he get those wonderful toys from?)
Time Travel (Where we go we don't need wheels)

—description from the designer

Este pack de expansion se compone de 6 géneros muy populares para la infancia y adolescencia de la generacion de los 80's y 90's. Peliculas de Amistad, con grupos de amigos viviendo aventuras, los superheroes ya eran populares en los 80 gracias al Batmand e Tim Burton y el Superman de Christopher Reeves, Los viajes en el tiempo tuvieron como referente una de las mejores peliculas de la cultura pop: Regreso al Futuro, la fantasia hizo volar nuestra imaginacion y las peliculas de animacion eran nuestras favoritas cuando eramos peques.

Generos incluidos:

Amistad (Hey chicos!)
Anime (Mi nombre clave es Proyecto 2501)
Dibujos Animados (¡Hakuna Matata!)
Fantasia (Debes vivir tu historia)
Superheroes (¿De donde sacará esos juguetitos?)
Viajes en el Tiempo (Allí a donde vamos no necesitamos ruedas)

—description from the designer (Spanish)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Doom Tin Crawler
description:
Doom Tin Crawler is a solo, card based crawler with dice where a heroic space marine embarks on a mission to collect precious sun shards scattered throughout the galaxy.

Along the way, they encounter hostile alien species and engage in intense battles to protect their mission. As they journey deeper into the unknown, they stumble upon barren tombs and spacecrafts, uncovering ancient secrets and technologies that could change the course of their mission. They must overcome the challenges that lie ahead and complete their quest before time runs out.

Set up your mission cards and complete the objectives needed! Flip over the top card of the Doom deck to get started. What will you encounter? When you explore, draw one card at a time. Flip the card face up and set it next to the deck. Read the text to see what kind of encounter the card represents. Combat with aliens, cosmic events, and hazardous locations are just some of the chaos you will endure.

Can you survive all 8 missions to save the planet from DOOM!?!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: My-town
description:
マイタウン (My-town) is a game designed in Japan.

"The hometown you once knew which used to bustle with activity is not what it used to be.
The public facilities closed down and the shopping district has became deserted.
You and your fellow competitor businessfolk have decided to try revitalize your hometown
and proudly call it My Town again."

Bring life back to your hometown and make it a new bustling lively place for people to enjoy!

My-town is a 2-4 player town building area control game.
The rules in this family friendly game are easy to learn, and are suitable for families and experienced gamers.
Players roll dice and move around the board to purchase stores and facilities,
develop the residential areas, and attract more people to increase the liveliness of the town,
to restore it to glory.

The Town is divided into 4 areas, try to gain control of the areas by placing more people, houses and upgrades.
Once you have successfully developed a house in each of the 4 areas, build your landmark in one of the areas!
Declare that area as "My Town", and race around the board.
As soon as you reach "My Town", the area with your landmark you win!

「陣取りゲーム」と「すごろく」を掛け合わせた、新感覚の街づくりゲームです。街に見立てたゲームボード上を周回しながら物件を購入し、増やした資産で人を呼び込み、家を建設して住宅街を開発します。4カ所のタウンで人や家のトークンを置いたり、動かしたりしながら他プレイヤーよりも多くの賑わいをつくり、自分のランドマークを建てたマイタウンに到達できれば勝利します。
--description by publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: GALLERY OUCHI (ギャラリーおうち)

name: Switch!
description: A fast pace, simultaneous play card game. Be the first to get rid of your cards, but mind the switch! Rules change as you play, time the switch to your favor!

name: A Strange Occurrence at Crown House
description:
One moment, you are chasing a hot lead on a case. The next, you find yourself inexplicably trapped inside Crown House. It's a strange place that is boarded up from the outside and filled with things from your past. You have the familiar feeling that you have been to Crown House before, but that's about as far as you get with your memories of the place. At first, everything just seems weird and confusing. Then, you find a find a note addressed to you written by someone calling themselves 'the owner' and you begin to panic. The owner tells you that you are trapped inside Crown House indefinitely and that lives are at stake if you don't find a way to escape. You immediately think of your family and frantically begin to try and understand what you need to do to escape the confines of this weird, old mansion. Whoever is holding you hostage inside this place is definitely making it personal. How does any of this connect to the case you were investigating? Will you unravel the threads of this story and come to know the details of A Strange Occurrence at Crown House?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

name: The Unknown Passenger
description:
When you boarded the train a few days ago, you didn’t know what to expect. This was your first time on a luxury train ride, after all. The ride to your destination is scheduled to take five days, but, thus far, the opulent accommodations have made the travel more of an extravagance than a chore. On the morning of day four, however, you are awakened by a commotion in the hallway. Opening your door of your cabin, you hear the words every good detective story begins with: "There's been a murder." The victim is an anonymous gentleman who has no identification and no ticket. Who is he? How did he get on board? Why was he murdered? Will the murderer strike again? Those are the questions you must answer as you attempt to solve the mystery of The Unknown Passenger.

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

name: Вулканы Камчатки: Рискни покорить! (Volcanoes of Kamchatka: Dare to Conquer!)
description:
Welcome to Kamchatka - a land of incredible nature, ancient volcanoes, and indescribable views! The region is specially popular among travelers, ready to accept the challenge and climb numerous summits.
Collect resources, prepare your equipment, and gain experience to conquer the highest summits on Kamchatka! Set out for a journey but be careful because the weather can change drastically and your climb can turn into a dangerous adventure!

name: Da schlägt's 13!
description:
At the start of the game, each player pays a token into the till and receives a figure. The game is played with 2 dice; You advance the figure in the clockwise direction by the number rolled on both dice. Every time a player gets past the number 13, he has to pay a token into the till for the new round. Whoever gets exactly the number 13 first wins and receives the contents of the till.

The game was published in postcard size for soldiers to play in the trenches.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Bomb Em
description:
Bomb 'Em is an Australian war time target game where players aim at a two-sided target board with one side displaying ground-based targets such as tanks, airfield, troops, railway bridges and Berlin and the other side showing maritime targets such as destroyers, troopships, aircraft carrier, cruiser and battleships.

Bomb shape darts are used to play in 3 different ways:


Dropped directly from above with the target on the floor
Aimed and darts thrown similar to a conventional dart game with the target board on a wall
Lobbed from a short distance with the target board on the floor


Where the bomb darts land determines a score and the highest score after a certain number of throws is the winner.

—user summary

name: Aka Count
description:
In this visual speed game you will have to take your concentration to the limit. The players set around the board whit a note pad handy. The younger will be the thrower on the first play. Then it will rotates the thrower on each play. The person on the right of the thrower will start the timer. When the shooting voice sound, the thrower throw a random amount of tokens on the board.
The goal is to count the tokens in a limited amount of time. When the time ends, an alarm sounds and the thrower have to lift one of board edges to erase the throw.
The players take note of the amount of tokens they think there are (whether they have counted or estimated them) on the first
column of the note pad. Then the thrower counts the actual amount of tokens there were on the board. That number is written down on the second column. And on the third column they have to write down the absolute difference between the first two columns.
A game consist of 5 plays. At the end, each player will sum all the difference on their own note pad. The winner is the one whose sum is the smallest.

En este juego de rapidez visual deberás llevar tu concentración al máximo. Los jugadores se disponen alrededor del bastidor con un anotador en mano . El más joven de la mesa será el lanzador en la primera jugada. Luego rotará el lanzador en cada jugada. La persona a su derecha será la encargada de iniciar el temporizador de la app. Al oír la voz
de tiro, el lanzador tira una cantidad de fichas aleatorias al bastidor.
El objetivo es contar las fichas que hay sobre el bastidor en un tiempo limitado. Cuando se termina el tiempo disponible para contar sonará una chicharra y el lanzador elevará uno de los extremos del bastidor para borrar la jugada.
Los jugadores deben anotar la cantidad de fichas que creen que hay en juego (ya sea porque las contaron o por estimación) en
la primer columna del anotador. Luego se cuentan cuántas fichas hay sobre el bastidor. Ese numero se anota en la segunda columna, y por ultimo, en la tercera se anota la diferencia absoluta entre las dos primeras columnas.
Una partida consta de 5 jugadas. Al finalizar se deben sumar todas las diferencias de cada jugada. El ganador es quien tenga la menor suma.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Educational, Math, Number, Party Game

name: Garlandland
description:
Garlandland is a game where players arrange their own deck of seven different cards, each showing half of a garland made up of three rings of different symbols. When the cards are placed next to each other, only one of the halves of the ring connects to form a full garland. Arrange your cards, to construct poker-like melds and create the most the best set of garlands that you can make!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Melding and Splaying, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Beyond the Horizon
description:
Have you ever dreamed of exploring new planets, discovering new species and studying alien civilization? Do you have what it takes to lead a team of scientists and specialists on a daring space mission? If so, play Beyond the Horizon! It's a sci-fi strategic Roll and Write, Print and Play board game for 1-4 players with lots of interaction between them.

In Beyond the Horizon, you are the space mission commander on a spaceship orbiting at the mysterious planet Zay Delia. As soon as the most powerful corporations found out about this planet, they sent their missions towards it to explore and investigate. You are the leader of one of them, your goal is to send your science crew members to the surface, research and collect four key types of samples: flora, fauna, planetary geology and remnants of alien civilization.
