Jasmin advantage is:
Between your turns, when any amount of sheep is traded between players or the supply, place one wool from the supply on this card. This card holds a maximum of 2 wool cards. On your turn, you may activate this card to collect all held cards.

Promo card was made available as a prize at CATAN official tournaments.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: 乏月百物語 (Bougetsu Hyakumonogatari)
description:
To celebrate the summer ahead and to honor an old temple soon to be demolished, the game of Hyakumonogatari Kaidankai (A Gathering of One Hundred Supernatural Tales) will be held. Danjo, the village's figurehead, puts out the invitation. Six men and women from all walks of life gathered together in the old temple. Danjo tilts his head at this strange group. “Huh, I thought I called on five people… or did I invite six by mistake?” Danjo felt uncomfortable, like small bones were scraping against each other in his throat. He suddenly recalled urgent business that required his immediate attention, so he excused himself. He ran out of the temple gates as fast as he could. Thus, a hundred stories will be told by the remaining six people. It's time to begin.

In 乏月百物語 (Bougetsu Hyakumonogatari/100 Tales Under the New Moon), Each player becomes one of the six storytellers who have come to the old temple to join in the telling of 100 stories. The more ghost stories they hear that are to their liking, the deeper and deeper the character becomes lost in the story, and the more Ghost Story Points they will be rewarded. If, on the other hand, a ghost story is not to the storyteller's liking, the player will pull their hair out and drop out of the game.

As the number of players gradually decreases, the last remaining player becomes the Ghost in the Ghost Story and loses the game. However, this ghostly player invokes a curse when they are revealed, and any player killed by the curse also loses the game.
mechanics: Finale Ending, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: 1987: The Last War
description:
Summer of 1985, hardline members of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union who were opposed to the new reform program, take control of the country from Soviet President and General Secretary Mikhail Gorbachev.

The new leaders, faced with the economic and social crisis unleashed, decide to invade Western Europe, and for this they begin to prepare all the economic, diplomatic and military resources of the Warsaw Pact. The new political bureau has to choose between starting a war immediately or waiting to accumulate resources and troops in greater numbers, hoping that the NATO countries do not become stronger in the same way.

1987 focuses on a hypothetical but possible third worldwide large-scale military conflict. Players control land, air, and naval forces of the various sides engaged in the conflict. The scenarios provided allow players to examine multiple aspects of how a World War 3 could develop. NATO and WP are challenged to win quickly and decisively, as both forces and munitions downgraded rapidly in the face of modern combat operations.

The game is divided in a PreWar phase and a War Phase. In the PreWar phase players consume resource points to improve their military forces or their diplomatic or technological positions. During the War phase players are given a hand of cards to play out seven segments of each turn. The deck of cards forces players to constantly make decisions as they need to do a little bit of everything (move units, reinforce the armies, build resources points...) but they can only do one thing at a time. How and when players play the cards will decide to a large degree the outcome of the war.

—description from the publisher

name: Das Bonner Karussell
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach space 100 wins the game.

The game was published as a campaign tool for the German federal election in 1972.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Avatar: The Last Airbender – Aang's Destiny
description:
Experience the epic story-telling of Avatar: The Last Airbender in this easy-to-learn Deck Building Game.

Players will take on the heroic role of Aang and his allies and play cooperatively to defeat adversaries, complete objectives, and make their way through the Four Nations to restore balance to the world and fulfill Aang's destiny as the Avatar.


Play Cooperatively as your favorite heroes.
7 Boxes of Unlockable Story and Increasingly challenging game content.
Use Deck-Building to Master bending, Recruit Allies, and gather items!


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000: Darktide – The Card Game
description:
The dark and gritty action of Warhammer 40,000: Darktide slips from the screen to the tabletop in a new card game by Cubicle 7 – publishers of tabletop RPG Imperium Maledictum and more. Darktide: The Card Game is a fast and deadly cooperative caper for one to four players, battling hordes of Chaos-warped monsters and traitorous Guardsmen across six missions decreed by their merciless Inquisitor.

The set includes over 260 cards, six player boards, and all the rules and tokens you need to play out missions packed with nerve-wracking decisions – after all, you’re merely Rejects, and the mission must succeed at any cost. If you’re up for a shorter experience, you can also tackle the terrors of Hive Tertium in solo and single mission game modes.

—description from the publisher

name: SAS: Rogue Regiment – KS Set
description:
This set includes a 36 card event deck, and 3 punch boards of tokens including new vehicles and other tokens AND the new operative: Henri. These items were unlocked as part of the 2023 Kickstarter campaign and are also included in the Black Box edition.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Wargame, World War II

name: Parkour Rush: Roll and Write
description:
Parkour competitions, which are characterized by the use of urban environments as obstacle courses, require participants to complete complex courses by running, climbing, jumping, and other techniques to overcome obstacles.

To take part in the competition, you will need 10d6 dice and a copy of the game.

Play as an urban traceur and engage in epic stunts with your friends or in solo mode! You face 80 challenges in 100 pages and have to add up all the points scored at the end. Each challenge consists of three parts: the name of the parkour trick, instructions, and an example of how to perform the trick.

—description from the designer

name: Tromi
description: Tromi is an abstract flip & write for 1 to 4 where players fill a grid with trominoes based on their own viewpoint of a shared card. Each turn a card is drawn which assigns each player one of four symbols (the symbol closest to them). The card also shows four trominoes (shapes made up of 3 squares) in each of the four symbols. Each player, looking at the card from their own point of view, must draw their symbol's tromino along with at least one other tromino to their player sheet, without rotating or separating the trominoes. When a player cannot place their trominoes, the other players finish their turn and the game ends. Players score points for the longest string of trominoes in each symbol, and lose points for the largest empty area on their sheet. Player are also aided by three 1-time actions they can take once a game. These are: Rotate their chosen trominoes, Ignore their assigned tromino, and Play one tromino only.

name: Deromateria
description:
A quick, fully self-contained card battler game.
The game comes with 20 "Thing Cards", which are drafted out to each player until each player has 10. Each has an attack and defense stat, as well as an effect.
The players then shuffle their decks and set their life to 20.
On their turn, up to 3 cards on their 3 spaces. Then, choose opponent spaces to attack. If the opposing center space is empty, their life is directly attacked. First to reduce the opponent's life to 0 wins.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Open Drafting

name: Dungeons & Dragons Chainmail: The Ghostwind Campaign
description:
The Might of Stratis Lies within Your Grasp. Legend and rumor have driven a handful of warlords to the Ghostwind Plateau. There, they will battle tirelessly to gain the powers and abilities they need to seize Bonebreak, the first weapon ever wielded by the God of War. The material in this book includes:

A complete campaign system that allows warlords to gain levels and win magic items while battling through an epic story.
Access to 3rd-level spells, including classic D&D spells, such as fireball and searing light.
Fourteen new scenarios that offer fresh challenges to battle-tested players.

You must choose your allies and devise your strategies well. Only a warlord who commands a truly formidable warband will survive Ghostwind and take the first step on the path to godhood.

To use this accessory, you also need the official Chainmail miniatures game rulebook, the Blood and Darkness guidebook, and the Fire & Ice guidebook.

—description from the back of the box

name: Dungeons & Dragons Chainmail: Core Rulebook
description:
There were seven main books for the Chainmail Miniatures Game:

Chainmail Miniatures Game sourcebooks
Product # Title Year
88339 Starter Set: Rulebook & Model Description Booklet 2001
88000 Core Rulebook 2002
88010 Blood and Darkness - Set 2 Guidebook 2002
88580 Fire and Ice - Set 3 Guidebook 2002
88960 Shadow of the Drow - Set 4 Guidebook 2003
17861 The Ghostwind Campaign 2002
17620 Dragons' Flight cancelled

At the very end of the product line, the Core Rulebook (2002) was released for digital purchase, for a brief period—not to be confused with the Starter Set: Rulebook. It included all the newer rules and clarifications made in previous books. It was released in September 2002 after the line had been cancelled in August.

name: Dungeons & Dragons Chainmail: Blood & Darkness
description:
As the god of war died, his blood fell from the sky and burned through the earth into the lost caverns beneath. Bold warbands willing to brave the perils of this ancient place have found the remains of a mighty civilization.

And something even greater. The blood of Stratis still burns hot in the deep earth. Those strong enough to claim it fight with his fury on their battlefield.

Every faction has come here to claim this lost power, bolstered by new forces. The Crazed Minotaur Cultist, the Ogre Delver, the Pulverizer, the Stonechild and more, all fight to possess that which was lost.

If you are to succeed in the unending darkness, you must perfect new tactics. This guidebook will begin your training. Master it, and be victorious.
Time to throw down.
Underground.

—description from the back of the book

name: Dungeons & Dragons Chainmail: Fire & Ice
description:
Great Power Lies Amid the Bones of Dragons. Ages ago, great legions of dragons battled in the skies above the Plain of Edora. Their skeletal remains cover the ground now known as Scalebane. Brave warbands have converged on the draconic graveyard, seeking powerful magic and formidable allies. The material in this book includes:

New recruits, such as the Gallowsgaunt, Ice Paraelemental, and Half-Dragon Mage.
Two new terrain cards - the dragon claw and the dragon skull.
Rules for using the Set 3 models and statistics for all the one from Set 2.

If you're to survive the day in Scalebane, you must adapt your warband. This guidebook will give you the tools you need. Master their use, and you will emerge victorious.

—description from the back of the book

name: Dungeons & Dragons Chainmail: Shadow of the Drow
description:
Deep beneath the surface of the Sundered Empire, warbands clash upon magical battlefields. As the exiled House of Kilsek enters the fray, every faction seeks out new allies, abilities, strategies, and spells.

The material in this book includes:

New recruits, such as the Drow Wizard, Werebear Trooper, Zombie Minotaur, and Drider Trooper.
New scenarios, such as the Cave of Pain, as well as new special abilities and spells, including Veil of Shadows, Displacement, and hold person.
Rules for using set 4 Models and statistics for all models from Set 3.

If you're to survive the day, your warband must bolster its forces and devise new strategies. This guidebook will give you the tools you need. Master their use and you will emerge victorious.

—description from the back of the book

name: Elements
description:
Elements is a spell-slinging card game for 2-8 players. Players can either win by reaching 20 gems or by being the last one standing. Players start the game with 20 life and 0 gems and cast spells of the four Element types.

Fire spells deal damage, water spells restore health, gem spells craft gems, and electric spells counter other spells. Spells have a power and a target. The power is the size of the spell's effect and the target is who is affected.

Spells of the same Element type can be combined to produce a spell that has the power of the combined spells and one of the targets of the original spells (chosen by the caster). A spell can be overpowered by a more powerful spell of the same Element type, which also counters the less powerful spell.

Game play uses a simple draft system: players are dealt 4 cards and keep 2 and pass 2. Players take turns (clockwise) casting one spell or passing the turn without casting. Rounds end when every player passes without playing a spell. Between rounds, players can purchase a Greatspell for 8 gems, which is a powerful spell that can only be purchased once per game (per player).

—description from the designer

name: SAS: Rogue Regiment – They Who Dare
description:
An expansion for SAS Rogue Regiment that adds the SOE agent, Nancy and a whole new way to play the game as a result. The set includes a new event deck, support SAS operatives, aircraft and AAC guns. Games can also increase from 9 to 12 boards with the addition of 3 new double sided tiles.

This is a Kickstarter Exclusive expansion that also featured in the Black Box edition of SAS Rogue Regiment.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Wargame, World War II

name: Soul-biting
description:
Soul-biting is a one-of-a-kind journey. It is an engaging adventure, in which your choices will decide the destiny and the shape of the story. It is a mix of mazes to explore, games to solve, and key decisions to take in a mysterious dream world.

To play, you need a pencil and three six-sided dice.
By exploring the maps in the book, you can find bonuses that increase your Life Points and Skill Points, necessary to influence the results of dice rolls.
The maps and routes are interspersed with roll and write minigames, puzzles or crossroads routes.
When you encounter an enemy, roll both dice and compare the results to determine the winner of the duel: whoever gets the highest score wins. If you have special abilities, you can manipulate the dice results to your advantage. By defeating enemies, you also gain new abilities that you gradually unlock on your player card.
As you progress and find resources on your path, you unlock new parts of the main story until you complete it and discover the ending.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Book, Exploration, Maze, Print & Play, Puzzle, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Multiple Maps, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sleepy Sloths
description:
Be the first to wake all your sloths in this fun performance game.

Rise and shine! Be the first to make enough noise to get all of your sloths out of bed in this fun performance game for toddlers.

Children take turns to pick cards - they could be miaowing like a cat, barking like a dog and even making the noise of a police car or a trumpet to wake up their sloths!

If they turn over a 'Shh!' card every players sloth remains asleep. There's lots of fun to be had as other players can join in making the sound too.

Sleepy Sloths encourages sound recognition, turn taking and even being quiet! Once the game is complete the adorable sloth characters are a great way to encourage conversation from little learners.

—description from the publisher

name: The Great Food Truck Assembly
description:
Welcome to the 20th Annual Street Food Fair! Every year Food Truck vendors from all across the state arrive ready to sell delicious delights -- but none of them know where to park their vehicles. Several of the Food Trucks have asked for your help in finding the best parking spaces. But beware! There are a lot of Food Trucks to remember, and some are hidden behind other trucks. Even worse, your opponent is trying to find the best spaces for their group of Food Trucks and just might frustrate your plans.

In The Great Food Truck Assembly, each player uses their Meeples to move among the Food Truck cards arrayed in a 3 x 3 grid . This is called the Parking Lot. Using the specials of the Food Trucks, strategy, and a good memory, the players will move Food Trucks to match the locations depicted on their Parking Receipt cards. The winner is the first player to complete all of their Parking Receipt cards.

FEATURES:

UNIQUE AND STRATEGIC MEEPLE MOVEMENTS

Players can move their Meeples in 8+ different ways. Each move and, more importantly, the timing of the move is crucial to your next move and opponent’s move.

NO DOWN TIME AND HIGH REPLAYABILITY

Players interact with each move whether they made the move or it was their opponent’s move. The game is consistently changing after each move.

LOTS OF FUN IN A SMALL BOX

The Great Food Truck Assembly is very portable and requires very little playing space. With only 26 components fitting in a mint tin box, you could play this on a cutting board in the back of a food truck!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Residenz: Das Immoblien Talent
description:
Objective:
get most money within agreed time
- acting by turns -

a classical Monopoly, taking place in Vienna, Austria with all the well known activities like buying, trading..
typically 3-6 players, including banker 7

There are some differences to Monopoly or DKT:
There are no train stations.
A group of lots may consist of up to 4 lots.
You may already build houses if you own at least two lots.
mechanics: Auction: English, Dice Rolling, Events, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Murray the A**hole Frog
description:
Murray the A**hole Frog is a game of set collection and set destruction with random end triggers.

On your turn, you have full access to the cards in your hand and limited access to a common deck and a small pool of revealed cards. The card set includes insects — common flies (fruit flies, midges, houseflies, and mayflies), royal flies (fireflies, robber flies, damselflies, and dragonflies), and wasps — and Murray. Common flies are useful for building swarms and getting more cards. Royal flies and wasps are useful for building swarms and for their unique special abilities.

Your main goal is to create swarms of insects to score points while using Murray to eat your opponents' swarms. Players keep their swarms face up on the table in front of them. Higher value insects and insects of the same type form higher value swarms — but you need to be careful because when Murray eats a swarm, he leaves a tadpole behind...and tadpole points can increase very quickly!

Ultimately, your success depends on how well you build your own swarms and how well you exploit opportunities to ruin other players' swarms, not to mention how well you manage Murray. The arrival of the hawk in the second round of play sets the endgame triggers in motion.

Your objective is to maximize your score. At the end of the game, your score will be based on the swarms and tadpoles you own. The player with the highest score wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Sudden Death Ending, Take That

name: The Cauldron: Promo Pack #4 (fan expansion for Sentinels of the Multiverse)
description:
Promo Pack #4 from the unofficial fan expansion The Cauldron, intended for use with the Sentinels of the Multiverse card game by Greater Than Games, contains alternate character cards for Cauldron hero and villain decks.

These decks — which come from The Cauldron: Base Set, The Cauldron: Experimental, and The Cauldron: Adrift — are available separately and required to play.

The following cards are included in this promo pack:


1609 Drift
1789 Drift
Test Subject Halberd-26 Drift
Dragon Ranger Gargoyle
Infiltrator Gargoyle
Captain Gyrosaur
Last of the Forgotten Order Necro
Expedition Oblask Pyre
Test Subject Harbinger-1 Quicksilver
Area-51 Starlight
The Stranger in the Corn
Creed of the Sniper Tango One
Oni Titan
Tomb of Thieves Vanish
2199 Tiamat
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: The Cauldron: Unexpected (fan expansion for Sentinels of the Multiverse)
description:
The Unexpected set for the unofficial fan expansion The Cauldron, intended for use with the Sentinels of the Multiverse card game by Greater Than Games, includes new environments but no new heroes or villains.

The following decks are included in this set:

Environments:

Dungeons of Terror
Oblask Crater
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Inheritance
description:
Inheritance is a City engine building card game, set in the City of Dreams. You take on the role of a person in the city, who was randomly selected to be elevated to the very top of society. The benefactor of the city has granted you infinite wealth and influence, with the opportunity to take it all.

In Inheritance, you will play as one of 24 unique characters. You will start the game with a few resources and access to the most basic locations around you.

Explore the city to gather resources to gain influence in new locations.
Draw cards to find new locations to add to your districts. Engage with socialites and stock traders to gain influence and gamble with debt.
The benefactor will not wait around and time is limited, so make your mark quickly.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hand Management, Layering, Modular Board, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Yield
description:
The Emperor Keralon is mad. His own daughter Lemron is starting a rebellion against him. Throughout the land, Leaders of the five most powerful houses of Oshra are gathering their armies. They want to extend their realm in the power vacuum of a civil war. Will you be victorious in battle and emerge as the most powerful dynasty of Oshra? Yield is set in the world of Oshra. and its story plays out 43 years prior to the events in Hidden Leaders.

2-5 players represent Leaders of powerful houses and try to conquer (and keep!) as many fortresses over 3 game rounds or 12 player turns as possible. You do this by commanding 3 armies across a tactical map by selecting action cards from your hand. Recruit units, conquer fortresses and defeat opponents in battles.

After 3 rounds the player with the most victory points in form of controlled fortresses wins the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Deduction, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deduction, Hand Management, Moving Multiple Units, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: とらかるきつね (Torakaru Kitsune)
description:
Antique "Fox Borrows a Trick" reappears as Torakaru Kitsune by Ginga Kikaku! It is a work where animals compete for the fruits of the forest.

Torakaru Kitsune is a trick-taking game where each player plays an animal card face down, and everyone counts the numbers from one. When your animal's number is called, you reveal your animal card. The key is being able to use special effects unique to each animal upon reveal, such as brainwashing. The number on the animal indicates its strength, and the strongest animal wins the fruit with the lowest point value on the field. As the game progresses, the points become higher, so by deducing the opponent's hand, you can aim for a comeback.

name: Dinner Party
description:
You’re the hosts of a dinner party, and your guests are people of history. Convince characters like Marie Curie, Cleopatra or Gandhi to join your table, use their special abilities and treat them to drinks from the bar. Send Adolf (who came uninvited and insists his invitation “got lost in the mail”) to the table of an opponent to ruin their evening, and make sure to keep your own guests entertained so other players won’t be able to charm them away from you. Only one can have the greatest party ever when the game ends and dinner is served!

Dinner Party is a quick, dark-humoured, dice-driven party game for 2 to 6 players.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Upcake
description:
Two imposing cake towers loll upwards in front of you. To get to the top, you have to choose the dice wisely and combine them to form a two-digit number. How far will you dare to climb? Whoever lasts the longest without failing will be rewarded with a hefty score at the end!

Gameplay:
On your turn you must decide whether you
a) play or
b) pass.

Play: Choose two (out of five) dice from the general display and use them to form a two-digit number. For example, you can use dice with the numbers 2 and 5 to form 25 or 52. Like this, you try climbing up your cake as high as possible. The next number must always be higher than the previous one.
Pass: if you cannot use any dice, you pass and re-roll all dice. You can only pass once on each level.

The round ends as soon as someone has reached the last level of his cake OR if someone has blundered (= not able to write a valid number after "passing")

A game consists of two rounds.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Dziadek do orzechów
description:
The Nutcracker is based on the story of the same name by E.T.A. Hoffmann. It tells the story of Klara, who received a nutcracker from her godfather. Imagine that, like Drosselmejer, you are a toy designer. Create beautiful nutcrackers with colorful pieces to win. The winner will be the constructor who makes as many grandfathers as possible from parts of the same color!

Game Goal:

Players try to score as many points as possible for the complete nutcrackers they have assembled. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.


Dziadek do orzechów to gra na podstawie opowieści o tym samym tytule autorstwa E.T.A. Hoffmanna. Opowiada o Klarze, która otrzymała od ojca chrzestnego dziadka do orzechów? Wyobraźcie sobie, że podobnie jak Drosselmejer jesteście konstruktorami zabawek. Stwórzcie piękne dziadki do orzechów z kolorowych części, aby wygrać. Zwycięzcą okaże się ten konstruktor, który wykona jak najwięcej dziadków z części w tym samym kolorze!

Cel gry:

Gracze starają się zdobyć jak najwięcej punktów za ułożone przez siebie kompletne dziadki do orzechów. Wygrywa gracz z największą liczbą punktów pod koniec gry.

name: Cat vs Rat: 奶酪陷阱 (Cat vs Rat: Cheese Trap)
description:
Cat vs Rat: 奶酪陷阱 looks to be a complete copy of Gobblet Gobblers, but with another graphical theme.

As in Tic-Tac-Toe the goal is to be the first one to get 3 in a row. With the additional ability to place pieces on already occupied squares, as long as the piece is big enough to cover the piece on the square.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Children's Game, Memory

name: El Gran Juego De Las Cuatro Reglas
description:
Old game of the year 1973 the great game of the 4 rules, from the collection mathematics is a Distein game, totally educational game for egb, ref. 305, Price in pesetas, complete and with instructions printed on the cover of the box.

From 2 to six players/team compete to arrive first at the finish line. They roll the four dices, discard one and with the remaining three count the possible solution by using a basic math formula, choose one and advance; then next players do so and so on until the end.

name: Tales of Evil: Final Chapter
description:
Tales of Evil Final Chapter is the adventure that will lead us to the final showdown against the Demon-Puppet-Mistress!

Includes 6 new tiles, 3 new adventures and 48 new cards.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Murder/Mystery

name: Warhammer: The Horus Heresy – Mechanicum Taghmata Army List
description:
The Horus Heresy Mechanicum: Taghmata Army List collects Mechanicum units and rules from The Horus Heresy Books One to Five in a 120 page, hard back book.

It includes background and profiles for all of the units available to the Mechanicum Taghmata, Legio Cybernetica and Ordo Reductor armies as well as support aircraft, seven classes of Knight, the Warhound, Reaver and immense Warlord Titans and introduces powerful new units such as the Ordinatus Macro Engines.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: CVLT
description:
CVLT is a competitive trick-taking game with a unique drafting mechanism.

After each trick, each player starting from the winner chooses a card from that trick. This card can be placed face-up in the player's offerings tableau or face-down in their dreams pile.

At the end of the round, cards from the offering tableau are added to the temple, and score points if every card of lower value in that suit has already been added to the temple.

Players also gain points by meeting the conditions of vision cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Quick Delivery
description:
The Quick Delivery Board Game is a game in which a driver who delivers food ordered from Tower M quickly wins.
It is a board game that delivers food quickly by moving the elevator up and down using numbers from two dice.

The game player must be the first to complete the delivery of all the food to be delivered.


Roll the dice.
Add or subtract the number of elevator floors with dice numbers.
Move the elevator.
Deliver food.


The game is over when anyone finishes delivering all the food.

—description from the designer

name: Micro Mycelium
description:
Micro Mycelium invites players to delve into the intricate world of a vibrant fungal forest, where they must strategically place tiles to expand their territory and maximize their points.

In this tile-placement strategy game, players must carefully grow, connect, and conquer as they navigate the dense mycelial network. With each turn, players strategically place tiles to expand their mushroom kingdom, earning points for their clever placement and strategic connections. The goal? To cultivate the most prosperous mushroom kingdom and emerge victorious as the ruler of the fungal forest.

Micro Mycelium combines immersive theme, engaging gameplay, and strategic depth to create an unforgettable gaming experience. With stunning artwork, intuitive mechanics, and endless replayability, it's the perfect addition to any game night or gaming collection. Are you ready to venture into the fungal forest and claim your place as the ultimate mycologist? Grow, connect, and conquer in Micro Mycelium!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Tile Placement, Zone of Control

name: The Race Game
description:
The Race Game is an Australian Horse race game where players race by the roll of a dice along a track until they reach the square 100. If a player lands on certain spaces showing the race hurdles then the player has to go back and miss a turn.

First player to reach 100 is the winner.

—user summary

name: Rail, Road and Air Race Game
description:
Rail, Road and Air Race Game is an Australian roll and move race game where players begin in three different Australian cities (Melbourne, Brisbane and Adelaide) with each player choosing either car, train or plane to race to Sydney Central Train Station.
Each separate route has squares that can aid or slow player progress. First player to reach Sydney Central Train Station is deemed the winner.
Several versions of the game exist beginning in the 1930s to the 1960s.

—user summary

name: Trio
description:
At the start of the game, the meeples are outside the game board. Each player strives to place one of his three meeples on three adjacent spaces in a row.
Each player rolls a die once in turn. On the first roll the player places a meeple on the space that shows the number rolled, this continues until all 3 meeples are on the board. Then, according to the roll, any meeple is moved forward. Anyone who leaves the board on space 24 immediately moves back to space 1. There is no capture; there may be two or more meeples of different colors on one space.
The winner is the first player to form a “trio”, that is, to have their meeples in a horizontal row, whereby none of these spaces may be occupied by other meeples.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Le Jeu des Cépages
description:
Discover the diversity of grape varieties grown in France and bet on their strengths to win the battle! Each grape variety has 3 characteristics: "surface area cultivated, change in surface area over 60 years and bunch size".

The principle of the grape variety game is simple: play against your friends to win as many cards as possible and win the game.

name: Solche Strolche
description:
First, the homeowner couple distributes the 10 rings to any black diamonds on the game board.
The 1st burglar starts, followed by the 1st homeowner, then the 2nd burglar and the 2nd homeowner. The homeowners start at A, the burglars at B. B is also the end space for the burglars. Each player can play with one or two dice as he sees fit.
The burglars try to roll the black squares to get possession of the rings lying there. If this succeeds, the ring is placed on the burglar meeple. If a burglar has captured 3 rings, he tries to leave the house at B, and the winner is whoever manages to do so.
The homeowners catch a burglar when their meeple lands on the space he occupies. This means that the burglar is eliminated from the game. The homeowners win, if if they capture both burglars.
No burglar is allowed to enter or pass the space on which a homeowner stands. He must choose a different direction, if such an option was still open to him.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Static Capture

name: Fußball-Würfelspiel
description:
Duration: 90 minutes, 2 halves of 45 minutes each.
The playing pieces of both teams are placed in the red or blue bordered spaces(team “Red” or team “Blue”) with numbers 1 to 11.
In any case, the blue team starts. Two dice are rolled and the parties take turns. For every normal roll of 2 dice, 2 pawns are drawn, corresponding to the number of points on each dice. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
The team against which a goal has been scored has kick-off after the pieces have been brought to the starting position. The red team starts the second half in any case.
Two dice are rolled and the parties take turns. For every normal roll of 2 dice, 2 pawns are drawn, corresponding to the number of points on each dice.

The game was produced as a promotional for Blendax toothpaste.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Poulp Party
description:
Dive into an underwater adventure with Poulp Party!

Head to an underwater world vibrant with life, where colorful fish swim around a mischievous octopus.
The mission cards guide the children on their adventure: each card indicates the fish to recover, transforming the game into an underwater treasure hunt.
Children will have to show skill and ingenuity to make the fish fall into the holes by making the octopus move using the string. But be careful! You must only collect the designated fish, otherwise the next player will benefit! Children learn to plan their movements, anticipate the actions of other players and react quickly. This way they develop their skills and their ability to think, while having fun.

The game includes a box illustrating the seabed, 20 mission cards, 30 fish, an octopus with its card and a dice.

—description from the designer

name: Magic Theater
description:
Abracadabra! Are you ready to lift the curtain and discover the animal hidden behind the smoke?

This observation and deduction game is designed for children aged 3 and up.
The game includes a cardboard theater with its curtain, 20 illustrations to guess, 18 magnetic clouds of smoke, a magic wand and a dice.

The clouds of smoke hide an illustration that had previously been slipped into the room. By rolling the dice and using the magic wand, the players gradually remove the clouds, each in turn. The illustration slowly reveals itself... The first one to guess the right animal wins the round!

Children learn to observe carefully, infer from visible clues, and respond quickly. Thus they develop their ability to observe and deduce, while having fun.
—description from the designer

name: Cléo Cartes
description:
Solve the puzzle to open the door…
Take the 4 puzzle cards of the color of your choice.
At the top, the coded message of the riddle card is revealed.

Arrange your cards cleverly to reproduce the right combination.

Place the Pharaoh grid on your cards to check. Did you find the solution?

—description from the designer

name: Millennium Blades: Elena Guerrero Character
description:
This is a print-and-play only crossover character for Millennium Blades featuring a duelist from the TTRPG Perfect Draw!

Elena favors smaller star cards and powers them up by combining them, much like her Building Block Battalion signature deck!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Real-Time, Set Collection, Simulation, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Terra Magyarország
description: Do you know which is the longest cave system in the country? And how long has Túró Rudi been produced? In the Terra Magyarország board game, you can encounter similar questions! Compete with each other while getting to know this amazing country!

name: Gongdo! Supreme Star Mahjong
description:
Gongdo! 拱斗 is a novel, engaging and meaningful four-player competition game. Inspired by the formidable stars in the sky, it’s also known as "Supreme Star Mahjong". Players must collect the tiles they need to win the game: gather 15 tiles of the hand comprising 2, 3, 3, 3, 4 - Win!

Gong 拱 means stars come together to pay tribute to the supreme winning status.
Do 斗 (pronounce as "Dou") - in Chinese it has two meanings - Fighting, Conquer or “Dou” are the Stars themselves!

The "Gongdo!”engraved tile set comprises 160 tiles in total. The tiles are categorized into five star echelons. You don't need to memorize them, just glance at the tiles’ differences to start the game.

"Gongdo!" can be easy to get started (since you can win with a fixed combination), while it also can be complex and in-depth (i.e. the combinations of 4 pattern tiles are unpredictable and changeable along the game.)

"Revealing your pattern/prospects": When you reveal your pattern/prospects, you can declare it loudly and get good luck! Each 4 pattern tiles, are formed by those “heavenly bodies combinations”, they can have a relatable good connotations in many aspects of life!

"Couples" are vital! "The matched 2 tiles and couples" are essential! Actively look for the "best match of stars" among tiles.

Friends of Gongdo!, let's play!

—description from the designer

name: Assertion: The Three Kingdoms
description:
In an effort to counter the growing number of uprisings, Emperor Xian of the Han Dynasty started granting regional power and military command to several lords around him. A number of these lords seized the opportunity and never gave back those privileges. As a result, Three Kingdoms arose, each vying for dominance in China. What no one of those Three Kingdoms accounted for, was the rising lords at the borders.

A game of Assertion: The Three Kingdoms puts you in control of such a regional lord on the borders of China, competing for power against other rival players and the already established lords of the Three Kingdoms. Through an innovative action-selection system, players choose how to distribute the limited number of ministers they have at their disposal, to accomplish maximum growth each turn. Among the many paths to victory, players can elect to help the unaligned Three Kingdoms in a race to forge powerful alliances, or trick them into being pitted against each other with catastrophic results, or even amass their own forces and make a beeline to the Emperor's abandoned palace:

War Room: Recruit armies, campaign across China, battle through a dice rolling system and conquer resource-rich territories.
Build: Erect buildings in your territories to cement your economy or strengthen your military campaigns
Negotiation: Coordinate and trade favors with the neutral lords of the Three Kingdoms to strengthen your influence over them
Diplomacy: Depending on your friendship and alliances with the neutral kingdoms, direct them to assist you, outright combat your rivals, or send them to their doom!
Technology: Spend resources to advance your cultural and technological means and upgrade your buildings.
Taxation: Direct all your ministers to tax your subjects to receive income in order to be able to proceed with your campaign to unify China.


During the game you recruit more cunning ministers and battle-proven generals. Also you score short-term milestones and long-term achievements to climb the hierarchy. The first player to be able to hold the Emperor office for a whole round wins the game.

No matter how, make sure that you sit atop the Dragon Throne, unifying China under one Kingdom. YOUR Kingdom!

Uniquely blending euro-style empire management and 4x-style map growth, Assertion: The Three Kingdoms packs a big grand-strategy punch set in an era loved by most: the Era of the Three Kingdoms.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Economic, Miniatures, Novel-based, Territory Building
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Ladder Climbing, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Track Movement, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Adventure Is Nigh!
description:
The Red Dragon Inn: Adventure Is Nigh! is a card game for 2-4 players featuring the characters from the Adventure Is Nigh YouTube series.

After another wild adventure, it's time you kicked back with your buddies for a party at your favorite nightclub. Brawl, gamble, and drink your way through the night as a unique character with its own deck, traits, and mechanisms. The last adventurer standing wins!

All of the characters in this standalone game can be mixed with characters from any The Red Dragon Inn game or expansion.

—description from the publisher

name: Reverse Charades Junior Edition Demo Pack
description: Set of 8 cards and 2 rules/advertising cards for Reverse Charades Junior Edition

name: Warhammer: The Horus Heresy – Campaigns of the Age of Darkness: The Battle of Beta-Garmon
description:
Campaigns of the Age of Darkness: The Battle of Beta-Garmon is teh second campaign expansion for Horus Heresy: Age Of Darkness. The book covers the narrative and battles of the Beta-Garmon, and provides a complete campaign to fight from its opening skirmishes to its cataclysmic climax in the Titandeath.

The 240 page hardback book also contains rules for the Shattered Legions and Blackshields forces, characters including Little Horus Aximand, Tybalt Marr, Shadrak Meduson and Endryd Haar, and rules for Onslaught team campaigns.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: Warhammer: The Horus Heresy – Exemplary Battles of the Age of Darkness: Volume One
description:
The Horus Heresy spans innumerable desperate battles and bitter grudges – many lost to history, other the subject of grim and terrible rumours. The champions who fight these far-flung battles are unlike any in the galaxy's history, warriors armed with inimical strategies and esoteric weaponry, locked into struggles across sprawling arcologies, towering citadels, and claustrophobic tunnels.

In this book, you will find five accounts of battles from the Age of Darkness - The Defence of Sotha, The Siege of Hydra Cordatus, the Battle of Armatura, The Atttack on Calth and The Purging of the Invocastus Sector - along with the campaign and missions rules to recreate them on the tabletop in games of Warhammer: The Horus Heresy.

This 112 page hardback book also includes new rules for five notable Legiones Astartes units unique to Legions that fought in these battles – the Night Lords, Iron Warriors, World Eaters, Ultramarines, and Salamanders – as well as expanded rules for the Emperor's Children Traitor Legion, and complete rules for their ascended Daemon Primarch, Fulgrim Transfigured.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: Franklin 1864
description:
Franklin 1864 allows gamers to refight the historic battles of Spring Hill and Franklin, Tennessee in 1864, using the popular Civil War Brigade Battle Series of rules. Franklin 1864 is Volume V, following Antietam, Shiloh, The Seven Days Battles, and Gettysburg.

The Battle of Spring Hill was a trap laid by Confederate General Hood in his drive on Nashville, trying to trap part of the Army of the Ohio under Union General Schofield. The historic battle did not go as Hood hoped with the Union forces escaping to Franklin relatively unscathed.

The Battle of Franklin the following day, November 30, was a last ditch by Hood trying to catch the Union forces with their back to a river and the bridges damaged. A lack of time, artillery, and planning led to a vicious Confederate defeat with 14 Confederate generals killed and 55 regimental commanders. The battle was a close run affair for the amount of time involved a Union deployment mistake almost giving Hood the victory he so desparately sought.

Fight each battle separately or combine to refight the 2 days together in a linked mini-campaign.

Players will command either the Confederate or Union armies as they battle to destroy opposing forces and capture key terrain objectives to determine victory.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Old School Wargames, Worthington Publishing, LLC

name: PolyDots
description:
PolyDots is an abstract strategy game and brainteaser for 1-4 players, aged 5+. Using 13-sided tiles called polykites, players align and connect tiles to claim territory with coins matching simple math outcomes.

COMPONENTS

30 polykite tiles
80 coins
2 dice.


GOAL:
Score the highest points by claiming tiles.

SETUP:

Shuffle the tiles and place face down between the players.
Give each player 20 coins of the same colour.
Each player takes five tiles and places them face up beside themselves.
Place a random starter tile between the players.
Decide upon the winning condition using either adjacent or non-contiguous territory.


GAME PLAY:
Playing in turns, a player drops one of their tiles in an attempt to connect colored dots of their colour. A connection can be complete or partial. A complete connection creates a dot of one solid colour, while a partial connection has a dot of mixed colours. Each tile has four sets of 3 dot fragments of the same colour.
If a connection is made, the player makes an attempt to claim one of the adjacent tiles with a coin. This is accomplished by rolling the dice and forming an equation. The equation dictates which coin to place. A coin can be placed on a territory claimed by another player only if the equation is higher than the value of the coin already in place.
Claiming a Tile:
A tile can only be claimed when an adjacent tile has formed a dot with the same colour. The subsequent coin can be placed on either tile.

Stealing Territory:
A player can only steal a territory (tile) by forming an equation whose outcome is mathematically higher than the existing coin.

Stacking Tiles:
A tile can be stacked on an empty tile if an appropriate dot can be formed.

Equations (Outcomes):
Upon rolling the dice, a player chooses the outcome of a mathematical equation from the two numbers. Only 20 outcomes are possible between 1-36. The outcome or solution is from addition, subtraction, multiplication or division of the two numbers. For example, rolling 3 and 5 can yield 2, 8 or 15 from subtraction, addition or multiplication of the two numbers.

WINNING:
There are two winning conditions based on the initial decision of claiming territory:
Adjacent: add up the value of coins in the largest contiguous area.
Non-Contiguous: add up the values of all coins.
The player with the highest coins claimed wins. In case of a tie, the youngest player wins.

STRATEGY:
Try to claim an important tile using the highest mathematically outcome. Such a tile links adjacent tiles to form a larger contiguous area.

SOLO GAME PLAY:
This mode requires you to solve the brainteaser by perfectly aligning as many tiles as you can to form complete dots. The perfect solution uses all tiles.

POLYKITE BACKGROUND:
Polykites were the miracle mathematical shape discovered in 2023. These 13-sided polygons allow a pattern to be formed that never repeats.
In the math world, this kite- or hat-like shape is known as an "aperiodic monotile", also called an "einstein" (or the German phrase for "one stone").
Slotted together, it's impossible to find a matching arrangement or orientation.
On March 20, 2023, a group of computer scientists (David Smith, Joseph Samuel Myers, Craig Kaplan and Chaim Goodman-Strauss) revealed their discovery nicknamed the "hat polykite”.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Um die Festung
description:
Each player is paying 10 tokens into the toll. The order is determined by placing the round tiles face down on the table and each player draws one. The die is then rolled in the order of the colors at the bottom of the guns. The players roll a die and push their grenades further according to the number they rolled. Whoever gets on a red number has scored a hit and will receive 3 tokens from the toll as a reward. However, if one gets to a white number, he has to move 1 number back. On the roll of more than 15, the player has to go back as many spaces from 15 as he rolled too many. Whoever gets to 15 first wins the game and gets 2 thirds of the contents of the till, the next person gets the rest.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Plum Plum
description:
Plum-Plum consists of 32 coins (8 each red, green, yellow and blue discs). Red is worth 30 points, yellow is worth 10 points, green 20 points, and blue 0 points.
The player who deals, places the coins on the table with the colored side facing down and shuffles them. Then, like in a card game, they are distributed evenly among the players. Nobody is allowed to see what color the coins are! The next player on the left comes out by turning over any of his coins. The other players follow in turn. Now the rule applies that the highest color played first wins. So if, for example, green-yellow-red-blue is played, red wins. When played: yellow-blue-blue-green, green wins.

Exception: If all players have the same color, the last player wins. Whoever wins comes out for the next turn!
After the game, the coins are added up and the result is written down by each player. The first person to reach 1010 points wins.

—user summary

name: Travel Ball
description:
You're the manager of a traveling youth baseball team that competes for Fun Points by winning tournaments and meeting objectives set by your board of directors.
Start by choosing players who can cover every position on the field and who will maximize the talents of your coaches. Improve your squad by holding practices and paying for trainers and gear, but don't get too low on morale or money you'll need to get into the tournaments.
Managers take turns picking from a variety of face-up team improvement cards that refresh every two turns.
They have 16 weeks (turns) to improve their players or raise money or morale. Fun Points are awarded at four tournaments and from Board Goals achieved or failed at the end of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, End Game Bonuses, Paper-and-Pencil, Turn Order: Progressive

name: General d'Armee 2
description:
General d’Armee 2 is designed for Divisional and Corps size actions in the Napoleonic period. Dynamic and fast-paced, General d’Armee uses the ADC command and control system seen in the first edition to put you in the shoes of the commanding General, deciding how and when to use your influence to control and win the battle.

Packed with Napoleonic flavour, General d’Armee uses the battalion as the smallest manoeuvre element, the Brigade the lowest tactical command. A typical club night action involving several Brigades per side and a full day or weekend handling a Corps or two with ease.

116 pages in length, General d’Armee 2 includes rules for using figures from 6mm to 28mm in size, details on organising your armies and getting them in the table. Two introductory scenarios are included to get you playing with the latest edition of these classic rules from the master of the big battlefield.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: 1813: The Battles for Germany – Six Wargame Scenarios for General d'Armee
description:
1813. The Battles for Germany is a scenario supplement for General d’Armee penned by game designer Dave Brown. Here Dave provides us with six iconic actions from the decisive campaign which saw Napoleon fight to preserve his German possessions after the disastrous 1812 campaign in Russia. Beginning with Weissenfels, this scenario supplement goes on to cover the actions at Lutzen, Bautzen, Dresden, Mockern and finally Liebertwolkwoitz.

This 40 page PDF contains an illustrated historical introduction to the campaign followed by six scenarios which are easily printed out for the game you wish to play and contain complete army lists with unit and commander ratings as well as deployment notes and a breakdown of the terrain. What’s more the six scenarios can be played individually or as part of a “campaign’, with the result of each scenario affecting the next.

Can you save Germany for the Emperor of the French or will you be the liberating forces of Europe combining to liberate the continent from the terrors of the Corsican Ogre?

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: 1941-43 Eastern Front: Barbarossa to Citadel
description: This PDF supplement for ‘O’ Group covers the war in the East from Barbarossa to Kursk, combining army lists for Germany, Italy, Finland, Romania, Hungary and the Soviet Union with nation specific rules and an array of support options. Also presented are eight scenarios which may be played individually or as a linked campaign.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: 1944: The Battle for Normandy
description: This PDF supplement for ‘O’ Group covers the 1944 campaign in the Normandy region of France, combining army lists for Britain the USA, Canada, Germany, the Free French along with forces from Poland and an array of support options. Theatre specific rules are presented alongside six scenarios which may be played individually or as a linked campaign.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: 1940: The Fall of France & the Low Countries
description: This sixty page PDF supplement for ‘O’ Group covers the 1940 campaign in France and the Low Countries, with army lists for France, Britain, Belgium, the Netherlands, Germany, and Italy with core forces and an array of support options. Theatre specific rules are presented as are six scenarios which may be played individually or as a linked campaign.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: Splinter Quad
description:
Splinter Quad is an abstract strategy game for four players, and a variant of the two-player game of Splinter. The object of the game is to knock out your opponents' kings, rooks, bishops and pawns while protecting your own pieces from enemy attack.

Each player starts the game with 4 types of pieces – 1 king (star), 2 rooks (squares), 2 bishops (crosses) and 4 pawns (circles). Play begins with the pieces arranged in a checkerboard pattern at the center of the board.

Choose a player to go first, then continue playing, with all players alternating turns.

On your turn, you may slide any one of your pieces one square in any direction (horizontally, vertically or diagonally). Any pieces that lie in the way (regardless of number, color or type) get pushed along, including off the board. If a piece is pushed off the board, it is eliminated and is out of play for the remainder of the game.

To avoid an infinite loop, you may not move any piece to a square that it vacated on your opponent’s last turn.

A splinter occurs when one or more pieces become disconnected from the original group so that there are empty squares between those pieces and the original group.

Following a splinter, the largest group remains on the board and all other groups are removed. If the groups are of equal size, the player who caused the splinter decides which group is removed. If a piece is removed as a result of a splinter, it is eliminated and is out of play for the remainder of the game.

A knockout occurs each time a player runs out of any type of piece (king, rook, bishop or pawn). Upon reaching two knockouts, a player is eliminated from the game, and that player’s pieces are removed from the board. The last surviving player wins the game.

Click here for official rules and diagrams: https://splinterboardgame.blogspot.com/2024/03/splinter-quad...

—description from the publisher

name: Giraffe Chess
description:
Giraffe Chess is a 68 square result oriented board game of India where an additional 4 squares are added to the standard 8 x 8 chessboard: 2 behind each King and Queen: these squares are occupied a pair of Giraffes (these have the move of the fairy chess Zebra, or the Bannerman in 3-sided Chinese chess).

There are a number of ways to win:


By checkmating your opponent's King.
By "Crowning": getting your King into one of your opponent's Giraffe squares.
If your opponent does not defeat you in 70 moves you win.
If your opponent does not capture one of your pieces within 50 moves you win.
If you stalemate your opponent, you win.

name: Freebooter's Fate: Tales of Longfall #7
description:
The second scenatio book for Freebooter's Fate, collecting fifteen new scenarios in a 40 page softcover book.

For the first time these include single player scenarios, and in addition optional rules and variants to add challenge and variety to your games of miniature piracy.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: Freebooter' Fate: Tales of Longfall #5
description:
Tales of Longfall #5's 28 pages are packed with fourteen new scenarios for Freebooter's Fate, each accompanied with little stories that describe a fight, a skirmish or a washed out battle and in which your teams are the main actors.

There are treasures to find, stupid birds to catch, fire or water to escape, and gold to find and lose. Of course, the enemy will try to stop you, mostly because he has exactly the same objectives.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: Freebooter's Fate:  Tales of Longfall #6 – Shadows
description:
Shadows have fallen over Longfall! They squirm out of darkened doors, a swirling mass of darkness. The streets of Longfall are shrouded in dark, impenetrable fog and the whole town is threatening to sink into chaos.

And that’s because power-obsessed Brotherhood members and curious Amazons have opened two ancient doors a little further than was wise. Doors to another world. A dark, formless, thoroughly evil world. Through this rift they emerge again, and the heroic efforts of a centuries-old secret society have been thwarted, for the shadows are back! And they are not kind. Suddenly the darkness on Leonera has become even more dangerous…

This 36 page paperback supplement for Freebooter's Fate provies all the new special rules and traits to create and fight a dark bunch of new shadow characters, and a first “shadow scenario” to start right away.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: Race thru Space
description:
A didactic card game, meant to teach children about the planets in the solar system. You have a 3 card hand and must play out a Sun card, then each planet in sequence, doing nothing but draw/discard if you cannot.

Advertised as part of the "small one's series"

name: Cités Royales
description:
You're a city builder, but would your reputation be enough to unite them again?
To govern, you need to be able to understand and manage all six provinces. Once united, they formed an exceptional kingdom.

Use your cards to build your cities and secure majorities, or to unleash their power and turn the tables. Cités Royales is played over 4 rounds. Each round corresponds to a season.

At the end of each season, players build their cities using the cards they have collected during the round. The most influential player wins prestige points. However, cards are also used to perform actions that can turn the game around.

It's up to you to optimize their use according to your strategy and your position on the Prestige track.

In Cités Royales, you'll need to pay close attention to your neighbors' choices to build your cities wisely and astutely!

name: Dragonbond: Lords of Vaala – Epics of Valerna
description:
This expansion includes an array of modules to increase player options:


Bring narrative scenarios to Valerna.
Develop your character with Epic Player boards.
More miniatures for existing factions and Denizen cards
A new creature to roam in Valerna


Narrative Scenarios:
At the beginning of the game, reveal 3 random scenarios that affect the regions of the board throughout the game.
After every Event card is revealed, a stage card is triggered one of the scenarios. These greatly impact the decisions from all players.

Epic Player boards:
Your board has different slots for your Power tokens. Each grant a bonus or some sort of ability. From increasing your Combat Value, to permanently reducing the amount of Power you need to cast Vaala cards, and more! Customize the growth of your Dragon or play with a General that rely more on their own skills than on their army.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Action/Event, Contracts, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events

name: Booty On Deck
description:
Booty on Deck is a swashbuckling board game where players take on the role of pirate captains, sailing the high seas in search of treasure and glory. The game combines strategic gameplay with real-time battles, challenging players to claim forts, sink rival ships, and bid for more resources at the Marauders Market.

Players must navigate treacherous waters and unpredictable events, such as the appearance of the Kraken or volcanic eruptions, all while managing their resources and crew. The goal is to accumulate 30 pieces of booty, which can be earned by claiming forts, plundering wrecks, and outwitting opponents in bidding wars.

With its blend of strategy, chance, and player interaction, Booty on Deck offers an exciting and immersive gaming experience that will have players on the edge of their seats until the final piece of treasure is claimed. Are you ready to set sail and become the most notorious pirate of the high seas?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Betting and Bluffing, Grid Movement, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Dominion: Farm
description:
Now 2 money and at the end of the game 2 points

Originally planned as correction card for the original Farm.
publishers: ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Rio Grande Games

name: The Sleeping Giant
description:
Choose your path and explore the ruins of the giant robot. Disable the traps and defeat the small enemy robots that come your way.
If you manage to deactivate the evil AI before the time runs out you have won the game.

To play you need a pencil and 3 6-sided dice.
By exploring the map you can find bonuses to increase your Life Points and Skill Points, necessary to modify the results of the dice rolls.
When you encounter an enemy you have to roll the dice for both and compare the results to find out who won the duel. Whoever obtained the highest result wins. If you have special skills you can change the dice results in your favor.

By defeating enemies, you also collect resources that will allow you to access the otherwise inaccessible AI room.
Now you can always fight against the AI using the dice rolling mechanism. Use all your energy to win the duel and finish the game.

—description from the designer

name: Monopoly: Blackburn Rovers F.C. Edition
description: A Monopoly version themed after the English football club Blackburn Rovers.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Creature Crunch
description:
A Meal Time Game for Two Fussy Eaters

In Creature Crunch, players take turns to Feed, Roll, and Trade food until their fussy creature is full with their favourite food. You'll need to be quick, for there are other ravenous creatures about who just might eat your lunch!

name: Two Faced: Adult Edition
description:
A game of acting challenges. But this ain't charades! No hand gestures, no body movements, just a lot of silly faces.

Teams challenge each other to act out an action and emotion card, at the same time, using only their face. There are tactics at play as you choose the trickiest combination for your opponents.

In this adult edition the challenges are too hard, or too rude for children. So you might be find yourself performing an 'ecstatic bikini wax' face, or 'depressed with pubic lice'.

The aim of the game is to guess the most correct answers, and of course to have a good laugh at your friends' weird faces along the way.

—description from the publisher

name: Dice Stackers
description:
Dice Stackers is fast-paced dice stacking game for two players. Flip a card over and race to stack the dice as depicted on the card. Not only do players need to match the die’s color but they need to match the value of the die as well.

Key Features:


Fast-paced
Dexterity
Competitive
Simultaneous Play
Add more dice to accommodate more players!


—description from the publisher

name: Birdie Pro: Maple Hill Expansion Course
description:
Disc Golf Destination: Maple Golds, Leicester, MA

Maple Hill, the #1 ranked course in the world (2020-2022), is one of the premier disc golf courses in the United States and home of the MVP Open presented by OTB.

The course runs through the fields and woods of the Maple Hill Christmas Tree Farm. It uses elevation change, heavily wooded fairways, and iconic water hazards to create a magical and unique challenge. The Christmas tree nurseries that span the open fairways, make even the open shots a challenge.

Designed by Steve Dodge, Tom Southwick, Gage Benson, and Dave Jackson, with input from dozens of touring pros, this course tests every skill as well as mental stamina. With a dozen signature holes and enough risk/reward for even the most hardened pro, this course will challenge every aspect of your game.

Components: Two game boards.
Board 1: Holes 1-9
Board 2: Holes 10-18

name: Birdie Pro: The Preserve Expansion Course
description:
Disc Golf Destination: Timberwolf, Clearwater, MN

Located directly on the banks of the Mississippi River, The Preserve is a challenging and fun track that plays through a vast, beautiful landscape. Five different bodies of water come into play requiring a solid variety of shots. The par 5 18th may be the most exciting finishing hole in disc golf! The connection to nature combined with the thrill of the sport makes it a must play!

Designed by pro and fan favorite, Cale Leiviska, the Timberwolf course challenges the best. It is revered as a fan and player favorite on the Disc Golf Pro Tour and has quickly established itself as one of the premier tracks in the world.

You will need to focus to keep the disc in bounds. Be smart about when to utilize your skills and make sure to save a little for the signature 18th hole.

Components: Two game boards.
Board 1: Holes 1-9
Board 2: Holes 10-18

name: 9 in a Net
description:
In the game 9 in a Net, players try to collect nine different types of bugs. Each bug card has a different number value, so that the higher the number the more points it is worth. There are seven different spots where bugs are placed in the center of the playing area. Each player has nine spaces in front of them that are different traps that can only be filled with bugs from specific spots. Players take turns collecting bugs, so they have as many different bugs with the best points possible. When one player has filled in all their traps the game ends and whoever has the most points wins.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Math, Print & Play

name: Hungarian Kingdom 1899 (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
Embark on a thrilling journey through the heart of Europe with this unofficial expansion that takes you back in time to the border of the 19th and 20th century, taking place in 1899.

Includes:

Historical City Names
7 Historical Regions of the Hungarian part of the Austro-Hungarian Monarchy + few foreign cities
Passport Cards that are based on real life passports and include people that existed
Tons of Fun!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains

name: MacMahonMosaik
description: Given a colored border of a rectangle, lay down square mosaic tiles with three different border colors themselves. Players who cannot place a tile are out. The last one standing wins.

name: Ecosfera Baltic Sea
description:
Ecosfera Baltic Sea is a version of the Ecosfera game.

A cooperative game in which you must restore the Baltic Sea.

A version with faster games and more unpredictable scenarios that will put you on edge.

Jointly designed between Julibert Games and Helcom. a intergovernmental organization bridging policy and science on matters related to the environment of the Baltic Sea.

name: Tip
description:
Each round, each player pays one point and forecasts the numbers of 6 dice thrown. The better you guess, the more you get points (up to 8). If you don't possess any points, you are out of the game. The player who reaches 64 points wins, if the game doesn't end earlier because the bank is bankrupt.
Except for the dice (plastic) and the rules (paper) all components are made of wood. The points are represented by colored sticks and are stored in holes of a personal table. You forecast by putting small dice into the large hollow of the table.

name: Ecosfera: Expansion
description: 40-card Ecosfera Expansion. Face unpredictable situations that will change the rules of the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: SpaceShipped: Expansion Collection
description:
A collection of three expansions for SpaceShipped:


The Dynasty Seal
Debts and Damage
Out of Route
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Gridlock: A Dice Deck Game
description:
Each player starts with either the black or white cards, and half the red cards. Play cards one at a time within a 5×5 grid to create of-a-kind sets or sequences of your colour. Sets do not have to be in a straight line, but must be connected.

When you play a red card, you can't score a set that turn.. red cards can be used by either player and are worth double the points!

Continue until all cards have been played, then count how many points you have in scored sets.

—description from the designer

name: Dice Blitz
description:
A frantic and fast-paced game inspired by the likes of Dutch Blitz, Bananagrams, and Speed; Dice Blitz is a 2-player realtime game where both players play as fast as they can.

Add cards to a crossword-style grid where every row is a sequence of the same colour, and ever column is the same number of any colour.

Be the first to play all your cards to the grid to win!

—description from the designer

name: Provem-ho en català: El joc
description:
Two people or two teams will compete to get four cards (one per color).

Yellow cards will challenge something refered to music.
Black cards deal with foods.
Red cards invite you to talk about games.
Blue cards suggest something about sports.
Use the spinning top as a dice to know the color of the challenge.
publishers: Departament de Cultura. Generalitat de Catalunya

name: Process of Elimination
description:
You don’t know what team you’re on, but you might be able to figure out from talking with others. Can you eliminate the players on the other teams and protect your teammates?

Each player draws a card, but can't look at their own card. Everyone has two minutes to ask questions of others to deduce their team (colour). When the time is up, everyone points at someone they want to eliminate!

Turn order is by number, lowest to highest. Once all eliminated players are removed from the game, count your team's score by adding up the pips on all remaining cards of your colour.

name: The Collector: A Dice Deck game
description:
Dig through an archeological site to uncover the bones for a new species of dinosaur!

In this tripeaks-style solitaire game, uncover and collect as many black and white cards as you can. If you get stuck, you can use a red card, but when the red cards are gone, the game ends! Can you collect every card?

name: Astro Lander
description:
Play as space truckers harvesting resources from asteroids across the galaxy and hauling them home. In an act of friendly competition, you challenge one another for who can deliver the most valuable cargo!

Use cards from your hand to move to upgrade your three harvesters; then play cards to move to asteroids of different colours, harvesting resources based on the efficiency of the harvester for that colour.

Resources are used to fulfill contracts of a variety of point values. Fulfill the most valuable contracts to win!

—description from the publisher

name: Ofertu
description:
Ofertu is a combination bidding + deckbuilding game; bid with limited resources to add red cards to your hand. On subsequent turns, bid using red cards to score the card you win as points, instead of adding it to your hand.

Ofertu is a light bluffing game for two, full of interesting mind games.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Odyssey: Legendary Arms
description:
Odyssey is a game that blends strategy with combat, where players must strategically weaken opponents' teams while planning the development of their own. The goal is to thwart rivals from completing the development of mythical weapons while successfully advancing their own weapon development in the game."

Odyssey: Legendary Arms is a tabletop game that combines luck and combat. With over 200 game cards and a competitive map, players collect coins and Vail crystals from the map. Coins can be used to purchase more game items, and collecting a specific number of Vail crystals allows players to upgrade their main character. By collecting specific Vail crystals and three designated attribute partners, players can win the game. It's a game suitable for playing with family and friends, with simple gameplay but endless variations in each game.

Gameplay: At the beginning of the game, draw 3 action crystals. Action crystals can be used to roll dice, move tokens, use action cards, and initiate battles. Players need to build their army from over 200 cards, with each weapon granting new abilities. Victory is achieved by assembling three designated stage 2 partners with specific attributes and collecting a specified number of Vail crystals from the map.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Role Playing, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Schere Stein Papier
description:
You know rock-paper-scissors from your sleep. You are quick with your fingers and know exactly which symbol you can use to beat your opponents. Your eagle eyes recognize the right colors in a flash and you form "paper" with your hand and win hands down.

But the game is not yet won. Can you survive all the rounds and take home the victory? You collect one card after the other, but it remains exciting until the end. You've never played this classic game like this before.

Experience the classic game in a whole new way! Rock-paper-scissors gets an update with this exciting game for on the go. If you already love the finger game, you won't be able to stop playing this version, because it gets really tricky here. Prove your speed and combine the symbols to beat your opponents.

Rock, Paper, Scissors contains 56 cards on which the three basic symbols of the game (rock, paper, scissors) are depicted in three different colors. In each round of the game, try to recognize the symbols of the same color as quickly as possible and then show the beating symbol with your fingers. If identical symbols are revealed, clap your hands quickly.

name: Mission to Earth
description:
