Word reached the spacestation Nexus-9 about a tiny planet called Earth. They have invented the one thing all lifeforms in the galaxy need. The five biggest corporations in the galaxy want the invention, and they want it first.

In Mission to Earth players play as one of five alien corporations trying to get to Earth first. Players have to buy three different upgrades for their spaceship in order to make it to Earth. Plus they need two pilots to fly through the tricky parts of space.

You mine, steal or trade crypto currency and you use this currency to gain the favour of pilots. But beware, the pilots are not the nicest people in the galaxy and they just might go with someone else. In the meantime try to hinder the other corporations by spying on them, seducing them or use "diplomacy" to sabotage their plans.

The first to have the three upgrades and two pilots on their side gets to Earth and wins the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Zoo Logico
description:
Welcome to the exciting world of animal care.
Gather food plus care plus medicine and get your animal. If the opponents fall on your animal, charge for the visit and collect victory points to win.
With luck and care, you will get them to breed and you will be able to collect more. But beware of hunters, traps, predators and the dreaded coronavirus that will slow you down or cause you to lose your winnings.

—description from the designer (translated)
mechanics: Negotiation, Turn Order: Role Order, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Mind Map: Cartes Promotionnelles
description:
5 new word cards to add to the game for more variety.
Pack found in Plato Magazine 163.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
publishers: Plato Magazine, Sorry We Are French

name: 談鬼俱樂部 (Urban Legend Night)
description:
Urban Legend Night is a multiplayer cooperative card library building game.

The game is based on the production of a supernatural TV program. The game is composed of many segments, and the content of each segment is taken from classic supernatural program activities and well-known urban legends. In each segment, there will be several supernatural events, some of which are even accompanied by urban legends. When these supernatural events are triggered, they will bring negative effects to the field, such as weakening the character's mental value, giving the character negative states, or eventually causing the character to fall into madness.

During the game, players can play topic cards to represent various topics on the show. Different topic cards have different effects, such as restoring mental value or drawing cards. The characters played by each player also has exclusive abilities that can help build their card library or remove effects. Players must also gather specific combinations of topic cards as quickly as possible to eliminate the supernatural events on the field.

The ultimate goal of the game is for all players to work together to eliminate the supernatural events and end the recording safely with everyone alive.
—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Big Fish
description:
Gameplay:
Everyone starts with equal chances of winning. The better you can predict someone's card, the better your chances of winning!
Goal:
Be the player with the most points through collecting fish.
Difficulty:
If you can play a card, you can play the game!

To Play:
All players play a single card from their hand at the same time.
Fish that are duplicates get combined.
Fish chains get created and collected
Repeat till all cards are played.

name: Thunder on the Mississippi: Grant's Vicksburg Campaign
description:
Thunder On the Mississippi depicts Maj. Gen. Ulysses S. Grant’s 1863 campaign to capture Vicksburg.

The game is designed by Joe Balkoski (the original GCACW series creator) and Chris Withers. The game map will adhere to the accuracy and high graphic standards of its predecessors, with map design executed by artist Charlie Kibler—whose work on the series dates to its creation in 1992.
Two new terrain features unique to the Vicksburg region are also introduced: loess hills and coastal bluffs. The Advanced Game rules cover situations specifically applicable to this unique campaign starting with an amphibious invasion, followed by sweeping cross-country movement ending in siege warfare.

Thunder On the Mississippi provides excellent gaming value, with 11 Basic Game scenarios and one Advanced Game campaign, ranging from 1-turn learning scenarios to the full 70-turn campaign game.

It contains:

GCACW Series Rules Booklet (24 pages, including illustrations, play examples, charts)
Thunder On the Mississippi Rules Booklet (about 56 pages, including scenarios, the Game as History, Gazetteer, etc.)
Two 22"x 32" full-color map sheets
Two 280-piece counter sheets and one 140-piece half counter sheet
One Terrain Effects Chart
Two full-color Force Displays
Two 4-page full-color Charts and Tables
Two 6-sided Dice


—description from the publisher, adapted
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Wargame

name: Charmkins
description: Players get 1 of 4 scavenger hunt find lists, then spin and move through the charmkins playhouse to be the first to find all their items and win the game.

name: Blokopolis
description:
Blokopolis is a cooperative game for 1-4 players. Players construct blocks by placing cards on the table. Will you be able to successfully complete the blocks before running out of cards?

Oh, and don't forget to achieve additional challenging goals before the completion!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Capitalia: Spontaneous Kingdom
description:
Once upon a time, passionate Fire, hardworking Earth, wise Water, and wayward Air spontaneously decided to build a kingdom. The Spontaneous Kingdom. However, the elements are very competitive—each wants to build the wealthiest part of the Kingdom. Join them in the battle for riches and influence!

Capitalia: Spontaneous Kingdom is a competitive family board game where each player takes on a role of one of the elements. The goal of the game is to be the first to earn 100 million.
There are 4 actions players will perform on their turns: move, visit, sell a building (optional), and discard (or build).
To move around the board, players will roll the dice and move their meeple the corresponding number of track spaces. When the movement is complete, a player must visit all the adjacent buildings around the hex where they stopped. To visit a building means applying the effect written on the building’s tile. When visiting Town Square, players trigger various events; be it a good or a bad event, players cannot refuse to apply it. There is also a Magic Tower that can help players with magic effects throughout the game. After performing the visit action, players may sell a building if they wish to and gain as many millions as stated in the current building’s price. Finally, players must choose between discarding a building from the market and getting the corresponding resources or constructing a building available in the market and spending resources for it.
To invent the best winning strategy, players must constantly analyze the situation on the board and decide when it’s time to buy and sell buildings. The game ends immediately when one of the players reaches 100 million in their supply.
It's time to become the most influential of the elements and the new ruler of the Spontaneous Kingdom!
mechanics: Events, Income, Open Drafting, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2022 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2022 Cards is a set of 1,500 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.
publishers: PT Games, Inc., Sideline Strategy Games

name: Shuffle
description:
Shuffle is a play-and-replenish word game, where a player plays as many letter cards from the hand as they can and wish during their turn, and then draws cards to give themselves a 7-card hand. The deck has 72 cards including 2 jokers (wild cards).

A player's first play of the game must be a word of 4+ letters from the hand (junior players: 3+ letters). After that they may play words of 3+ letters (juniors: 2+ letters) from the hand, and they may also do the following:

Swap a joker with the letter that it stands for from your hand.
Take letters from words on the table (yours or other players'), while leaving each of them as a valid 3+ letter word, and adding at least as many cards from your hand to make a new valid word.
Steal an entire word from another player by adding at least as many letters from your hand to make a new valid word. The new letters may go anywhere in the new word, but the order of the previous word's letters may not be changed.
Add letters from the hand to an existing word (yours or others') to make another valid word.


If you play all the cards in your hand in a turn, draw 7 more and take another turn.
If you can do nothing with the cards in your hand, draw another card and pass.

After the deck runs out and one player plays all their cards or no one can do anything more, everyone adds up their score, which is the value of each card in your words on the table, plus bonus points based on the length of each word, minus the value of the cards left in your hand. The highest score wins.

name: Crown Collect
description:
Collect all four crown parts from each corner and bring them back to your Castle to form the whole crown.
The first player to form the crown wins.
Buy assets on squares to improve your chances of collecting the crown.
Set up land fields and units to expand your movements. Set up a market and let your workers generate income. Set up houses to get working pawns to generate coins when others move by.
Allow your strategic decisions to shape your game so that you can collect the crown before your opponents do.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Income, Moving Multiple Units, Pattern Movement, Square Grid

name: A Very Merry March Madness
description:
In A Very Merry March Madness you'll use card values, special abilities, and bonus gifts to complete your bracket and help your team win the final game by the biggest margin! As a bonus, your completed game sheet can be used to fill out your actual March Madness bracket!

The game sheet features a tournament bracket, but unlike traditional brackets, you have much more control over the outcomes! Each matchup in the first two bracket columns is associated with a card suit. Each turn, you'll flip over two cards from the deck, and find a matchup with same suit as one of the cards. Then you'll choose a card value to write in one of the two boxes for that matchup. Numbers are limited, so you'll need to be strategic about when and how you use each number!

The numbers for each matchup are either added or subtracted and the total contributes to a power score for each suit/team. When all of the matchups are complete, the power scores are used to determine the bracket finalists and winner. Achieve the highest possible score by correctly picking the finalists and the winner, maximizing the win margin of the final game, and minimizing penalties.

—description from the designer

name: Scrum Disaster
description:
You are a company development team trying to finish projects on time. Assign team managers, developers, designers and other resources to get the work done. You have three weeks to succeed or fail.

You start out with 3 available tasks out of 8 needed to win the game. Players play clockwise around the table usually either by playing a card from their hand on a task, and thus fulfilling its conditions, or moving a task whose conditions have been met further down the production line. Most tasks need two cycles of fulfilment before they can be scored. Some cards can also be played to upgrade production line or as onetime effects. After everyone has played their one action, a new round is played. After fifteen rounds (three weeks) the game is over, ideally you fulfilled all your tasks, if not you score those you did for their point value. To increase difficulty, the downloadable app will assign random events at the start of some or all weeks.

name: The Perfect 10 Word Game
description:
The Perfect 10 Word Game is part of the Smethport Hip Hugger game series, with a foldable vinyl-covered metal board that can fit in your hip pocket, and magnetic pieces, which in this case are 98 8mm x 8mm letter tiles.

At the game start all the letters are placed face down, and players take turns revealing the letters one at a time. After revealing a letter, if a player can make a 2+ letter word with that letter and other visible unused letters, they take the letters involved and make the word on their part of the board. On your turn you can also take another player's word by combining it with one or more unused letters to make a new word, scrambling the letters if you want.

The first player to have 10 words wins.

name: Fast Blast
description:
Fast Blast is a game of speed and discard. Be the first to get rid of your cards to win the game. Everyone plays simultaneously with their 4 cards revealed. Discard your cards if they match the same color or number as the card in the center of the table.

Get ready for the ultimate race! Fast Blast is a game of speed that will get your heart racing! You'll need to hurry to outpace your opponents and be the first to get rid of all your cards. A game lasts only minutes, packed with sensations, ending with the glory of being first. Fast Blast stands out with its constant frenzy, no downtime; you won't have time to catch your breath.

—description from the publisher

name: Svemirci
description: Base game is the same as Pachisi but with four different additions that change things up. Now you can protect your pieces from being eaten, you can teleport around the board, impede movement of figures and reroll.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Take That, Track Movement

name: Spella: Alphabet Mahjong
description:
Spella comes with 100 Mah Jong-type tiles that each have a letter of the English alphabet on the front. [The set could be used for any language that uses the Latin alphabet.] The game is set up and played like traditional Mah Jong: each player starts with a hand of 16 tiles; a turn consists of drawing a tile and discarding a tile; you can claim the recent discard if it helps you meld; you go out if you can meld all 17 tiles -- your hand and the tile you just drew.

The difference is that the melds are not sets and runs, but valid words of 2 or more letters each. When one player goes out, each player scores 1 point per letter in the valid words they can make. The winner (the one who went out) thus gets 17 points, but they also get 1 point per letter in their longest word. This bonus can be multiplied:

Clean Out: If the winner never drew a discard tile, their bonus is doubled.
Fast Out: If the winner goes out with the first drawn tile, their bonus is times five.
Sentence: If the winner's words make a valid sentence, their bonus is times ten. (In this case, the words "I" and "a" are allowed.)


The winner is the player with the highest score after an agreed number of rounds, or the first to reach a target score.

Ten vowel tiles have small B on them, indicating they are Bound and must be played next to another vowel within their word.

If desired, a round's words can be limited to a certain part of speech (e.g. noun, verb, adjective), or a certain theme (e.g. sports, movies).

—user summary

name: Reluctant Friends, Bitter Enemies: The Battle for Sicily 1943
description:
In Reluctant Friends, Bitter Enemies: The Battle for Sicily 1943, three players take on the roles of the Axis commander, the American commander, and the Commonwealth commander.

The objective is to either reach the port city of Messina first (as one of the Allies) or to preserve your forces to fight another day by escaping the island (as the Axis).

Can you, as the Commonwealth player beat the Americans to Messina? Or can you as the Axis player prevent the loss of territory and troops long enough to claim victory?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Word Challenge
description:
Word Challenge was designed by a teacher in remedial reading to be an aid to strengthening reading skills in students, but the games it includes are fun in their own right.

It includes a deck of 108 cards (104 letters and 4 wild cards), 100 plastic chips, and a rules book with rules for 16 different games, including:


Word Challenge. A form of contract rummy. Each of the 7 hands requires a player to meld words of a certain size (from two 3-letter words to three 4-letter words) before laying off the rest of their hand.
Word Rummy. Normal rummy, where players draw, meld words and discard. When one player empties their hand all stop and score according to the length of the words they made.
Cincos. Each player deals out a 5x5 grid. For each row and column, the player who makes the longest word in their grid gets chips from the others.
Barter I. Each player has 5 cards and 10 chips. Until a player can spell a 5-letter word, cards are turned up 1 by 1 and players can bid on them with chips.
Read My Mind. In a turn, one spells a word and the next player tries to recreate it given its letters, getting points for how well they do.
The Chips are Down. A variant on Spoons.
Memory Game. A variant on Concentration/Pelmanism, where players turn up 3 cards and try to spell a word of 3 or 2 letters.
Go Dig. Like Go Fish with word making.
Quick Trick. One player quickly reveals cards 1 at a time in a row; when anyone can spell a word from the revealed letters they call out the word, play pauses, and they collect the letters in that word.
Chipper Snitcher. Each player gets 5 cards, and estimates how long a word they'll be able to make after exchanging up to 3 cards. If the can spell a word that long they get its length in chips, unless another player can spell a longer word from those letters, in which case they get those chips.

name: Truth or Fear
description:
The cards know your secrets, in this party-game version of Truth or Dare.

The game includes Fear cards featuring a variety of challenges designed to push the players' cringe levels to the limit. These cards are dealt face-down to the table.

Players then take turns drawing Truth cards and asking the personal questions to others in the group. If the person asked can't answer, or chooses not to answer, they can still earn the point by completing a random Fear challenge instead.

Guaranteed to get conversation going and laughter flowing, Truth or Fear is the awkward love child of the other popular CUT titles Truth or Drink and Fear Pong.

—description from the publisher

name: Smart Ass: Everything 80's Card Game
description: Stand alone card game, or expansion pack for Smart A** board game. Where were you in the '80s? If you lived it, you know it! Hear the clues and guess the people, places and things from this decade.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: Revenge: The Diplomacy Sandbox Card Game
description:
Players compete to be the sole survivor in a no-holds-barred series of power plays, standoffs, negotiations, and assassinations. Victory is gained by forcing other players out of cards and jealously guarding one’s own hand. Each player begins with a hand of cards each representing one of 15 different actions like stealing a card (Sword), countering/reversing effects (Mirror), or eliminating a player (Death). On a turn, players can play multiple of any single card effect before drawing to recuperate. Eliminating opponents is rewarded with a bonus turn.

This is accompanied with the legalization of every form of table talk including extortion, threats, bluffs, and the facedown gifting and exchange of cards (not always those agreed upon). The game is a diplomacy sandbox where player’s can creatively maneuver their opponents to their favor. Players have to make and break alliances and complete tense exchanges to gather the power they need to win.

At its core, Revenge is about outsmarting opponents through a mix of strategic card play and shrewd negotiation.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Alliances, Bribery, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deduction, Events, Hand Management, King of the Hill, Player Elimination, Take That

name: To the Strongest!: Medieval Army List
description: This PDF contains 152 TtS! medieval army lists, including background information on the armies and images of painted wargames figures. The lists are mostly set in the period 550 CE to 1500 CE.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Grid Movement, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – OP Kit – Store Support: Skeletal Warriors and Spectral Warriors
description:
The Dungeons & Dragons Onslaught: Store Support Kit Skeletal Warriros and Spectral Warriors includes incredible prizes for in-store tournaments for Dungeons & Dragons Onslaught! Each kit is designed for 8 players, including a Skeleton Warrior mini and foil Skeleton card for each participant, and 4 special Spectral Warrior minis for the top finishers.

The kit includes 4 unique sculpts each in 2 different versions, creating 8 unique minis for players to collect! Each sculpt is a version of a favorite character from the original four Onslaught factions! It includes 2 of each in the Skeleton Warrior version, and 1 of each in the Spectral Warrior version.

Players can use their Skeleton and Spectral Warrior miniatures to upgrade the tokens in the Tendrils of the Lichen Lich Starter Set and other Onslaught products!

These Store Support Kits provide prizing and incentives for new and exsiting Onslaught players to participate in events and play in your stores! If you've never bought an Onslaught store kit before, this is a great place to start!

name: Valhalla: Loki's Cunning
description: This expansion contains 10 cards. Only one card chosen at random is used during each game. Each card grants different bonuses to the player who loses the battle. The bonus depends on difference between battle power of the winner and battle power of the loser.

name: V Craft
description:
Each player is trying to be the best Vtuber out of all the players.

First, players attract a crowd and bid on their activities, which would earn them a spot on the shared schedule board. By the end of the game, players receive points based on who occupied the most time slots on the schedule board. Be careful not to get cancelled, or you will not receive new crowds for a turn.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction: Multiple Lot, Auction: Sealed Bid, Auction/Bidding, Income

name: Similo: History – Yi Sun-Sin Promo Card
description:
Promo card at Spiel '23.

Yi Sun-Sin
Text: Korean admiral who heroically defended his country in the Imjin War (1545-1598).

name: Similo: History – Heo Nanseolheon promo card
description:
Promo card at Spiel '23.

Heo Nanseolheon
Text: Korean painter and poet of the Joseon Dynasty. She left poems in Hangul and Chinese verse (1563-1589).

name: Drachenhüter: Der Drachenschatz
description:
Promo card given out at SPIEL 2023.

Rules:
This card can be earned by any person that scores 21 points or more, while taming dragons.
The dragon treasure is worth 12 points at the games end.

name: Million Dollars But... The Game: Anime Pack
description:
Million Dollars, But... The Game Anime Booster Pack comes with 30 new cards to either play standalone, or combine with your core game to expand the fun.

Million Dollars, But... The Game (based on Rooster Teeth's popular comedy series, Million Dollars, But.) is a card game that puts your morals and imagination to the test, posing the question, "What would you do for a million dollars?"

—description from the publisher

name: Million Dollars But... The Game: Aussie Pack
description: Million Dollars, But... The Aussie Expansion Pack comes with 100 new cards to either play standalone, or combine with your core game to expand the fun. 75 new gold rule cards, 25 new black trigger cards, and one game rules card for standalone play. Each card is labelled with a kangaroo symbol for easy sorting.

name: Robo Rally: 30th Anniversary
description:
If you thought that factory robots took the weekend off like you do (well, most of you), then you haven't seen a robo rally yet. When the supervisors are gone and the cameras have been angled to watch the ceiling, the robots take charge and participate in exciting and deadly race-battles.

Robo Rally is a competitive racing game full of robotic chaos! Program your robot to tag checkpoints, attach powerful upgrades, and turn this dreary old warehouse into a fabulous fast and frenzied fun factory!

Robo Rally: 30th Anniversary is a special edition of Robo Rally that features eight pre-painted robots, four new double-sided game boards, wooden tokens, a metal priority token, and dual-layered player boards.
mechanics: Action Queue, Bias, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Programmed Movement, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Transformers Deck-Building Game: Chaos Unleashed
description:
Unicron, the Planet Eater, threatens the multiverse! One by one, planets fall prey to the mighty Chaos Bringer, who gains more and more power as he consumes or destroys everything in his path. Both Autobots and Decepticons must put aside their differences to face this doom together and stop it, before Cybertron itself is devoured!

In this new expansion for the Transformers Deck-Building Game, you can play the likes of Rodimus Prime, Wreck-Gar, and Galvatron, and join forces against the all-powerful Unicron in two exciting modes of play: Co-op and One versus Many! Automata-Unicron gives up to 4 players a menacing threat to overcome in a fully cooperative experience, while player-Unicron comes with his own set of dangerous Starter cards and a massive Character card, ready to take on all comers in an epic One versus Many battle!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Rivals: Martial Law
description:
The Martial creed are masters of the equipment needed to hunt monsters. Their skill with guns, explosives, vehicles, and even drones are second to none. They will need all this and more when they also have to face off against the vampires that skulk about in the shadows.

Vampire: The Masquerade – Rivals: Martial Law includes a pre-constructed Martial deck, as well as new vampires and cards for the six latest clans: The Banu Haqim, Caitiff, The Ministry, Ravnos, Salubri, and Tzimisce.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror

name: Power Rangers Deck-Building Game: It's Morphin' Time
description:
A relic of millennia ago, Cyclopsis is a tool of war created by Rita and rebuilt by Lokar for one purpose: to destroy the Rangers! The War Zord, piloted by Goldar, serves as the flagship of Rita's army and rallies her forces to battle the Rangers.

But as evil Masters gather in the Power Rangers Deck-Building Game: It’s Morphin' Time expansion, the Rangers are enabled to meet force with force, bringing in more Zords to combat their foes. Will the combination of Cyclopsis and the Masters overwhelm the Rangers, or will the presence of additional Zords tip the scales in the favor of good?

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Team-Based Game

name: Dungeon War
description:
Dungeon War is a game for 1-4 players, set in an expanding dungeon. Each player controls a group of heroes searching for treasure, and a band of monsters to attack their opponents. The winner of the game is the player who has accumulated the most treasure at the end of the game.

The game ends when there is only one player in control of all the Hero and/or Monster Tokens in play, or when the last Dungeon Card is drawn. On a Turn when the last Dungeon Card is drawn, play continues until it is the First Player’s Turn again.

When a game comes to an end each player determines how much treasure they have found in the dungeon by counting up the value of their Treasure Tokens, and any unused Relic Cards they have. Then, they add up all the treasure value of each Monster and Hero Token they still have in play. The player with the highest treasure value has won the game.

Dungeon War also has a solo mode.

—description from the designer

name: My Little Pony: Adventures in Equestria Deck-Building Game – Scholarly Shenanigans Expansion
description:
Put on your thinking caps and line up your quills because it's time for a new curriculum for My Little Pony: Adventures in Equestria!

The new cards included in the Scholarly Shenanigans expansion will open up new adventures in My Little Pony, adding more locations, situations, hurdles, and challenges, while also introducing Twilight Sparkle's School of Friendship. This new set of locations will help you expand your horizons and spark your imagination. What's the first lesson? Befriending these six spirited students: Gallus, Ocellus, Sandbar, Silverstream, Smolder, and Yona!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Sharjah: The Board Game
description:
Get ready for an electrifying, time-traveling escapade with Sharjah: The Board Game! Be transported to the bustling heart of Sharjah's Central Souq in 1978, where the race is on to become the ultimate merchant tycoon!
Dive into an exhilarating challenge where cunning strategy and high-stakes objectives thrust you into the race to be Sharjah's wealthiest merchant. On the stunningly illustrated game board, Sharjah's Central Souq comes alive, beckoning players to harness dazzling Dirhams Cards, deploy game-changing Action Cards, and pursue glory with rewarding Objective Cards, crafting their unparalleled trading empire. Will you rise above the competition?
"Sharjah: The Board Game" is the perfect centerpiece for thrilling game nights with friends and family, promising an immersive and action-packed experience that will leave you breathless and hungry for more. Can you conquer the Soug and reign supreme? Embrace the thrill, seize the opportunity, and dive headfirst into this unforgettable journey back in time. Remember, no matter how intense the competition gets - "Smile, you are in Sharjah". Your adventure begins now!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Contracts, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Race

name: Ancient Shadows: The Shaman in the Demon Village
description:
The young shaman must face dangers of all kinds in the village of NewCastle overrun by demons. The search for magical items to activate the powerful talisman is crucial, and time is running out. A map-based, dice and pencil exploration adventure.

How to play
The game is a "roll and write and click" (the device is an integral part of the game, along with the use of physical dice and the printed map). Each level involves exploring a map of the demon-infested village, where essential items for casting spells, opening doors and fighting demons are hidden. For each room, we have to roll the dice and choose which action to take, between opening a chest, taking an item, facing a pitfall and breaking down doors.
The fights are the most interesting part, as we have to compare our dice roll with that of the device that represents the demons. To make things even more complicated, there are 3 levels of flooding for each map, which will force us to use the freeze points we have been given wisely. A challenge in which the device sets the exit point for each game and determines where to hide magic items and demons, making infinite combinations possible. We win when we have found all the items that make up the powerful talisman and chased the demons out of the village forever. There are different endings and different combinations of objects, chosen each time by the device. A unique adventure, but always different.

—description from the designer

name: The Brightview Haunting
description:
The Brightview Haunting is a one vs many possession-themed horror board game for 3-6 players.

One player takes on the role of a demon once bound in the town's forest. Its main objective is to permanently possess the other players (the exorcists) by pursuing them around the map. As an exorcist, you have two objectives. Find your lost friend in the forest, and gather special items to perform the main ritual that ultimately banishes the forest demon for good.

Work together or split up to find what's needed before you end up under the demon's control.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Rat Race
description:
Welcome to your first day at our innovative and exciting recruitment agency, explicitly tailored to our hardworking rat colleagues. As new employees, your mission is to assist our fellow rats in finding their calling in diverse industries—each with its own unique appeal. From the bustling sector of food scraps to the rustling sector of leaves and yard waste, you will guide your recruits toward their dream jobs in one of our esteemed trash-related industries. As you navigate this dynamic workplace, always remember that at our agency, every rat has the potential to become the Big Cheese!

In Rat Race, you’ll assume the role of a recruiter who tries to put your rats in the best position to succeed. Expand industries by building the trash pile. Assign new recruits to entry-level jobs. Encourage them to climb the corporate ladder (to earn a bonus when they become the Big Cheese). Or undermine the competition by reaching full employment before your opponents reach their full potential. You can win either way.

Rat Race is a highly interactive game with simple rules that yield a complex and dynamic game space. Filled with strategic and tactical depth, this game might leave your brain feeling like Swiss cheese.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hexagon Grid, Layering, Movement Points, Pieces as Map, Race, Slide/Push, Take That, Three Dimensional Movement, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Hex Race
description:
Players race tokens from their base and must successfully navigate to the centre and back on an ever-changing board. The first player to successfully reach their base again wins! Cards determine actions that can be taken on their or their opponent's tokens and tiles to help, block or hinder progress.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Pattern Movement, Point to Point Movement, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Tales of Danger #2: First Footholds
description:
Continuing the Tales of Danger story, First Footholds picks up with the initial villages established on the uninhabited archipelago discovered in the first game in the series.

Players take on the roles of village leaders, each building a village on their own island. On each turn, they will assign the people of their village to gather building materials and food, provide defense, build buildings, store supplies, and respond to events. At the end of each turn, new people arrive to help for the next turn.

The game takes place over 6 turns, spread across a Prelude and 3 Acts, with game features added and removed for each Act. Points are scored on buildings, events, supplies, and a secret scoring goal for each player, and the player with the most points wins.

Gameplay is centered around worker placement and resource production and spending. It is playable solo, and also with 2 to 5 players.

—description from the publisher

name: DIMOI Couples
description:
DIMOI games are crafted to encourage conversation among players, making them perfect for discovering, rediscovering, or simply sharing memories with loved ones.

The Couples edition allows you to (re)discover yourselves as a couple, to nurture your relationship, and to cultivate your bond.

This card game offers a chance to take a break from connected devices, allowing for sharing, introspection, and heartfelt exchanges.

With questions designed to deepen intimacy and provoke reflection, laughter, desire... Each question serves a purpose!

On average, we spend nearly 5 hours a day in front of a screen. What if we break the routine? In an era where new technologies and daily stress dominate our lives.

It's on these values and desires for connection that DIMOI Couples Edition was born, the favorite couples' game in France.

Crafted to spark engaging discussions, our questions help you to better understand each other and enjoy moments together filled with closeness, laughter, and tenderness.

DIMOI aims to strengthen our relationships and return to the essentials: authentic exchanges.

name: Mega Fighting War Machines
description:
A set 6-10mm Sci-Fi miniatures wargames rules for Mech combat.

The rules have been design for futuristic combat between war machines like Mechs (or Mecha) and Supersize Tanks, which you can add your own storyline too. Miniatures are available from a number of manufactures.

The game uses a points allocating system, which you placed counters on to a card. which are allotted to a system, which allows you to move, shoot evade missiles etc.

You will also need dice (D6s), three types of colour counters, enough for all players, damage markers for the infantry and print out enough Elements Cards for all Mechs and AFVs.

—description from the designer

Rules will be available for free later this year
categories: Book, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: City of Spies: Enigma Promo Card
description:
A Promo Card to be used with "City of Spies: Estoril 1942".

At the start of the 1st Round, the Enigma card is placed in a random Reward Space face-up. All cards in this Location must be face-up at all times (including the Reward Card).

The player who wins the Reward Card for this Location also wins the Enigma Card and places it next to him or her.

At the Start of each Round after the Reward Cards are placed the player who controls the Enigma card MUST place it in a Reward Space of his or her choice. If no player wins this card, place it in the next Round in the same way it was done in the 1st Round. At the end of the game, this card awards 2VP to the player who owns it.

name: Insectarium
description:
Welcome to the Insectarium, a museum of insects! You are tasked with creating a board of insect specimens for display in the Insectarium's main hall. You must use your gear, gather insect specimens, and collect tools to precisely arrange and pin your specimens in your display.

On your turn, you will choose a card and token from the yard and pin an insect specimen to your board. Precisely pin your insects, collect display tools for bonuses, and swap tokens for gear abilities.

During the game, each player will take exactly nine turns to choose specimens and gear, and pin cards to their display board. At the end of the game, each row and column of specimens will be scored based on type and color categories.

Will you have the most precise specimen display that will be chosen for the Insectarium?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Vampire: The Masquerade – CHAPTERS: Epilogue Expansion
description: The Epilogue Expansion adds 8 new chapters to the story, after the events of the main game. The story adapts to the choices you've made, testing your ability to persuade and lead. It brings three new clans into play (Tzimisce, Ravnos, and Salubri) expanding your strategic options.

name: Choconnect
description:
In the game Choconnect you are chocolatiers, immersing yourselves in a tantalizing world of confectionery mastery. Your task: skillfully arrange an assortment of chocolates to become the ultimate chocolatier and triumph in the sweetest challenge.
To set up, put the board in the middle of the play area and all of the tiles in the cloth bag.
On your turn, without looking in the bag, you take a tile from the bag and slide it on the board.
You can slide the tile from any of the edge spaces on any of the four sides of the board, even if that space already contains a tile. When doing so you push other tiles in that row or column one space further in the direction in which you are sliding the tile.
You are not allowed to slide a tile in a row that is already full (because you would be pushing other chocolates out of the box, we don't waste food!).
The goal of the game is to create a line of chocolate tiles of the same type either orthogonally or diagonally. The number of tiles needed in the line to win is indicated by the number of decorations on it.
Whoever succeeds in creating the winning line first wins the game.

name: Spirit Fire: The Slabs Realm
description:
The ramshackle descendants of a once-great civilization seek to prove themselves worthy of their ancestry. By uncovering the lost knowledge of this world's spirit-powered technology, they hope to follow their forebearers deeper into the depths.

Standing in their way: the darkness. Exposure is forbidden, and those touched by it are cast out forever. Preserving them is the safety of the Slab - a massive stone construct imbued with spirit fire - the last refuge of light against the corrupting dark. Equipped with spirit lanterns, the people search the ruins for the understanding they seek.

Of late, a mysterious voice has been heard echoing up from below, drawing people into the dark, never to return. What lies beyond the security of The Slab, and what strange secrets does the darkness hold?

Every realm comes with 9 resealable realm packs, 1 blister pack of cards, 7 PVC dividers, and a dual function display box.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy

name: Spirit Fire: Hidden Depths Pack Bundle
description:
This bundle includes a display box and 7 10-card character packs to add variety to the 12 character packs included in the character box. Use them to master new disciplines and earn advanced spark of life cards with triggered abilities.

—description from the publisher

name: Spirit Fire: Companions Quest Bundle
description:
Personal quests are standalone storylines and quest chains that can be added to your character's campaign. Each unfolds across two 10-card packs that will take you to the far corners of the world, solving mysteries, overcoming challenges, making connections, and discovering things long-thought lost.

This set features four quest lines centered around enigmatic creatures who, if you play your cards right, may become stalwart companions.

Includes: one display box and 8 resealable packs (each personal quest is 2 packs filled with story quests and character development rewards)

—description from the publisher

name: Spirit Fire: Winds of Wisdom Quest Bundle
description:
Personal quests are standalone story arcs that are independent of those that can be discovered in specific realms. These quests travel with you, regardless of what realm you are in. Each personal quest consists of two 10-card packs filled with tasks, objectives, and rewards, some of which will ask you to seek answers down paths that may by unfamiliar, or even dangerous.

This set features four quest lines centered around seeking wisdom in the unassuming people around you, the obscure places you might find yourself, and the pursuits that drive you from within.

Includes: 1 display box and 8 resealable pack (each personal quest is 2 packs filled with story quests and character development rewards)

Quests: The Wisdom of Instinct, The Wisdom of Experience, The Wisdom of Culture, The Wisdom of Music

—description from the publisher

name: Glorious Battles: Treasure Hunters Edition
description:
A hexagon tile based game with more than a dozen upgradable characters, monsters that you can tame and then some really hard monsters that will tame you!

Just shuffle and deal the cards each time for a different game experience.

In Treasure Hunters, all you need to do to win is find the treasure. But that means traveling through the safer plains to the much harder caves and not dying along the way!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pieces as Map, Role Playing

name: 8-Legged Peacock
description:
Wave right! Wave left! Put your fan up and rumble rump!!

8-Legged Peacock is quick draft-and -match card game about the mating dance of Maratus spiders, a.k.a., peacock spiders.

Match male dance move cards to the color and moves of your Maratus female card. Each round, players draft eight cards, then score points depending on symbols and colors. Mate tokens are awarded for getting specific dance combos. After a set number of rounds, points are added up and bonus points are awarded for collected colors and sets of mate tokens.

—description from the publisher

name: Wüstenritt
description:
Each player tries to be the first to reach the destination, the palace, with their camel caravan, whereby their water supply (water cards) must not be used up. If you run out of water cards, you die of thirst and have to return to the start. The winner is the player who gets both camels to the finish area first.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Jeder Spieler versucht, mit seiner Kamelkarawane als erster das Ziel, den Palast, zu erreichen, wobei seine Wasservorräte (Wasserkarten) nicht verbraucht werden dürfen. Wer keine Wasserkarten mehr hat ist verdurstet und muss zum Start zurück. Gewonnen hat der Spieler, der zuerst beide Kamele ins Zielfeld führt.

—description from the publisher

name: Valhalla: Thor's Support
description: This expansion contains 14 cards. These cards allow other players to support one of the parties who are in battle right now (something like betting). It is an alternative way to get victory points.

name: Love 2 Hate: Politics
description: When considering the current state of our politics, what can you do but laugh? Love 2 Hate: Politics is here to help! This 108 card expansion adds a slew of new sentence Starter and Finisher cards to the game. Mix them in with your standard Love 2 Hate cards or play the expansion on its own for a themed experience. You may hate politics, but you'll love this expansion!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Political

name: Bitter Woods Deluxe Edition: Expansion
description: This expansion includes an expansion rule book, a new scenario with set up aids and a set of new counters to play the scenario. The scenario is called Erasing the Bulge and starts with the Ger Dec 30AM turn and ends with the allied Jan 4 PM turn. This also comes with a double sided players aid with rules and optional rules on 1 side and a battle map and Order of Battle on the other side.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Was ist das für ein Stein?
description:
Each player chooses 3 real mineral samples based (if more than 4 people take part, only 2 minerals), places them on a corner of the game board closest to him and writes down the names of his minerals. The last player to choose his minerals starts. One player after the other makes a move with one of their minerals on the white spaces. It can be moved straight and crooked, even backwards. Each player must bring their minerals to their destinations via the processing locations indicated on the game board.
For each mineral that a player brings to its correct destination, he can take a new mineral from the collection. The player who brings the most minerals to their destinations is the winner. If two players have brought the same number of minerals to their final destinations, the winner is the one who finishes earlier.

—user summary

name: Marvel  Mission Arena  Trading Card Game
description:
Players face off by building 2 Teams against each other to determine the winner. Both players draw 10 cards from the deck and deploy 3 characters. They must then lay 2 hidden characters in the Reserve Team (these are the characters who will enter combat after the defeat of the previous ones).

5 uncovered cards are then played in the Missions Zone: they represent the turns and the main method of earning Mission Points: each time you defeat your opponent, you can take the first of your Mission cards into your hand and earn the Mission Points indicated on the card.

name: Pic-A-Chick
description:
Pic-A-Chick is a race dexterity game using pieces shaped like cooked chickens. Both players place their chopsticks in front of them and the pile of chickens midway between them on player then rolls a die, at which point both players can grab their chopsticks and try to retrieve that many chickens. The first player to accomplish this task wins as many points as chickens, the other player scoring nothing. The die is then passed and the process repeated for an agreed (even) number of rounds. The player with the most points is the winner.

The game is packaged in a plastic barrel similar to Barrel of Monkeys and to Pile the Bones.

—user summary

name: Let's Go Spidey Team!
description:
It's a race between Spider and his Super Hero friends to climb to the top of the Web Quarters. Whoever reaches the top first wins.

Players move by revealing tiles which can be orientated in two different ways, determining what each player's token will move (or remain stuck).

Simple race game for 3 year old kids

name: Noni-Coni
description:
Each player places a set of 9 cones, 8 pawns and a king, in one of the corners of the board. The aim of every player must be to occupy the cone pattern in the middle of the board with their cones. The movement always occurs on the black lines by 1 square, outside the square bordered by a red line in all directions. Once entered, the red square may not be left again.
If a cone comes to stand in front of an opponent with an unoccupied space behind it, the former jumps over the other and takes it away. Under certain circumstances, this capturing can be done several times in one go; it is permitted in both straight and transverse directions.

Anyone who misses capturing loses the cone in question.

A king can only be captured by another king.

The cones that occupy the center of the cone pattern can only be captured by other cones within this pattern. A cone that has already been in the center cone pattern, but has come out of it again, is now again subject to the general regulations with regard to capturing and being captured.

As soon as there are only 9 cones left on the board from all parties, the capturing stops and you now limit yourself to forming patterns with the remaining cones that count as much as possible.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Toriki: The Castaway Island
description:
Toriki is a hybrid family friendly game in which you play as teenagers in the 19th century who are part of the very first scientific expedition on an unexplored island, almost legendary: Toriki.
Within swimming distance from the Island, your ship sinks in a fierce storm. There begins your adventure. Will you be brave enough to live up to the challenges that await you?
The game is structured around a 6 to 8 hour campaign and you can save your progress at any point.
Complete the Almanac by making discoveries, craft objects, find lost treasures, etc.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Yomi: Lum & Argagarg
description:
Lum is a gambling panda who loves randomness. While he's fighting, he also tries to make poker hands to sneak in extra damage and effects. He gets random boosts every time he deals damage with an attack, as well. Argagarg is a wise water shaman, with a patient style. Though his combos are weak, his hex grinds you down every turn whether he hits you or not.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Yomi: Grave & Jaina
description:
Grave is careful and in control. His Dragonheart attack is tied for the fastest in the game. Sometimes he can look at your hand cards, other times he counters whatever you tried to do. His sister Jaina, by contrast, is fiery and reckless. She can damage herself to buyback her attacks, and to change her mind mid-combat in desperate situations.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Yomi: Midori & Setsuki
description:
Master Midori is an honorable teacher who uses a lot of throws. He can transform into a dragon to really power up. Setsuki is a young ninja who can draw more cards than anyone and do lots of combos. Her speed is high but her damage and hit points are low.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Yomi: Rook & DeGrey
description:
Rook is a stone golem with the highest hit points in the game, and the strongest throws. He's slow but he can punch right through other attacks sometimes. DeGrey is a slippery debater and a slippery fighter. He has the best dodge in the game, and while his combos are usually small, he only needs a very few cards to do enormous damage.
Rook started the Fantasy Strike tournaments at DeGrey's urging, to bring the many different struggling provinces together.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Yomi: Valerie & Geiger
description:
Valerie is a painter with emotional highs and lows. She's pretty good at drawing cards and keeping the pressure up. She can also get an extra burst of speed when she needs it the most. Geiger is a precise and logical watchmaker and a scientist who has time-bending abilities. He can stack his deck and save up for a really huge combo that's immune to the opponent's combo escapes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Yomi: Complete First Edition
description: Complete First Edition includes 2 full color playmats and all 10 character decks.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Transformers Deck-Building Game: Bonus Pack 7
description: A promo pack for Transformers Deck-Building Game containing 2 new playable characters (Blaster & Nemesis Prime), as well as new robot cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Valhalla: Valkyries
description: This expansion contains 40 cards. They are shuffled in the main deck at the begging of the game. New warriors and new type of frost giants have different and more complex effects during battles. Also there is a new way to earn victory points - you should fulfill orders of the valkyries by activating certain number of warriors, not using re-rolls of the battle dice and so on.

name: Hi-Seas
description:
The game consists of a battle between two equal fleets, played on a board comprised of 35 Dark Blue (sea) squares, and 28 Light Blue (sky) squares, two of which show Red-triangles representing area above AIRBASES.

Each side uses 6 Battleships, 5 Destroyers, 2 Submarines, and 5 Airplanes. One fleet is on ivory discs, the other on black. Two or four can play the game. If two play, each uses the entire fleet on their side. If four play, one player on each side commands and moves the airforce; the other player, the surface-ships.

The ultimate objective is the same as a naval battle, to destroy the opponent's fleet. Intermediate objectives are to 1) raid opponent's airbase; 2) destroy opponent's airbase; 3) "Cross-The-T" of opponent's battle line. These maneuvers are rewarded with extra moves or other advantages.

name: Brain Training Challenge Puzzle (Matching Match)
description: Match the patterns with colored sticks.

name: Throw Throw Burrito: Battle Pack
description:
This pack includes two burritos and nine new expansion cards, designed to refresh and expand the fun of Throw Throw Burrito (not a standalone game).

Gather your friends for a fast-paced, laughter-filled showdown! With this expansion, you can now enjoy the burrito-throwing action with 2 to 6 players, making it perfect for a lively group.

name: Blood & Crowns
description:
Blood & Crowns is a 28mm miniatures skirmish game that immerses you in late medieval Western Europe and the chaotic period known as the Hundred Years' War. Blood & Crowns allows players to recreate the countless skirmishes, raids, sallies, acts of piracy and all manner of small-scale engagements that hide in the shadows of history between battles such as Crecy, Poitiers, Najera, Agincourt and Castillion. It is not a game with hordes of faceless masses, but of individual warriors that puts players in the armor of the combatants at the level of fighting where personal combat was the most visceral. Where blood was spilled and crowns were won and lost!

—description from the publisher

name: Goblin Auction
description:
Generate gold, recruit goblins from the Market and buy your way to the top. Greed is the name of the game in Goblin Auction!

A Market is laid out with a selection of Goblin, Equipment and Action cards that players can purchase. These cards help players gain money to get even more cards until the players are overflowing with gold!

Condition cards create random events that happen every round and change the game. They can help or hurt players!

Once the players get enough gold, they can start purchasing expensive Huts. The first player to obtain 3 Huts, finalizes the creation of their goblin village and wins the game!

—description from the designer

name: The National Race Game
description:
The National Race Game is a simple roll and move game with the player objective of advancing their playing piece along a horse race track anticlockwise and be the first to reach the end at square 100. Obstacles in are on certain square where a player will miss a turn.

The game is listed in National Archives of Australia as being registered and exhibited in 1910 by Christopher George King.

—user summary

name: City of Demons
description:
Your tribe's survival hinges on accessing hidden knowledge deep within a ruined city's tech center. As the bravest runner, you must sprint to the city's core, collecting beacons, information, and junk with which to craft bizarre gear. Endure scalding pockets of radiation and evade the lurking creatures known as Demons that grow deadlier near the city's center. Beat rival runners to reach the core and secure your tribe's future.

A fast-paced, 2 player, push-your-luck dice game. With solo mode.
Race to collect beacons, info, and junk to craft bizarre gear and discover the core before your rival runner.

—description from the designer

name: The Raven Order
description:
The Raven Order is a captivating strategy game designed for two players who compete for domination in a dark fantasy realm. Players must build their base, train different warriors and send them into battle. The core of the game's strategy hinges on the players' ability to judiciously choose their build order. This critical decision-making process is influenced by the initial cards drawn at the game's outset and the evolving actions of the opponent. Each choice carries weight, as players navigate the delicate balance between expanding their realm, enhancing their military might, and unlocking new, game-changing abilities. The game mechanics are simple, but difficult to master.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Force Commitment, Ownership, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: Dystopian Knights
description:
Dystopian Knights is a 2-4 player adventure RPG board game. Fantasy concepts set in a colorful illustrative sci-fi world. Play as species of Hero (Humans, Elves, Orcs, Dwarves) from a distant land (corner of the board) and travel to the center to fight a random Boss, steal its Treasure and return it Home. But every other player wants that treasure and oh yeah, all Treasures come with a random de-buff to make it harder for the Hero holding it to back Home.
There are 12 playable Heroes each with their own unique stats and abilities, colored miniatures to match, 24" x 30" quad-fold gameboard, 350+ cards, and a handful of D6 dice.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Blast Track
description:
Get all the thrills and chills of amusement parks in blast track!

Create your roller coaster track with gravity-defying loops, steep slopes and thrilling tunnels that will have the park’s visitors go for more than one ride.

Players place tiles to extend their ride by optimizing their path to have a blend of different attractions including slopes, tunnels and loops. Try to make the longest path to gain bonus points at the end of the game. Whoever has the most balanced roller coaster at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Wroth: Venna
description:
Addition Faction for Wroth! The Venna are Northland folk, less a people and more of a coven. They provide a safe haven for those exiled from their kingdoms, providing purpose and meaning from the deep magicks of the Nort Woods. However, those who find a new home and place to belong must also make a deal with the darkness. Mastering spells and incantations dredged up from places not spoken of, the Venna resurrect more than just fallen warriors!

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Territory Building

name: Wroth: Paldeyn
description:
The Paldeyn Faction for Wroth are noble warriors. Their armor gleams in the noonday sun. They stride nobly into battle atop imposing steeds, horse and rider united under a single goal: to drive out those who might dare crest the top of King's Hill! Their shields are thick and their armor strong. Those who dare to stand up against a Paldeyn rider will break upon their iron will!

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Territory Building

name: Exscape
description:
Embark on a spine-chilling adventure like no other with Exscape, the ultimate test of teamwork and nerve. In this heart-pounding cooperative card game for 2-5 players, you find yourself trapped in a haunted house with only one goal – escape before it's too late.

As you navigate the eerie corridors and dimly lit rooms of the haunted mansion, all communication is lost to the void. Players must rely solely on intuition and deduction to decipher clues and select the correct door leading to freedom. But beware, not all doors are created equal – only one leads to safety, all others to certain doom.

Exscape challenges players to work together seamlessly to outsmart the house's malevolent spirits and traps. With each turn, tension mounts as players make critical decisions without uttering a single word. Can you overcome fear itself and lead your team to salvation, or will you become another victim of the haunted house's sinister secrets?

No words, just choices - Exscape or succumb to the darkness.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Masters to Mythics: Behind the Magic
description:
In Masters to Mythics, as practicing pestidigators, you will work to become a master magician. In this game of semi-simultaneous play, the players utilize the skills of their Master mentors to manipulates their own 3x3 grid of discs in an attempt to complete patterns to emulate the Legends and eventually rising to the level of the Mythics. Hone your craft to vie for the top tier of illustrious illusionist.

As a big bonus, after the end of the game, each player will have their choice of dozens of magic tricks from which to choose to learn. Each player will then be taken to a video (or illustrated detailed description) where they will be taught how to perform their unique trick by one of a cast of magicians who have joined the cause for our game: celebrating the history of magic and spreading the love of the great art.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Riddle Of Fire: One Speckled Egg
description:
Three mischievous children embark on a woodland odyssey when their mother sends them on an errand: You must gather the ingredients to make a blueberry pie, including the One Speckled Egg. But it turns out the Enchanted Blade Gang has the same goal.

Riddle Of Fire: One Speckled Egg is a 2-4 player set collection game where one player plays as the gang and each other player plays on a team of kids, all trying to get control of the One Speckled Egg. Each round, players will play their cards as goals to the goal group (for example: Most Blueberries) or as ingredients to their team's side of play (for example: a blueberry). Once all cards have been played, the team that earned the most goals takes control of the One Speckled Egg card. If that team already has control of the card, they win the game!

Riddle Of Fire: One Speckled Egg was made in connection with Yellow Veil Pictures, Vinegar Syndrome and Anaxi
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Water
description: Water is a traditional reaction card game: It is our first aim to get four of a kind of an animal. Once the first player to get four of a kind has grabbed a water token, all other players' next aim is to immediately grab a watertoken, too. There is always one fewer water token than there are players, so each round one player will be left without water and get a minus point. Thus, third and utmost aim is: Don't be the one who gets the most minus points!

name: Sorry What?!
description: The bad lip-reading adult party game where you have to make the headphone wearer guess the sentence by lip-reading.

name: Sloshed Mini
description: Sloshed, get drunk and get your friends drunker. Take turns to pick either a Tipsy, Rowdy or Sloshed card. Complete the challenge for points and choose who drinks or suffers with a punishment card.

name: Murder Mystery Cases: Murder at the Eiffel Tower
description: The body of a climber has been found at the bottom of the Eiffel Tower under suspicious circumstances. Use your detective skills to uncover who is responsible for their death… and why?

name: MMC Disappearance at Wirth Circus
description: Jules Leitzel, the star trapeze artist for the Wirth Family Circus went missing a few days ago. We need answers. This one play mystery in a box will grip you with online video hints and real Instagram accounts.

name: FPI Mystery: Death of an Artist
description:
A few days ago, Duncan Lomas dies under suspicious circumstances in the sleepy town of Westlow.

Unlike other mystery games, the evidence includes real props to make it a true cold case: photographs, transcripts, emails, passports, maps, screenshots and newspaper clippings. For an even more immersive experience, use your phone to access hints and bonus content online.

This Escape Room style game is a twisty mystery that can be enjoyed equally alone or with others. Working collaboratively with other players means this game is perfect for a date night in, a team-building exercise, or a hilarious dinner party with friends.

A difficulty rating of 3/5 means this game won’t be too difficult for new players but there’s plenty to get your teeth into. Suitable difficulty level for a dinner party!

name: Brutally Honest
description:
Prepare to hear some savage truths with Brutally Honest - the game that'll have you spilling the tea or sipping on something truly revolting.

Choose a question card from one category: Mild, Spicy or Hot Takes. Answer the savage question about your friends and score points! But refuse to answer and you're in for a stomach-churning forfeit! Roll the dice to decide which disgusting Forfeit Vial is coming your way!

It's a hilarious, gut-wrenching, and brutally honest game. Think you can handle it?

name: Get Wet Family Edition
description: The family trivia game where incorrect answers get you wet. Take turns to be put on the spot and answer trivia questions. Answer correctly and stay dry. Answer incorrectly and get wet.

name: Get Wet NSFW
description: The adult trivia game where incorrect answers get you wet. Take turns to be put on the spot and answer trivia questions. Answer correctly and stay dry. Answer incorrectly and get wet.

name: Demigod: Epic Adventures In The Greek Mythos
description:
DEMIGOD is a small-scale (3-7 models on a 3'x3' board) 28mm miniature skirmish game that allows players to explore ancient temples, forgotten labyrinths, and beast-haunted caverns as they seek out artifacts hidden by the gods themselves and hunt creatures of myth in order to amass the renown to become gods themselves.

The core book includes:


Rules for running the game player-versus-player or player-versus-environment.
Six different quests inspired by Greek mythology. Slay Medusa or the Minotaur, save the lovely Hippodamia from the Thessalian centaurs, and more!
Rules for playing demigods patroned by Zeus, Hades or Poseidon, as well as boons for each.
The ability to bring in minor demigods of Athena, Ares, Dionysus and all of the other gods of Greek mythology.
A party-focused renown system, so that achievements are shared between the party and not just focused on one or two individual models.
A growth system that focuses on actual deeds and not experience points.


—description from the publisher

name: 2D6 Dungeon: Haunted House Expansion
description:
This is the Haunted House Expansion for 2D6 Dungeon, a seasonal special, and features the rules and tables for exploring a Haunted House. To play the Haunted House Expansion you will need the 2D6 Dungeon Core Rules to reference, but there are some exclusive and themed rules below that make exploring the Haunted House quite different to exploring a dungeon. You will also need the Tables Codex as some of the tables referenced in this expansion are found there.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: FantasyForm: Ripped Apart
description:
The ground quakes and splits beneath your feet. The air crackles with sparks, alchemically charged by your rival’s ambitious experiments. As their strength grows, you must take dire risks to defend yourself from their pursuit.

FantasyForm: Ripped Apart is a 6-card expansion for FantasyForm. Each multi-use card, like those found in the base game, adds multiple elements to the game. Master the new Lightning Form, hoist the Obsidian Blade, hire the defensive Brute or the aggressive Raider, and more. New Encounters introduce the possibility for your Rival to attack unexpectedly, so be ready for a fight if you want to defeat them!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: FantasyForm: Twisted Up
description:
Smoke billows in the distance as volcanic activity surges. The coming eruption is a source of potentially unlimited power…if you can wield it more effectively than your rival.

FantasyForm: Twisted Up is a 6-card expansion for FantasyForm. Each multi-use card, like those found in the base game, adds multiple elements to the game. Master the two new Forms of Magma and Smoke, hire a Wizard for increased magical power, and more. New Entangled Essences make better use of your pack by counting as two of their Essence type, though they no longer include a discard power. Make use of this cataclysmic environment to defeat your Rival!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Mushrooms By Moonlight
description:
Deep in the forests at the heart of Mysterra, a once sparkling lake has deteriorated into a swampy bog. The magic crystals that have protected the land for centuries are growing dim, so the Queen has decreed that anyone who can claim a new gem and rescue the forest will be celebrated as heroes of the realm. The Four Great Clans of the Forest all attempt to vie for the glory. However, only fairies remember how to find magic gems, so the Clans must be crafty and build mushroom huts to entice the mischievous creatures. In return, the fairies will use their magic to find the gems and save the lake, restoring beauty to the forest once again. Will you be able to eliminate the quagmire and earn the Queen’s favor?

Mushrooms by Midnight is a 1-4 player game of shifting strategies and sinking maps, involving dice, lily pads, and mushrooms! Puzzle your way through an ever-changing swamp as you beat your opponents to attract the most fairies. Only with their magic can you collect the sacred gems and restore the lake to its former beauty, earning favor with the Queen at last.

On a player's turn, they must match their available Wishing Dice with an action card in their hand. Once a card has been used, it is no longer available to play (until all discarded cards are returned to their hand via the Rest action). Then, the player re-rolls their dice to prepare for their next turn.

Actions include:

Exploring the map
Collecting resources
Building a mushroom hut
Spending moonlight tokens to build your engine and enhance future turns by acquiring tools and hiring Scouts
Applying bonus fairy magic
Mirroring another player's top card
Resting to reset your hand


Points are scored for various accomplishments during the game. When the final gem has been found, all players finish the current round and end-game scoring begins. Whoever has the most points wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Map Reduction, Race, Variable Set-up

name: Welcome to Everdell
description:
Join the kids of Everdell as they pretend to be adults while the adults are wishing they are still kids. Welcome to Everdell is an accessible introduction for new players of all ages and features familiar gameplay to the original Everdell. Come along and explore Everdell. Gather resources to build the best pretend city of all! Welcome to Everdell is great for game night with friends and family. Children, teens, and adults will enjoy the beautiful art and engaging gameplay. Welcome to Everdell is for 2-4 players, ages 6 and older. The average play time is 30 minutes.


Easy to learn and great for families
2 options available for younger players to help balance the game
Fun game night choice for children, teens and adults
Great introduction for kids to worker placement games


—description from the publisher

name: Corps of Discovery: Expansion 1 – Insecta
description:
The Corps of Discovery ventures further westward only to find the woods teeming with giant insects. Only an airborne insecticide can put an end to the menacing masses that threaten to overrun the Corps. The ingredients needed to concoct such a poison are readily available from the land itself, but all of your precious scientific gear is back on your boat. In order for you to be able to shuttle resources back to the boat, you must first deal with the Ranidae–a monstrous, frog-like creature that lies in wait just beneath the surface of the river, somewhere between the shore and the ship.

—description from the publisher

name: Corps of Discovery: Expansion 2 – Vameter
description:
As they explore deeper into the heart of the continent, the Corps of Discovery encounter the Fezron, a species of small, sentient, blue-feathered beings. You share a mutual enemy with the Fezron in the form of the Vameter, a vicious, winged predator that claims the heads of its victims as its own. The Fezron and the crew of the Corps must work together in order to weaken the Vameter and then trap it. You’ll need to plan carefully and be willing to make sacrifices to give your sharpshooters the best chances of putting a bullet into the beast before it takes to the air to elude capture.

—description from the publisher

name: Corps of Discovery: Expansion 3 – Maldonado
description:
This Expansion has 2 modes to it: Co-operative and Traitor! The malevolent specter of a long-dead conquistador, Maldonado, is trying to exert his evil influence over the Corps. Initially ingratiating himself to the Corps as a sort of spirit guide, Maldonado quickly showed his true colours by spreading misinformation and lies that rot the expedition from the inside like a worm corrupting an apple.
In the Traitor mode, only one of you will be under Maldonado’s sway so you will need to root out the weak link to save your crew.
In the Co-op mode, Maldonado's influence is still felt, but you need to work together to save your entire crew!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration

name: Dice Pirates
description:
Ahoy! It's time to hoist yer pen, tis mightier than the sword! Grab ye some dice as well so ye can sail the high seas with yer mates, but just make sure ye are the wealthiest Pirate Captain when the missions have all been vanquished!

Dice Pirates is a game of piracy on the high seas for 1 to 100 players. It plays in 20 to 60 minutes. In phase 1, ye be rolling dice and placing components on yer ship! Grab some Sails, a few Cannons, maybe space for Cargo and Crew, then get ready for a real challenge! Phase 2 is just that, players will face increasingly difficult missions over 6 rounds. Can they make it through the Missions with Sails and Crew enough to keep their ship afloat or will they be meetin' Davey Jones hisself?
Players can also play a campaign game where they sail one of each ship over even more challenging missions. Over 3 games, one game for each ship, the players will battle new challenges on the missions and the player with the highest about on Doubloons at the end of the game will be declared the King or Queen of the Pirates!

—description from the designer

name: Flowering Foliage
description:
