Roll and Write Revolution goes Cottage Core with Flowering Foliage! Plant the most beautiful and bountiful flower garden utilizing the most skillful gardeners and tools to maximize your seed stash for next year!

This game blooms with a standard deck of cards and a game sheet for up to 4 players per deck. Get twice the foliage with 2 player sheets per 1 printed page.

Players will have to carefully manage their hand in order to play seed cards to their baskets. When the basket is full the player may plant their seed cards to their garden to potentially get tools and other advantages. Tools either disrupt opponents or help the player build a more favorable hands.

Just like planting seeds in the right seasonal order is vital for a garden- so are the cards order in each players hand. Each turn the player will draw cards to the "back" of their hand and play cards to their baskets from the "front" of their hand. However, players may discard cards from any where in their hand each turn.

Strategic play abounds as players embrace their inner gardener while planting their card-gardens. While utilizing only 2 baskets, each player has to build the biggest baskets they can by progressively exceeding the values of the last card played in each until a Gardener shows up (face card) and locks the basket and makes it ready to plant.

Planting a garden is easy but planting the biggest, most beautiful garden around takes skill, patients and a whole lot of strategic card playing.

Grab a standard deck of cards, a game sheet, and a pen then you're ready to go! Up to 4 players will all be able to play with 1 deck of cards. Each printed sheet is two player sheets which will save ink and paper as players can print 1 page, cut it in half and have 2 sheets ready to go!

—description from the designer

name: Boxtop Pinball: Haunted House
description:
Get ready to flick your dice, and roll to victory in this spooky game of haunted house pinball! Take down monsters, uncover hidden clues, and dodge trap doors as you try to rack up as many points as you can.

Each turn in Boxtop Pinball: Haunted House, you flick one of your dice from the launch pad into the cardboard pinball machine to earn points. For each die that remains on the machine at the end of the round, you score the number of points indicated on that die, plus additional points for various bonuses. Earn points by hitting monsters, gathering clue tokens, and staying in haunted realms. Landing in the summoning circle gains you an additional die!

Whoever scores the most points after three rounds wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Idol Alive
description:
Idol Alive is a live stage competition for fans.

Get fans on the deck of three idols and aim for 20 points faster than your rivals.

Easy deck construction in three steps!
The game is a live battle where fans compete!
Let's have fun in different ways!
Go for it! Top idol!

name: Karmageddon: The Card Game
description:
Karmageddon the card game is a game of survival and wits that thrusts players into a post-apocalyptic world reeling from the cataclysmic event known as "Karmageddon." In this desolate landscape, players compete to be the sole survivor in this Survivor Royale. The game's theme revolves around using your wits, luck and karma to survive the apocalypse full of vengeful and crazed monsters set to destroy mankind

Players engage in a strategic card game where they must navigate unpredictable challenges and outwit their opponents. Each player assumes the role of a unique character with distinct strengths, they take turns moving through the deck facing off against dangers, bad luck, and rival players. Through a combination of tactical card play and resource management, players strive to outlast their opponents and become the last survivor standing.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Move Through Deck, Storytelling, Take That

name: Escape: Murder in the 80's
description:
Number of Chapters in the Game: 2

TWO murder mysteries await in this box! The year is 1985. A new arcade has opened in town and everyone is there for the opening day. The owner of the establishment is a failed entrepreneur who is hoping this arcade might finally be his salvation. Celebrities have been brought in for the ribbon-cutting… from the coolest musician available to book to a fitness superstar attempting to make her break… Politicians are there to shake hands and survey the scene. High school students are skipping class to attend, while their principal is on the lookout, attempting to catch them in the act. It is chaos… Yet, as the ribbon is cut, someone winds up dead. It is up to you to search the arcade and to interview the suspects. You need to find out whodunit, why, and how before you become the next victim… And who is to say that only one person will be dead before the end of the game?

name: Escape the Genie
description:
Number of Chapters in the Game: 2

For 1,001 nights, Scheherazade told wondrous tales of flying carpets, genies, caverns of treasure, and villainous thieves. We have come to learn, however, that there might have been some truth to these tales. A huge sandstorm rages outside of the city limits on one side, while an army rides in from the other. Even more terrifying, however, come the tales that a genie has been found from a lamp. Whoever found this lamp has the genie under their control, and with wishes to be granted to their every desire, the palace is in peril. There are rumors that this villain controls 40 thieves and holds a cavern of treasure already. They will be nearly impossible to beat. Hope is not all lost, however. There is another genie, not as powerful as the first, but waiting to be uncovered somewhere in the markets of the city. This “genie of the ring” might be your only hope to save the palace. Can you uncover the genie, avoid the dangers, and battle an all-powerful genie?

name: Escape the Witch Trials
description:
Number of Chapters in the Game: 2

TWO SEPARATE GAMES are in this box… One of them is MERRY… One of them is SCARY. Salem Massachusetts is known for their infamous Witch Trials in 1692. Hundreds of innocent people were accused of witchcraft and 20 of them were even executed. While there are many theories as to why this hysteria occurred, from mob mentality to hallucinations, no one believes that witches actually were near Salem… We have proof that there may have been something to that rumor and we need you to investigate. One mission in the box is a family-friendly investigation in 2023 through Salem during Trick-or-Treat. There are rumors that a witch was sighted in town, but you think that someone is pretending to be a witch and it is up to you to solve the crime. Costumes, candy, and jack-o-lanterns fill this MERRY game that will put you in the Halloween spirit. If you are looking for something a bit more SCARY, we have another mission in the box. We are sending you back in time to 1692 to defend a young woman accused of being a witch and who is up for execution. Gather evidence to prove her innocence and come face-to-face with a real witch in your midst. This game is darker and more PG-13, with magic, spells, colonial punishments, and even some jump scares. Salem needs your help. It is up to you to choose which mission you will undertake!

name: Escape Atlantis
description:
Number of Chapters in the Game: 3

In this MASSIVE, 3 chapter game, you are tasked with finding the legendary “Lost City of Atlantis!” You have uncovered maps and research that claim to show the route to the sunken city, but they also hold a secret. Apparently, in the very center of the city, there is a strange power source that allows you to raise the city up out of the depths. Once you manage to do that, you will have free rein to explore Atlantis and uncover its many treasures! This won’t be an easy journey, however. Your arch-enemy, Mr. X, is headed there and someone in your crew seems very intent on sabotaging the mission. Even worse, there are tales of a giant squid that stalks the ocean around the city and, if the multitude of sunken ships are any indication, this beast is a formidable foe. Even if you manage to defeat this monster, find the city, and raise it to the surface…remember that Atlantis was swallowed by the sea once before. You had better hope that you won’t vanish back into the depths with it!

name: Escape: Sled Race
description:
Number of Chapters in the Game: 2

In 1925, a sickness was threatening the community of Nome, Alaska. In the harsh winter months, the only way to deliver the medicine to them was by dog sled. A relay system of sled dog teams was put in place and these brave mushers and dogs attempted the impossible… a 674 mile race against time through the wilderness. You might know some of these famous dogs… like Balto or Togo… but, there has been a change to history. The medicine has been stolen by our rival and replaced with empty vials. The sled teams have already started their journey and it is up to you to catch up to the dogs and to pass off the real medicine to the musher. It won’t be easy. Avalanches, dangerous wildlife, and frozen obstacles will attempt to delay you and the choices you make could add time or slow you down further. This is truly a race and only the cleverest of puzzlers will be able to catch up to them in time!

name: Metbetoch
description:
“Explore the ruined Imperial City of Metbetoch in search of lost secrets, powerful spells, and artifacts before your opponents can beat you to it!”

Thematic scenario-based hexploration and area control game with quests and combat, where each player manages their party of adventurers improving skills, getting gear, and discovering secrets while fighting some of the most dangerous denizens that have infested the city's ruins and catacombs.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Map Addition, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Million Dollars, But... Million Dollar Box
description:
Million Dollars, But... Million Dollar Box is the best box ever designed... ever. It has enough space to hold all of your favorite MDB cards and other things you wish to conceal. Plus it comes with a brand new, exclusive MDB booster pack of 25 hilariously stupid cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: El Món Als Teus Peus
description:
Children work together to discover the quantity of water required to produce a food or a product.

They will win guessing or wasting the less amount of water.
publishers: Departament de Medi Ambient de la Generalitat de Catalunya

name: アクアレギア (Aqua Regia)
description:
Aquaregia is a ladder climbing game about the ionization tendency of metals. Put out the metal cards that will become your hand depending on the field, and get rid of your hand faster than anyone else.

Melt the metal cards in your hand into the field, and the strength of the cards placed on the victory field by the first player who has no cards in his hand is ordered by ionization column, not by number, with lithium being the lowest and gold being the strongest. The field changes in the order of water → steam → acid → aqua regia when everyone passes and the type and number of metals that can be produced differs depending on the field.

name: DIMOI Family
description:
DIMOI games are much more than mere entertainment; they are designed to be conversation catalysts, facilitating authentic connection among players. By exploring a variety of captivating subjects, these games provide an ideal platform to discover new perspectives, rediscover precious moments from the past, or simply share experiences with loved ones.

The Friends version of DIMOI transcends ordinary conversations among friends. It invites exploration of emotional territories, triggers spontaneous laughter, raises profound questions, and even prompts moments of intense reflection. Each card serves as an open door to exciting new topics, encouraging participants to engage authentically and deepen their bonds of friendship.

Featuring questions specially crafted to foster kind exchanges, away from screens, take the time to laugh together, share memories, listen to one another, and delve into original and unique topics.

Playable by the whole family from 11 years old and up (children, parents, grandparents, aunts, uncles, etc.), each question is designed to strengthen bonds and enhance family communication.

With no limit on players, enliven your meals, car rides, vacations, family gatherings, moments at home, and much more!

name: DIMOI Kids
description:
DIMOI games are designed to encourage conversation among players. These games are perfect for discovering, rediscovering, or simply sharing memories with your loved ones.

The Kids version allows you to share a special moment with your children, listening to their needs, emotions, desires, and dreams. This version was developed in collaboration with childhood professionals.

Children's needs are constantly evolving: the need for autonomy, affection, security, learning, and social connections. This edition of DIMOI encourages your children to open up more, to question, to take a step back, and to better manage their emotions. Be the first to understand their needs, emotions, desires, dreams, and concerns.

Stay close to your children with DIMOI's positive questions to support them in their wonderful development.

Ask them DIMOI questions and experience quality moments filled with laughter, reflection, imagination, and positive perspective-taking. Enjoyable for both kids and adults, at home or elsewhere: children aren't the only ones who love DIMOI ! Parents, grandparents, babysitters are equally eager to spend precious time with children.

DIMOI is ideal for playing at home, at dinner, snack time, or before bedtime. With its practical and easily transportable format, DIMOI is also perfect for entertaining on car rides or family vacation evenings! Share unforgettable moments!

name: Starfarer
description:
Discover stories yet untold by the stars in Starfarer, a simple-to-learn and quick-to-play strategy game in which you and your opponent will spot stars in the night sky to form constellations!

Place your stars carefully to solidify your territory - restricting your opponent's options while trying to form constellation shapes yourself.

When you claim a constellation using your stars, neutral stars are left behind which can be spotted in straight lines. This could lead to a big positional advantage for you - or your opponent, if they're well prepared.

Rules include the full version of the game, which typically runs 40-60 minutes, as well as an easy-to-set-up quick version that typically runs 20-25 minutes.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: War For Elipzo
description:
An unholy army led by the Scarlet King and Queen begins conquering the Southern regions of Elipzo. Their Scarlet Legions will stop at nothing to conquer the Kingdoms of Order. The Kingdoms hold their lands valiantly, but corruption continues to spread. The Tribes fight ferociously and fear no enemy, yet the undead keep pushing forward. You are a General leading your forces for good or for evil. Take control of your army to outmaneuver and destroy your opponents army with powerful Faction Units. You will need to adapt to the battlefield if you want to save Elipzo, or conquer it.
War For Elipzo is a two person card combat game with elements of trading card games and tabletop strategy games but without the hassle of building a deck or army outside of playing. Using Cards as army units with special effects, players will move them in turn-based combat and use dice rolls to attack and use unique abilities. No need to open packs of cards to create a deck or build a tabletop army, just get straight to playing!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Wargame
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Escape from New York: Bands of New York
description:
The Bands of New York expansion is played by replacing the New York bot with an actual player, which brings the allowed number of players up to 5. The more the Heroes will make noise, the more cards New York will be able to play - and the stronger they will be.

New York doesn't play with mission cubes like the bot: it will use mission cards instead, trying to resolve some missions' requirements, triggering events in the game like destroying the gullfire or discarding a timer tile, approaching victory.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Escape from New York: United States Police Force
description:
The United States Police Force expansion is playable for 1 to 5 players, and it adds a command board, on which Bob Hauk is placed. Task cards will be revealed, with missions for players that will allow them to get Rewards.

Heroes will need to complete Rewards to get the presidential pardon at the end of the game, but there are not enough pardons for everyone, making the lone victory even more appealing than before. That is also more difficult though, because you will need to find the item that lets you remove the deadly charges from your body, since you will not get the X rays treatment escaping alone.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Gold Treasure Chest
description:
Championship Organized Play Kit

Run an Onslaught Championship event at your store with prizes that upgrade key components of the game! These exciting items will be highly sought after for the bragging rights! Each kit provides prizing for up to 8 players. For events with more than 8 players, stores should purchase additional kits.

Each kit includes:

 1 Gold variant of the Treasure Chest Accessory for the winner
 2 Foil decks of Core set treasure cards for the top 28
 Translucent d20s with gold ink and glitter (2 for each faction) for the top 4, or the top player of each faction
 9 Foil Gnoll cards for participants and the tournament organizer

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Loot Goblin & Dralm
description:
Part of Storyline Organized Play Pack.

The kit comes with everything retailers need to successfully run an in-store tournament for Dungeons & Dragons Onslaught. Store Support Kit 1 – Loot Goblins and Dralm comes with tournament rules and prize support for up to eight players. It comes with three alternate sculpts of Dralm the Sellswords Tortle Fighter, to be given to the winner and tournament organizers; 9 pre-painted Loot Goblin miniature and foil monster cards for each participant, and a rulesheet.

name: BattleTech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 16
description:
Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine is your ultimate target for tales of hard-hitting, explosive BattleMech action across the battlefields of the 31st century and beyond!

In this issue, you’ll travel to the edge of the Periphery, where a dying, sun-baked world breathes its last gasp; you’ll follow a daring criminal cult in search of dangerous victims in the Capellan Confederation; and you’ll have to outsmart or outfight other pirates to keep them from stealing the perfect score out from beneath you… Plus, brace yourself for the exciting conclusion of the serial novel Lone Wolf and Fox, by Bryan Young.

No matter where you go in the Inner Sphere, conflict will inevitably find you, and the surefire way to defend yourself against it is with articles on arms dealers to either buy from or hunt down, spacefaring threats both real and imagined, and the best methods for transporting your weapons of war. Then go deeper into the trenches with unit and planet digests, technical readouts, a cautionary tale of ten playable pilots, and more—all by BattleTech authors both new and old.

—Description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Linos: The Game of Twelve Stones
description:
James Ernest has challenged himself to make a game with minimal rules and pieces, with enough depth that it could still be an enduring (yet mysterious) pastime from a bygone era.

The Conscript will be an epistolary novel, set in the Dew Point universe (After the Fog, Shipwrights of Marino). James has barely even started that book, but we thought we might hurry him along by posting some of his preliminary chapters here.

Linos is one of the background mysteries of that novel, having once been a game so popular that no one bothered to document the rules. The title character, naval officer Galiard Gaspar Ewen, travels the world on many adventures, amassing a collection of game variations that lends just enough insight to take a wild guess at the mechanics of the original game.

The Pieces: Linos uses a set of twelve rectangular pieces: six dark and six light. Each piece
has the proportions 1 x 1 x 2.

Players take turns drawing stones from the supply, and adding them to the stack.

Each move scores points. Because there are advantages and disadvantages to going first, a complete match is two games, each player starting once, playing for the highest total score.

—description from the publisher

name: Fist
description:
Fist is a two-player abstract strategy game, in the same family as chess, tafl, and xiangqi. The game is described in detail in Alysa Wishingrad’s upper middle-grade novel, The Verdigris Pawn.

Fist is an asymmetric strategy game, meaning that each side has different pieces and goals. The King’s forces are plentiful, but somewhat weak, while the Challenger’s pieces are few, but clever. If the Challenger’s pieces can learn to work together, they can overthrow the King. Between the two sides stands the Verdigris Pawn, a powerful piece that can be controlled by either player.

—description from the publihser

name: Journey to The West: Eighty-one Perils
description:
Perhaps you have heard of Wu Kong (known as Monkey King) who caused havoc in the Heavenly Palace in "Journey to the West". However, you may not know the extraordinary creatures and the 81 perils that Tang Sanzang and his disciples encountered on their quest for Buddhist scriptures. Also, you may be familiar with the rules of poker, but what if we add stories of "Journey to the West" into it?

The Journey to the West is a thrilling and fascinating card game inspired by the classic Chinese novel. With taking on the role of the disciples, Shifu, monsters, and deity, the fate of your journey rests in your hands.

In this mystical realm, you will navigate your journey by strategically playing cards. Each time, you must carefully observe and follow the card played by the previous player. However, beware! If you find yourself unable to match the card, fate deals a cruel hand, and you must take all the cards on the play area as "Peril Cards".
When the deck runs out means that the journey has come to an end. Player with the fewest peril cards wins the game!

Will you possess the cunning and courage to conquer this extraordinary quest, or will you succumb to the perils that await?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Party Game

name: Virus!: Roll & Write
description:
The research area at General Hospital is experiencing busy times. You are students in practices and you are competing to get a scholarship at the center. Your mission will be to investigate vaccines against four different viruses that have the health community worried.

For such an important and noble mission you will have to manage all the resources at your disposal. Conduct clinical trials quickly to get ahead of your competitors and decide whether to collaborate to advance hand in hand or make things difficult for them... always being careful not to contaminate the samples with viruses!

Will you be up to the challenge?


El área de investigación en el Hospital General está viviendo una época ajetreada. Sois estudiantes en prácticas y estáis compitiendo por conseguir una beca en el centro. Vuestra misión será investigar las vacunas contra cuatro virus distintos que tienen preocupada a la comunidad sanitaria.

Para tan importante y noble misión tendréis que gestionar todos los recursos a vuestro alcance. Realizad ensayos clínicos con rapidez para adelantar a vuestra competencia y decidid si colaborar con ella para avanzar de la mano o ponerle las cosas difíciles… ¡siempre con cuidado de no contaminar las muestras con virus!

¿Estaréis a la altura del reto? ¡A trabajar!

name: Tailor Master
description:
In the bustling studio of Tailor Master, creativity flourishes and dreams take shape. This captivating board game is an invitation to a world where aesthetic intertwines with the recognition of graphics, colors, and the charm of fashion. By deftly pairing 'Clothing Designs' with the intricate patterns on object cards, they tailor their way to victory.

The starting player reveals an Object Card. Both players take the same Clothes Frame or Pants Frame based on the back sign of the Object Card.
Each player find the matching pattern of the Object Card on their own Cloth. And ring the Tap Bell placed in the center of the table immediately after confirming that they have framed the right pattern. Then, both players check together if the pattern found by the player who rang the bell matches the Object Card.

Whoever can match enough cards as quickly and accurately as possible will be the winner. Embedded in this aesthetics studio, the art of fashion comes to life.

name: Pop Com
description:
Welcome to Pop Com! Congratulations, you've just been hired to work for the best of the best advertising agencies, which means you must have what it takes to be the advertising stars of tomorrow. But to get there, you're going to have to work hard, my little sweeties!

You'll take turns writing slogans, designing logos, striking poses, role-playing, and doing voice-overs for ads... With so many opportunities to hone your multitasking, there's no way you'll get bored! So, over to you! It's time to create some sublime ad campaigns, magnificent logos and innovative ideas!

HOW TO PLAY
1- Briefing
Stand out from your competitors by scoring the highest total points for each campaign, deal or project that you land!

2- Brainstorming
At the start of each round, the CD draws a card and chooses a project from the 4 projects and reads it out to the other players.

3- Pitching
Pitch your great idea, alone or in groups depending on the task.

4- Debriefing
At the end of each round, the CD chooses the 2 ideas they liked the best. Their favorite scores 2 points, and the second favorite scores 1 point.

The game ends as soon as everyone has had the opportunity to play as the CD once or twice (depending on the number of players.)

THE PLAYER WITH THE MOST POINTS WINS THE GAME. As for the player with the fewest points... well... you can be on coffee duty... forever!

—description from the publisher

name: Zombicide: White Death – Jennika Survivor
description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Survivor included with the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Timecrash expansion when acquired during the Kickstarter campaign.


1 Miniature
ID and Equipment card
6 engraved plastic pizza tokens, replacing the cardboard tokens in the Timecrash expansion.
Massive Darkness 2 hero card and 2 equipment cards.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: Zombicide: White Death – Chang E and Hou Yi Survivors
description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Survivors included with the Eternal Empire expansion when acquired during the Kickstarter campaign.


2 Miniatures
ID and Equipment cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: Weather Report (ウェザーリポート)
description:
You are a shaman in a distant village. The village chief entrusted you to forecasting the weather on the day of an important ceremony. But you don't have any precognitive abilities. However, you hold in your hand a cursed talisman that can control the weather. Use that power to adjust the weather to your forecast!

Weather Report is a game where you manipulate the weather to make your own weather forecasts successful. Weather forecasts are made every round and the player who gets it right gets points. During a round, players play weather cards to change the weather. Read the forecasts of others and guide the weather to your own forecast.

Repeat playing rounds until a player scores a total of 10 points and wins.

—description from the publisher (translated)

In a round of Weather Report, players will start by selecting a card from their hand to be their forecast. On subsequent turns, players will either play a card to adjust the weather at 1 of 3 altars or will redraw their hand to get different cards. Each card played will advance the date closer to the ceremony date by 1, 2, or 3 steps. Certain dates on the calendar trigger events which allow the player to take additional actions to influence the outcome.

When the date marker reaches the ceremony date, a specific altar site is determined by drawing the next card from the deck. The goal for each player is to match their forecast card to the weather at the selected altar. All players who correctly forecasted the weather score points. The number of points earned depends on the value of the other players' forecasts and the number of players who correctly forecasted the weather.

Rounds are repeated until a player scores 10 points. The first to do so wins the game.

—user summary

name: Escape from Camp Creepwood
description:
Escape from Camp Creepwood is a cooperative horror board game for 3-6 players.

You and your friends take control of campers, each with their own strengths and weaknesses, as they attempt to scare each other around the campfire. The scares quickly become real as the cursed grounds bring the horrifying stories to life.

Now, tasked with a set of objectives in one of 20+ unique scenarios, you must fight to survive. Exploring the camp, you'll flip tiles to build out the map, ensuring the grounds are never the same upon each playthrough. You'll stumble upon items that may help or hinder you and events that will leave you making real choices, each with their own results and tests. But keep your wits about you, if your stats are depleted... you will never make it out alive.

Will you live to tell the tale... can you Escape from Camp Creepwood?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Map Addition, Modular Board, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: De Nationale Bijbelquiz
description:
How much do you really know about the Bible? Play the National Bible Quiz and find out how contemporary the Bible is.

Playfully, you'll find out all the time!

name: ZeroDay.exe
description:
"The .RAT (Regime of Authoritarian Tetrarchs - the New World's government), has created the ultimate weapon - A Killswitch in case the world's A.i. gets out of hand, aptly named ZeroDay.exe. Unfortunately, the .RAT also doesn't think too far in advance. Their precious A.i. learned of this weapon and were...angry, to say the least. The A.i. decided to take control of the program and have started targeting our bio-cybernetics (cybers). At first, they only targeted the .RAT and those close to it here in Shijima - the capital city - so us commoners didn't care much about it - hell, some were even happy about it. But recently there have been attacks against anyone the A.i. deems a threat…which is basically every human with cybers.
We didn’t want (or try) to get caught up in this fight, but here we are. Now, we’re on the A.i.’s shortlist, so the only thing left to do is infiltrate their databanks and destroy them before they get to us. And I guess if we save some lives, that’s a plus." - Syn

Take on the role of one of 8 unique characters and fight to reclaim the city of Shijima in this Cyberpunk-syle, cooperative Rogue-lite dungeon crawler.

Each sessions will have you playing through one of 10 random Operations, followed by 1 of 5 random Boss Operations. Throughout the Operations, you will be downloading Hacks, attacking enemy A.i. robots, Scavenging them for parts to build Mods and items, and completing Operation-specific objectives!

On your turn, you will have 2 action points to spend on a variety of different actions.

Load Hacks to your Processing Track by paying their PRGM cost - a specific pattern of 3 PRGM tiles that must match in color and position in order to play the hacks. Or save Hacks to play them for a secondary ability outside of your turn that will assist your allies!

Attack enemies - Each character deals either Cyber or Physical damage, so you must be strategic in your attack as enemies will have different resistances from one type of damage.

Recharge to gain life and re-PRGM your PRGM tiles in order to form new patterns to use for Hacks.

Access terminals mid-Operation to gain instant stat bonuses for yourself and your allies.

Mechanics:

Deterministic Combat - No dice rolling or card flipping. You will need to be very strategic in how you fight the enemies!

Hand Management - Each round you'll choose a card to play for initiative, discarding it after revealing. You'll need to play the right Hacks at the right time, while also saving Hacks to assist your allies in fights!

Deck Building - Each round you will be downloading a new Hack to add to your deck. Create a synergistic deck by choosing Hacks with PRGM costs that are easy to combo into, while also making sure to get a good mix of defensive and offensive secondary actions.

PRGM Patterns - Each Hack has a PRGM cost - a set of 1-3 tiles that must match in color and position on your player board - to play. When you play a Hack, you flip the tiles matching it's PRGM cost over, creating a new pattern with the backside of the tiles. Plan ahead to combo Hacks and chain PRGM costs to shift the balance in battle.

A.i. Threat and Initiative - Each round, players and enemies will be placed in order on an initiative track, determining turn order. Play faster initiative cards to go before the enemies, but be careful! The faster you go, the more Threat you'll gain, raising the A.i. Threat level and giving your enemies upgrades to damage or defense, adding status effects to their attacks, or if you go too fast, hitting their overload card giving them a 1-time effect that could devastate you and your allies!

Level up your character during operations by accessing terminals to raise stats.

Strategic Positioning - Take the high ground by moving into elevation spaces and gaining benefits to defense and range. Use obstacles to your advantage to keep enemies from reaching you.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Monster Kill
description:
The game is a blend of boss fighting and dungeon crawling set in a dark fantasy world where a cult venerates the dual suns. According to this belief, the emergence of the second sun heralds a time of cleansing for the earth. When this second sun finally appears in the sky, mysterious monsters wreak havoc, worshipped by the faithless as prophets of a new world. Players assume the roles of 'Blades of the Suns,' the armed branch of the dual suns order, who view the beasts as heretical omens and believe that their eradication will lead to humanity's salvation. The player`s task is to find and eliminate these monsters, often protected by the faithless cult. The game can be played in three modes: single scenario (where players engage in direct combat with the beast and cultists), mini campaign (where we play several scenarios in row), and story campaign mode . The game relies on dice pool management. At the start of each turn, the player rolls a pool of 4 dice to arrange actions and 1 die to determine the opponents' actions. At the beginning of each turn, an action card is also drawn, on which the player places one of their dice, granting them a specific pool of points (movement, attack, defense, skills, power). Using skill points, the player can set their active special actions from a choice of 6. A crucial aspect of combat with monsters is targeting specific body parts and flanking opponents. The game ends when the monster is defeated in one of three ways: by depleting all its health points, executing enough attacks on its weak point, or using the map to trigger a trap that defeats the monster. The game is designed for single-player mode but also offers a duel mode where players compete against each other (without other opponents).

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Action Retrieval, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: PolyPlots
description:
PolyPlots is an abstract strategy game and brainteaser for 1-4 players, aged 5+. Using 13-sided polygon tiles called polykites, players align and connect tiles to claim territory with coins matching simple math outcomes.
The theme is growing fruits on triangular plots of land. Coins represent fruit crops of varying values.

WOODEN LASERCUT COMPONENTS

50 polykite tiles
80 coins (4 colored sets of 20)
2 dice.


GOAL:
Score the highest points by claiming plots.

SETUP:

Shuffle the tiles and place face down between the players.
Give each player 20 coins of the same colour.
Each player takes one tile placing it face up.
Place a random starter tile between the players.


GAME PLAY:
Playing in turns, a player drops one of their tiles in an attempt to form a triangular shape of any color. If a triangle is formed, the player rolls the dice and forms an equation from the two numbers. The equation dictates which coin to place on the plot.
Alternatively, the coin can be placed on a territory claimed by another player, but only if the equation is higher than the value of the coin already in place.
Play until all tiles have been laid.

Claiming a Plot (Triangle):
To claim a plot, place the coin matching the equation on any complete triangle. The triangle does not need to match your color, however, all sections of the triangle must be of the same color.
Stacking Coins to Steal a Plot:
You may stack a coin on another coin of any color as long as the new coin’s value is higher than the top coin.

Equations (Outcomes):
Upon rolling the dice, a player chooses the outcome of a mathematical equation from the two numbers. Only 20 outcomes are possible between 1-36. The outcome or solution is from addition, subtraction, multiplication or division of the two numbers. For example, rolling 3 and 5 can yield 2, 8 or 15 from subtraction, addition or multiplication of the two numbers.

STRATEGY:
Try to claim an important triangle using the highest mathematical outcome. Knowing that a player automatically gets 10 points for each triangle matching their color, you can forfeit a plot by placing a coin on a differently colored triangle.
 
SCORING & WINNING:
Each player automatically gets 10 points for each triangle matching their color. Add up the visible coins of the same color. Total the two numbers to get a final score.
The player with the highest score wins. In case of a tie, the player with the most plots wins. If still a tie, the player with the highest coins wins.

SOLO GAME PLAY:
This mode requires you to solve a brainteaser by creating as many perfect triangles of the same color as possible using all 50 tiles.

—description from the designer

name: Mythorifts: Clash of Gods
description:
Embark on an epic journey in Mythorifts: Clash of Gods, a strategy fantasy card game where players harness the power of Mythologic Gods and Mythical Creatures. Construct a deck featuring Mythologic Gods(Avatar), Legendary Creatures, and potent Spells. Use Divine Essence to summon creatures, cast spells, and activate powerful abilities.

Two players face each other in this Clash of Gods.
Construct a 40/50-card deck featuring Mythology Gods, Legendary Creatures, and potent spells. Use Divine Essence to summon creatures, cast spells, and activate powerful abilities. Each element — Fire, Water, Lightning, Earth, Light, and Darkness— brings unique playstyles, from aggressive fire tactics to strategic water control. Engage in turn-based combat and unleashing synergies for victory.

In Mythorifts: Clash of Gods, to learn to play, players construct decks comprising cards aligned with one elemental affinities of your chosen Mythologic God(Avatar), each offering distinct play styles. With a 40/50 cards per deck, players strategically select creatures, spells, and legendary cards to craft synergistic combinations and execute their chosen strategy. In the advanced rules you can choose 2 Mythologic Gods(Avatar) even of different elements and build the deck (40/50 cards per deck) with cards from the elements of your Gods.

During gameplay, players take turns drawing cards, summoning creatures, casting spells to outmaneuver their opponents. Each card requires Divine Essence, a precious resource, to play or activate its abilities. Players must manage Divine Essence carefully to maximize their plays and maintain control of the battlefield.

Creatures engage in combat in turn-based sequences, their forces to attack enemies or defend against incoming assaults. Abilities, keywords, and synergies further enhance creature interactions, allowing for dynamic and strategic gameplay.

Legendary creatures and Gods wield immense power, offering unique abilities and effects that can turn the tide of battle. Mythologic Gods (Avatar) provide a active skills and an ability “Wrath of Gods” who can unleash his power once he reaches his required rage charge, further shaping the course of the game.

Victory conditions from reducing the opponent's Mythologic God(Avatar) health to 0. With diverse elemental affinities, synergies, and strategic depth, each game of Mythorifts: Clash of Gods offers dynamic and engaging gameplay, where careful planning and decisive actions lead to triumph.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Resource Queue

name: Dragon Clans
description:
Have you ever wished you had a DRAGON as a pet? Now it’s possible! You can breed your own Dragons and compete to be the one to train the toughest and most valuable specimens.
Watch out for dragon eggs in your rolls, but take a chance on your final move to get the best creature!

OBJECTIVE:
Be the one who manages to breed the most difficult Dragons.
The more difficult your Dragons are, the more points you will earn.
Be careful with the Dragon Eggs, but take risks in your final move to get the best creature.

GAMEPLAY:
Players can roll dice up to 3 times per turn. After each roll, they can choose to keep some dice and reroll the rest, but once dice are kept, they can't be rerolled in that round. After three rolls or if they're satisfied with the results, they pick the best combination of Eggs to get a Dragon from the table. If they fail, they return a Dragon to the table. To get a Dragon, players need to collect at least 4 Eggs shown on the card.

When getting a Dragon, it's placed in the player's area and remains visible. They can also choose to get the Egg on the Dragon's right, which gives them a Barrier card for protection. Keeping a Barrier earns an extra point.

BRED DRAGONS:
Bred Dragons are placed face-up nearby. When a second Dragon is obtained, it's placed next to the first, with an Egg between them. Only two Dragons can be visible at a time, so if a third Dragon is obtained, it covers one of the previous Dragons. All Dragons score points at the end.

GAME END:
The game ends if there aren't enough Dragons to replenish the centre or if a player reaches a set number of Dragons. The winner has the highest score, based on Barriers held, points for Dragons, and extra points for evolutions. If tied, the player with the most Dragons wins. If still tied, it's a shared victory.

—description from the publisher

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Order Battletome – Daughters of Khaine
description:
Order Battletome: Daughters of Khaine is the guide to fielding an army of the Daughters of Khaine for Age of Sigmar.

This book contains a miniatures showcase illustrating colour schemes and painting advice, plus examples of painted models. It also features rules, battleplans and warscrolls for fielding your Daughters of Khaine as an army in games of Age of Sigmar.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Death Battletome – Flesh-Eater Courts (Second Edition)
description:
Battletome: Flesh-Eater Courts is the guide to fielding a Flesh-Eater army for Age of Sigmar.

This book contains a miniatures showcase illustrating colour schemes and painting advice, plus examples of painted models. It also features rules for fielding your Flesh-Eater army in games of Age of Sigmar.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Interstates Wonderland
description:
Let's journey through the great American Interstates!

Interstates Wonderland is an engaging board game that takes you on an adventurous road trip across the United States, where your aim is to make the most memories by exploring destinations via the iconic interstate highways. The game is designed for 2-5 players, each representing a traveler embarking on a memorable vacation.

The game board represents a map of the USA; various states connected by interstates. Players start their journey from a designated starting point and navigate the vast network of interstates that crisscross the country. Along the way, they explore the country and challenges that mirror the real-life experiences of a road trip.

The objective of the game is to explore and collect the most memories along the way. Players advance their vehicles along the interstates by drawing destination & interstate cards, strategically planning their routes to maximize their memories.

Throughout the game, players must overcome obstacles such as traffic jams, detours, and conditions that will challenge them to rethink their strategies. Cleverly use interstate cards to gain advantages and outmaneuver their opponents.

As players traverse the interstates they will learn quirky facts about the destination states and interstates written on the cards. They have the opportunity to explore and make memories for each destination they visit. Additionally, they can interact with other travelers, forming alliances or competing for resources to enhance their journey.

The game concludes after a year or two year road trip. The player who has explored and strategically accumulated the most memories emerges as the winner, having had the most fulfilling and memorable road trip experience.

Interstates Wonderland offers a unique blend of strategy, luck, and exploration, providing players with an immersive and entertaining gaming experience that captures the excitement and adventure of a cross-country road trip through the USA.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Events, Network and Route Building, Simulation

name: Shape-A-Palooza
description:
Come play our original creation - Shape-A-Palooza - a fun, fast-paced, family friendly card game where players vie to collect card crafted from basic geometric building blocks like triangles, rectangles, hexagons, and circles. The aim of the game is simple: strategically collect the cards which increases the potential of your hand, and play your hand at the time of maximum impact. The game ends when an end card in the deck shows up, the player with the most points wins. Get ready for a whirlwind of strategic thinking, swift decision-making, and thrilling competition!

Game Contents:
4 Shape Cards - Triangle, Rectangle, Hexagon & Circle
1 End Card
More than 50 Thing Cards & Shape Shift Cards

—description from the publisher

name: Prowl
description:
Prowl is a compact area control game designed for 2 to 4 players, where each participant vies for dominance over territory with their tiger companion.

In this immersive game, players embody tigers navigating the wilderness, strategically exploring, hunting for sustenance, marking terrain, and initiating challenges to assert their dominance. As you navigate this dynamic landscape, you'll need to safeguard your territory against rival tigers while seizing opportunities for expansion.

Beware, however, as rival tigers are always poised to challenge for coveted spots, ensuring constant engagement and tension. The survival of the fittest hinges on your ability to outmaneuver opponents and secure the most advantageous land.

Ultimately, victory is determined by accumulating points from controlling valuable territory, ensuring your tiger's supremacy and survival in the unforgiving wilderness.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hidden Victory Points, Layering

name: Alliance of Wizards: Nether Portal
description:
In Alliance of Wizards: Nether Portal, fate has dealt a dire hand as a monstrous gateway to the Nether Realm cracks open, unleashing a tide of vicious demons, know as Infernals, set to engulf our world in chaos. In this desperate hour, you and your fellow wizards, once rivals, now find yourselves bound by necessity, forging an uneasy alliance to stem the demonic onslaught and safeguard humanity’s future.

This gripping fantasy-themed deck-building game combines cooperative gameplay with tactical combat elements. Designed for 1-6 players, Alliance of Wizards: Nether Portal offers a riveting experience lasting 60-90 minutes. At the outset, players wield a basic arsenal of spells, gradually enhancing their decks as they progress. Spells serve various purposes, from decimating enemy forces to conjuring minions and bestowing potent enchantments upon artifacts.

Your objective: navigate the treacherous combat track, advancing your wizard unit to the heart of the battlefield where you will cast a powerful incantation to seal the portal. Yet, with each step forward, Infernals surge forth relentlessly, testing your mettle at every turn. Every decision matters as you strategize to outmaneuver the demonic hordes and reach your goal.

Success hinges on teamwork and resourcefulness. Coordinate your efforts with fellow wizards, pooling your magical prowess to overcome daunting odds. But beware—time is of the essence. Fail to close the portal before it reaches critical mass, and all hope is lost, condemned to face an eternity under the infernal yoke.

With its immersive theme, dynamic gameplay, and nail-biting tension, Alliance of Wizards: Nether Portal offers an unforgettable gaming experience. Will you rise to the challenge and seal the portal, or succumb to the relentless tide of darkness? The fate of humanity hangs in the balance.

—description from the publisher

name: One Sheep, Two Sheep, Many Sheep
description:
One Sheep, Two Sheep, Many Sheep is a family card game about herding sheep and pigs.
Animals are arriving all the time and have to be herded to the right field.
Some need pigs, some need sheep and some, with the farmer, can have a mixture of creatures. As soon as the exact number of creatures are in the field, the gate is closed and you collect all the field and animal cards.
At the end of the game the player with the most cards collected will win.
Along the way you can change the number of animals in a field or change the type of animal being put in the field.

name: Hordes & Heroes Ancients and Medieval
description:
Hordes & Heroes Ancients and Medieval is designed as a fast play tabletop historical wargame, which uses hexagon marked terrain as a precise and effective method for moving troops. The rule system is simple and easy to learn, yet sophisticated enough to allow “realistic“ battles to be fought between a diverse range of ancient and medieval armies. It is easy to play, but more difficult to master.

—description from the publisher

name: To be continued...
description:
Five fellow gamers, The Collector, The Sore loser, The Strategist, The Stickler and Lady Luck, are invited to the game night. Play the role of a Comics creator and follow the adventures, on their way to the favorite hobby activity.

In this game, Players will create their own Comics Chapters, with 9 scenes.

The cards, they will use, are part of the five parallel story line (indicated by the story line icons), and their chronological order is indicated by a number (1-15.

Players’ objective is to create a Chapter with as many as possible scenes from the same story line. Additionally, their Chapter will score better if they will use cards with suitable numbers.

—description from the designerç
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Relative Movement, Set Collection

name: Sequence: Intro
description:
Play a card from your hand, and place a chip on a corresponding space on the game board – when you have four in a row, it’s a SEQUENCE.
Each player or team tries to score the required number of four-card SEQUENCES before his opponent.
The first player or team who gets two sequence, is the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Rail & Road
description:
In this tile draft and placement game, up to 3 players take the roll of companies competing to design the best transportation network.

Fulfill the requirements of public authorities, connect people, cities and industries but don't forget sustainability. Forest and lakes will provide you with extra reputation points.

Build the best transportation network and beat your competitors in this thrilling abstract game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: Factions: Battlegrounds – The Vitawaasi Expansion
description:
Vitawaasi warriors use their knowledge of the Savannah to lay traps to slow enemies and long ranged attacks to finish them off, while dangerous predators and nightmarish horrors seek out wounded prey.

The Vitawaasi expansion faction is the 10th and final faction for the board game Factions: Battlegrounds. This unique faction includes brand new monsters, spells and abilities.

Includes everything you need to go to battle against the other Factions:

15 unit cards (all with new, original illustrations)

5 savannah Terrain Tiles

Vitawaasi Faction Overview

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pieces as Map, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Partner Poker
description:
Partner Poker is designed for 4-8 players, offering a unique twist: each player is paired with a partner, necessitating collaborative efforts to secure victory.
The gameplay revolves around each player possessing half of a Poker hand, which they must merge with their partner's hand to form a Poker hand.
Each round unfolds through four distinct phases: The Flop introduces a central card known as the Piggy, the Gift grants every player an additional card, the Volley prompts each player to exchange a card with their partner, and culminates in the Showdown where players unveil their combined Poker hands to determine the victor.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Relic Takers
description:
After an eternity, a dungeon appears. Resting within are relics that were supposed to have been lost to the past. The people who brave the dungeon in search of relics are called Relic Takers. Yes, you are a Relic Taker! Gather your friends to help you on your adventure and set off into an unknown dungeon!

-description from the publisher (translated)

In Relic Takers, players delve into a dungeon in search of relics using 2 characters each round. Each character has special abilities and order, so players must select the best character for their needs. Outside of the dungeon, there are requests for specific combinations of relics (combinations of color and number of relics needed to 'complete' a request). Players must acquire these from within the dungeon. This is accomplished by drawing from a bag of relics... but a player's character is limited in how many relics they can carry. Get to greedy and spend too much time in the dungeon and your haul out may be quite a bit sorter than your needs.

The game centers on a press-your-luck mechanic in drawing relics. Players must balance this risk by drafting the right characters to aid them in completing requests. The game ends and the winner is determined when a player completes 6 requests or all 12 crystals are recovered.

—user summary
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers
publishers: メリーアンドリューワークス(merry-andrew-works)

name: Loch im Zaun
description:
Hedgehog Nig's home is threatened because the strict gardener Sepp is cleaning up his garden. While he trims the bushes and cleans the flower bed, the natural gardeners quickly build their animal-friendly gardens.

Who will be the first to get all the important natural elements together so that hedgehog Nig can slip through the hole in the fence to safety? Hurry is required before the protective pile of leaves is cleared away!

Get to know the animals in the natural garden in a playful way and find out how you can protect them with lots of fun and exercise! — description from the publisher

name: Peep Spotting
description:
Spot the Peep in the Crowd in this head-to-head "Where's Waldo" style card game.

Players reveal a Peep to spot. The peep will be on 1 of the 3 Crowd Cards. The catch is that 1 of the 3 Crowd cards will be facedown. Be the first to spot the Peep and slap card the right card to win!

Over 150 Peeps.

Each copy of the game contains a unique set of peeps.

—description from the designer

name: Bitcoinovej kanál
description:
In the imaginary country of Fiatlandia, fiat currencies are losing the trust of the people. The government has decided to act and is playing one card - cryptocurrencies. It has a few interesting projects lined up. However, it wants to see how these projects will behave not only in bull and bear markets, but above all what fundamental value they can offer people. Which of the cryptocurrencies will eventually beat all the others and become the accounting unit of Fiatlandia?

The goal of the game is to beat other cryptocurrencies and become Fiatlandia's official currency. This is achieved by increasing Fundament value to 7 or 8 and gaining 13 or more Market Cap units.

All players share one standee which moves along the game board. After rolling a die, a player moves the standee and resolves the corresponding action space:

Fundament: Active player takes the top Fundament card, reads a question out and all players use their tokens to guess the correct answer. If answered correctly, their Fundament value increases, otherwise it drops by 1.
Pump +, Retail, FOMO, To the Moon, BTD: Active player increases their Market Cap.
Pump -, FUD, Correction, Flashcrash: Active player decreases their Market Cap.
Whales: Active player rolls a die. Even numbers mean increasing Market Cap by that number of units, odd numbers mean decreasing Market Cap.
Market event: Active player takes the top card from the Market event deck and resolves the effect.
Consolidation: Active player is not affected by other players' actions in this round.
Speculation: All players can use their "long" and "short" tokens to predict the market development. Active player then rolls a die; even numbers mean market goes up ("long" tokens), odd numbers mean market goes down ("short" tokens). Players who guessed correctly increase their Market Cap and vice versa.
HODL: Active player gains a HODL token which can be discarded to avoid decreasing Market Cap.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Pie & Smash Card Game
description:
Cut yourself a slice of the action with this fast-moving game of pies and pairs! battle it out to be the first player to get rid of all their cards as you attempt to match the pies and get ready to smash the mash! with added wild cards aimed to mix things up and throw you off your game, it's time to get out of the kitchen if you can't stand the heat!

—description from the publisher

name: Flesh and Blood: Ira Welcome Deck
description:
Flesh and Blood: Ira Welcome Deck is a free intro product to Flesh and Blood TCG. It focuses on the key components of FAB - how to gain resources to play your cards, how to play out the cards in your hand by using go again, and how combat works.

After watching the 6 minute learn to play video on fabtcg.com, you will be ready to start playing as Ira, Crimson Haze and will quickly discover the surprising level of depth that awaits!
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Start Your Rockets!
description:
Return to the world of Rocket Ranchers with this new push-your-luck racing game! In the game of Start Your Rockets, you are one of six raceship pilots vying for sponsorship, fame, and the checkered flag. Drive as fast as you can but don't blow your engine! Throughout the game, buy upgrades for your raceship, speed past opponents, and deal with the effects the various biomes have on your vehicle. And of course, be careful of space cats catching a ride and frying your systems and causing malfunctions. At the end of the game the fastest racer (or the one with the most fame) will be the winner!

Will you be the fastest? Everyone... START YOUR ROCKETS!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck, Race

name: Titania: Forest of Fairies and Jewels
description:
On a sweltering midsummer night under a full moon, a festival of fairies begins deep in the forest. But the pixies are moody, the brownies are housecleaning, the gnomes are working in the mines, and the trolls are sitting idly by. The leprechauns are accumulating rune stones, and the goblins are playing tricks. Oberon, the arrogant king of the fairies, can't read the mood, and Titania, the queen, is touring the forest with her fairy friends in tow. Gathering such fickle fairies is a difficult task. Fortunately, they love shiny rune stones that contain the power of fire, water, earth, and trees! To convince the fairies to participate in the festival, you must give them the rune stones they desire.

In Titania, each player drafts rune stones from a shared board. Players use their rune stones to pay the cost of summoning fairy cards from a common deck. Each fairy has its own special ability, so players must use these abilities to summon the highest scoring fairies!

The game ends when the deck runs out of cards. The player with the most victory points on their fairy cards wins. Gain bonus points by creating sets of matching fairies. (The game includes special rules for solo play.)

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Chester: Four Sisters and a Magical House
description:
In a village lived four witch sisters. Their elder said to them, "I'll give you some land on the outskirts of the village. You can build a mansion there to live." And so the four sisters began building a house together. The rooms they create are magical, leading to unexpected places when you open the door. The selfish girls use their familiars to create the rooms they like; the eldest daughter loves gardening, the second sister obsesses over cooking and eating, the third daughter who craves books, and the third daughter's hobby is sleeping. Of these witches, who will contribute the most to building their mansion with its mysterious layout?

In each turn of Chester, a player chooses one room tile from their hand and adds it to the mansion, marking it with one of their cubes. Each room has colored arrows at each exit to show the room's requirements, and the player covers those arrows with cubes as the conditions are met. Once a room is completed, the player who placed it receives the points written on the tile. Players continue to complete their rooms and collect points, and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins. (The game includes special rules for solo play.)

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Monopoly: Édition de Lyon
description: Monopoly, the world’s most popular board game, with a Lyon, France theme. Limited issue of 10,000 copies.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Kaos in the Catacombs
description:
A one-page dungeon crawl for solo players!
Enter a room, roll a d6, kill monsters or buy potions, defeat the Squeleton King and try to get out of the catacombs.
Good luck!

name: Karni
description:
Karni is a tile-laying polyomino game for 2-4 players.
You assume the role of a farmer on a plot of swampy land. The only thing that grows on your land is your carnivorous plant. Attract flys to grow your plant. Attract men in PointyHats to feed your plant even meatier snacks. The farmer who grows the most impressive plant wins the game.

Each turn you will attract Flys and PointyHats to your farm. Flys and PointyHats are fed to your plant and become a game currency to claim new tiles to grow your plant.
Surround Clearings to unlock Attractions and lure more Flys and PointyHats.
Players score victory points by completing various objectives such as covering all the spaces on their farm game board to unique objectives defined by objective cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Ark Awakening: Sealed Section
description: Neutral Factions, Side Missions and two new playable asymetric Factions - the Raghna and Qfin.

name: Cartaventura: Les Trois Mousquetaires – Au nom du Roi
description:
The game where you are the hero.

Cartaventura offers historical adventures in pocket format, “Book in which you are the hero” style. Players build their adventure using cards that offer different options. They think together about the best choices in order to follow in the footsteps of the game's hero. Thanks to rich scenarios and magnificent watercolor illustrations, they are truly immersed in different eras of History.

The game system, simple and unique, allows you to replay each scenario several times in order to discover all the possible endings. In The Three Musketeers, discover 3 different endings, including 2 alternatives!
Scenario: Richelieu has Constance Bonacieux kidnapped and d’Artagnan imprisoned. In prison, he meets Benjamin de la Fère, a Huguenot activist captured for espionage. He reveals to him that an attack against Louis XIII is to take place during Gaston's wedding. Benjamin had sought to warn the King, but was captured and imprisoned by Richelieu, who seemed to protect the conspirators for obscure reasons.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Fifteen Minute Jutland
description:
A set of rules allowing teams of players and umpires to recreate the battle of Jutland, 1916.

The actual movement and combat rules are very simple - the core of the game consists in the use of umpires who provide the players with realistically limited and inaccurate information on which to base their decisions.

The rules were published in issue 80 of Miniature Wargames, October 1990.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Street Masters: Rise of the Kingdom
description:
A SteamForged Games KS repack of

Street Masters
Street Masters SG
Legend of Oni Expansion
Twin Tiger Expansion
Redemption Pack 1
categories: Adventure, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Street Masters II: Aftershock
description:
SteamForged Repack containing:

Street Masters: Aftershock
Street Masters: Aftershock Stretch Goals
Street Masters: Essence of Evil
Street Masters: Redemption pack II
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Street Masters III: Tide of the Dragon
description:
SteamForged repack of:

Tide of the Dragon Expansion
Rumble Pack
New Challengers Pack
categories: Adventure, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Street Masters IV: Lament of the Blood Moon
description:
This brand new and exclusive expansion introduces the next chapter in the Street Masters story, featuring the elegant-yet-deadly Blood Moon and all her intimidating minions!
Description from the publisher.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Order of the Day: Normandy
description:
A two-player boardgame about the Normandy invasion of June, 1944, playable in 45-120 minutes that is not a complicated wargame.

Played in IGOUGO fashion, players move units from area to area across northern France and Belgium. Combat occurs at the end of a turn in any area where both sides have forces and is resolved with a draw of cards. The cards inflict hits on opposing units with 'bonus hits' caused by having specific types of units in the battle (Panzers, Rangers, Artillery, etc).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Force Commitment, Multi-Use Cards

name: Arcane Acres
description:
Arcane Acres is a card-drafting and tetromino tile placement game for 1-4 Players.

Become a caretaker of the Sanctuary for Mythical Creatures to create the most harmonious habitat! Taking turns drafting the Creatures and expanding their Sanctuary, Players seek to shelter magical animals while shaping a perfect home for them to live in.

The goal of the game is to build an optimal Sanctuary and find Creatures that naturally work together to score points. At the end of the game, the Player with the most points wins.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Matching, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: The Botch is Back
description:
In The Botch Is Back, we return to the chaotic bluffing-lying-hurting playstyle of The Botch, but with a Canadian flair. The ferry between Seattle and Vancouver is a perfect place for white collar crimes to take a quick breather, for big deals and small crimes to go unnoticed. It's also a perfect place for knuckle-busting blue-collar good-natured crooks to try and get their end in, hauling booze or maple syrup across the border. You get bad folk in closed spaces trying to get their own in, and what can possibly go wrong?

Everything!

Meant to evoke those chaotic crime movies where everything's going wrong, The Botch Is Back is a party game of hidden information and ridiculous messes. It's a game about bluffing and nerve, about pulling off a con, and about grabbing the jewels and running. In The Botch, you're going to lie, cheat and steal, and if you're really lucky you'll get out of this with your skin intact.

The Botch Is Back is a hidden-information bluffing game designed to keep things reasonably chaotic and make it hard for players to get an overwhelming edge through experience and memorisation. It's a game to get people into gaming, where things going embarassingly wrong is part of the design.

The Botch Is Back contains 5 Basic roles and 5 Basic items, which are designed to be played as an entry-level stable game. As you become more comfortable with the game you can add more roles and more items, choosing from an additional 7 Advanced roles and 7 Advanced items.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Memory, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Riddle Of Fire: One Speckled Egg – Petal
description:
Promo card for Riddle Of Fire: One Speckled Egg.


Petal
Change any ingredient to a Syrup.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Super
description:
Over a decade ago, the legendary superhero agency, "The Guardians," closed its doors, shaken by a political scandal of unparalleled magnitude. To this day, with its 60 million followers, no other superhero group has managed to captivate the masses in the same way. The disappearance of The Guardians left a vast void, an empty throne at the pinnacle of superhero glory, waiting for the one who can rekindle the flame of universal admiration.

You, the ambitious director of a major Super agency, are determined to change that and inscribe your name and that of your agency in history. The race to surpass the mythical threshold of 60 million followers is on, and you're at the forefront, ready to take on the challenge.

Your arsenal? A collection of Supers with unmatched talents, each proudly displaying the colors of their Alliance, demonstrating their power through the number of stars that glitter next to their name, and most importantly, possessing unique powers that, under certain conditions, can turn the tide of a mission. Every recruitment is a step closer to glory, every mission accomplished a chance to gain new followers.

Completed missions will allow you to acquire various bonuses and precious resources to strengthen your agency. But the ultimate reward is not measured in material wealth; it's measured in millions of followers.

The goal of the game? Attract 60 million followers as quickly as possible. How? By recruiting superheroes. Each hero has their color, their strength represented by stars, and a special power that can aid during missions. The missions themselves provide bonuses and, most importantly, can earn you millions of fans.

It's a race against time to become the number one superhero agency. Every choice counts, and every second is precious. So, are you ready to take on the challenge and make history?

—description from the publisher

name: Extraordinary Rendition: A Mission Pack for Exploit Zero
description:
Extraordinary Rendition is a five-part, mini-campaign for the solo/cooperative miniatures war game, Exploit Zero.

Designed for beginner to intermediate level players, the missions are presented in a linked, narrative format which can be run over the course of several sessions, or perhaps a single, frenzied day of cyberpunk espionage and mayhem.

In Extraordinary Rendition, your four Agents are tasked to 'reacquire' a corporate defector, defend and deliver him safely to waiting transport, then initiate follow-up operations to keep the competition off balance.

This supplement includes four pre-generated player Agent profiles, generic H-SEC stats, one unique H-SEC Agent profile, as well as mission briefs and set up suggestions for each game.

—description from the publisher

name: Smuggler's Neck: A Case File for When Nightmares Come
description:
People are disappearing on the Waterfront - corner boys and hookers, immigrants and vagrants. The discarded and downcast.

So far, the police have kept it out of the news, explaining away the incidents as drug overdoes, gang violence, tragic accidents, and poor life choices.

But your contacts on the streets say that's a lie; something is stalking the homeless, the helpless, the vulnerable. Someting fast, something mean. Something unnatural.

The police won't listen. Social services doesn't believe them. The local residents don't care. Can you and your Nightwatch friends help?







Smuggler's Neck is a six-mission campaign supplement for Osprey Wargames' When Nightmares Come - An Investigative Wargame of Supernatural Horror.

—description from the publisher

name: Chekoes
description:
A checkers variant with scoring. The board has numbered spaces, & players would have to track their score through the game on sheets of paper. The winner is the player with the highest score, not the player with the last remaining piece.

—user summary

name: GrammarnistA1
description:
GrammarnistA1: Do you think grammar is complicated? (2-4 Players)

Embrace the challenge and sharpen your grammatical skills in GrammarnistA1! This fast-paced educational board game for 2-4 players is designed to test your knowledge of English grammar in a fun and engaging way. Whether you're a seasoned wordsmith or a student eager to improve, GrammarnistA1 caters to a range of skill levels.

Gameplay: Players take turns making sentences that are GRAMMATICALLY correct. Each 30-second turn, players can form sentences with their decks (or even other players' ones). Throughout the game, there are function cards to spice up the rounds.

The Goal: The ultimate objective is to be the first player to score 30 points. These points can be accumulated by successfully making up sentences and completing missions. Along the way, players can utilize exciting power-up cards that grant temporary advantages or hinder your opponent's progress. By creatively coming up with accurate sentences and strategically using power-ups, you'll solidify your grasp of English grammar and emerge victorious!

The theme: The game is heavily inspired by the ways Vietnamese people learn English grammar. Hence, the art and concept of the game capture some Vietnamese cultural aspects.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Timer, Hand Management, Take That

name: LandXcape: Das geheimnisvolle Amulett
description:
Exciting escape game for children aged 12 and up, as well as adults, across Bavaria.

After the escape room, comes the escape region: The original home escape game takes players on a journey through Bavaria with 50 puzzle cards - passing by the most famous landmarks from Franconia through the Upper Palatinate to Lower and Upper Bavaria. In search of the solution to the puzzle, players must tackle tricky tasks, think outside the box, and cleverly combine clues. The puzzle game can be played multiple times by two or more players. It has a moderate level of difficulty and is suitable for both beginners and experienced escape room enthusiasts.

name: Cyberpunk Edgerunners: Combat Zone
description:
Fans of Cyberpunk will be able to bring their favorite characters, such as Maine, David, Lucy, Rebecca, and more, to the table for epic battles against Adam Smasher and the Arasaka Corporation.
