Cyberpunk Edgerunners: Combat Zone features a brand new 2-Player Starter box that is fully loaded with beautiful, full-color acrylic StandUpz™, a rule book, scenarios, double-sided game board, scenery, game cards, dice, limiters, and tokens, allowing players to play cinematic games straight out of the box, with minimal setup.

Using Monster Fight Club’s acclaimed [RE]action System, Edgerunners is 100% fully compatible with the existing Cyberpunk RED: Combat Zone game, giving players who wish to play anachronistic “what if” games the full freedom to do so.

Edgerunners will launch alongside supporting products, such as a full range of miniatures for hobby enthusiasts and Combat Zone veterans, as well as a special collector’s miniature of the moment Adam Smasher makes his infamous introduction.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: LandXcape: Der Schatz der Freibeuter
description:
Exciting escape game for children aged 12 and up, as well as adults, across Nothern Germany

The next escape room is called Escape Region: On 50 puzzle cards, this thrilling escape game leads along the coast of the North and Baltic Seas, passing by famous landmarks. In pursuit of the treasure of the pirates, tricky tasks must be solved, cleverly combined, and thought outside the box. The puzzle game has a moderate level of difficulty and is suitable for beginners, but also brings enjoyment to experienced escape room enthusiasts. Two or more players can play the North Germany escape game multiple times.

name: Rolling Carpets
description:
In Rolling Carpets, players become merchants who weave and sell magic carpets.

The active player rolls four dice, takes one, two, or three dice and draws a carpet pattern on the loom board that matches the eyes of those dice.
If you complete a square carpet that meets the conditions as shown on the guest card, you can cut and sell the carpet to the customer and earn points and rewards.

The player with the most points wins.

—description from the designer

name: Spätzli & Plätzli
description:
A new chef is being sought: That's why the candidates meet to compete in the kitchen to find out which of them has the potential to become the new chef. However, things are hectic in the kitchen and the appropriate ingredients are needed for the required dishes. And ultimately the player who keeps track of things and prepares the desired food and dishes the fastest wins.
The goal of the game is to get the ingredients needed for the open recipes as quickly as possible so that you can prepare them before the other players. The player who first collects recipe cards with a total of at least twelve ingredients wins the game. Also included in the game: QR codes so that the appropriate recipes can be downloaded. This children's and family game was developed in collaboration with Betty Bossi.

—description from the designer

name: Gods Heist
description:
Assemble your team, plan your heist, and plunder the ancient city of the Gods!

1-4 players
60-120 min
Ages 10+

"Imagine an ancient fantasy world inspired by Babylon and the Olympus. The Gods and humans have lived side by side for thousands of years. One day, the bristling city wakes up and realizes the Gods have all but gone.

A century later... Welcome to the city of Astarion, sitting next to deserted Sanctuary of the Gods, where only their faithful servant, the dangerous Drakonids, remain.
You and your team of Marauders have mustered the courage to explore the Sanctuary in search of the mythical artifacts left by the Gods, promising incredible wealth and power.

It's time for a GODS HEIST!"

Choose your character, assemble your team of experts, and venture into the mysterious and perilous Sanctuary of the Gods. Only the bravest (or cleverest?) will succeed in this heist.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Action Drafting, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Movement Points, Multi-Use Cards, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Royal Race
description:
Royal Race is a lively and engaging group game perfect for gatherings. With a simple setup requiring only an empty cup and your favorite beverage, the game provides everything else in the box. Players take turns rolling the dice, and advancing along the board's tiles. Each tile presents a unique prompt, some involving the whole group. The goal is to reach the finish line but beware, the last player to arrive must drink from the King's Cup placed at the center of the board. With over 30 entertaining prompts inspired by the classic King's Cup card game, "Royal Race" guarantees hours of laughter and fun with friends.

—description from the publisher

name: Jambuza
description:
Jambuza is a simple abstract game in which players add pieces to the board or move the pieces on the board to align them in a certain way to win. It's a 2 to 4 player game. You can play 1 versus 1, 1 versus 2, or 2 versus 2 in teams.

—user summary

Jambuza is a Kuwaiti game! If you imagine something that combines the simplicity of an x-o game with the intelligence of chess ... then you should try Jambuza game! - Jambuza game features a variety of ways to win and a variety of plans, which allows you to deceive those against you. And Deir Balak, you must read the black paper, the laws of the whole gymnastics. - Note: The game is designed with Kuwaiti Sadu designs, after careful study of art, in cooperation with the Kuwaiti Sadu House.

—description from the publisher

name: Warfighter: A Chtorr Special Forces Card Game
description:
The Chtorrans are here! You must assemble your Squad of Soldiers to clear them out with Fire, Cryo, and Conventional Weapons. This game takes place in the Modern era and is fully compatible with every other Warfighter Core game. Warfighter Chtorr looks to simplify the system by reducing the number of keywords and effects, while keeping the complexity and decision-making the series is known for. New features:


Field Points! Chtorran bodies that haven't been cooked or exploded can be studies by the science team working with your Squad! Preserve their bodies by not using Explosive, Spray, or Fire Attacks to earn Field Points. Spend Field Points to Spark Skills or purchase new Equipment/Weapons mid-Mission with Radios to help with your fight against the alien threat.
Your Weaponry matters! There are 3 types of Weapons in Chtorr: Fire, Ice, and Conventional. Starting with Fire, these Weapons offer a huge Defeat Cover (Pen) bonus but reduces the Hostile's available Field Points, they also come with very little Ammo, meaning you have to feather the trigger, and use Field Points to resupply more Fuel mid-Mission.
Next is Ice, these Weapons do not inflict direct Wounds to Hostile cards, but instead place Slow counters. For each Slow Counter placed on a Hostile, Soldiers add 1 to their Attack and 1 to their Defeat Cover (Pen) rolls against that Hostile until the end of the turn. This means you can use Conventional Weaponry against Chtorr to preserve their Field Points!
Finally, we have Conventional Weaponry, these Weapons don't have great Defeat Cover (Pen) roll bonuses, but they more than make up for that with quantity of Attacks! These Weapons can perform exponentially more Attacks than Fire or Cryo based Weaponry and most importantly, preserve the Hostile's Field Points! (Unless you Deploy your MG4's Bipod!)


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: I Love/Hate Everything
description:
The Party Game for Opinionated People

Players try to win Emotion Cards by accurately predicting which Item card from their hand the dealer (Judge) Loves or Hates the most.

Goal of each hand is decided by the Emotion card (Love or Hate) drawn by the dealer (Judge).

Win by collecting 5 Emotion cards.

—description from the designer

name: Dog Catcher Card Game
description:
Dog Catcher is a strategic, trick-taking card game that's a little bit Hearts, a dash of Spades, a pinch of Uno, and a whole pack of DOGS!

Build packs of dogs to give them homes and remove them from the game.
Avoid the Dog Catcher card.

There are 4 suits of dogs - 3 pedigrees and Mutts.

Win by giving all the dogs in your hand homes and avoiding the Dog Catcher.

—description from the designer

name: BURST!
description:
BURST! is a quick card game with the goal of getting rid of cards by challenging opponents. In a turn, a player chooses a hidden action and challenges another opponent. The opponent chooses an action that will either continue, cancel, or double the effect of that hidden action towards them. Actions include acquiring or getting rid of cards, reflecting an action towards the challenger player, and swapping hands.

The mechanics are similar to a game of rock-paper-scissors.

name: Shogun: Revised Edition
description:
In Shogun, each player assumes the role of a great Daimyo with all his troops. Each Daimyo has the same 10 possible actions to develop his empire and secure points. Castles, temples, and theaters replace the infrastructure of Wallenstein (as rice replaces wheat), creating a thematic experience for players who wish to move their exploits east to the Land of the Rising Sun.

The revised edition includes the base game and Shogun: Tenno's Court.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Cube Tower, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Djeser
description:
Build your numerical pyramid.

Spend action points to take cards and build your pyramid.

Building stones need to be the sum or difference of the bellow cards. Keep an eye on your fellow players and block the colours or numbers that you don't want them to take.

Try to fulfil objectives for bonus points at the end of the game.

name: River Valley Glassworks: River Glass and Other Sundries
description:
This expansion contains all the stretch goals from the Kickstarter campaign, consisting in 6 modular mini-expansions:

"Assistants",
"Equipment",
"Lake Diving",
"Orders from Afar",
"River Treasures",
"Flooded Market".
mechanics: Action Drafting, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: QUEST-O-GRAPHS: Pencil Board Games – Volume 1
description:
An all new type of "puzzle book" that uses board game mechanics. All you need is a pencil!

You are a wanderer, exploring different places around the globe. Each level is a single page, providing a new location complete with its own unique name, image, logline, foliage, food/drink, weapon, and map tailored to that destination.

Move throughout the map, opening and closing room doors (with "X" marks) on the square grid spaces as you progress on your trek. Inside the rooms are icons corresponding to your inventory below the board. Rooms can contain villains, helpful sidekicks, resources to save and spend tactically, useful items to maneuver safely, and more. The space you're currently on often determines which direction you can move next, so some strategy is important.

Excluding the ones on tunnel spaces, if you can open and close all room doors on the map, you win!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Advantage Token, Area Movement, Grid Movement, Map Reduction, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Cassette Dungeons!
description:
The dungeon is stinky, the treasure has underwear and cassette tapes in it and the boss is a ball of tangled wires! No better place to recruit some valiant heroes and go exploring! Charge into danger as you explore compact dungeons and manage the constant dangers you’ll encounter.

Cassette Dungeon packs together resource management, light strategy and the spirit of metal into a cosy little ruleset and game box so that it can be played in even the most cramped cells and dungeons

Stomp through dungeons one by one, murdering the unanimously hostile inhabitants, navigating typical trope traps, slaying a weird boss-thingy, then carefully place the treasure in an evidence bag and repeat this process to gradually build a sense of accomplishment!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wyse Fork 2nd Battle of Kinston March 8-10, 1865
description:
The Battle of Wyse Fork also know as 2nd Battle of Kinston is the battle to defend Kinston, NC and the rail road from falling into Union hands. The battle took place over several days March 8-10.
The battle also had the Confederate gunboat ironclad the CSS Neuse giving fire support and then it was scuttled by the crew so as not to be captured. The battle needed in a Union victory.

—description from the designer

name: Hogs Of War: The Card Game – Team Lard cards
description:
Five additional unit cards released as a promo:

Sniper (Pinstripe)
Orderly (Izzy)
Engineer (Ian)
Bombardier (Bobby)
Grunt (Roger)

name: CatStronauts: The Board Game
description:
The International Space Station has been a big success! With a green light from President Cat, the CATSUP space agency can now expand the station by adding on all the modules. It's up to the CatStronauts to move these modules to the right spot as each arrives, bringing them online one at a time...before their time runs out!

CatStronauts: The Board Game is a co-operative game in which you get to guide fearless commander Major Meowser, brave-but-hungry pilot Waffles, genius technician and inventor Blanket, and quick-thinking science officer Pom Pom on their most important mission yet. You win as a team by completing your core mission, which is to bring all of the space station's new modules online, boot up the system, and launch the re-entry pod before the power level drops to 0. As you move about the space station and assemble the modules as they arrive, you'll encounter side missions and alerts that make your core mission take extra time — but with teamwork and communication, the CatStronauts will overcome these difficulties to make it home in time for their parade. There will be really good snacks, too!

Rules variants simplify the game for younger players, make it solo-player friendly, and increase the challenge for advanced gamers.

—description form the publisher

name: CatStronauts: The Board Game – Deluxe Edition
description:
This stellar upgrade to the CatStronauts core game includes BOTH the standard game and the Fish Finder Satellite expansion. PLUS, it upgrades your play experience with space-age transparent acrylic game pieces, and a special "How to Play" comic by CatStronauts creator Drew Bockington. All of this comes wrapped in a holographic foil slip cover, that has a fun coloring sheet on the inside!

—description from the publisher

name: CatStronauts: Fish Finder Satellite Expansion
description:
The World’s Best Scientist has purr-fected the Fish Finder Satellite! Once the satellite is active, no cat will ever go hungry again! The CatStronauts have teamed up with the Cosmo Cats to complete this monumental mission.

This expansion adds the new core mission Fish Finder Satellite. You'll need to build all the Fish Finder Satellite modules, program the satellite, then activate it! But don't forget, you still need to finish your other core mission, too! You'll need to work as a team and communicate extra well to get all your tasks done before time runs out. But with more characters to play with, we know the Earth is in safe paws!

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based, Science Fiction

name: Peruano Pe
description: A game of speed starring the most influential characters in Peruvian history. These double-sided cards have so many colorful characters on one side, and a condition on the other. When on your board, focus on each detail in each of your cards as if one of them fits the condition on the current turn you can get rid of it... as long as you're the first one to do so! Be quick and get rid of your cards faster than the other players to win!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Catacombs & Castles (Second Edition): Big Box
description:
The big box version of Catacombs & Castles Second Edition!

In addition to the base Catacombs & Castles game, this box includes three massive 24×24″ (61x61cm) playmats, the Keystones & Keeps [second edition] expansion, and the Siege Defender [second edition] expansion.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Flicking, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Payback Backpack
description:
Spend turns capturing material from other players to make pairs or use action cards to foil your opponent's plans. The first player to complete seven pairs wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: AGAPE: A game about Love
description:
Agape is a game about Love that will make you confront what you feel in your soul.
Do you really have an open heart and mind?
Then with skill and a bit of luck you will win!

Type: Card Game

Mechanics: Direct grips and effects activation. Observe the details and connect the features. Interaction between players. Gender identity as a Game Mechanics.

Brief description of the game

In Agape you are new recruits to the Agape Love Agency and you must learn to match as many people as possible by respecting the general rule and the specific matching request that will be expressed to you.

Whoever plays has 3 person cards in their hand and will have to match them with those on the table, creating pairs.
Each couple generates points and each couple satisfied in their request for love will activate effects that will be suffered by the other levers of the agency.

The game ends immediately when the number of people runs out, so watch out for the game time!

Overcome your limits, satisfy as many couples as possible, excel in the various specialties and you will be named Master of Love!

—description from the designer

name: Beast Builders: Claws & Jaws
description:
Beast Builders: Claws & Jaws is a competitive strategy card game for groups of 2—6. It's set in the far future, where aliens battle one another to earn rare and valuable Lithium Salts. (Their reasons for doing so are numerous, and private.)

Players choose one of 6 Beast Builder alien characters, and take turns playing Animal Cards from their hand to augment their Beast, or attack the Beasts of their opponents. Each Animal Card also has a Skill that can grant a one-time advantage.

Each contest takes place in a different Earthlike biome, granting a bonus to Beasts that are specialized for the environment. The winner will defeat their opponents by building a superior Beast!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Inis: Nemed
description:
Nemed is the second expansion to Inis, the area-influence game rooted in Celtic history and Lore. Nemed incorporates three different modules that will change the dynamics of your game.


With the Nemetons module, try to gain control of these sacred sites. They will award you deeds based on various conditions and adjacency, as you can't enter the Nemetons!



With the Hollowed Sanctuaries module, dedicate your sanctuaries to legendary heroes! Give offerings to these particular sanctuaries, and receive special favours based on the hero you honored.



Finally, the Territories and Epic tales module will bring more variety to various element of the game. Discover 10 new epic tale cards, 5 new territory tiles, and new advantage cards.


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Set-up

name: Suspects Pocket: Opération RAVEL – Une enquête de Claire Harper
description: In this forth chapter of the Suspects line, players embody detective Claire Harper as she will embark in a new enquete.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Gear Krieg: Fighting Vehicles of the Modern Age
description: This supplement for Gear Krieg takes a look at the many types of fighting super science vehicles fielded by the armies of both the Axis and the Alliance. Each vehicle is detailed with background information, variants and modelling guide.

name: Humanity: A Game of Civilizations
description:
Humanity is a trading card game that celebrates the vast spectrum of human achievement. Players take on the roles of rival civilizations competing to determine who will have a greater impact on future cultures. The cards are inspired by our shared heritage, taking the form of ancient rulers, great works of art, philosophical breakthroughs, and mythical beings.

Key Features:
Civilizational Conflict: This box contains three civilization cards, each with its own strengths, weaknesses, and unique abilities.

Multifaceted Gameplay: Humanity offers multiple paths to victory, encouraging players to explore different strategies and tactics to outmaneuver their opponents.

Cultural Enrichment: Each card in Humanity is a testament to the richness and diversity of human civilization.

Gameplay
Each player starts with a civilization card that has a unique victory condition.
Add cards to the bank to generate suns. Spend suns to play cards.
Challenge your opponent's cards to send them to the dustbin of history.
Win by attacking your opponent directly, meeting the victory condition on your civilization card, or forcing your opponent to draw all of their cards.

—description from the designer

name: Cosmic Clock Solitaire
description:
The evil mastermind Kronoxator has erased the hours of the Cosmic Clock! Space and time will collapse unless you repair the Clock. You also need to rescue the Time Jokers and defeat him before the Timer reaches 0!

Cosmic Clock Solitaire is a fast, high-score solo game of hand management, multi-use cards and circular movement. Mostly built around the classic 54 deck.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Nuclear Destruction
description: Six players vie to stay alive and wipe out their opponents in this stand-alone expansion to the classic Nuclear War card game. Nuclear Destruction reimplements the Weapons of Mass Destruction game, and adds enough cards for a full six player game. It comes with 6 large playmats and a comprehensive rulebook covering all the Nuclear War family of games.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Modern Warfare, Negotiation, Political
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Take That

name: Green Island (Fan Expansion for Age of Steam)
description:
A global warming inspired semi-modular expansion map for Age of Steam.

Due to the climatic impact, the island undergoes changes. As the game progresses, the glaciers in the northern part of the island melt and grassy fields with small ponds take their place.

Forests start to spread in the southern parts of the island, which need to be cleared for tracks or from tracks.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Map Addition, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Dicey Diggers
description:
In Dicey Diggers players take on the role of experimental miner robots, digging tunnels underground to collect riches. These robots are still in prototype phase: they move a bit erratically, and sometimes their pieces fall off for no reason. To make matters worse, the area is peppered with explosive landmines! Try to get the most riches without breaking down!

A roll&write game of drawing tunnels, resource collection and push your luck. Free to print, allows for 1 to 6 players to play simultaneously in about 40min.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Push Your Luck, Variable Set-up

name: El Árbol de las Aves
description: El Árbol de las Aves invites us to learn more about these beautiful species while we have fun trying to place them on a tree defending each place. Each participant has 7 birds and must go around a board to find a place on the tree to place them. Eye! When there are no free spaces you must compete for the place. The first to place all his birds on the top of the tree is the winner.

name: El Gran Sabor Argentino
description:
El Gran Sabor Argentino is a question and answer game about customs, flavors and foods of the Argentine Republic.

It is the first board game in the country that is written in Easy Reading.

Contains: 150 cards (450 questions) – 1 regulation with explainers – 1 Argentine recipe as a gift!

name: Contame: Malvinas
description:
The proposal of this game is to give a voice to History. That the stories are impregnated with the places and landscapes of the Islands, their flora and fauna. "That the stories generate links, that they enable exchanges and encourage reflections, aspects that we consider fundamental and necessary for the strengthening and construction of citizenship.

As usual in the Contame series, the objective of the game is to create and tell a story where the Malvinas Islands are the protagonists.

Includes 4 game suggestions.

name: Shima
description:
Shima ("water" in Yagan) invites us to discover a wonderful world, close but at times unknown: our sea.

The species that inhabit the Beagle Channel are presented in this game and invite us on a journey to learn about their ways of life and their importance in the ecosystem. The cards allow us to learn about their interactions as we play!

El Equipo Azul and the Beagle Foundation came together to think up this game that is part of the Educational project "A Window to the Sea", in the province of Tierra del Fuego.

It's two games in one!

On one hand, the different modalities for players +5 years old, which are: Kombaíbi, Yela and Miakasha. Where the objective is to beat or equal the score of the card played by the person immediately before us.

The other is Kaiuala, intended for childhood and first players. With the dynamics of the memo, the winner is whoever finds in the cards that are arranged face down on the table, their four cards with details of the species.

name: Tokyo Highway: Rainbow City – SOLO
description: This new bonus pack contains 36 cards, and new solo rules for a single player. Follow the road guideline specs and aim to build multiple highways alone to achieve the best score.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stacking and Balancing

name: Catacombs: Wyldlands KS Playmat for Catacombs 3E
description:
Travel deeper into Wylemuir with this exclusive double-sided neoprene playmat which serves as a companion to the Wyldlands expansion. This map places obstacles and such in different locations unique from other maps resulting in a different playing experience.

Playmat dimensions in inches: 26.7″ x 12.6″
Playmat dimensions in metric: 68 cm x 32 cm

This new playmat was first made available as part of the Catacombs 3E playmat version Kickstarter in 2018.

name: Run Run Run! (2nd Edition)
description:
While exploring a mysterious Egyptian pyramid, you discover a huge vault. There lie the Ancient Relics of Tutankhanine, the Cursed Pharaoh! Were the legends true?

Examining the symbols on the Pharaoh’s sarcophagus triggers a hidden mechanism. The ground shakes and heavy stone doors start to descend. You escape being sealed inside the vault by dashing further into the pyramid, but now you’re cut off from the exit. You’re trapped!

In the distance, you hear frightening growls, as if angry mummies are waking up to punish those who entered their tomb. It seems the legends are indeed true!

Your only way forward is the stone hallway leading off into the darkness...

Your objective is now clear:

Prevent the mummies from touching the Relics of the Pharaoh (they would gain immense power, threatening all mankind).
Activate the hidden mechanisms to wake the most powerful mummy in the pyramid, then defeat all the mummies to lift the curse once and for all!


You have 5 torches left... Run! Run! RUN!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Halo: Flashpoint
description:
Halo: Flashpoint is the tactical miniatures game for two players. Begin your journey in the War Games combat arena as a Spartan fireteam commander, bringing a range of classic Halo weapons and game modes to life on your tabletop. Discover an exciting game that's easy to learn, challenging to master, and rewards cool thinking under fire!

Will you lead a fireteam of Spartans to victory in the arena, or bring the alien might of Banished Elites to bear against your human opponents?

Choose a side and prepare for the ultimate tactical tabletop experience.

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Moving Multiple Units, Square Grid

name: Münchengrätz: Gitschin 1866
description:
While the bulk of the imperial army begins its movement from Olmütz to reach the heart of Bohemia, the  I Austrian Corp of Count Clam-Gallas is ordered to guard the border and collect the retreating Saxon divisions in accordance with the plan drawn up by the general staffs of the two countries. He will then be able to begin his withdrawal to join the rest of the Austrian corps concentrated for the decisive battle envisaged in the purest Napoleonic tradition.

But this is without taking into account the energetic Prussian advances of the Elbe Army and the First Army which, during the battles of Müchengrätz and Gitschin, jostled and disorganized the imperial troops in their retreat.

New module in the “Battles in the Time of Napoleon III” series, Müchengrätz-Gitschin is the third and final game in the series of preliminary battles of the Bohemian campaign of 1866 leading to the major confrontation between the two German powers: the battle of Sadowa/Königgrätz which will be the subject of a big game later.

The “The Great Battles of Napoleon III” series (VaeVictis n° 55, 73, 138, 157 and 165), offers a simple and dynamic system, emphasizing troop engagement in the face of deadly defensive fire.
Scenarios by Arnold Giraud-Moser on a system by Luc Olivier.
Game turn: one hour
Units: regiments and battalions
Map: one hex. = 750m
Complexity: 5/10
Solitaire: ​​7/10
Playing time: 2 to 4 hours depending on the scenario

Third volume of the campaign of 1866 which also includes Trautenau/Soor and Nachod/Skalitz.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Baju
description:
An abstract strategy game for two players.

Move your buttons according to their unique values, while avoiding your opponent’s bridges.
Swap places with another button by moving to its location.
Arrange four buttons in a row to win!

name: Bounders
description:
Bounders is a territorial game played on a hexagonal board of side length 7 or 9, and some light and dark stones. Players decide who goes first, and alternate turns. Each turn, players put a stone of their color on an empty space, adjacent to an equal number of light and dark stones.

When no more moves are available, the game is scored. Players get points for surrounding territories: for each empty region, the player with more stones bounding that region is awarded points according to the number of empty spaces there. Regions next to an equal number of light and dark stones are not counted. The player with the higher total score wins.

There are also two advanced rules that are used in case of serious tournament play, to ensure a competitive experience. First, this involves deciding who starts via the pie rule, in which the first player places one stone and gives their opponent a one-time opportunity to swap sides. Second, players use a slightly more nuanced scoring system, in which the following scores are compared until a winner is determined:

Awarded the higher total score
Awarded points from the largest single territory
Awarded points from more distinct territories
Played fewer stones
Offered the pie


Bounders was designed by Alek Erickson in March 2024. The game was inspired by Mark Steere's game Hadron and Markus Hagenauer's game Cairo Corridor, and accidentally bears some similarity with Luis Bolaños Mures's game Quinten and Phil Leduc's game Midgard.

—description from the designer

name: Chicago Dry
description:
For years, Prohibition has poured Americans a tall glass of austerity and condemned the whole country to a life of secret transgressions. In Chicago Dry, players look for a way around Prohibition to bring bottled fun to Chicago's hidden pubs and speakeasies.

In this game, 2-4 players secretly distribute alcohol across city districts as they face off against rivals and fight for territory, achieving higher scores as they occupy the Chicago central area. The player with the most influence points in both phases of the game wins and becomes the most infamous gangster in town!
mechanics: Area Movement, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Variable Phase Order

name: HE.R.O: Box of Heroes
description:
Kickstarter exclusive expansion pack which brings 10 new HEROes, 2 new consultants and their corresponding standees.

The cards are available in English, German, French, Italian and Spanish.

name: HEXADOR
description:
HEXADOR is a dungeon crawler board game, designed to be played with 2-5 players.
Players progress through the dungeon, facing and dealing with trap cards, discovering and equipping treasure cards, and using spell cards to influence the game in various ways. The main goal of the game is defeating the boss card at the end of the dungeon, advancing with various strategies with 9 different playable characters, each with its own game play styles.
The game offers a unique experience with a turn-based combat system using dice, filled with all sorts of shenanigans.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Interrupts, Modular Board, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Tags, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: What's Kraken?: Ghost Captain
description:
What's Kraken?
.... Ghost Captain!

Your ship survived the Kraken, do you have the fortitude now to defeat the Ghost Ships that have set their cannons towards you? Or will your vessel be the next recruit for their fleet?

This is a stand-alone expansion to What's Kraken? a solo roll-and-write, with a clear win/lose condition. At the beginning of each turn you will roll 4 dice. 2 for your Pirates and 2 for the Ghosts. Use your two Pirate Dice to perform actions and use your Crew to give boons. Will you Board the Ghost ships for helpful items and rescue prisoners, Repair your ship, or even Attack the Ghosts? Sink the 3 Ghost Ships to claim you victory! Be careful though - when each ship sinks, so does their unclaimed loot!

Each turn, after your dice are spent, it's time for the Ghosts to Attack! Using the 2 Ghost Dice and polyominos, you'll fill in the two sides of your ship with damage. Be prepared for more damage the more ships there are! If you ever run out of space for the shape you need to place, you sink! And the Ghosts claim their next spectral crew!

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Pirates, Print & Play

name: Was bin Ich?: Fortsetzungsserien
description: This expansion adds 20 new cards to the game.
mechanics: Deduction, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Storytelling

name: Rolling Tides
description: Players take turns rolling, moving and placing dice on the gameboard with the goal of creating groups of four or more dice to earn tide-pool animal tokens. The first player to place 20 tokens on their scoreboard wins.

name: Evening
description:
Evening is created as a family game of Alexander Brady's Interleave.

Like Interleave, it is a turn-less game, and instead of the sightline placement restrictions of the original game, it uses placement restrictions based on group size superiority.

Setup
Use a regular hexagonal board of any size (size 5 is preferred) and a sufficient number of black and white stones. The white player begins the game by first placing one white stone in any empty cell.

Groups
A subset of stones of the same color that are adjacent to each other on the board is called a group. The size of a group is the number of stones it contains. A single stone is also considered a group of size 1.

Gameplay
You can only place your stone in an empty cell where the sum of the sizes of your group adjacent to it is smaller than that of your opponent's group. The number of cells available for placement is recalculated each time a piece is placed.

Game End
The owner of the largest group wins. If the largest group is tied, the next largest group continues to be compared until a difference occurs. If all groups are tied, the black player wins.

Variant: Odd-Even protocol
The white player is responsible for the "odd" pieces and the black player for the "even" pieces.
If all groups are tied in size, the number of pieces of one color (whichever is chosen is equal) is counted. If there are an odd number of pieces, the player responsible for the odd number wins; if there are an even number of pieces, the player responsible for the even number wins.

name: Control
description:
Control is a finite, draw less territory game based on SNORT. This game is also relevant to Glass Bead, Stigmergy and Tumpletore (a variant of Tumbleweed).

Components

Hex grid regular hexagonal board of any size (Size 5 or larger)
Sufficient quantity of white and black pieces (A majority of the number of hexes is sufficient)


Terminology
Control
The player responsible for the majority of the colors of the pieces placed in hexes adjacent to a given hex controls that hex (If there is a tie, neither player controls the hex).

Setup
Each player decides which color he/she is responsible for.
The game begins with the board empty.

Gameplay
First, the white player places a piece of his/her color in one of the hexes bordering the perimeter of the board.
The next black player and onward take turns.
On his or her turn, the player makes one of the following two types of move. Passing is not allowed.


Place a piece of your color in an empty hex not controlled by the opponent.
Remove a piece of the opponent's color in a hex controlled by you.


Game End
The player with no legal move in his or her turn loses the game.

If both players are experienced in the game, the game may be terminated by mutual agreement. In that case, count the number of empty hexes under your control and thereby determine the player who loses.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Archwynd
description:
Archwynd is a competitive, asymmetrical fantasy card game for 1-3 players, age 12 and up.

In this game, you choose a Hero who sets forth to save the land of Archwynd from a monstrous invasion. The King will pay a bounty for each monster killed.

Along the way, you will collect magic and treasure to help you buff up for fights, heal lost health, or avoid traps and damage from encounters. The bounty you collect may also be used to make your Hero stronger.

You win the game by being the last Hero standing. There can be only one! If your Hero dies, you lose. But all may not be lost, as special cards, like Raise Dead, can help your Hero live to fight another day.

THE HERO CARDS:

Players may choose one of four Characters to be their Hero in the game.

The Fighter: Strength of arms is the primary style of the Fighter in Archwynd. The Fighter wades into battle with any weapon he can lay his hands on, dealing damage with the force of his attack. His aggressive style and ability to deal damage makes him a formidable champion defending the realm of Archwynd!

The Ranger: Scouting is the primary style of the Ranger in Archwynd. Using his knowledge of the mountains, hills and forest, the Ranger tracks his opponents and uses his weapons to defend Archwynd from invaders. He is a well-balanced champion, capable of defending the realm to the death!

The Rogue: Stealth is the primary style of the Rogue in Archwynd. Using her speed and agility, she avoids being hit and uses her weapons to deal precise damage to the invaders of Archwynd. The Rogue is definitely in it for herself as she races to loot treasure (and save Archwynd, if she can!)

The Sorceress: Magic is the primary style of the Sorceress in Archwynd. Using her knowledge of the arcane arts, she avoids being hit and uses magic to deal damage to her enemies. She is a powerful magic user who can easily contend to be the final Champion of Archwynd!

ENCOUNTER CARDS:

Archwynd may be played with varying levels of difficulty to adjust the challenge and length of the game. From standard, to difficult, or god-mode, the more difficult the game, the shorter the game before one player is named the Champion.

When an Encounter occurs, the Hero must content with either a Monster, a Trap, or a Benison. Monsters attack the Hero whose turn it is (unless deflected away by special cards); Traps may deal damage to one or more Heroes simultaneously; or Benisons may grant healing or other boons that help the Hero in their adventure.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Fysh
description:
Fysh is a two player abstract strategy game. Four balls randomly roll into holes that determine the shape needed for victory. Position your fish and rotate the whole board to achieve that shape in this two player abstract strategy game that will have you thinking upside down, sideways, and outside of the fishbowl.

—description from the designer

name: Super Slopes: Snow Report
description:
Weather in the mountains can change faster than you can bomb a blue run. Better be ready for anything!

Snow Report adds weather cards.

Shuffle 2 random Snow Report cards into the deck. When a Snow Report card is drawn, apply its ongoing effects.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Super Slopes: Park Rat
description: Super Slopes: Park Rat adds a terrain park that you get points for if you follow the right direction as you score.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Super Slopes: Black Diamond
description: Super Slopes: Black Diamond brings cards 19-24 into the draft with a new ability that lets you reserve cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: LAG
description:
LAG is a two-player abstract strategy game. Based on transversal games, your pieces move in a straight line a number of steps equal to the number of groups of your pieces. The goal is to have fewer groups when the active player runs out of legal moves.

LAG is named after the lag caused by process failures in digital games.

Setup
This game is played on a regular hexagonal board of appropriate size (size 4 for practice, size 5 for regular play).
Each player decides which color they are responsible for and places pieces of their color in the two rows on their side.
For example, in the case of size 5, the pieces are placed as shown in the diagram.

Terminology
Object - When pieces of the same color are adjacent and connected together, they form a single "object" as a whole.
(Defined in the same way as so-called groups, the name is just a flavor)

Gameplay
The White player moves first and then turns alternate.
The active player moves one piece of his/her color. Passing is not allowed.

-Movement
Your piece moves in a straight line along the grid for a distance exactly equal to the number of objects of your color on the board at the beginning of the turn. Pieces cannot be moved off the board or into cells already occupied by pieces of friendly color.
Pieces can move to any cell with a piece of the opponent's color, and then that opponent's piece is captured by replacement and removed from the game.
On the move, a piece can jump over any number of other pieces, regardless of color.

-Restrictions
Moving a piece forward is always allowed.
If a piece is moved sideways, the number of objects of its color must be reduced after the move.
Moving a piece backward is not allowed.

Game end
The game ends when there are no legal moves left for the active player.
The player with fewer objects wins.
If there is a tie, the player who ended the game, i.e., the player who no longer has a legal move, wins.

name: Path of Civilization: Woody Promo Card
description:
An additional level 1 leader card

Card GL-47

When played, draw a level 1 wonder

name: Chantas
description:
Hidden roles game, a kind of Argentinian Mafia.

There are Chantas between us. Among the art that is seen in the graffitied streets there is hidden one or more chantas. We must burn them, before they burn us all!

Objective: there are two teams; that of the trout letters (including those of chantas) and that of the posts. The posts win when they burn (leave out) all the black cards and the trout win when there is a black card among the last 3 unburned cards.

Ideal for gatherings, super transportable.

name: Chamuyo: Expansión ESI
description:
Chamuyo: Expansión ESI is a tool to address Comprehensive Sexual Education (ESI) with young people and adults. Once again, Chamuyo offers you the opportunity to talk about everything that interests you. We choose words that are triggers and enable a playful experience crossed by ESI.

Take a position and seek to defend it to win!

Includes 23 cards (4.5×6.4cm) and Rules.

This expansion includes definitions that frame the words in the curricular guidelines of Law 26,150: National Comprehensive Sexual Education Program.

You need Chamuyo: A full! or Chamuyo: De una! to be able to use them!
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Player Judge, Storytelling

name: Jiangnan: Li Zhizhen Promo Character
description:
Li Shizhen (李時珍) is a character promo made available during the Taiwan crowdfunding campaign and again during the Kickstarter campaign.

Li Shizhen was called a boy genius for passing the college exams to become a Xiucai (秀才) at the young age of 14. But despite his best efforts, he could not pass the triennial provincial exams to become a Juren, and quit after three tries.

However, he eventually became a well-regarded doctor, and after three decades of extensive research, he authored the largest encyclopedia of oriental medicine and herbology ever written, the 本草綱目 (Bencao Gangmu) or translated as Compendium of Materia Medica.

When utilized as a player's Scholar, Li Shizhen will grant them double the Discard Bonus on their turns. As an Assistant, a player may spend $1 to activate a Discard Bonus on their used or drafted tiles. All together, Li Shizhen is a highly adaptable and practical character to use.

—description from the publisher

name: Climate Crisis Card Game
description:
Climate Crisis is a two player card game about saving the planet for two players. To win the game, be the first player to save Earth's three domains land, air and water.

At the start of a battle, each player puts down a number card from their hand (face-down) and declares the card’s suit and number. When they do, it can be the truth or a lie. The game rules determine which card wins a battle along with strategy, wit, bluffing, and accusations. After the battle, the winner draws an Action card. If a player collects three action cards that could be used to claim a domain, they must show the cards to their opponent and explain how each card relates to saving that domain. Players can trade their action cards if they follow certain rules. The first player to save 2 domains wins the game!

—description from the designer

name: Gib Gas
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. The race track is formed by eight wooden planks. On some variable positioned spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to complete one or more laps wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Veiled Fate: Tribunal
description:
New expansions bring deeper strategy and enhanced deduction to a game that asks one not-so-simple question—can you hide in plain sight?

The Tribunal expansions elevate every aspect of a strategic deduction game that already stands apart
When Veiled Fate first launched in 2020, it didn't fit in any genre—and still doesn't. It requires social deduction, but that's not how you win. You win through strategic decisions that are informed by the deduction. Hence strategic deduction.

The Tribunal expansions supercharge both the strategy & deduction in Veiled Fate—further elevating a game that already stands apart.

HADRIA EXPANSION
A being to be feared, Hadria mercilessly annihilates any demigod found ahead of her on the score tracker at the end of the game—meaning having the most points isn't always a winning strategy. Use new powers to move Hadria and create all kinds of new quandaries for your opponents.

The Hadria Expansion is focused on introducing more strategic variables to the game and adds a new miniature, renown tracker, and favor cards.

CELESTIALS EXPANSION
Each of the seven celestial beings bestows one player with an asymmetric win condition & abilities. All other players will have to adapt their strategies around the Celestial's win condition to ensure their own victory.

The Celestials expansion is focused on introducing more deduction and misdirection to the game and adds a new miniature, renown tracker, spell cards, and 7 celestial cards.

SERVANTS EXPANSION
Each servant influences the quest in its region, so players must consider their effects when determining where to move their Demi. Moving the servants introduces new strategic and tactical options towards victory.

The Servants expansion adds 3 new miniatures and cards. Servants can be commanded by all players.

RENEWAL EXPANSION
Every time a demigod enters The Pools when being moved out of the Abyss, the player moving them activates the current modifier on the Renewal Dice. That play then re-rolls the renewal dice, resulting in a new modifier for the next player to move a demigod from the Abyss to the Pools.

The Renewal Dice replaces the permanent 'refresh card' effect that normally activates in the Pools, creating more dynamic gameplay and ever-shifting strategies surrounding how players use the Abyss.
mechanics: Action Points, Deduction, Hand Management, Hidden Roles

name: Check 10
description:
Check 10 is a two-player, abstract strategy board game. You play with either the white or black pieces. Each player has 16 pieces, numbered 1-8. The aim is to score more points than your opponent. You can score points by capturing pieces of your opponent and by promoting your own pieces.

You capture pieces if the combined value of your own pieces and your opponent's pieces is exactly 10 when making groups. A group consists of any pieces that are connected diagonally or orthogonally.

You can promote pieces by reaching the opponent's end of the board. Then, your piece can no longer be removed and is worth points at the end of the game. Moreover, you can remove a piece of the same value from your opponent if it is available.

name: Costumed Cats Memory Game
description:
If you find a cat and its costumed companion, keep the cards and take another turn.

Are you fe-line lucky? Take it in turns to pick two cards to reveal. If a cat looks fur-miliar, match it with its costumed counterpart! The player with the most matches win...

A more advanced version of the classic memory game.
Instead of revealing two matching cards, the goal is to reveal and match a plain cat with another card of the same cat wearing a costume.

name: Casting Shadows: Cheeky Chinchilla Promo Card
description: Card Text: "Companion - Each time you Collect a Counterspell card, look at the top 2 cards of the Counterspell deck. Add one face down to your Spell Book, then return the other card to the bottom of the deck."
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination

name: Tic Tac K.O. 2024 Convention Exclusive Objective Promo
description:
The Tic Tac K.O. 2024 Convention Exclusive Objective Promo card is given away at the Unstable Games convention booth with purchase of a Tic Tac K.O. game or game related item. It has the "CON" expansion/set symbol that Unstable Games began placing on Convention cards in 2024.

Card text:
When you take this Objective card, reveal it immediately. Draw 3 cards, then return this Objective card to the bottom of the Objective deck and take a new Objective card.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Interrupts, Square Grid, Take That, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Pit Lord: Linzara The Cyclops
description:
It is not unheard of for some combatants to make a life of fighting daily in the Pits. Linzara 'The Cyclops' is such a combatant.

The rules of the pits are not written anywhere and there is nothing that suggest that the combatants must outright challenge the Pit Lord when their trials are complete, but this is often the last mistake that fresh combatants make.

Lovingly referred to as 'The Cyclops' ever since she lost one eye from a strike by a Clawfoot's tail stinger. She used the very stinger to impale the beast in the same combat trial. Linzara is content to enter the Pits each day, emerging from her hideout deep in the decrepit depths of the pit tunnels. From here she makes short work of the enemies that emerge and puts on a fine show for the people of the Megopolis. After her three challenges are complete, she opts not to attempt the fourth and instead disappears back into the tunnels only to emerge the next day. Deep within depths of the pit tunnels thrives a secret city where only the most brutal survive. This is the place Linzara calls home.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Exiled Legends: Crane Sensei Promo Card
description:
November 2019 Convention Exclusive

Card Type: Light
Max HP: 3
Strength: 2

Champion Ability: When Crane Sensei is attacked, roll 1d6. On 5-6, the attacking Champion takes the damage instead.
Support Ability: Remove 1 damage counter from your Champion.

name: Tipping Ice
description:
Stuck on an ice flow, floating aimlessly in the frigid ocean, two opposing factions of animals have been stranded on this piece of ice for days now. The leaders from both factions, sly foxes, have realized that the ice flow is melting and before too long the ice flow will tip, leaving one side under water. Sneaky and self-serving, the fox leaders of both factions have concocted a plan to send their clueless faction members to the opposite side of the ice flow to weigh down the opposite side. The question is, whose factions will implement the plan quicker?

Its a race to send your animals to the opposite side of the ice flow to save your side from plunging into the frigid waters. Each animal has their own particular way of moving and special actions. As you work animals to the other side, be sure not to have your fox stray onto your opponent‛s side, for they are trying to preserve their lives.

If you can get three groups of animals to the opposite side, while keeping your fox on your side of the ice flow, you win!

Tipping ice is a two player, area control game where you are trying to move your game pieces to the opposite side of the game board. There are five groups of animals that you can score with.

—description from the designer

name: Atom Monsters
description: A 2 players card game based on chemistry. Use atom cards to build molecules and score points based on their molar mass.

name: 鱼的回忆 (Sea of Memory)
description:
Sea of Memory is a collaborative card game where players need to follow the connections between memories, relying on their teamwork and memory skills to link common memories. Before fading into oblivion, guide the lonely fish back to the sea of memories...

《鱼的回忆》是一款合作卡牌游戏，玩家需要沿着记忆之间的关联，依靠彼此的默契以及自己的记忆力，串联起共同的往事。
在彻底忘却之前，让落单的鱼儿，重回记忆的大海……

name: 京杭大运河 (The Grand Canal)
description:
The Grand Canal, stretching from Beijing in the north to Hangzhou in the south, traverses China from north to south, connecting five major water systems and being the longest artificial canal in the world. The Grand Canal has always been an important channel for China's water transportation. In this game, players take on the role of the Ming Dynasty's Grand Canal Governor, tasked with completing official grain transportation missions while also establishing connections with local areas to open up trade routes.

京杭大运河，北起北京，南抵杭州，纵贯中国南北，沟通五大水系，是世界上最长的人工河。 大运河一直是中国漕运和商旅往来的重要通道。在本游戏中，玩家扮演明朝的漕运总督，需要在完成官府的运粮任务的同时，也与地方建立联系，打通商路。

name: 自在西游 (Journey to the West)
description:
自在西游 ("Journey to the West") is a Chinese-style card game based on ancient Eastern mythology, adapted from the mobile game of the same name. Players will retrace the journey of Journey to the West in the game, dispatching gods from the four major races of Sheng, Xian, Mo, and Yao, crossing mountains and seas for adventures and fighting for battle rewards.
﻿
The resurgence of Journey to the West gods, exploration of ancient realms, and taking you on a fantastical adventure through the three realms await in this game.

《自在西游》是一款以东方古典神话为背景的国风卡牌游戏，改编自同名手游。玩家将在游戏中重走西游降妖伏魔之旅，派遣圣、仙、冥、妖四大种族神将，穿越山海冒险，争取战斗奖励。
游戏节奏明快，规则简洁，策略与运气并重的聚会类卡牌游戏。
角色画风精美，定位为“新派国风唐彩西游”，从唐艺术形式当中当中吸取灵感来源。

西游神将再临，探索上古幻境，带你开启光怪陆离的三界冒险之旅。

name: BattleTech: Clan Spaniel Sourcebook
description:
A civilization driven to war.

An entire Clan brought to ruin.

And the course of human history forever changed by…

CLAN SPANIEL!

For generations, every freeborn and trueborn in the Kerensky Cluster was raised in the Way of the Clans, learning their culture’s traditions, taboos, caste roles, and philosophies through The Adventures of Clan Spaniel. Clan children were engrossed with the Spaniels’ missions to defeat the evil Monkey Tribes and restore the Star League, subconsciously forging their own identities in the process.

But darker secrets lurked behind the unblinking lens of the holoprojector. Now, for the first time, learn the true story behind the critter crusaders and the sinister agenda beneath their wholesome façade.
Read on, if you dare!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Science Fiction

name: Tetroku
description:
Tetroku is a tetromino-based roll-and-write game where you score points using a simple sudoku-style system. It plays in about 20-40 minutes, depending on the number of players. There is no limit to the number of players who can play (from 1 to 999 or more!).

The only components required are a six-sided die for the group, plus a single game sheet and pencil per player.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Educational, Math, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Archwynd Vale
description: Archwynd Vale is an expansion set for Archwyind which provides support for up to 6 players. Archwynd Vale provides additional Hero cards, Monsters, Traps and all-new magic items -- as well as advanced rules that enable complete customization of each Hero.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Chicken Fried Dice
description: Players operate their own Chicken (or vegan chicken replacement) Food Trucks in this dice chucking and plucking roll-n-write. Feed customers by matching ingredient dice to the dishes they want before they get too hangry!
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Real-Time, Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: Multimania: The Multiplication Board Game
description:
Dive into the world of math like never before with the new and improved Multimania! This latest version of the beloved multiplication board game brings a whole new level of fun, learning, and quality to your fingertips. Ideal for kids aged 6+, Multimania transforms number crunching into an epic adventure where speed, strategy, and smarts lead to victory.

With its enhanced gameplay, vibrant components, and high-quality materials, this edition introduces fresh challenges and more ways to play. Navigate duels, leverage handicaps, and enjoy individual 30-second sprints with our newly included components, ensuring that each round is packed with excitement and educational value.

Whether it's a family game night, a classroom learning session, or a solo quest for math mastery, Multimania is your go-to for interactive and engaging multiplication practice. Experience the upgraded game where every flip of a card, tick of the clock, and placement of a pawn immerses players in a world where math is endlessly entertaining. Embrace the new Multimania – where learning meets joy and every calculation counts!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Action Timer, Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Impulse Movement, Memory, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Recognition, Race, Team-Based Game

name: Crusades
description:
Crusades is a card-driven (semi cooperate) light wargame depicting the series of religious wars between Christians and Muslims to control the holy lands.
Each player takes the roles of christian and muslim leaders:

Christian Leaders and imperial cities:

Baldwin II of Jerusalem (Jerusalem)
Joscelin I (Edessa)
Bohemond II of Antioch (Antioch)


Muslim Leaders and imperial cities:

Zahir Al-Din Toghtekin (Damascus)
Al-Amir Bi-Ahkam Allah (Cairo)
Rukn Al-Din Mesud (Iconium)


Both players have a secret objective to plunder, siege, conquer enemy cities and to control/influence the christian kingdoms of Cilician Armenia and Eastern Roman Empire (Byzantio). Also at the same time they must defend their imperial cities from their enemies.
Τhe game lasts 7 rounds and in each round two historical event cards determine the conditions and the battles of the game.

At the end of the game

the number of secret cities conquered/plundered
the number of winning battles
the influence/control of the christian kingdoms of Cilician Armenia and Eastern Roman Empire


are compared and the side with the most wins the game!!!

Fight and manage your supplies wisely, it is the only way to control the holy lands !!!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Napoli 1799
description:
Napoli 1799 is a non-simulation-based card wargame included with issue number 34 of the Italian gaming magazine IoGioco.

In January 1799, the Republic in Naples was proclaimed after tumultuous days of uprising, involving Jacobins, a division of the French army, and Lazzari. By June, a papal army counterrevolution, supported by the English fleet, ended the Republic and executed the Republicans.

Each side fought along with its own vision of freedom, and the game focuses on these tumultuous dynamics.

name: Forge of Fists
description:
Forge of Fists is a two-player deckbuilding card game set in the land of Almokon, which is ruled by an old and wise emperor, Manfred the Most Loved. Unfortunately, Manfred is dying (for he is old) and upon his death he knows his empire will crumble (for he is wise). To maintain peace in Almokon, Manfred must decide, now, who is to wear the crown of the empire upon his passing.

You, the player, are one of many monarchs vying for Manfred’s favor. Your ability to rule, to protect, and to grow your realm will determine if you will be the next emperor of Almokon.

Each player begins the game with a unique monarch, city, and deck. Players then take turns playing cards from their hand - improvements, characters, cults, and events - to build up their realm and launch attacks on their opponent by land and sea. The first player to win Manfred's favor or obliterate their enemy is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management

name: Masala Lab Mini
description:
Inspired by the best-selling book Masala Lab by Krish Ashok, you will prep various Indian dishes while trying to rack up the highest score.

Masala Lab Mini is a set-collection game, where you have to collect food "Items" to make your "Prep", in a way such that the Items match the recipe of the Prep. An interesting card-overlap mechanism means you need to collect the Items in a particular sequence shown on the recipe. The game ends when the one player collects 5 Prep cards, but the winner is the one who scored the highest! Watch out for penalties for incomplete Prep. A game lasts 20-30 minutes.

This is a "mini" version of the game Masala Lab, and is sold separately.

—description from the publisher

name: Trivial Pursuit Mini Pack: 1980s
description:
This quick-playing game features trivia questions from the years 1980 to 1990. Since it includes cards only, you can take it to parties, get-togethers, on vacation, and more. On your turn, another player will ask you a question; get it right to keep the card. The first person to earn 5 cards wins! Answer fun trivia questions like "What kind of laceless shoes were sometimes worn with a coin in the tongue?" and "What hairstyle was described as 'business in the front, party in the back'?"

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: MINIMINION
description: Draw, line up, and quickly read aloud Minion cards! If you're able to read them all, you're safe, but don't say the wrong thing or trip over your words! Even with such a simple rule, this is a game that will have you rolling in laughter!

name: Alibis
description:
Inspired by the game For the Queen, Alibis, is a card-driven story-building game that you can begin playing in minutes, without any RPG experience.
The gameplay relies of a simple mechanism: draw a question card, read it out loud and answer it out loud.
One question at a time, create a criminal investigation (as silly or serious as you want it to be).
Being prompt driven, the game is infinitely replayable. It comes with 6 crime scenes, 15 illustrated characters, 8 causes of death, 14 clues, 25 questioning cards, 12 newspaper front pages and 12 jury reactions.

The first player reveals a crime scene, the second reveals the identity of the victim; the next, the cause of death.
Then in clockwise order, everyone chooses a clue or a suspect until there is as many suspect as there are people playing and 3 clues.

The questioning of each suspect is driven by card prompts.
The players secretly attribute culpability tokens of different values to the suspects.
The players then vote for the suspect they think has the most culpability.
The players can then introduce the classification of the crime and mitigating factors before the suspect is sentenced.

The players now play as journalists writing about the case by using 2 out of 3 cards to present an event occuring during the trial.
Only then will the culpability tokens be revealed and the truth exposed.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Questions and Answers, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Ancient Future
description:
The world was at peace until the discovery the "weapons". Strange mechanical titans made of stone and metal that lay dormant depths of the world. Now the tribes are in disagreement in what should be done to these mysterious artifacts.

Ancient Future is a competitive card game for 1-4 players with no direct combat. Players will create a deck of 30 cards and compete to be the first to either destroy or awaken 2 of the artifacts that are in the center of the table.

Ancient Future features an innovative depleting resource system that has players start with 10 resources to spend and each turn refresh all resources and remove one resource from the game, slowly depleting their pool from turn to turn. The game also ends when the last resource is removed at which point the player holding the highest value artifact is the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Socialistos
description:
SOCIALISTS
STEALING IN A PANDEMIC IS A GAME

This board game is ideal to give to that left-handed friend who doesn't want to work and needs to pass the time while waiting for his pay.

Play without complexes, because they have been playing with you for a long time.

—description from the publisher

SOCIALISTOS
ROBAR EN PANDEMIA ES UN JUEGO

Este juego de mesa es ideal para regalar a ese amigo zurdo que no quiere trabajar y necesita pasar el tiempo mientras espera su paga.

Juega sin complejos, porque hace tiempo que ellos juegan contigo.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

name: Epireia
description:
Immerse yourself in the epic grandeur of ancient Greece with Epireia, a captivating board game where you command one of six cities: Sparta, Athens, Elis, Delphi, Corinth, or Larissa. As the city's Administrator, you're tasked with a monumental challenge: to elevate your city-state to unparalleled heights of power and influence.

Epireia is designed around three scenarios, ensuring that each game is a unique journey through strategy, alliance, and conquest.

A round in Epireia is segmented into three phases to mirror the complexities of ancient leadership. The Strategy Phase is where your visionary planning comes to life, allowing you to construct buildings that are the envy of your rivals and develop your prestige to your citizen.
During the Diplomacy Phase, your strategic acumen is tested as you deploy influential figures across the game's map to secure military victories or establish key trade routes. The journey concludes with the Production Phase, where you reap the fruits of your labor through resource collection and military buildup.

Victory in Epireia is not just about the glory of a single city but the triumph of an alliance. The first league to complete all three scenarios will be crowned the ruler of the land, achieving a legacy of dominance that will be remembered for ages.

Epireia invites you to a world where strategy, diplomacy, and resource management intertwine, challenging you to claim your place in history as the greatest leader of ancient Greece.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, City Building, Educational, Territory Building
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Automatic Resource Growth, Cooperative Game, Income, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types, Zone of Control

name: Bin'Fa: A Collection of Possibilities
description: A stripped down 'basic' form of the game, with a plethora of optional rules and ideas that can be added or ignored to customize Bin'Fa to be any sort of game you would like, all without violating the basic principles and concepts that make Bin'Fa what it is: a beautiful game of Oriental Strategy and Conquest!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Honey Bees
description:
Honey bees are flying from flower to flower, spreading pollen and gathering honey. While other bees are building the beehive and store the honey.

In Honey Bees you will be choosing an action card at the start of your turn. After that you roll the dice to see what actions you can take. Unlock more dice or build the beehive so it can be filled with delicious honey. Gain bonuses while building the beehive or spreading pollen. Other players get to perform actions during your turn.

The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

Honey Bees is a roll & write game with a unique take on rolling dice. You can choose what the dice results do every turn you take.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses

name: Beach Bounce
description: Choose your team, either Dolphins or Seals, and try to make 3 in a row by bouncing the beach balls and landing them in the waves. For each 3 in a row, your team can place their flag on the scoring island. The first team to raise 3 flags on the island wins!
mechanics: Pattern Building, Square Grid, Take That

name: TamTam Englische Wörter
description:
A lot of cards, half of them with pictures and the other half with english words.
Every pair of picture and word card has exactly one match, and the players have to find the matches. Their are several game modes, for single players, cooperative or competitive play.

name: Sprach Memo at home
description:
Educational memory game - match a picture with the english word for it.
Words from A1 basic language level English.
contains additional vocabulary list

name: ROVE: Tourist Traps
description:
A ROVE’s exploratory nature causes no end of trouble. These curious little bots are suckers for even the most humdrum attractions. With a near-infinite number of alien worlds to visit, every ROVE is guaranteed to get stuck in a tourist trap eventually!

This 6-card expansion for ROVE: Results-Oriented Versatile Explorer introduces new Movement cards which remove the bonus movement points for matching a specific pattern. Instead, each of these new cards require you to move a specific Module, using at least one of the card’s movement points, before using the rest for any movement you like.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Movement, Pattern Recognition, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: ROVE: Dive Mode
description:
Nothing can stop a ROVE from its task. Once they reach the shore, it’s time to activate their aquatic descent protocols and continue their mission!

ROVE: Dive Mode is a 1-card amphibious expansion that combines the core ROVE game with Aqua ROVE. Once you’ve completed a normal game of ROVE, place this card over your last mission to initiate Dive Mode, then continue your game using the Aqua ROVE rules and cards. If you can manage to complete 7 Missions of each, you’ve earned the title of Ultimate Amphibious Explorer!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Movement, Pattern Recognition, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: 3OFF
description:
3OFF is an n-in-a-row strategy game with a twist.

Most n-in-a-row games require that you line up n pieces to win. However, 3OFF requires a player be the first to remove all their tokens that are lined up 3-in-a-row to win.

Although the objective sounds simple enough, it will not be that straightforward because the game consists of 8 tokens per player, which creates a paradox of needing to remove all your tokens to ultimately win, but requiring the addition of one or more tokens to ensure it. Further, you will find that removing 3 at the wrong time ensures your opponent wins on their very next turn.

Course of Play


With white moving first, players take turns strategically adding one of their tokens to the board until all 16 squares are filled
White must then remove 3 tokens lined up vertically, horizontally, or diagonally (or lose the game—see rule 6)
Black then has the option of removing 3 lined up tokens, or, strategically moving one token already on the board, to an empty space. A token can move any number of spaces in a straight line in any direction, as long as the space travelled to is empty and not blocked (i.e., you cannot jump over tokens) by a token belonging to either player
After black's turn, white and black, on subsequent turns, must now do 1 of 3 things: (a) remove 3 lined up tokens, (b) strategically move a token to an empty space according to rule #3, or (c) if any tokens have been removed by a player, strategically add one token back to any empty space
The first player to remove their last 3 remaining lined up tokens on their turn wins
A player who is unable to perform any of the actions in step 4 at any point during the game, loses the game

name: Air & Armor: V Corps
description:
Air & Armor: V Corps, Operational Armored Warfare in Europe is the second game in the Air & Armor series. Air & Armor is a grand tactical simulation of a hypothetical Soviet attack on West Germany in the mid-1980s. V Corps depicts the collision of the Soviet 28th Army and 1st Guards Tank Army with the U.S. V Corps in the Fulda Gap. Three maps cover the sector from the Inner German Border all the way to Frankfurt.

Air & Armor employs a highly interactive game system with asymmetric rules modeling the different command & control capabilities of each alliance. The game simulates all major aspects of modern warfare, including reconnaissance, combined arms operations, air, helicopter, and artillery strikes, chemical and electronic warfare, and combat engineering. Multiple levels of hidden intelligence produce a true “fog of war” providing plenty of opportunities for deception, surprise, traps, and ambushes. Play this game to experience what it would have been like to command a division in battle if the Cold War had gone hot.

Air & Armor: V Corps features twelve different scenarios, each a complete game by itself. Each scenario covers a different battlefield operation, including a meeting engagement, a delaying action, a frontal assault, an attack on a fortified line, a blocking action against a Soviet OMG, an armored cavalry covering force, two NATO counterattacks, a desperate defense of a broken line, and a surprise attack with NATO still in barracks. Extensive Scenario, Player, and Designer Notes provide advice on play and historical detail.

Air & Armor is ideal for solitaire play. The hidden intelligence system provides a high level of tension during solitaire play because, even though a solo player is commanding both sides, he never knows what he will hit when he conducts an operation.

Product Information:
Complexity: High
Time Scale: 1 Turn = 2 Hours
Map Scale: 1 Mile/Hex
Unit Scale: Companies to Regiments
Players: 1-7 Players
Solitaire Suitability: High
Playing Time: 3 to 12 hours based on Scenario

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Simulation

name: Pro Wrestling Titans: The official Pro Wrestling Card Game
description:
Pro Wrestling Titans is a card game with a pro wrestling theme. It's a fast paced fighting game that uses only cards to have a full wrestling match. This game is for 1 to 4 players. The only way to settle a feud is to fight it out in the squared circle. Build your feud to a steel cage match.

Styles make fights. Each superstar builds a custom 40 card deck with a specific fighting style. Choose a Brawler, Showstopper, Powerhouse, Dirty, Technician, or Highflyer style. Superstars are also either Heel, Babyface, or Conflicted(a little bit of both).
