With these custom decks, many match types are possible, 1 vs 1, 3 man matches, Battle royale, tag team, table, ladder matches, steel cage, submission, street fights, and more. Each match has a different win condition to increase replay ability. A 1 vs 1 match is won when one wrestler has reduced one of their rival's health stats to zero. The three body health parts are limbs, body, and head. Zero head health equals a knockout, zero limb health equals a submission, and zero body health equals a win by pinfall. Another example of a match is an ironman match, which is won by reducing all 3 body health stats to zero.

Achieve combos attacks by building up stamina. Your superstar has eight powerful individual cards that are only used by the superstar you choose. These cards include finishers and signature attacks, managers, special weapons, arena areas, and individual talents. Attacks are achieved by playing Stamina (the resource used in the game) to play attacks like, body slams, punches, kicks, flying attacks, and submission holds.

—description from the publisher

name: RIVALES
description:
RIVALES is a board game about football (soccer) that uses cards and a dice, combining chance, mathematics and strategy. Two people over fourteen years of age compete, each one representing a club. Eight fixtures are simulated to define who has hegemony in four seasons, with two fixtures being held per football year. A game lasts approximately 120 minutes, depending on the skill and concentration of the participants.

Each player plays different roles: owner, sporting director, manager, footballers and referees. The footballers and the actions of the referees are cards. Footballers have different types (categories) and monetary values in relation to the goals they can score or avoid. Cards that give or take away money, cause inconveniences (sanctions, injuries) or allow the situation to be unraveled or the score changed are also influential. Monetary values are indicated in millions without specifying the currency (M¤).

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Economic, Math, Memory, Sports
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Action/Event, Advantage Token, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Investment, Memory, Score-and-Reset Game, Single Loser Game, Trading, Turn Order: Role Order

name: En Route: Special Edition
description:
People love traveling. We want to meet new cultures, see famed landmarks with our own eyes and taste the world cuisine. One of the most pleasant ways to explore a new city is... just going for a walk. But how to chart a tour route that satisfies everyone? There’s an answer!

En Route is a flip-and-write game in which you create tour routes to the most interesting landmarks of the real-world cities (London, New York City, Hong Kong, Paris, Cairo, and Rio de Janeiro) and the made-up First City packed full of geek references. Every city features basic and specific mechanisms, so all of them play and feel differently.

Cards are not flipped randomly — instead, an active player plays one card face up, and two players next to them secretly choose one card each. Then, an active player selects one of the two and discards the other. After that, all players use coordinates and other information from the two cards left on the table to draw their tourists and routes.

During the game, route segments are drawn, connecting different types of tourists to various landmarks and attractions. A game of En Route lasts exactly 10 rounds. At the end of the game, each place of interest on the final route will earn players Prestige Points according to its rules. Whoever creates the most satisfying tour route, wins!

The game features constant and quite intense player interaction, and players have a fair degree of control and can strategize. It plays fast, dynamic, and makes you constantly think about what your opponents want to do (and sometimes even negotiate so that they play cards that are beneficial to you!).

En Route. Special (Kickstarter) Edition features four additional cities, new mechanisms and game modes, plus Kickstarter-exclusive cards.
mechanics: Connections, Grid Coverage, Line Drawing, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Biomass
description:
Biomass is a tense, area control wargame. Become one of four asymmetric Biomorphs, each uniquely adapted to hunt and survive in this beautiful and strange alien landscape. Gather Biomass by hunting prey and investigating strange monuments, spend your resources on a wealth of rotating powers and units, and fight tooth and claw for territory and ultimately, victory!

—description from the publisher

name: Spells and Brews Tavern
description:
Ever dreamt of running your own bar?

Picture this – a lively medieval tavern filled with quirky customers, fantasy brews, and unusual events.

Become a medieval tavern owner with Spells and Brews Tavern - a 2-6 player card game. Greet eccentric customers, concoct brews, and watch the profits roll in!

Your goal? Get the most valuable customers by expanding the tavern, serving brews, and navigating the world of unpredictable events; it’s an immersive experience where strategy meets fantasy.

Best served with 6°+ drinks!

HOST CUSTOMERS

The Spells and Brews Tavern boasts 96 customer cards, each featuring a funny and unique character with their own special quirks. These patrons will frequent your tavern, endowing you with special abilities, and ultimately leading you to victory.

SERVE BREWS

There are 5 different brew types in the game, each catering to specific tastes of our customers.

With each patron having their preferred brew, you must ensure to stock up on their drink of choice to accommodate them in your tavern.

COLLECT COINS

With each round, you'll amass profits from customers indulging in your tavern's offerings.
The fancier the brews and the clientele, the more coins you'll rake in.

EXPAND YOUR TAVERN

Utilizing your earnings, you can expand your tavern by purchasing more seating space to accommodate new customers. Additionally, invest in events to influence gameplay and throw a wrench into your opponent's tavern management.

WINNING THE GAME

The player who hosts the most valuable customers in their tavern emerges victorious.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Income, Multi-Use Cards, Variable Phase Order, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Pura Vida
description:
Pura Vida is not only the life motto in Costa Rica, but also stands for the country's enormous biodiversity and its stated goal of living in harmony with nature and wildlife. The approximately 30 national parks, which make up around 26% of Costa Rica's area, also make an important contribution to the protection of its biodiversity.
All kinds of landscapes can be discovered here: from dense rainforests and mangrove forests to rocky volcanoes, dry savannahs and sandy coasts. The wildlife is equally diverse: toucans, sloths, snakes, butterflies and many other species live here – not least the red-eyed tree frogs, which are so iconic for the country.
As a ranger, your task is to create a balanced animal population in the numerous nature parks. The particular challenge is to take the animals’ individual and natural movements into account. Besides taking numerous tricky decisions, you will also get to know Costa Rica's cheerful and relaxed attitude to life - Pura Vida!

Gameplay:
On your turn you must choose between these two actions:
a) Move
b) Rest
Move: Move your ranger along the path and take the tile where you end your movement. Place the tile in your own national park, trying to align animals and/or landscapes the best way to get points.
Rest: Move your ranger to the rest area. You are not allowed to make any more moves this round.

Scoring: Every time you place a tile in your national park, you check whether you meet one of the biodiversity criteria and receive points for it:
For 3/4/5 tiles directly next to each other in a row or column with different animals and the same landscape, you get 2/2/3 points.
For 3/4/5 tiles directly next to each other in a row or column with different landscapes and the same animals, you get 2/2/3 points.
For 3/4/5 tiles directly next to each other in a row or column with different animals and different landscapes you get 1/1/2 points.

The game ends as soon as someone has reached at least 20 points. This person wins.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Flash Flood
description:
The river is rising and the only road connecting your settlement to the world is threatened. Responding to the call to action, your team is assigned a section of the riverbank and a wagonload of sandbags. You must build a levee before the river rises to flood the road!
Flash Flood is a cooperative card game for 2 to 4 players. The participants are counting on each other, but your communication is hindered by the roaring river. Will your fellow players to repair a leak while you add an intact sandbag, or should you help with stop the leak?
The deck of cards represent the sandbags, and players will arrange these cards, turn-by-turn, to form a levee on the table. Hidden in the deck (in semi-random intervals) are cards which indicate the rising water level of the flooded river.
Working together, there's still a chance that the flood will overcome your efforts. Good luck!

—description from the publisher

name: Fox and Geese
description:
A simple race game where one player takes the role of the Fox chasing the other players as the Geese.

After paying a deposit into a central pot, players spin the teetotem and move along the numbered tile course (from 1 through 80) with

the fox attempting to catch the geese (and gaining from the pot); and,
the geese racing to safety in the last space.


Some of the spaces on the course are pictured and have associated benefits/forfeits noted in the Rule book.

—user summary

name: Sonic The Hedgehog: Sonic Battle – The Search for The Chaos Emeralds
description:
Sonic and Friends must compete to find the 7 Chaos Emeralds and harness their powers to defeat the notorious Dr. Eggman!

Play as Sonic, Amy, Tails or Knuckles and be the first to find the Chaos Emeralds.But beware.... Dr Eggman's robots are lurking behind every corner and will try to sabotage your mission! Its time to find out if you have what it takes to win this epic battle!

The aim of the game is to be the first player to reach Dr Eggman at the centre of the board with all 7 Chaos Emeralds (one of each colour) in your possession. Once there, you must face Dr Eggman in a final battle to win!

name: Bro! Surfing
description:
Bro! Surfing is a quick playing solo game. Go for a casual surf or compete in competitions. Link competitions and lay down a Legendary surf career.

Each run will be different from the last. You will have decisions to make along your run.

Manage your "FLOW" to prevent dings in your board. These dings will lower your overall score at the end of the run.

Easy trick system make Bro! Surfing very easy to pick up and play. Three levels of tricks that can be performed on any wave. These tricks will add to your overall score at the end of the run.

Gain sponsors by performing tricks on Sponsored waves. You sponsors will provide you with funding that can be used to purchase items that will help you throughout your career.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Kings of War: Clash of Kings – 2024 Edition
description:
This much-anticipated Clash of Kings supplement unleashes the Twilight Kin upon the world, along with updates for existing factions.

As well as all the background information and the new army list for this incredible new army, there’s a slew of new art, and, of course, the annual Clash of Kings game updates for the rules and other factions in the game. This year is a another big one, and includes the full updates to the Northern Alliance and Nightstalker armies launched in 2023.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Kings of War: Ice and Shadow – 2 Player Starter Set
description:
During the Abyssal Dwarf invasion of Chill, they bought with them wicked contraptions of Twilight Kin making known as void-cages. These devices, once opened, create rips in the fabric of reality and connect the mortal world to the Void, birthing Nightstalker horrors into reality. Relive the battle for Chill, as the Nightstalker presence threatens to turn the tide in the favor of evil.

—description from the publisher

Contains a revised 3rd Edition softcover rule book and the new miniatures for both the Northern Alliance and the Nightstalkers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Het Festivalspel
description:
The game that takes place at a festival. With music, bars, food trucks, fun tasks and visitors who sometimes get in the way...

With your Festival Card you plan your optimal walking route through the Festival. During the festival, you earn tokens which you place in the right place of your Festival Card.

The winner is the one who first leaves the festival grounds with a full Festival Card.

Do you win the game by outsmarting everyone, working best together and completing your assignments the fastest?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Enclosure, Grid Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Negotiation, Relative Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Fluid Fealty
description:
Fluid Fealty is a 1-4 player trick-taking game. The king is dead—killed by his own advisors—and many are rushing to fill the void left by his passing. To take the throne, and hold onto it, you need allies—but who can you trust when everyone is out for themselves?

At the beginning of each round, players will choose a card from their hand to represent their ambition--this card will dictate both that player's bid for how many tricks they expect to win, and that player's favored suit for the round. Each round comprises 13 tricks; however, there is no single trump for a round. Instead, a played card is automatically considered a trump card if it matches that player's ambition suit--so different players have a different trump suit!

At the end of a round, the player who came closest to matching their bid adds their ambition card to their alliances. Once a player reaches a certain number of alliances, they automatically win the game; but, the more alliances you have, the more your opponents will know about your hand...

Fluid Fealty also comes with a solo mode, where you play against two automated rivals.

—description from the designer

name: Stick It!
description:
Stick it is a family friendly, abstract, tile-placement game where players are strategically placing stickers on a water bottle and a phone.

Players earn points in several ways as they create set collections of stickers.

Stick it has 100 unique sticker illustrations that feature designs in 15 different categories. There is something for everyone in this colorful and charming game.

—description from the designer

name: Reservations
description:
Reservations is a trick taking game that shares DNA with traditional contract bidding games, such as Konigrufen, Vira, Doppelkopf, etc. but with a "modern" feel.

In the traditional games, the scores are almost always zero sum, meaning if I am gaining points, you are losing points. In Reservations, the scoring is based on an area majority in the 4 different levels of contracts you can complete. Most of the contracts are 1 vs All (solo), however, when playing 4 players you can have 2 vs 2 (team) contracts as well. Completing a solo contract will let you place two cubes, where as a team contract lets each player place one cube. Be careful, any failed contracts will count against you at the end of the game!

Contracts also change how the card play system works. One contract might have you play Talon Exchange/Must Follow/Must Trump/Must Win while another contract will have you play Talon Reveal/Must Follow/May Trump/May Win.

There is also an advanced mode that includes a side board full of additional bonus contracts.

—description from the designer

name: Paper App Dungeon: Free RPG Day 2024 Expansion
description:
We are providing 4 unique levels for our upcoming game Paper App Dungeon, along with custom P6 pencils, for players to experience some fun dungeon delving and pencil rolling on Free RPG Day 2024!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cartographers: Packs de parchemins 2
description:
An expansion set bundling three previously released expansions

Frozen Expanse
Kethra's Steppe
Hornheim
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Territory Building
mechanics: Bingo, Grid Coverage, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Third Wish
description:
Welcome to your first day of Genie school! Before you can become a certified Genie, you need to master the art of granting wishes. Not only that, but you must remember to always grant exactly 3 wishes. No more, no less!

Third Wish is a trick taking game that has players aiming to win exactly 3 tricks each round. The deck is made up of 3 asymmetrical suits and special Genie cards. It is a must follow trick taker where the highest card, regardless of suit, wins the trick and the lowest leads the next trick. After a set number of tricks (10 for 3 players and 13 for 4 players) any players that took exactly 3 tricks will gain a gold lamp. If you take more than 3 tricks, you will gain a bust cube, which can help you avoid tricks in future rounds, but will have a chance to count against you at the end of the game. After a set number of rounds (short game is 6 for 3 players and 4 for 4 players) the player with the most lamps wins!

—description from the designer

name: Pursue
description:
This is a FUN Social Strategy game mixed with Chance and highlighted with Trivia. Designed for 2, 3, 4, or 6 players the game is played with tokens on a hexagonal shaped board. Three dice are thrown to start a round, cards are drawn and played, and tokens are moved based upon the player's strategy. The game takes 45 minutes to an hour for most games played primarily for strategy purposes, but when played primarily for social engagement the time passed with others normally lasts a couple of hours. The 108 unique starting cards included in the box have eight topics (1 topic for each suite with 2 decks included) and each card has a QR code to source the cards' statements.

The goal and setup of the game are simple. The advancement of pieces on the board is easy, and the fun new knowledge gained is wild.

Players move their tokens based upon the number of turns rolled for the round, what the bonus color cards say they can do for the round, and what level token they have to play.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Moving Multiple Units, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fish Off!
description:
Fish Off is a 2-4 player competitive dice and tile fishing game where you catch and steal fish from players through a tug-of-war dice mechanic. Players compete to catch and steal point value fish to earn the highest score over 3 matches. Most of the game is played synchronously, meaning that players all take their turns at the same time allowing the game to be played at a good steady pace with the occasional dice war needed to settle the inevitable tug-of-wars over high value fish.

The game board displays a 5 by 5 grid of water with hook icons arrayed along each row and column of the grid. Players sit along each edge of the board and are given Hook and Seagull tokens of the same colour, matching their edge of the board. Fish tiles are randomly shuffled and dealt face down on the grid, discarding all leftover tiles. Players are now ready to start their first round of game.

One Round of play is broken into 3 steps: Positioning, Casting and Catching. Players select a Position along their edge of the game board by placing their Hook token on a hook icon which will be beneath a column of tiles. Players then roll their dice to Cast their hook and resolve where their hook landed. Players then reveal their hooked tile and decide whether they want to place a Seagull token on an opponent's tile to try to steal it off them. Uncontested tiles are collected first, then any remaining tiles with multiple players contesting them must enter a dice base tug-of-war to see who keeps them. Once this has all been resolved, one round of play has concluded, and a new round can start. Players spend multiple rounds catching and stealing fish until all players have collected 5 fish, ending the Match. Players tally the face value of their fish and can now setup the board for a new match. The player with the most points collected over the 3 matches is the overall winner of Fish Off.

The game board is double-sided with Calm Waters on one side and Strong Currents on the reverse side. The Calm Waters side is suitable for first time players and younger kids who want to play a simple fun game. The Strong Currents side is suitable for more experienced players and adults who want to add another level of complexity and strategy to their turns. The currents help direct a players hook through the waters granting them a greater chance to hook a better fish tile. Players can also choose to add Fish Set Bonuses to either side of the board which act like poker rules. For example: Players are rewarded bonus points for catching unique sets of fish at the end of a match i.e. A Full House, Four of a Kind and a 5 Fish Straight to name a few.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Score-and-Reset Game, Slide/Push, Tug of War

name: Trivial Pursuit Mini Pack: 1990s
description:
If you love playing trivia games anytime, anywhere, then the Trivial Pursuit Mini Pack 1990s game is for you! This quick-playing game features trivia questions from the years 1990 to 2000. Since it includes cards only, you can take it to parties, get-togethers, on vacation, and more. On your turn, another player will ask you a question; get it right to keep the card. The first person to earn 5 cards wins! Answer fun trivia questions like “Which U.S. president, elected to two terms in the ’90s, was born in Hope, Arkansas?” and “What computer bug did companies around the world fear would cause mass chaos when the digits flipped to the year 2000 on January 1st?” Here's your chance to prove your prowess of 1990s pop culture!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Little Alchemists
description:
Will you surpass your teachers' knowledge and grow up to become the best alchemists in the land? Let's find out! It's time to grab your potion ingredients, sharpen your deduction skills, and get mixing!

Little Alchemists is a family-friendly deduction game that's designed to grow with the curious minds of young players. The game starts with simple concepts and mechanisms; you'll start by gathering and combining ingredients for brewing potions to sell. However, as you collect keys by achieving your potion-making goals, you'll unlock new chapters that gradually add more components, mechanisms, and complexity to the experience.

Not sure how to make potions? No sweat! Potion craft takes mere seconds with the free Little Alchemists companion app. To make a potion, players select two ingredient tiles, then scan them using the companion app loaded onto a tablet or smartphone. This reveals the combined result and lets players acquire and mark the corresponding potion knowledge on their secret player board.

With each potion you make, you'll begin to discover the secrets that lie at the heart of alchemy. Players will have to use clever deductions to figure out the arcane properties of each ingredient, then they can use that knowledge to their advantage throughout the game!

Over the course of seven chapters that unlock over multiple playthroughs, players will learn and master many new facets of the alchemy trade, preparing them for what's to come. Each chapter is designed as a replayable experience that expands on the previous chapter, with new layers of game mechanisms that add more subtle depth and complexity over time. Also, fully exploring the world of Little Alchemists will introduce you to many of the concepts from and better prepare you for the original Alchemists game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Deduction, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: 1889 Berlin
description:
1889 Berlin, an 18xx game in the series originated by Francis Tresham's 1829, is set in Berlin Germany.

In 1889 Berlin, 2-5 players will use money to purchase shares in railroad companies during Share Dealing Rounds. Between subsequent Share Dealing Rounds, railroad corporations then conduct operations on the game board, with the decisions being made by the player who is the major share holder. The game simulates the progression of railroad development during an historic period in Berlin (1889 - 1989). Old trains become obsolete while the revenue earnings from cities grows over time. Players will try to purchase the most profitable shares at the right times of the game to maximize earnings in dividends and stock value gains. In the end, the player with the highest value of personal cash and held stocks is the winner.

Unique mechanisms in 1889 Berlin:

At the beginning of phase 1945 (end of WWII) players remove some brown tiles - simulating bombardment of the city
At the beginning of phase 1961 (building the wall) the map is split by wall tiles (functioning as "edge of the map")
Companies in West-Berlin can't operate in East-Berlin (phases 1961 - 1989)
Companies in East-Berlin can operate in West-Berlin (phases 1961 * 1989) but had to end in their station token or loop back to East-Berlin
Companies in East-Berlin use a common pool of trains an had to reach a given target value ("Planwirtschaft") to get a new train or loose a train
Phases: yellow (1889), green (1900), brown (1933), green (1945), brown (West-Berlin 1961), green (East-Berlin 1961), gray (1989)


—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hexagon Grid, Market, Network and Route Building, Ownership, Stock Holding, Tile Placement, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Marco Polo Reise-Spiel USA
description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible, but don't miss to be back home on time
- tactical (geographical) quiz
3 phases - moving by turn - each player starts on his marked/coloured area

move around collecting cards/images
answer questions regarding images/cards you hold - if you fail discard card
get back home (can be difficult); don't arrive being the very last one- whatever you'd collected it doesn't count


—user summary

name: Scream Park
description:
Halloween season is nigh, and you have to get your 'haunt' ready for customers to be properly terrified on opening weekend. Your boss Rickole is looking to each of you to make the perfect scary entertainment attraction, but you only have the sets, costumes, effects and more from last year to pass around. Can you piece together a thematic and properly dreadful haunted house? Or will you disappoint the visiting VIPs and your horror-loving fans?

On a turn, draft two cards from a hand to use in your layout, building the experience from left to right. Either add new rooms, or 'scenes', that bolster your theme, or merge them together to bolster previous ones with the use of add-ons like costumes, special effects, and decor. Use your staff to finish your creation, or to rearrange your haunt and perfect the crescendo of fear. Keep in mind your theme, the needs of your scenes, and the VIPs that will visit on the first, second, or third rounds of Opening Weekend, with each randomly seeking different elements to approve of.

An accessible and smooth drafting game that inspires strategy and storytelling within the first few moves, Scream Park offers a beautiful design in an easy-to-travel format that has vast replayability with 100+ unique cards.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Cyberpunk Attack
description:
Welcome to Neon City, paradise for all lovers of the cyberpunk universe.

In our game, you will dive into the future where corporations and cyber technologies have changed the world.

The board game is a cooperative fighting game with a cyberpunk theme for 2-8 players. Take part as an employee of a corporation whose goal is to identify and eliminate traitors by any means available. Or be part of a sabotage group of cyberpunks trying to take down the corporation's boss. However, be cautious, as each of them could turn out to be a cyber-strey pursuing their own interests and posing a serious threat to both teams.

You have a variety of actions and cyber body that can be developed with cyber-implant to increase your power. Defeat enemies and assist your comrades using actions and cyber-implants.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Party Game
mechanics: Action Queue, Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Hidden Roles, Multi-Use Cards, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Veiled Fate: Hadria
description:
A being to be feared, Hadria mercilessly annihilates any demigod found ahead of her on the score tracker at the end of the game—meaning having the most points isn't always a winning strategy. Use new powers to move Hadria and create all kinds of new quandaries for your opponents.

The Hadria Expansion is focused on introducing more strategic variables to the game and adds a new miniature, renown tracker, and favor cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Deduction, Hand Management, Hidden Roles

name: Veiled Fate: Celestials
description:
Each of the seven celestial beings bestows one player with an asymmetric win condition & abilities. All other players will have to adapt their strategies around the Celestial's win condition to ensure their own victory.

The Celestials expansion is focused on introducing more deduction and misdirection to the game and adds a new miniature, renown tracker, spell cards, and 7 celestial cards.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Deduction, Hidden Movement, Hidden Roles

name: Veiled Fate: Servants
description:
Each servant influences the quest in its region, so players must consider their effects when determining where to move their Demi. Moving the servants introduces new strategic and tactical options towards victory.

The Servants expansion adds 3 new miniatures and cards. Servants can be commanded by all players.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Deduction, Hand Management, Hidden Roles

name: Veiled Fate: Renewal
description:
Every time a demigod enters The Pools when being moved out of the Abyss, the player moving them activates the current modifier on the Renewal Dice. That play then re-rolls the renewal dice, resulting in a new modifier for the next player to move a demigod from the Abyss to the Pools.

The Renewal Dice replaces the permanent 'refresh card' effect that normally activates in the Pools, creating more dynamic gameplay and ever-shifting strategies surrounding how players use the Abyss.

name: Quissama: Expansão para o 5° jogador
description:
Set of 10 meeples for the fifth player.


Conjunto de 10 meeples para o quinto jogador.

name: Varia: Death Pirate
description:
Step into the shoes of a dreaded pirate captain with this ready-to-play Varia deck.

This deck is all about disruption. Whether it's forcing opponents to move when they don't want to, causing them to discard their hand, or making them to roll poorly, this deck wins by manipulating the opponent.

Deck Difficulty: 3 out of 5 - Intermediate Level

name: Varia: Cosmic Mage
description:
Step into the shoes of a brilliant mage with this ready-to-play Varia deck.

With this deck you will feel like a master of time and space. Your cosmic spells enable you to think on the fly, fusing different cards together as you play them to create unique, game-breaking effects. Your mastery of time will enable you to break the rules of the game and play cards out of turn, or even completely re-write your future in order to gain the upper hand on your opponent.

Deck Difficulty: 3 out of 5 - Intermediate Level

name: Varia: Divine Paladin
description:
Step into the shoes of a faithful paladin with this ready-to-play Varia deck.

When playing this deck, the goddess always has your back. Many of the actions contained within the deck have a special ability called improved. This ability stacks the odds in your favor, making it more likely that the outcome of a confrontation ends in your favor. This deck is also filled with the divine magic of the goddess herself. As you play it you will find that so long as you have proper faith, you will never be without a weapon.

Deck Difficulty: 2 out of 5 - Beginner Level

name: Varia: 6th Blade
description:
Step into the shoes of a mysterious blade-wielding golem with this ready-to-play Varia deck.

This deck enables you to embody one of Miyamune's blades. By utilizing the unique properties of the blade, your blocks can be converted into vicious attacks. Patience is key when playing this deck. Once you recognize an opening, you can strike for the win.

Deck Difficulty: 4 out of 5 - Advanced Level

name: Varia: Mystic Monk
description:
Step into the shoes of a skilled monk with this ready-to-play Varia deck.

This deck utilizes a unique stack called Chi. Many of the magical actions in the deck generate stacks of Chi that you can use short-term to enhance your current self, or store up the alternative energy to fuel a long-term plan.

To master this deck you must become the line between demonic rage and angelic grace. Many of the cards in the deck are either angelic or demonic in type. As you play each card, your discard pile will begin to reflect your past actions. Were you overly angelic? Did you rely too much on demonic power? Maintaining a balance between the two types is the key to unlocking the deck's true power.

Deck Difficulty: 5 out of 5 - Advanced Level

name: Varia: Arms & Armor Expansion Pack
description:
Prepare for battle with a new set of Arms & Armor! Each non-randomized Varia: Arms & Armor pack comes with one of each of the fifteen items that make up this expansion.

—description from the publisher

name: Varia: Mechatrap Artificer
description:
Mechatrap Artificers are deceptive, trap-laden brawlers who combine arcane ingenuity with ambush tactics that leave opponents weighed down by unwanted accessories.
Ensnare your opponent with this ingenious class experience. As a Mechatrap Artificer, you pilot an artificial mech armed to the teeth with mechanical traps that leave your enemies wishing they hadn't triggered you.

Deck Difficulty: 3 out of 5 - Advanced Level

—description from the publisher

name: Varia: Dragon Knight
description:
Unleash your fury with this all new class deck for the original first person card game! As the dragon knight, you’ll rain fire on your foes and use your dragonrage to rampage your way to victory. Your opponent woke the dragon. BURN THEM TO THE GROUND.

Deck Difficulty: 3 out of 5 - Intermediate Level

—description from the publisher

name: Varia: Deathblood Sorcerer
description:
Deathblood Sorcerers are occult spellcasters who sacrifice health to unleash devastating assaults and empower a death magic that increases in effectiveness the closer its caster is to the grave.
Weaponize life and death with this powerful class experience. As a Deathblood Sorcerer, your own life becomes fuel as you funnel your blood into your magic and amplify both your initial spell
and the follow-up death magic assault.

Deck Difficulty: 1 out of 5 - Beginner Level

—description from the publisher

name: Varia: Stoneroot Druid
description:
Forget everything you know about collectible card games. In Varia, there aren't any minions to protect you or walls to hide behind. You raise the shield. You cast the spell. You swing for the win with your weapon of choice. If you want to strike with the might of a hurricane, you’ll have to become a force of nature yourself...

name: Varia: Phoenix Spellsword

Phoenix Spellswords are unwavering combatants who meld life-fire sorcery with tactical swordplay and unleash that combined might with burning sword assaults.

Fuse fire and blade with this tenacious class experience. As a Phoenix Spellsword, you will fuse tactical physical assaults with life-fire magic as you craft combination attacks that will leave you burning bright as the opposition
flickers and fades.
